name: Camilla
description: Camilla was surrendered at the vet by her owner because she is an older dog. She is very loving and likes to lay in your lap. Camilla is great with other dogs and new people.

name: Ashley
description:
Ashley is about  2  yrs old and weighs about 50 lbs.   She was surrendered with her sister Halsey.   They are bonded,  with Halsey (shyer of the two) looking to Ashley for courage.   They are reported to be good with children and cats.   More will be known about me soon.   

A Path 4 Paws holds adoption events EVERY Saturday & Sunday from 10am-4pm at C-A-L Ranch,  located at 232 N. Jones Blvd right off the I-95.   Please bring your dog(s) for a meet and greet (if applicable)

If you are interested in Ashley, please contact dogrescuelv@hotmail.com to confirm the dog you are interested in,  will be attending that particular weekend.  We have limited space at the store, therefore we can not take every dog out to the event.

Ashley is spayed/neutered, has current vaccinations and includes a microchip, deworming and 2 free vet visits.  Adoption fee applies.  Please make sure you have read the information listed on the homepage for requirements and restrictions. 

Foster homes & volunteers are always needed.  Please contact us regarding how you can help by fostering or volunteering for our organization.

name: Halsey
description:
Halsey is about  2  yrs old and weighs about 45 lbs.   She was surrendered with her sister Ashley.   They are bonded with Halsey (shyer of the two) looking to Ashley for courage.   They are reported to be good with children and cats.   More will be known about me soon.   

A Path 4 Paws holds adoption events EVERY Saturday & Sunday from 10am-4pm at C-A-L Ranch,  located at 232 N. Jones Blvd right off the I-95.   Please bring your dog(s) for a meet and greet (if applicable)

If you are interested in Halsey, please contact dogrescuelv@hotmail.com to confirm the dog you are interested in,  will be attending that particular weekend.  We have limited space at the store, therefore we can not take every dog out to the event.

Halsey is spayed/neutered, has current vaccinations and includes a microchip, deworming and 2 free vet visits.  Adoption fee applies.  Please make sure you have read the information listed on the homepage for requirements and restrictions. 

Foster homes & volunteers are always needed.  Please contact us regarding how you can help by fostering or volunteering for our organization.

name: MESSINA
description:
ALL ANIMALS are placed on a legal stray hold per Bullhead City Ordinances for the to owner reclaim. If the animals are not claimed they will be placed up for adoption based on the available date provided.

* All animals MUST be spay/neutered before leaving the shelter *

Adoption Fee is $100

I'm available for adoption on 09/04/2019

Adoption fees cover vet exam, spay/neuter surgery, rabies vaccine, first core vaccine (DA2PP or FRCP), and if you reside in Bullhead City your first 1 year license is on us!

I was picked up as a stray and my owner came in and signed me over but took my housemate home. I am very sweet and absolutely adorable.

name: NAMIMI
description:
ALL ANIMALS are placed on a legal stray hold per Bullhead City Ordinances for the to owner reclaim. If the animals are not claimed they will be placed up for adoption based on the available date provided.

* All animals MUST be spay/neutered before leaving the shelter *

Adoption Fee is $100

I'm available for adoption on 09/09/2019

Adoption fees cover vet exam, spay/neuter surgery, rabies vaccine, first core vaccine (DA2PP or FRCP), and if you reside in Bullhead City your first 1 year license is on us!

I was picked up as a stray and waiting for my owners to come and pick me up.  I have not missed a meal and you can tell I was loved.

name: POOKIE
description: Pookie is sweet, easy going, and easy to be with! Her records says she is 2 years old and 58 lbs, she is short to the ground and only medium size. Poor Pookie thought she got lucky when she was adopted from the shelter only to find herself looking for a new home again when her owner passed unexpectedly. Pookie loves all humans, yes children, too, but she must be the only pet in the household. Please help Pookie finds a safe and a forever home.

name: Holly
description:
Holly is almost 2  yrs old and weighs about 41 lbs.  She has been around children, but is jumpy so would do better with bigger kids.   She is good with male dogs.   She needs a home without chickens and horses, she loves to chase them.   She is energetic and needs a family who will offer her exercise.   She loves water!  More will be known about me soon.   

A Path 4 Paws holds adoption events EVERY Saturday & Sunday from 10am-4pm at C-A-L Ranch,  located at 232 N. Jones Blvd right off the I-95.   Please bring your dog(s) for a meet and greet (if applicable)

If you are interested in Holly, please contact dogrescuelv@hotmail.com to confirm the dog you are interested in,  will be attending that particular weekend.  We have limited space at the store, therefore we can not take every dog out to the event.

Holly is spayed/neutered, has current vaccinations and includes a microchip, deworming and 2 free vet visits.  Adoption fee applies.  Please make sure you have read the information listed on the homepage for requirements and restrictions. 

Foster homes & volunteers are always needed.  Please contact us regarding how you can help by fostering or volunteering for our organization.

name: TD
description: TD may need a little while to feel comfortable with you, but once he is, he's a great companion for families with kids and other dogs.  He has a high energy level, like most Jack Russell mixes, and would make a great hiking buddy!

name: Mohave
description: Mohave is a gorgeous redhead!  He starts out a bit shy, but once he feels comfortable, he loves to hang out with this humans.  He does well with other dogs, cats and kids.  He can be a little protective of his territory.

name: Maverick
description: Maverick is a very playful Yorkie that does not act his age!  He gets along with just about everyone, but doesn't like to be stuck in a kennel or left alone for too long.  He's a very social creature who just wants to play and snuggle.  He has a crooked front canine, but it doesn't bother him at all.

name: Daisy
description: Daisy is very active, great with other dogs, kids and cats.  She loves to go on adventures with her humans, but will go on her own adventures if not supervised.

name: Cracker
description: Cracker is a heeler/pit mix who is about 6 1/2 years old.  She was with us when she was a puppy, but was recently surrendered back to us because her family had to move oversees for the military and couldn't take her along.  She is very particular about other dogs and prefers dogs around her size.  Doesn't do well with cats or kids.  She can be protective of her humans.

name: MELO
description: Meet Melo with his adorable squishy face! His foster mom states that he is house trained, crate trained, and walks great on the leash. Melo is playful and enjoys his stuffy toys, his ball, and he loves a puppachino! He also loves to just chill on the couch or his bed. Melo enjoys short walks, quiet time, and Frank Sinatra. Melo is extremely intelligent! Of course, he knows the basics-sit, stay, halt, and come, but he knows more than he is telling us! He's approximately 5 years old and is an enrichment scholar with Pawtastic Friends. Training after adoption will be available to help him settle into his new home.

name: Lele
description:
Sweet Lele is looking for a new forever home.  She was adopted when she was 9 months old and lived with her family for 7 years.  She was recently returned when the families circumstances changed and they could no longer care of her.  This broke her heart as she didn't understand why she no longer had a family when she did nothing wrong.  Lele is an energetic girl who would love to keep you company on your nightly walks and weekend hikes.  She also loves to play with toys and is happy to lay next to you on the couch while watch a few movies on Netflix.  

Lele would do best as an only pet and in a home with older children.  

She is very well behaved and knows to sit, lay, drop her toys.  She walks great on a leash (no tugging or pulling) and is fully potty trained.

name: Kenny
description:
Kenny was rescued from a hoarder with 7 other dogs we recently took in. He is a sweet senior , who is ready for a home to call his own. He has an awesome personality, and is quite the character. He loves to sniff your face and then plop down next to you for a belly rub. 

We know he is great with other dogs, and seems to like everyone he meets. Kenny will be an awesome companion for someone. 

His overall health seems to be good, the doctor did discover that he has dry eyes, which means he needs eye drops 2X a day, and will need them for the remainder of his life, but they are very easy to give, and he doesn't mind them. 

If you are interested in fostering her or finding out more information about her please message us. 

The adoption fee for dogs 8 months and older is $250 and includes the dog being up to date on vaccines, micro-chipped and spayed or neutered. 

To meet Kenny please e-mail us at secondchanceLV@gmail.com
** or view our website, https://www.secondchancelv.org/ to see when you can meet him/her at one of our adoption events. 

*Please be aware that we can not adopt out dogs larger than 40+ pounds to an apartment or condominium

We are a non-profit organization ran by 100% unpaid volunteers, the adoption fee for each animal is to help offset the costs of running the rescue (medical care, food, shelter, etc) and to ensure that we can continue helping animals.

name: Angel
description:
Angel was rescued from a hoarder with 7 other dogs we recently took in. She is a sweet senior gal, who is ready for a home to call her home. She is good with kids, other dogs, and even birds so we think she could fit in pretty much anywhere. 

She lets her foster mom know she has to go potty by running to the door and sitting.

The adoption fee for dogs 8 months and older is $250 and includes the dog being up to date on vaccines, micro-chipped and spayed or neutered. 

To meet Angel please e-mail us at secondchanceLV@gmail.com
** or view our website, https://www.secondchancelv.org/ to see when you can meet him/her at one of our adoption events. 

*Please be aware that we can not adopt out dogs larger than 40+ pounds to an apartment or condominium

We are a non-profit organization ran by 100% unpaid volunteers, the adoption fee for each animal is to help offset the costs of running the rescue (medical care, food, shelter, etc) and to ensure that we can continue helping animals.

name: Mulligan
description: What a sweet and loving boy.  he's always happy to say hi!

name: Roxie
description:
Hi I'm Roxie! 
I'm a super sweet girl that just wants love and pets. Other dogs make me uncomfortable and I'm not too fond of cats either. If you don't have other pets and want a dog that will adore you I'm your girl! I'm also good with older kids that will give me love but also respect my space.If you would like to contribute to the care and well being of our animals please visit
Nevadaspca.org

name: Mav
description:
Mandi Wirtala
Attachments
8:48 PM (8 minutes ago)



Bio for Mav:

All dressed up and no where to call home-yet!

I am Mav, a female shepherd mix puppy. I look like I am wearing my fancy eyeliner and am told I am a very pretty girl! 
In spite of a rough beginning where my siblings and I were dumped in the desert unweight, I am very trusting and loving. 
I am working on my potty training and love to play just as much as I love to snuggle. 
I hear how smart of a girl I am lots of times a day and just want to be where all the action is.
If you are looking for a bright, playful pup to add to your household, look no further. text 702 239 7986
I am only three months not quite ready to go yet..

name: Nikki
description: My name is Nickolos\" Nikki\" and I'm a Pomeranian. I am 13 and weigh 9 lbs.  My Mom had to go into the hospital, and she passed away,and now I'm very sad and searching for a forever family. I'm a very calm boy and like nothing better than sitting on your lap.I hope there is a Senior looking for a sweet guy to love. I'm with my foster Lynn and you can call her for any other info. 702-876-2005  A Home4 Spot

name: Lucy
description: Lucy is a four year old female Terrier mix.  She was surrendered to LVVHS when her owner could no longer care for her.  She is a sweet girl, but would do best as an only dog in the home as she wants to be the center of attention.  Lucy is spayed, current on vaccinations, and micro-chipped.

name: Hudsyn
description: Hudsyn came to us from the shelter the same day that she gave birth to her 9 puppies. She is a friendly girl who loves to give hugs to her people. Hudsyn plays well with other dogs of all sizes, knows how to sit, is kennel trained and not a barker. She weighs approximately 50 lbs and is 2 years old. Meet me Saturday from 11 to 1 at Petco, 645 S. Green Valley Pkwy in Henderson.  If you are interested in adopting please submit an application at www.waggingtailsrescue.org.

name: shaggy
description:
Meet Shaggy! Shaggy is a Lhasa/Poodle mix and weighs around 20lbs. He is a super sweet boy and especially loves women. He can be a little shy at first with men but after a few treats and pets he relaxes quickly. He walks well on a leash and seems to get along with other small dogs. Shaggy is a great boy and will make a great addition to any home. He is neutered, chipped, and up to date on vaccines. For more info please text 702-239-7986 No children














 
 
Meet Shaggy! Shaggy is a Lhasa/Poodle mix and weighs around 20lbs. He is a super sweet boy and especially loves women. He can be a little shy at first with men but after a few treats and pets he relaxes quickly. He walks well on a leash and seems to get along with other small dogs. Shaggy is a great boy and will make a great addition to any home. He is neutered, chipped, and up to date on vaccines. For more info please text 702-239-7986

name: Buffin
description: Buffin is full of energy since he is a young man, and wants to play, play, play!  Cuddling is good too.

name: PRINCESS
description: Look at that face!  Princess is only about 1 year old, and has already had a litter of puppies!  She is spayed now, and ready to find herself a new home! Princess is a goofy and playful girl.  She is short and stout!  She is very particular with other dogs, so may do best as an only dog.  That's ok, because this girl is enough dog for anyone!  If you would like to meet Princess, please email AdoptAnimalNetwork@gmail.com.

name: BELLA
description: What a beautiful girl!  Bella is a little over a year, at 15 months old.  She is a loving a playful girl.  She gets along great with other dogs her size or bigger.  No small dogs!  She can also co-habitat with cats, but does try to play with them.  She is shy at first, and may bark, but she does warm up.  It just takes her a few minutes.  She is a typical German Shepherd, in that she does become protective of her humans.  She knows most of her basic commands and is house trained with a dog door.  Bella would benefit from some training, and would love a home where she is not left alone for long periods of time.  She hates the crate, and being so young, she does still like to chew and tear things up when she is left alone for an extended period of time.  She would also do best in a home with kids over the age of 10 due to her energy level.  If you would like to meet Bella, please email AdoptAnimalNetwork@gmail.com.

name: Junior
description:
Diana England 
8:06 AM (1 hour ago)

to me


Junior is a very loving, caring and friendly dog. He loves cuddling up on the couch or in bed. He loves playing with other dogs and is always the first to run around in circles and get the other dogs to play with him. Junior is potty trained and walks well on a leash. He loves to be active and take walks anytime you want. but isnât afraid to just cuddle up on the couch and sleep and watch tv with you. Junior is a just the perfect dog all around and accepts any and all the attention and love he can get.  text 702 239 7985

name: Jada
description:
Hello I'm Jada!
I'm a friendly girl that is looking for a forever home. I don't mind other dogs but I get too excited with small breed dogs so I would be best with other dogs my size. I am a senior pup and a home with older children would be the best fit for me.If you would like to contribute to the care and well being of our animals please visit
Nevadaspca.org

name: Staccs
description:
Stacks is a 6 year old chihuahua mx.  She is a sweet dog looking for a forever home. Stacks prefers children that are calm around her. She is not used to having other dogs around her but does warm up eventually to other dogs.

Dogs are available for adoption Saturday from 11am to 4pm and Sunday from 11-3pm at PETSMART (9869 S. Eastern Ave at Silverado Ranch, in the Target plaza, Las Vegas, NV 89123).  

Volunteers and/or donations are always welcome!  Thank You for your support.

name: Lilly
description:
Mayteâs Rescue
Meet lilly. This 3 year old girl who is cattle dog/ pit loves kids,cats and other dogs. She is potty trained and loves to give kisses and be spoiled. Her family couldn't keep her and cried when they left. She is loved and needs a loving family that won't leave her again.

name: Annie
description: Annie is a beautiful little girl that just wants to sit on your lap and give you love. She is about 6 yrs young, not aggressive to anyone , dog, or cats. She does need someone who has LOVE in their heart. Potty trained, leash trained, and no barking as she has been in foster care. Annie will have to meet you first and then you are her best friend. Please contact Hearts Alive\Chi of Hearts for more information and how to meet and adopt this beauty queen.

name: Ally
description: Ally is a super super super ( did i say super? ) sweet girl who loves to give hugs and kisses all day long. She was found on the streets and scared. Ally is back on track and would make the a great addition to the family. Ally loves kids, cats, dog, and frogs ,. wait she has not met a frog but would love a frog.! Ally is potty trained, leash trained, and is waiting for a family with or without kids to adopt her. Ally follows commands and fetches her tennis ball nicely. Please contact Hearts Alive for further information and to set up a meet and greet. Do not miss out as she has plenty of interest!

name: Oscar
description:
Greetings everyone! My name is Oscar and all I want is this world is to be the center of your love and attention!
I am a very sweet boy and ultra friendly to people but other animals and small children tend to stress me out and vying to be the main attraction is just not something I am comfortable with.
I know there is an experienced and committed person out there that is looking to make a four legged furry friend their main squeeze.
It takes all kinds to make the world go around and I know my special someone will see me for the fun loving boy I am and provide me the life I so rightfully deserve. 
Please be the one to walk this world with me! Adopt me today!If you would like to contribute to the care and well being of our animals please visit
Nevadaspca.org

name: Chance
description:
Greetings and salutations! My name is Chance and smart money says I'm the dog for you!
If you can't tell by the pure joy on my face, I am a super friendly mid size fella that still has plenty of pep in my step at a cool 10yrs young. The secret to a long happy life is to keep moving!
That's why I love to fill my days with plenty of play. I get so into it sometimes that I need to be reeled back in to keep my excitement focused and mannered.
For this reason it would be best that if there are any children in the home, they be much older and mature.
I may enjoy the company of other animals so it would be IMPORTANT to bring any existing doggies you have already to meet me in person. 
Let's live the good life together and adopt me today!If you would like to contribute to the care and well being of our animals please visit
Nevadaspca.org

name: Margeaux
description:
Hello! I'm Margeaux! 
I'm a senior pup and in need of a home that I can feel safe and secure in. My eyesight isn't what it use to be and I will need a patient and kind home. I do not do well with other pets or children as I tend to panic with fast movements.If you would like to contribute to the care and well being of our animals please visit
Nevadaspca.org

name: Lulu
description: Lulu is the longest resident at PAWS kennel. She has been with us for a year. Lulu requires a person that can handle a very large and strong dog. Lulu needs to be the only animal in the house. Lulu has very high prey drive. Lulu is very friendly, loves to play with her ball, chew on her nylabone and probably would love your couch. Lulu listens well and knows basic commands. Lulu is potty trained.

name: Shadow
description: Shadow came back to PAWS because she was jumping a 5 ft fence and roaming. She was being left outside alone while her owner was a work which is probably why she was jumping the fence..she was bored and needed something to do. While a PAWS kennel she has not tried to jump the fence but we are with her at all times so she is not bored. She is a really good dog. Knows basic commands, potty trained, likes to play ball and is very well mannered. She will need a home that will exercise her daily.

name: Tinker
description: Tinker came in with her sister Midnight. Their owner passed away. Tinker was very shy and scared and took awhile to open up and trust the kennel volunteers. Now she is a happy pup full of energy and would make a great hiking or walking partner. She came to us knowing no basic commands. She has learned to sit and loves to show you for treats. She is potty trained. She will need home that is willing to take the time and patience to earn her trust.

name: Pepper
description: Pepper has had a hard year. His owner passed and he was put into a shelter and was not doing well at all. He was showing aggression. PAWS took him in and he has done very well with all the kennel volunteers. It took time and patience to get him to trust us. He is a very sweet little dog and would be a great friend for someone. Pepper will need to go to a home with no children and the adopter will need to know that Pepper will take time to earn their trust. He loves treats and that will help win his heart. He will need to be taken outside to potty on a leash until he trusts you enough to come to you. With patience Pepper will make a great companion.

name: Spike
description: Spike is one of the happiest pups at the kennel. He just loves life and loves everyone. He is very energetic and would love to be somebodys walking buddy. He does not like large dogs but does well with small dogs that do not mind his high energy. He loves to show he can sit for treats.

name: Carla
description: Carla is a very fun pup. She is full of energy, loves to play ball, loves water and loves to play with other dogs. Carla knows all basic commands very well. She knows how to shake too. Carla listens very well and loves one on one with people. Carla would make a great sport dog, hiking or walking partner. She will need patience on potty training.

name: Kaylie
description: Kaylie is a very shy little girl at first but will warm up to you very quickly. Kaylie loves to be held and sit in your lap but she is also an energetic girl that loves to play ball and go for walks. She does well with small dogs.

name: Midnight
description: Midnight came in with her sister Tinker. Their owner passed away. Midnight was more scared and shy than her sister Tinker. Now she is a happy girl and loves attention. Midnight came to us knowing no basic commands and she really does not seem to think they are necessary. Would love to go for walks and just be with her people. Midnight will need someone that is willing to take the time and have patience to earn her trust. She will make a great friend.

name: Athena
description: Athena loves everyone. She would be a great walking or hiking companion. She would love to just cuddle too! Athena is potty trained. Athena came in with another dog so she may do well with a family that has another dog.

name: Carter
description: Carter needs to be the only dog in the house. He is a wonderful loving dog and enjoys being with his people. He would love to go for walks or just sit on the couch with you. Carter is potty trained.

name: OREO
description: Oh my!  Cutie alert!  Little Oreo is a pint sized pit mix.  He is the perfect age of 5 years old, which means he is past the crazy puppy stage.  He is on the mellow side.  He knows his basic commands, rides very well in the car, and walks nicely on the leash.  He can be particular about other animals, so would do best in a home as the only pet.  He is a friendly boy  who was rescued him from the shelter after he was adopted and returned. We think he is so adorable!  If you would like to meet Oreo, please contact AdoptAnimalNework@gmail.com

name: Bella
description:
Bella is about  4 1/2  yrs old.  She gets along with other dogs, but would need a relaxed male companion.   She does not seem to be fond of the hyper ones.   She lived with cats also.  She is a little shy at first, but the first night in the foster, she was relaxed.  She seems housebroken and has not had an accident so far.  She likes to  follow you around and needs to be able to see you or will be a little whinny.   More will be known about me soon.   

A Path 4 Paws holds adoption events EVERY Saturday & Sunday from 10am-4pm at C-A-L Ranch,  located at 232 N. Jones Blvd right off the I-95.   Please bring your dog(s) for a meet and greet (if applicable)

If you are interested in Bella, please contact dogrescuelv@hotmail.com to confirm the dog you are interested in,  will be attending that particular weekend.  We have limited space at the store, therefore we can not take every dog out to the event.

Bella is spayed/neutered, has current vaccinations and includes a microchip, deworming and 2 free vet visits.  Adoption fee applies.  Please make sure you have read the information listed on the homepage for requirements and restrictions. 

Foster homes & volunteers are always needed.  Please contact us regarding how you can help by fostering or volunteering for our organization.

name: Sprouse
description:
Sprouse is about  6  yrs old and weighs about 49 lbs, needing to put on some weight.   He will do better with older children who understand dog boundaries.  He would not do well with the excited toddlers.  He came in as a stray so more will be known about me soon.   

A Path 4 Paws holds adoption events EVERY Saturday & Sunday from 10am-4pm at C-A-L Ranch,  located at 232 N. Jones Blvd right off the I-95.   Please bring your dog(s) for a meet and greet (if applicable)

If you are interested in Sprouse, please contact dogrescuelv@hotmail.com to confirm the dog you are interested in,  will be attending that particular weekend.  We have limited space at the store, therefore we can not take every dog out to the event.

Sprouse is spayed/neutered, has current vaccinations and includes a microchip, deworming and 2 free vet visits.  Adoption fee applies.  Please make sure you have read the information listed on the homepage for requirements and restrictions. 

Foster homes & volunteers are always needed.  Please contact us regarding how you can help by fostering or volunteering for our organization.

name: Berra
description:
COURTESY POST: IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN MEETING BERRA IN LAS VEGAS PLEASE CONTACT rescuesaints@gmail.com.

I  need to rehome my 7 year old St Bernard/Shepard mix dog. We adopted her from you 7 years ago. She is large and is very loving, however very stubborn and will nip at our friends and jump on them for attention and so we don't know anyone that wants her. She is good with other dogs small and large and is ok with small children however can knock them over easily due to her size so I would say she would be better in a family with older kids. Our two year old can crawl all over her and pull at her hair and she doesn't mind but if she gets in a playful mood she knocks him down which can be scary for some kids.

She needs lots of exercise and attention which she is lacking in our home and with the addition of a new baby it has gotten worse for her. She often has to be locked in a separate part of the house so she doesnt hurt our guests with her jumping and nipping at them and we feel she would be able to enjoy her later years in life in a different home. We are constantly having to tell her to go lay down somewhere because she is just too much around the babies not for being bad just the way she tries to get attention (she leans and pushes on you) ends up knocking them over and hurting them. We have been trying to find her somewhere to go for over a year now with no luck we even posted her on the no kill network back on November 2018 and paid to feature her and no one has been interested.

name: Addison
description: Hello, my name is Addison and I am a 1yrs. old Labrador Retriever mix. I enjoy playing and running with my four-legged friends, big and small. Iâm a bit shy when you first meet me, but I warm up to you quickly.  I love attention and will at times ask for it. I love being with my family. I would love to have a family who will take me on long walks to the park. I weigh 60lbs. I am currently enrolled in the Pups on Parole program at the women's correctional facility where I am learning my basic commands. Upon completion of the program, I will be brought out for viewing at Saturday adoptions at Bogarts Bone Appetit, 4985 S. Fort Apache at Tropicana. Â  Please call about my status at 702-227-5555 if you are interested in adopting. Please checkout our Facebook page to see who is making an appearance to Saturday.Â Be advised that I may have a waiting list.I like to sleep on Kuranda Dog beds, but we don't have enough for everyone.  If you would like to donate a bed at a special wholesale price for me to sleep in comfort, please click here.https://kuranda.com/donate/3894

name: Dougie
description:
Drum roll pleaseâ¦.!!
 
I would LOVE to introduce Doug, Dougie, Douglas to the WORLD!!! This little boy is so beautiful, so special and SO ANIMATED he will brighten up your day with just a look!
 
Here is a little about him!
He is an estimated to be about 4 years old, neutered, up to date on shots. He does suffer from dry eye and will need drops 3-4 times a day in both eyes for the rest of his life.
Dougie came from our local shelter and has with double eye ulcers one is almost healed while the other one continues to give us some trouble but is healing. He was newly blind when we started fostering him, so he was very scared of everything and how it was presented to him and honestly is a bit scared of things still.  He does get extremely comfortable with his surroundings quickly.  He loves his toys, LOVES company around him, loves short walks. He does well with other dogs if introduced correctly and finds confidence with other dogs around him. We are working on some anxiety issues and potty training; I believe he was an outside dog his whole life. He does have some skin allergies but what bulldog doesnât! 
 
I cannot express how great this lilâ boy is, he so affectionate, wraps your leg up like a burrito and will not let go! He does little dances around the house and loves you each time he sees you a little bit more.
 
If you are interested in Doug please contact A Home 4 Spot and if you have any additional questions or concerns for me, please let me know!text 702 239 7986

name: Copper
description: Are you looking for a companion to sing the night away with you? Copper is a 1yr. old Coonhound, who will sweep you right off your feet with his soulful voice.  He is a very smart and loveable guy, who enjoys being by you. Copper loves everyone he comes into contact with and will stare you down with his handsomeness.  He is very affectionate and loves attention. He is a very happy and energetic guy who needs an active family that loves the outdoor and will take him on adventures. Copper weighs 60lbs. He is currently enrolled in the Pups on Parole program at the women's correctional facility where I am learning my basic commands. Upon completion of the program, I will be brought out for viewing at Saturday adoptions at Bogarts Bone Appetit, 4985 S. Fort Apache at Tropicana. Â  Please call about my status at 702-227-5555 if you are interested in adopting. Please checkout our Facebook page to see who is making an appearance to Saturday.Â Be advised that I may have a waiting list.I like to sleep on Kuranda Dog beds, but we don't have enough for everyone.  If you would like to donate a bed at a special wholesale price for me to sleep in comfort, please click here.https://kuranda.com/donate/3894

name: journey
description: Meet Journey! She is a 5 year old Chihuahua mix and weighs 7lbs. Journey is a new addition to the AH4S family. This little nugget has the sweetest face and looks like a forever puppy. She was scared when we got her from our local shelter but within a few minutes she started to calm down and wanted nothing but love and attention. Journey loves to play with other small dogs and walks well on a leash. She's spayed, chipped and up to date on vaccines. For more info please text 702 239 7986

name: Elijah
description:
Elijah is a cocker spaniel and 8 yrs old 18pds real sweet dog seems to be comfortable being around dogs his hair is very soft he looks much younger then they say. Will update as we know more. text 702 239 7986
Elijah personality is really starting to shine.

name: Albert
description:
Meet Albert
9 pdf of love very sweet, seemed not afraid but did want out of the kennel. He is going to be a love bug.
Will update as we learn about him text 702 239 7986

name: Beethoven
description:
Beethoven is about  4  yrs old and weighs about 56 lbs.  He came into the shelter as a stray so more will be known about me soon.

name: Parker
description:
Parker is about 1 yr, 9 months old and weighs about 53 lbs. He was adopted from the shelter as a teenager, than returned a year later.   He is reported to be housebroken and knows the doggie door.  He is active so needs an owner looking for a fun guy ready for an adventure.  More will be known about me soon.   

A Path 4 Paws holds adoption events EVERY Saturday & Sunday from 10am-4pm at C-A-L Ranch,  located at 232 N. Jones Blvd right off the I-95.   Please bring your dog(s) for a meet and greet (if applicable)

If you are interested in Parker, please contact dogrescuelv@hotmail.com to confirm the dog you are interested in,  will be attending that particular weekend.  We have limited space at the store, therefore we can not take every dog out to the event.

Foster homes & volunteers are always needed.  Please contact us regarding how you can help by fostering or volunteering for our organization.

name: RUSS
description: Meet Mr. Russ!  This boy is full of spunk and personality. He was left in the park with his brand new toy.  No owner came back for him. We can't understand why, as he is such a sweetheart! A neighbor fostered him for 3 days and said he was great other than just a little protective of his toy. He loves to be brushed, loves cuddling with humans, playing with other dogs or just enjoying his special bone. He is estimated at 2 years old and is 30 lbs of pure love. We looks to be a Russell Terrier mix. We do suggest older children he is guarded with his toys and food and does like to be top dog. If you would like to meet this sweet guy please contact AdoptAnimalNetwork@gmail.com

name: Shay
description:
Shay is a sweet terrier who gets along well with other dogs and is friendly with people once she takes a few minutes to get to know them. She is approximately 3-4 years old and 35 lbs. 

Meet me Saturday from 11 to 1 at Petco, 645 S. Green Valley Pkwy in Henderson.  If you are interested in adopting please submit an application at www.waggingtailsrescue.org.

name: Mia
description: Mia came to us with one newborn puppy and now that she is finished with her mommy duties, she is ready to be someoneâs loved lap dog. She is doggie door trained and good with kids as well as other dogs. Mia is approximately 7 years old and 11 lbs. Meet me Saturday from 11 to 1 at Petco, 645 S. Green Valley Pkwy in Henderson.  If you are interested in adopting please submit an application at www.waggingtailsrescue.org.

name: Marvin
description:
Marvin is a sweet, good-natured, handsome boy. He gets along well with other dogs, large and small, and he rides dreamily in the car! He sits politely and, if offered the opportunity, will put his nose out to get some fresh air! 

He walks well on a leash but sometimes pulls in excitement, particularly if he sees a new dog or person. He sometimes will bark, but with verbal reassurance from his human, he gathers himself and continues politely on the walk.

Completely potty trained, Marvin does not have accidents. When at home with his human, he kindly stands at the front door when he would like to be let out. 

Despite his age of 6 or 7, he still has energy and does enjoy jogging around or playing with his canine friends. 

At home, Marvin loves to cuddle with his human, but he will also curl up at your feet while you read a book or lay on the bath mat while you take a shower. At bedtime, he likes to sleep in bed with you but, if asked, will sleep on his fluffy dog bed right next to you.

Marvin bonds quickly and strongly to kind people. While he will go into a crate, when left alone he will scratch at the crate door and howl. When left alone at home with run of the house, he does bark, whine, and howl, while scratching at the door nearest him. 

His ideal home would have least one person in the house to be with him most of the time. With some time and consistency, he could gain the needed confidence to be home alone, but being able to have the opportunity to work on his separation anxiety only in short bursts over the course of a few weeks would be most appropriate for now. He is the perfect dog in every way for someone who is able to spend the majority of every day for a while with him, while his confidence and trust bloom.

name: Lafayette
description:
Meet A Home 4 Spot new kid Lafayette. We have learned so far that Lafeyette is...
***A very happy dog who is friendly towards all people but may not care for small children.
***He is non- reactive to other dogs and cats as well so will probably do well with both.
***Lafayette walks great on a leash and is a medium energy, calm, dog.
***He absolutely loves to play in the water and loves food - we were told he may have some              issues with snapping treats out of hands but have not seen this.
Lafayette is an absolute pleasure to be with and will be going to a home where any children are older and mature.  Stay tuned for more information about Lafayette as we get to know him better but so far, he is pretty perfect.
www.ahome4spot.com     text 702 239 7986

name: Ava
description: Ava is a super sweet girl who we are getting to know better. She is shy at first but will warm right up once she meets you. She is not good with other dogs or cats. She loves to play with her toys and get her belly rubs. She is crate trained, working on walking on a leash, and potty trained. Please contact Hearts Alive for more info and to set up a meet and greet with her.

name: Shadow
description: Shadow likes to chase toys and play.  He's not overly rambunctious and seems like he'd prefer a couch.

name: Mike
description: Mike loves to play!!!!  he loves water. if there is a water bucket out, he will be sitting in it.  He's super friendly. He loves to play with toys as well.

name: Zeus
description: Zeus and bear bear are a duo who came into the shelter months ago.  They get along with each other very well but don't need to be adopted together.  they'd both do fine alone.  They like to toss toys around and play, but they are pretty easy going and not overly active.

name: Maddie
description: Maddie is a spunky girl who loves to run and play! Approximately 4-5 years old and 22 lbs, she is a perfect medium sized dog who doesnât take up too much room on the couch yet is perfect for hikes and other adventures. She gets along so well with other dogs and loves people.Meet me Saturday from 11 to 1 at Petco, 645 S. Green Valley Pkwy in Henderson.  If you are interested in adopting please submit an application at www.waggingtailsrescue.org.

name: Willie
description: The many faces of Willie - smiling or serious, he's still adorable! This 3 month old pup is friendly and playful. He is looking for a fun family to call his own where he'll get lots of playtime - and treats! We are expecting him to be approximately 10-12 lbs when fully grown.  Meet me Saturday from 11 to 1 at Petco, 645 S. Green Valley Pkwy in Henderson.  If you are interested in adopting please submit an application at www.waggingtailsrescue.org.

name: Toto
description:
GOOD LUCK TOTO ?

This senior cairn terrier came to rescue because his owners passed away and he needed a new home. His foster mom Jen and her pups welcomed him in and loved him up. He got a full physical and bloodwork and is super healthy but does need pancreatic enzymes each meal. His foster family took him on night walks, day hikes and so much more. Toto is a decendant to the real Toto of Wizard of Oz.

name: Golden
description:
GOLDEN ?

She's about a 2yrs old petite GSD. Very timid at first meeting but will warm up quickly. She gets along well with other dogs too. ??

She can be a little bit of an alpha/dominant girl as with most GSD females. She has no food or treat aggression, loves the outdoors and could use a little leash work. 

She LOVES attention and has no problem giving it in return. She would make a wonderful addition to any family ?????????

vegaspetrescueproject.com

name: Avalon
description: Meet Avalon, or as we call her in her foster home, Ava.  Ava is a very sweet 4 year old chihuahua possibly Doxie mix.  Sheâs shy at first, but once she feels safe, sheâs happy and outgoing.  Ava is great with other dogs and does well on a leash.  She uses a dog door, or stands by the door to be let out, and has never once had an accident in her foster home.  Ava does best with calm, older children, as little ones scare her.  She enjoys playing with her ball, and she loves being outside when itâs not too hot.  She will bark to defend her yard.  Ava is about 17 pounds.  She rides very nicely in the car and enjoys looking out the window.  She sleeps on her dog bed through the night. Ava loves to be with her people, you can tell because she has a huge smile when you come home!  To meet Ava, please text her foster mom at (702)366-6391.  She is spayed, up to date on shots and microchipped.  Her teeth look great.  There is an adoption fee.

name: Katie
description:
Meet Katie,  a 5 month old Italian Greyhound-Chihuahua mix who has a lot of puppy energy.  She is a happy girl who loves to play, go on walks and enjoys the company of the dogs in her foster home.  Katie sleeps through the night so her humans can get their rest.  Katie is house trained and  has learned to use a dog door.  She would do best in a home with another small dog.

Katie is spayed and micro chipped and has received her first vaccines.    If you are interested in Katie, please go to wecareforanimals.org to complete our online pre-adoption application.  Katie's adoption fee is $150.

name: JORDAN
description: Jordan is from a hoarding home with several of our other dogs. Very easy going, does great with other dogs and loves to be around people. If you would like to meet Benny with several other Terriers from the same place please contact AdoptAnimaNetwork@gmail.com

name: Kennedy
description:
Kennedyâs day out! 
This 7 m old Pointer/Pit mix is ready to find a foster home!
Sheâs bubbly and social with people and greats other dogs appropriately while on leash. 
She would love a home with an active lifestyle!
Training is provided by rescue ? 
Fill out an application to foster Kennedy! 
www.animalhelpalliance.org

name: Kiki
description:
Our very perfect Kiki is searching the city for a foster or foster to adopt home. 
Kiki is approx 4 years old sheâs THE FRIENDLIEST girl you could ever imagine and loves any human sheâs ever met! She enjoys walks and car rides but is very laid back. 
The hair on her head is like velvet & sheâs also potty trained. 

Kiki is diabetic and takes insulin 2x a day after her meals and sheâs also partially blind, we do think she sees shadows and has adapted very well. 
Because of being blind it takes her a while to get use to new dogs and is at first very defensive when they run up to her face. 
With that, she would either do best as the only pet, or in a home committed to very slow intros and working closely with our trainer. 

Kiki has been living at our vet and as much as she loves them she needs a home, a very special home, for a very special girl ??

All costs are paid by rescue. 
Fill out an application on our website to meet her. 
www.animalhelpalliance.org

name: Wrinkles
description:
Wrinkles is an approximately 5 year old male shar pei that came into rescue after being abandoned. He is recently neutered and had bilateral entropion (eyelid) surgery. He is about 38 pounds. He will chase cats and we arent sure about small dogs, but seems good with larger dogs and people!

We will post more info as we learn it. Visit www.peipeople.com to fill out an application.

name: Bubba
description:
Hi, my name is bubba.
I am a miniature American Shepard. I am approximately 3 years. I love to play with toys and go on walks. Im good with other dogs. But you have to introduce us slowly, I have anxiety issues Iâm working on , I canât be around children, thatâs what causes my anxiety. 
Iâm very loyal and loving. 
I love to cuddle. Take me home today. Iâll Love you forever? text 702 2397986

name: Darth
description:
Meet Darth

If you are interested in meeting Crayon, please complete an adoption application on our website at: http://pitstopets.org/adoption-application/

name: Yony
description:
How the heck are ya?! I'm doing great.. NOW!! Just a couple of weeks ago I was not feeling so well, walking down Main Street in the Las Vegas heat. A nice Animal Control officer lady took me to the shelter and now I'm with Hearts Alive Village Rescue. Strange how life can just turn on a dime! I've been to the vet where they treated my ears and discovered my thyroid was in need of support. This new medicine makes me feel better than I ever have before. I'm a big girl at 104 lbs and only 7 years young. I really looooove humans and dogs and cats are just fine in my book, too.

I really enjoy a car ride, will try to crawl in your lap for attention, and need a safe and comfy place to call my own. I'd love to meet you! For interest in being my foster or forever home, please email info@havlv.com

name: Beagly
description:
Beagly is a 5 yr old male tricolor beagle. He has been with the same family for for all 5 years but has had some typical behaviors that many beagles have and the family could not handle this anymore. Beagly has some food aggression and resource guarding. which means that typically he might need to be fed separately and you have to be very careful taking things from him that he might not want to give up. He also reacts if you touch him while he is sleeping. Beagly has mostly been able to get away and do what he likes due to the fear of getting bit portrayed to his owners. So far we noticed that he is in great condition and is very smart. He picks up learning rather quickly. Beagly likes to play and is a nice dog. He needs a home that will continue to work with him and have patience. No toddlers though. We have been able to work with his food aggression and he has made great strides. He absolutely loves to watch TV.

adoption fee is $225. Adoption fees go back to and cover all of the medical for all of the dogs. All dogs are spayed/neutered, vaccinated and micro chipped upon adoption and many have received further treatment for such things as lump removal, severe ear infections, leg injuries, etc.. **Free T-Shirt with adoption, please let us know your size**
For more information or to submit an adoption application, please visit our website at http://www.southernnevadabeaglerescue.com . We are also on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/SouthernNevadaBeagleRescueFoundation . Come meet and play with our available dogs at Las Vegas area dog parks. Times and locations can be found at http://www.meetup.com/beagles-207/ . Contact us or check our Facebook updates ahead of time if you are interested in meeting a particular dog. All our dogs are in foster homes so not all are available to attend all our park meetups.
Our meetup group playdates allow you to socialize your beagle with his/her own breed at dog parks with large fenced areas where the beagles can run and play off-leash. Beagle enthusiasts, come bay with us..... AROOOOOOOOOOOO!

name: Ozzy
description:
Ozzy is a beautiful special needs boy, he is about 16 months old and has had a rough start in life.  His mother was a stray that had a litter of pups.  She and her babies were on their own until Ozzy was about 9 months old and finally trapped by animal control and brought into the shelter. Eventually, Ozzy and his siblings were adopted.  Unfortunately, Ozzy became ill and was returned to the shelter.  It was determined he had valley fever.  For the next 5 months he was in foster care, where with the correct medicine and extra nutrition he started gaining weight and getting better. 

It has been a long road but ge is ready for his own family to love him and for him to love.  

Ozzy will need to continue his medicine daily and have blood work again in October.

If you would like to meet Rocsi, please email AdoptAnimalNetwork@gmail.com.

He is a snuggler and loves to cuddle under covers with his person. Timo is approximately 1 year old.

name: Jolene
description:
Jolene came to us when her owners realized puppies are a lot or work and hounds are pretty loud. 
This sweet puppy is a huge snuggle bug and wants to be as close to you as possible. She loves playing with toys and is great around other dogs. 

The perfect home for Jolene will give her a job, like agility training, nosework, or something similar to keep her mind engaged and her body working.

If you want to make Jolene part of your family, apply to adopt her at www.onmywayhomerescue.com

Treeing Walkers make nice companions and family dogs, assuming you donât expect them to be content to just lie around on the front porch. They have a strong desire to hunt, and if you donât help them fulfill that need, theyâll go off on their own to see what they can find. On the trail, this is a dog that hustles. Heâll find a track, push it and get to the tree before all the other dogs. Not surprisingly, he does well in coonhunting competitions.

The Treeing Walker generally gets along well with children â although a puppy can be too rambunctious around toddlers â and other dogs. If you have cats, rabbits or other small, furry pets, beware. The TW may view them as prey. Supervise his interactions with them in the home, donât leave them alone together, and donât let them out in the yard together.

Bear in mind that the Treeing Walker is more gung-ho than some other Coonhound breeds. Health permitting, heâll enjoy a couple of long walks or runs daily. Heâll also appreciate the opportunity to run off leash in a safely enclosed area once or twice a week.

As far as training, hounds tend to be independent thinkers who like to do things their own way. They have a short attention span because their interest is always being captured by a scent theyâd like to check out. Assume that if your Walkerâs nose is down, his ears are closed. He is more sensitive, tractable and amenable to training than many hounds, however. For best results, begin training early, keep training sessions short, and use positive reinforcement techniques, never force. The Walker especially appreciates food rewards.

name: Joby
description:
Introducing joby, a sweet dachshund mix!

Joby came to us under socialized and unsure of himself with other dogs. He's learning so much and making lots of canine friends along the way!

You can apply to adopt him at www.onmywayhomerescue.


Quick Dachshund Facts
Dachshunds are in the hound dog breed group.
Theyâre known for their short legs and long bodies.
Common nicknames are: doxies, dachsies, sausage dogs, wiener dogs, and hot dogs.
Pronunciation of the word âdachshundâ is DAK-sund and not âdash hound.â
There are four sizes: toy dachshund (smallest), miniature dachshund, tweenie, and standard dachshund.
Their average weight is under 11 pounds (toy dachshunds and miniature dachshunds),  11 to 16 pounds (tweenies), and 16 to 32 pounds (standard dachshunds).
Their average life span is 12 to 15 years.
There are three varieties of dachshund fur: smooth or shorthaired; longhaired; and wire-haired.
They come in many colors and patterns.
They were bred to dig and they will dig holes in your yard if you let them.
They have a loud, deep bark that people will assume is coming from a large dog. That makes them great guard dogs!
Theyâre considered clever, intelligent, and mischievous.
Dachshunds are very affectionate. They often bond most with one person and can become clingy, in a cute way.
Theyâre stubborn and notoriously hard to housebreak. Vets and trainer recommend crating them on a schedule to solve this.
Theyâre not easy to train. It takes a lot of patience, and will include a lot of laughter.
Theyâre brave. They show it by barking and sometimes by lunging at other dogs.
When theyâre puppies especially, theyâll chew up your shoes, book covers, and other objects.
Dachshunds are prone to becoming overweight. To keep your doxie healthy youâll need to monitor his food intake carefully and take him on daily walks.
Dachshunds love to jump on high things. But they can also develop herniated or slipped disks because of jumping down. So you need to keep an eye on them and place them on the ground.
When you hold them, you need to give support to their backs with your hand.
You should only get a dachshund from responsible breeders and rescue organizations, which you can research in advance on the Internet.

name: Esme
description:
Recently joining the ranks of the rescue family is Esme, a 8 year-old Mexican hairless girl weighing 6 pounds.

Arriving at the shelter with 3 teeth, she left the shelter with only 1 because there was a piece of stinky fabric stuck in her teeth and when it was removed, 2 of her teeth came out with the fabric. So...Ms. Esme joins the old lady, \"tongue brigade,\" and is getting lots of cuddles and kisses.

If you would like to sponsor Esme's care or apply to adopt her, please visit our website at www.onmywayhomerescue.com or you can donate through our PayPal savethedoxies@gmail.com.

Thank you for always supporting our rescue mission throughout Southern Nevada.

PERSONALITY AND TEMPERAMENT
Prized as both a companion and guard dog, the Xoloitzcuintli maintains a calm demeanor even as it remains attentive to its surroundings.  It is an intelligent breed, and generally takes to training easily, as long as the training is gentle and consistent. The Xolo will not respond well to harsh training methods.

While the adult Xolo is known for being composed and relaxed, the Xolo puppy, like many young animals, is more high energy and will require more daily exercise and attention â and lots of chew toys. If this is given appropriately and as needed and training is consistent and enforced with affection, the Xolo puppy will grow into an admirable and reliable representative for its breed.

The Xolo does retain some of its more primitive characteristics, chiefly as a hunter of small game, so its environment should be one in which it will not be able to easily escape (e.g., high fences, closed gates).

Humans have long believed that the Xoloâs warm, soft skin radiates healing energy, so as part of its natural evolution has been in alignment with its human companions, the Xolo has developed  a strong sense of tranquility and patience with humans.  The Xolo is believed to relieve the pains associated with rheumatism and head pains, as well as to help relieve insomnia.

CARE
The Xoloitzcuintli needs very little grooming. Generally, a soft, warm cloth to cleanse the skin is sufficient.  Exercise needs are moderate. Daily walks or jogs and outdoor play during warm weather will benefit the Xoloâs health.  Skin care should be undertaken carefully, with regular checks to make sure the skin has not become too dry. Skin care products, lotions, shampoos or anything that has the potential to irritate the skin should be avoided.

With these precautions in mind, keeping your Xolo safe from harsh sunlight, as well as protecting it from cold temperatures will be main concerns. Because they are sensitive to climate, Xolos are considered indoor dogs. They should never be left outdoors for long periods of time. During cold seasons, your Xolo may be more comfortable wearing a sweater, and of course, spending as little time outdoors in the cold as possible.

HEALTH
As a result of its natural evolution, the Xoloitzcuintli is a vigorous and healthy breed, with very few health concerns. As previously mentioned, the skin should be protected from chemicals, sun, and temperate changes. When products are needed, stick to skin care products that are specifically formulated for sensitive skin (like baby sun block, baby lotion, etc.). It is always a good idea to check with your veterinarian before using anything new on your Xoloâs skin.

name: Neutron
description:
Neutron is 12 years young, and has a loving, caring personality. He does great with other dogs, cats, and chickens. His favorite thing to do is lounge around, and get belly rubs. He also loves to rub his face against you. 

Neutron does great with other dogs that are nice and calm like him, and while he gets along with ALL dogs, we think it would be best for him to share his new home with other seniors or dogs with a laid back demeanor like him.

Neutron is part of our Pip's Pals program where his adoption fee and care for his life will be sponsored by the rescue. Message us to find out more about it!

To meet Neutron please e-mail us at secondchanceLV@gmail.com
** or view our website, https://www.secondchancelv.org/ to see when you can meet him/her at one of our adoption events. 

*Please be aware that we can not adopt out dogs larger than 40+ pounds to an apartment or condominium

We are a non-profit organization ran by 100% unpaid volunteers, the adoption fee for each animal is to help offset the costs of running the rescue (medical care, food, shelter, etc) and to ensure that we can continue helping animals.

name: Jade
description:
Poor Jade has been with the rescue for two years. Jade is a 13 year old Miniature Pincher who was rescued from the local shelter after she was dumped by her previous owners who were having a baby.  Her favorite things to do are cuddle next to her foster parents, hide and sleep under blankets, and go for car rides. 

Jade may be a senior but she has a ton of life left in her and is looking for a home to call her own. She is still spry enough to go to the dog park and go for walks. She recently had her teeth cleaned and her bloodwork shows she needs a kidney friendly diet, which we can supply. She will eventually also need to take kidney medication, which will be covered by the rescue as well. 

Jade is potty trained, her foster home leaves potty pads out when she's going to be gone for extended hours and she uses them. Jade is good with other dogs and doesn't mind sharing her house with a new brother or sister, but also wouldn't mind being your one and only.

This pet is part of our \"Pips Pals\" Program. 

In March of 2012 we began taking in medically fragile and animals in need of hospice, with our first resident, Pip! However it wasn't until 2019 did we give the program a name and begin to have a focus on those who are so commonly overlooked

Unfortunately, our rescue is adoption-based, and that is how we guarantee that we can continue to save lives. But, we could not let these senior and terminally-ill dogs live out their final days in a cold, lonely shelter. So, we started the Pip's Pals Palliative & Hospice Care. 

This program relies on hospice foster homes to open their hearts to dogs who will never leave. They will not be able to find a wonderful adoptive family, they will not watch their foster dog transform into a healthy pet, they will never say, see you later,but rather goodbye. As you can imagine, it takes a very selfless, compassionate, and strong foster to do this. Essentially, they are taking these dogs in as their own, and loving them fiercely until it is their time to pass.

Say Yes When Others Cannot
Hospice fostering isn't  cheap, Second Chance covers all of our Pip's Pals medical bills. So, we look to donations to help support this program. Each animal gets special food, pain medicine if needed, various other medicine for eye issues, ear issues, dental issues, etc. as well as ongoing medical care to make sure they are comfortable.

When the time comes for them to cross the Rainbow Bridge, we believe in their foster home, surrounded by the people (and animals) they love, is the only way to dignify these sweethearts. 

Below you will find a list of our current hospice animals. We will keep the ones who have passed on our page as well. They are important. They are loved. Thank you for helping us save them.

Questions? Please email SecondChanceLV@gmail.com

If you are interested in meeting please submit an application by visiting our website, https://www.secondchancelv.org/

To meet  Jade*Sponsored Adoption & Care please e-mail us at secondchanceLV@gmail.com
** or view our website, https://www.secondchancelv.org/ to see when you can meet him/her at one of our adoption events. 

We are a non-profit organization ran by 100% unpaid volunteers, the adoption fee for each animal is to help offset the costs of running the rescue (medical care, food, shelter, etc) and to ensure that we can continue helping animals.[

name: Kane
description:
Kane is a  handsome 3 year old male rescued from the local shelter. He was not showing well at the shelter because of his intimidating bark.  We are working on his meet-n-greet social skills as he does become vocal when seeing new people.  

He enjoys his treats, loves attention and spending time hanging out with his peeps, including other dogs.  

Kane is a strong, big boy, so a home with large breed dog experience  is best.  

If you are interested in Kane, please submit an online application. www.sincitysaintrescue.org

name: Bobbie
description:
Bobbie is about  2  yrs old and about 10 lbs.  She was owner surrendered with 4 other small dogs, 2 big dogs and 2 puppies.   She was one of three that were surrendered pregnant.  They lived mostly outside and were around children.  She has  transitioned well to being an inside dog.   The puppies were born in May, and now everyone is looking for a new beginning.  More will be known about me soon.

name: Carter
description: Meet Carter! Carter is a male 7 year old Lab/Pit bull Mix and weighs 64lbs.  He's an absolute love and will give you kisses all day. He is a proud graduate of Animal Foundations ACE Program which is a 10-step Canine Good Citizen training program developed by the American Kennel Club.  He knows his basic manners and will happily show you what a good boy he is.  He loves to play fetch and will see you playing all day! Carter is neutered, chipped, and up to date on vaccines. For more info please  text Diana at 702 239 7986.

name: Trinket
description: Trinket is a super easy 1 year old dog.  Sheâs possibly a chihuahua pug mix.  She is shy at first.  Trinket is great with other dogs and wants friends to play with.  She loves squeaky toys and ripping stuffing out of her toys. Trinket potties on pee pads or outside. She is a quick learner. Trinket may be best with older kids, since she is shy at first.  She does well in the car and on a leash.  Trinket is a sweet girl who loves to have her belly rubbed and to snuggle on the bed. Text 702 239 7986

name: Tucker
description:
Tucker is a happy Beagle  mix.  He currently lives in a foster home with other dogs and cats and gets along well with everyone.  He is a very friendly guy who enjoys a nice walk each day and hanging around with his humans.  He also enjoys car rides.    

Tucker is about 6-7 years old, weighs 27 lbs. and is neutered and current on vaccines.  He recently had a dental and is micro-chipped.  To express interest in Tucker, please complete our online pre-adoption application at wecareforanimals.org.  Tucker's adoption fee is $60.

name: CALISTA
description: Look at that senior face.  Who knows what this poor girl has been through.  When she came into our rescue, she was missing most of her fur and her eyes had a white haze over them.  As you can see from these pictures, her eyes have cleared up and she has most of her fur back now.  She is now ready to find a home to live the rest of her life as a loved member of a family.  She is very sweet and gentle.  She seems to do fine with other dogs and people of all ages.  We are estimating her to be around 9 - 10 years old.  If you have room in your heart and home for this sweet girl, please email AdoptAnimalNetwork@gmail.com.

name: Louise
description: Louise is a sweet girl. She is the kennel mate of Thelma. This pair were found straying together but unknown if there siblings. Or partners of circumstance. Like her girlfriend loves to play catch, loves water and is very loving. They do seem pretty bonded. But they can also be adopted it separately.

name: Thelma
description:
Thelma is a sweetheart who gets on well with her female friend who she was found straying with. She is playfull but definitely an adult. Loves to play fetch and loves the water.
She seems pretty much bonded with Louise her kennel mate. 
Goes to be fixed 8/5 so will be available for pick up after that date. But if you want to come meet her before then please do.

name: Prince
description:
Prince is a beautiful loving boy. He is still young so is energetic. He knows some commands. Walks on a leash fairly well. He cannot be homed to a home with cats as he definitely dislikes then. Also probably no other small animals as he has strong hound tendency's. 
He likes other dogs and people very much. Great dog to take on outdoor trips and to the lake or river

name: Mika
description:
Very sweet little girl, gets along with other dogs, okay with cats; love people, kids.
Prefer she be adopted with sister Metea, but not necessary.
About 20 pounds.

name: Jay or Jaymie
description:
Meet Mr. bright-eyed and bushy-tailed, Jaymie...

\"Hi, my name is Jaymie.  You may have already noticed my soft, fluffy coat and feathery tail!  I bet you didnât know that Iâm quite the people pleaser too.  I enjoy playing fetch, tug-of-war, and chase with my foster sisters, but most of all I enjoy the company of my human.  

Iâm a quick learner and have already mastered commands like sit, come, kennel, and shake.  Iâm getting better at walking on a leash and my foster mom says with a little more training, Iâll be a pro in no time.  I am looking for an active family with room to run, as I have lots of energy and love to share.\" 

From his foster mom:

Jaymie is a 2 year old Springer-Aussie mix.  He is an active and incredibly smart boy who has a very gentle disposition. He likes to play hard, but settles down easy and wants to relax near his human; you get the best of both worlds with this sweet boy.  He'd suit an active person who wants an outgoing and friendly companion - if you can toss a tennis ball or throw a frisbee, you'll have a friend for life.  

Jaymie has been sharing his foster home with two active female pups (a Springer Spaniel and a German Shorthair Pointer).  He has been an absolute gentleman.  He is house trained as well as crated trained.  He will sleep in his crate all night without complaint.  He knows basic commands and has proven himself a quick learner, so he will excel at obedience training.  Jaymie is happy to be by your side, whether you are going for a walk or a car ride or just lounging around.  Jaymie is driven by praise and is learning that tasty treats are an acceptable form of payment for his good behavior.  He is eager to please and enjoys giving kisses.  He will be a great fit with any physically active and fun-loving family.

name: Barkley
description:
I am an 8 year old, 44 lb. male Red Heeler. I love people and other dogs. I just enjoy a quiet life. Owner surrender.

Adoption fee $225.00

If interested, please complete an application at:

https://forecloseduponpets.org/dog-adoption-application/

name: Kami
description:
Kami is a sweet super senior. At the age of 17, her owner passed away and the family dumped her in a shelter. We got her out of there and attended to her foot right away. They were able to drain pus out of the foot and put her on antibiotics. We will continue to watch this. We believe Kami is mostly deaf and she does pretty well for a 17 yr old.
Kami
LOVES snuggle time. Nothing makes this lady happier than your rubbing her belly or your petting her.
Kami
is not shy about communicating to you it is time for snuggles! She has such a sweet personality and is a very social gal - super friendly with kids, other dogs, and all people. She just loves being around everyone.

Kami
is a good loose leash walker and believe it or not, this beagle gal will walk in a straight line instead of zooming from one side to the other. Seriously!

Kami
is a very active girl. She likes many long walks and is a pretty fast walker when she is not smelling.... everything.

Kami
is house trained and communicates when she needs to go outside and sleeps through the night. She is also a funny gal.... If she thinks you are late on meal time, don't worry, you can find her in the kitchen waiting for you.

name: Fergie
description: Fergie is a friendly, but very fearful tiny little lady looking for a calm home full of love.

name: Gideon
description: Gideon is an interesting guy who's not experienced much yet in his life. At a year old he is very fearful. He likes people, but does have some barrier aggression and resource guarding so he will require an experienced home willing and ready to do some mandatory training. He's a sweet boy who wants to make friends with people and dog, but doesn't really understand how.

description:
Chica is an Approximate 6 yr female beagle. She came into rescue when her elderly owner had to go into long term care. She is severely overweight and we have her on a diet but her adopter will need to keep her on one until she gets does to a healthy weight. She was nervous when she first came in, as expected but seems to get along with other dogs and is adjusting nicely. Now she just needs a forever home dedicated to her healthy and well being.

She was surrendered as a whippet, but she has a bit of a hound bay that she was very vocal with when she wasn't being paid attention to.

name: Farley
description:
Meet Farley! Farley is a handsome Min Pin mix and is just a year old and weighs 11 lbs.  He came to us from the local shelter with his sister Fanni. Farley is a very outgoing boy and loves to meet new people and dogs.  He loves to play and go on walks.  He is a very social and fun dog and would make a great addition to any home!  

Fanni is a 7 year old female beagle mix and weighs 28lbs.  She is a little shy and timid but very sweet.  She follows Farley around and likes to be close to him.  She takes a little while to warm up but is very sweet and loving. Fanni is spayed, microchipped, and up to date on vaccines.  

For more info or to meet Farley or Fanni please text Diana at 702-239-7986.

name: Fanni
description:
Meet Fanni! Fanni is a 7 year old female beagle mix and weighs 28lbs.  She is a little shy and timid but very sweet.  Fanni came to use form the local shelter with her brother Farley. She follows Farley around and likes to be close to him.  She takes a little while to warm up but is very sweet and loving. Fanni is spayed, microchipped, and up to date on vaccines.  

Farley is a handsome Min Pin mix and is just a year old and weighs 11 lbs.  He came to us from the local shelter with his sister Fanni. He is a very social and fun dog and would make a great addition to any home!  text 702 239 7986

For more info or to meet Farley

name: Kayce
description:
Kay is a 9-year-old pitbull who has been through so much in her lifetime but somehow remains one of the sweetest creatures. She absolutely loves to play with toys! Anything she can fit in her mouth that's chewy, she loves! She enjoys walks and playtime with dogs her size. She enjoys sunbathing in the backyard, just make sure she has extra water around! She should not be in a home with cats but is totally fine with dogs her size. She loves to relax and take naps! She is a snorer! She enjoys laying on dog beds and blankets and listens/understands basic commands. She does not like to be crated; she actually Houdini'd her way out of them but is potty trained. She tends to get nervous when meeting guys for the first time, especially with hats but definitely warms up one she realizes they are friends! Overall she is a very mellow girl who just needs a lot of love!

For interest please email info@havlv.com

name: Meadow
description: Meadow is shy at first, but she is quick to warm up with treats. once she gets to know you she's a very playful puppy that just wants to learn how to be a good girl!

name: Milo
description:
Hi all,
Milo was born October 6, 2015. He's pretty timid and a stereotypical chihuahua, despite the white coat. He's neutered and up to date on all shots. He's a timid boy and defensive when he's in unfamiliar territory but as soon as he's comfortable, he's incredibly loyal and a sweetheart. He loves toys and looking out the window. He's always excited to see you and hates seeing you leave. He's good with kids that are gentle after he is comfortable in his environment. His ears look like they have chocolate chips on them and he never knows whether to keep them up or down, but often it's both. He's always been spoiled and well taken care of. Text barb 702 338 9562

name: Shadow
description:
Shadow is a 3yd old black lab and seems to need to be in a home with older mature children.  She has never reacted badly to other dogs that we have seen but she does react to cats.  She LOVES going on walks and walks quite well on a leash without much pulling unless something spooks her, like fireworks.  She definitely spooks easy with fireworks as I think most dogs do.  She just needs to be put in a crate and that helps her feel more secure and comfortable.  She is a pretty quiet dog.  She will always give a few barks when someone knocks or the doorbell rings but she quiets down quickly.  She is very protective of her family.  She has never made an aggressive move toward visitors but she will quietly growl at times until she knows everything is ok.  She is house broken.  I do not know if she will use a dog door as we did not have one big enough for her.  We would just let her out throughout the day.  There are times that she has needed to go and she will \"talk\" to us and make noises that made it known that she needed something. Our word for relieving herself was just potty.  So we would just tell her to go potty.  The first night she spent with us it took her about 24 to actually go potty until she felt safe and secure. She seems to like going on grass the best.  She is not a very energetic dog as far as playing.  We have tried numerous times playing different kinds of toys and she is pretty uninterested for the most part.  Again, her favorite thing is going on walks. text 702 239 7986
Potty trained..walks perfect on a leash....dog friendly!!!!

name: Blue
description:
Blue is a 3 yr old male Saint Bernard mixed with Bulldog? He is tall and lanky and has the extra toe on the back paws. He is listed at 75 lbs, but looks bigger. He was a surrender to the shelter because they were moving.  He seems non reactive with other dogs. Big goofball  More will be known about me soon.

If you'd like to meet this lovebug email us at adoptanimalnetwork@gmail.com

description:
ALL ANIMALS are placed on a legal stray hold per Bullhead City Ordinances for the to owner reclaim. If the animals are not claimed they will be placed up for adoption based on the available date provided.

* All animals MUST be spay/neutered before leaving the shelter *

Adoption Fee is $100

I'm available for adoption on 07/18/2019

Adoption fees cover vet exam, spay/neuter surgery, rabies vaccine, first core vaccine (DA2PP or FRCP), and if you reside in Bullhead City your first 1 year license is on us!

I AM NEUTERED AND COULD GO HOME TODAY!

I was picked up running around the beaches close to the Laughlin bridge. I have one eye that is probably been with me since birth and I am deaf. I am very sweet and my flaws are an extension of my perfection.

name: Mustard
description:
Mustard was part of a pair. He came in with Brit but after an evaluation period, we found them not to be a bonded pair. Mustard is 11 years
but acts like he is 8.
. Mustard is a friendly outgoing guy who is happy and a wiggle butt. he is on the tall side. He was owner by the same family all of his life but was made to live outdoors until they moved and then he journeyed his way from Texas to Las Vegas. Now he is looking for a home to spend the rest of his life in. He does well with other dogs but is also quite independent. We just had the holistic dentist clean up his teeth.
