Wouldn't you love to come home to this beautiful girl's big smile?  Avery is a hound/shepard mix we're guessing 3-4 years old.  She has a petite frame and a very sweet disposition.  She knows her basic commands and walks well on a leash.  She is a bit of a jumper so a well fenced yard is important.   She'd make a pretty perfect addition to any family.
All RSQ Dogs are chipped, fixed and up to date on shots before adoption.
To learn more about RSQ Dogs or to fill out an adoption form for any of our animals, check out the RSQ Dogs website at https://www.rsqdogsutah.org/animals-for-adoption.

name: Yam
description: Adopt a friendly, playful, snuggly puppy! All Best Friends puppies are already spayed or neutered, microchipped, vaccinated, and infused with extra love and cuddles. They need to be taught all those good things that puppies need to learn in order to grow up to be adult dogs, of course. A puppy is a project! But there's nothing these little ones would love more than to grow right up into your family. This puppy was born in May 2019 and came from an animal rescue group in Utah. If you're in love, please fill out an adoption survey and let's get started!

name: Russett
description: Adopt a friendly, playful, snuggly puppy! All Best Friends puppies are already spayed or neutered, microchipped, vaccinated, and infused with extra love and cuddles. They need to be taught all those good things that puppies need to learn in order to grow up to be adult dogs, of course. A puppy is a project! But there's nothing these little ones would love more than to grow right up into your family. This puppy was born in May 2019 and came from an animal rescue group in Utah. If you're in love, please fill out an adoption survey and let's get started!

name: Jalapeno
description: Are you looking to spice up your life? Check out Jalapeno! This boy is still a little shy, but his doggy friends are helping him come out of his shell. With some patience and delicious treats (chicken is his current favorite) he'll open up and let you see his great personality. He loves to go on walks with his friends and enjoys being out in the sun and fresh air. He's curious about new things, although approaches them with caution to make sure that he's staying inside his comfort zone. If you have a lot of love to give and the patience to help Jalapeno see that the world isn't so scary, he would love to learn and be your new best friend!

name: Griflet
description: *ADOPTION PENDING* Adopt a friendly, playful, snuggly puppy! All Best Friends puppies are already spayed or neutered, microchipped, vaccinated, and infused with extra love and cuddles. They need to be taught all those good things that puppies need to learn in order to grow up to be adult dogs, of course. A puppy is a project! But there's nothing these little ones would love more than to grow right up into your family. This puppy was born in December 2015.If you're in love, please fill out an adoption survey and let's get started!

name: Phileas
description: Adopt a friendly, playful, snuggly puppy! All Best Friends puppies are already spayed or neutered, microchipped, vaccinated, and infused with extra love and cuddles. They need to be taught all those good things that puppies need to learn in order to grow up to be adult dogs, of course. A puppy is a project! But there's nothing these little ones would love more than to grow right up into your family. This puppy was born in March 2019 and came from an animal rescue group in Arkansas. If you're in love, please fill out an adoption survey and let's get started!

name: Purple Viking
description: Adopt a friendly, playful, snuggly puppy! All Best Friends puppies are already spayed or neutered, microchipped, vaccinated, and infused with extra love and cuddles. They need to be taught all those good things that puppies need to learn in order to grow up to be adult dogs, of course. A puppy is a project! But there's nothing these little ones would love more than to grow right up into your family. This puppy was born in May 2019 and came from an animal rescue group in Utah. If you're in love, please fill out an adoption survey and let's get started!

name: Princess Aouda
description: Adopt a friendly, playful, snuggly puppy! All Best Friends puppies are already spayed or neutered, microchipped, vaccinated, and infused with extra love and cuddles. They need to be taught all those good things that puppies need to learn in order to grow up to be adult dogs, of course. A puppy is a project! But there's nothing these little ones would love more than to grow right up into your family. This puppy was born in March 2019 and came from an animal rescue group in Arkansas. If you're in love, please fill out an adoption survey and let's get started!

name: SULLY
description:
Silly puppy Sully is a big boy at almost 6-months old, with lots of personality and an eager to learn attitude. Sully was one of our Pixar puppies who unfortunately got displaced from his first adoptive home. He was a little too much puppy for that family, but with some more training and consistency he is likely to make someone very lucky. 
Sully can be a lot of puppy for other dogs too, so we would want to introduce any dog(s) you have to make sure they match well before he gets himself into trouble. 
He and his littermates showed off their confidence and smarts a few months ago and Sully already knows the importance of âsitâ â we expect he would be a quick study for other obedience or trick training when tasty treats are involved.

To meet Sully or find out more about him please text or call Julie at 435.773.5209.  His adoption fee is $150.

name: BUTCH
description:
Butch joined the BAM family having been labeled a 17-year old dog who was likely more in need of a hospice home than typical rescue. Now that heâs in care and has been seen by vets we have the better assessment that he is still a senior, but more likely 10-13. Butch, however, has some neurological defects and impaired vision that can make him seem older. In spite of those physical setbacks Butch has learned how to cope with two groups of five or more dogs in both his foster home and at our adoption center where he spends most of his days. Butch will often motor around with a funny little wobble, but can see shapes or contrast well enough that he doesnât typically bump into things. 
Our biggest concern for this little guy is that he ate some gravel and had to undergo surgery to have rocks removed from his system that werenât moving either direction. This may be something he tried to do again if unsupervised, so we will be quite particular about the home we ends up in to ensure his health and well-being. 

To find out more about Butch, text or call Julie at 435.773.5209.  His adoption fee is $100 but Butch is also eligible for our Seniors Helping Seniors Program.  If you are 65 years of age or older, ask Julie about it.

name: DOM
description:
Dom is the most lovable puppy-dog-eyed Beagle/Bassett Hound blend youâll ever meet. This low-rider came to live at That BAM Place while suffering with Cherry Eye (it doesnât look great but is mostly cosmetic) but that is being corrected and after then heâll be ready for his new family. Dom has clearly lived in a home before and has pretty impressive manners â he does get up on our sofa and is still working on the dog door. Though Dom doesnât bay like a hound he has a bit of separation anxiety at the adoption center when he has to be put in his kennel while other dogs are out. This would likely be different in a home environment and we do offer trial placements to make sure our dog is right for you and your home.  Dom does not do well with young children.  
Dom gets along with the wide variety of dogs we have in residence with him, often napping with the smallest 6-pound dog. But Dom wouldnât mind being an only dog either as he seems to have more connection with our staff and volunteers than with the dogs, and prefers to be with people if given the choice. 

To find out more about Dom or arrange a meeting with him, contact Julie at 435.773.5209 by texting or calling.  His adoption fee is $125.

name: MISSY
description:
Meet Missy! She might look tough but deep down she is just a softy that loves to give kisses and cuddles. She also loves to go on walks and car rides, gets a little sad when you leave her behind. She is very choosy on who her furry house companions are because she likes a lot of love so she does best being the only dog, however she doesnât mind other dogs visiting. Missy is 100% potty trained and would be best with older children because she needs a quiet environment. She is a wonderful dog who will be a great addition to someoneâs family. 
Missy is a gorgeous blue Cane Corso/Pit blend who was very reserved when she first joined BAM but has begun to come out of her shell in foster care. Weâre sure this means that an adoptive home would get to see even more of her personality shine. Missy would love a person or family that she didnât have to share with another dog. However, it may just be that she prefers to be the only girl dog in the home, so if you have a male dog and would like to introduce them we can facilitate that. 

Missy is a medium dog with a lot of muscle, so she would be a good exercise companion and it would help her stay fit too. 
To find out more about Missy text or call Julie at 435.773.5209.  Missy's adoption fee is $125.

name: Addi
description: With good looks and a sweet personality to match, this gal is a double threat! Addi is gentle and loving and warms up quickly to new people especially if you have treats! She is very intelligent and eager to learn and has a grade A sniffer perfect for practicing scent-work. Contact our adoptions team today because this sweet girl is ready to wiggle her way into your heart.

name: Calvin
description: This real life cartoon character is ready to make his way into tour home! Calvin is a big guy with an even bigger personality to match. Though he loves toys, he can play a little rough so we are practicing impulse control & trading. His favorite pass times at the sanctuary are lounging in the shade and romping around the dog park - he even likes to go for a dip in the pool! He's loved every person he's met here at the sanctuary. Contact our adoptions team if you're ready to add a little animation and a whole lot of love to your life.

name: Tomatillo
description: If you are looking for the perfect ingredient to add to your family, look no further than Tomatillo. With his infectious smile and endearing little dance to greet you, he could be the one for you. Tomatillo has impeccable leash manners and loves car rides almost as much as he loves belly rubs. Tomatillo does have an old injury to one of his hips, but it doesn't slow him down much. He gets along well with his two younger runmates and serves as a great role model, as one is quite shy and the other is young and brushing up on her manners. Come by and meet Tomatillo and you will surely fall as deeply in love with him as we all have!

name: Maize
description: Maize steals hearts wherever she goes.. She resides in one of our management offices in Dogtown Headquarters where she acts as a brave role model for one of our long term shy residents, as well as cuddling in for emotional support with all of our human staff. She may look a little squinty in her photo, but she hopes you'll still notice her beautiful face- Maize has a perfectly correctable condition with her eyelids that is being fixed here at the sanctuary. She's an all around awesome dog- friendly with all the dogs she's met here, as well as cats and people of all shapes and sizes (she's our tour dog!). We hope you fall in love with Maize as much as we have!

name: Cucumber
description: The best smile award goes to Cucumber! This girl always has a huge doggy grin no matter what she's doing, although she's happiest when she gets to jump into the pool and splash around. Cucumber's recipe for looking so cute also includes a good roll in the sand after playing in the water, just to make sure you have the adorable dirt-on-the-nose look. She loves to be with her people and enjoys being loved on and having all the attention. After an afternoon of pool time, she would love to snuggle up on the couch and enjoy a good movie. Cucumber is a playful girl who would love to be your new best friend!

name: Edsel
description: You know a dog is really nice when her intake exam notes call her \"very sweet\". Edsel came to Best Friends in July 2019 from Texas and has been winning hearts ever since. Edsel has done excellent with a skin treatment that has greatly improved her coat condition. She has started duty as a tour dog, and meets and greets our afternoon visitors with a smile and a wag of her tail. Edsel is much more popular than the namesake car, and will make a great addition to your home.

name: Krump
description: Large breed lovers, meet this sweet soul Krump! He's a tall and leggy 82 lbs. For him, there is no love sincerer than the love of food. He excels at nose work at the sanctuary finding every last crumb. Krump is crate trained and knows basic cues. A perfect gentleman in the car, he enjoys sitting in the backseat and watching the world go by. One of his favorite pastimes is laying on his back with his legs sticking straight into the air. While at the sanctuary, he currently lives with another large breed female and would do best in a similar environment. He loves to be near you while your around in the house but is calm and relaxed while you are out.

name: Sosa
description: Sosa is a sensitive sweetheart. He's also a fun, active dog who loves toys, water, walks and car rides. Born in 2014, Sosa was picked up as a stray and came to Best Friends from a shelter in Indiana. Sosa appreciates having a predictable routine. He loves to lounge in the shade after playing in his kiddie pool. He also enjoys breaks in his crate where he can work on one of his favorite things: a frozen treat. Sosa loves doing agility and catches on quickly to new training cues. He's also learning to play with a flirt pole, which encourages him to chase and play with a toy on a long rope while helping him with impulse control. Sosa really likes hanging out with his friends at Dogtown. He's a good role model for other dogs, and he has plenty of play dates here. Sosa is working on getting more and more comfortable when he's out exploring new places. He's looking for a patient person or family who can help him learn about life in a home, since we believe he never had one of his own. Although he may need a slight adjustment period in a home, Sosa is a wonderful dog who bonds well with people and would probably do best with a dog friend to show him the ropes.

name: Jango
description: How adorable is a dog who snorts when he's excited and can't stop wagging his tail? Jango is a happy boy who loves people. He's crate trained, rides great in the car and walks really nicely on a harness and leash. Jango loves affection and will try to crawl into your lap. Jango is eager to learn new tricks and truly enjoys using his brain during training. Behind his adorable face is a good-natured boy who enjoys living life and making people smile.

name: Walter
description: Walter is a sweet, friendly, and easy-going dog, who we affectionately call our \"gentle giant. His generous spirit and jovial personality are in direct proportion to his size - all in abundance! As you can see, he has beautiful expressive brown eyes and a gorgeous silky coat that you will never tire of petting. Walter is a \"people person who loves the attention of his caregivers and the volunteers who visit. Walter gets along well with his run mates (both male & female), and will engage in gentle play. He has nice leash manners when exploring the trails at the sanctuary. And he enjoys walking with his run mates, always checking in to make sure they are not too far behind him. Walter is well-behaved in the car, and likes to stick his head out the window to take in the summer breezes. He is a smart pup who knows several basic commands, including \"sit and \"shake. Walter is one of the sweetest dogs you will encounter. We cannot think of anything better than coming home to this special boy as he greets you at the door to smother you with affection and non-stop tail wags. Walter will make a wonderful addition to a very special family.

name: Tillie
description: I'm loving life and now I just need someone to share it with! My name is Tillie and I'm a spunky little lady who is learning all about being a dog. It takes me a while to make friends but once I do, I will trust you and let you into my inner friend circle. I walk on leash, but I feel much better about it when I'm with a friend. I think with time and more good experiences on leash I can be a walking pro. I'm medium energy so I like to be active and do stuff, but I spend a lot of my time just hanging outside and watching the world go by. I would really love a home that has patience and understanding and will give me the time I need to gain confidence. Having a confident role model to learn from would be super helpful as well. I like other dogs and can be playful once I get to know them. Sometimes if they are too rambunctious, I stay away. Are you looking for a friend like me? I will be your loyal companion for life if you let me!

name: Winston
description: Winston was born in 2016 and has energy to burn. He loves to play fetch and to run, and he likes to keep both his mind and body busy with fun activities like nose work and agility. When he sees people he knows, he gets so excited. Winston would be a great running or hiking partner and would do best in an active home. Winston would do best meeting any potential new dog housemates at the Sanctuary before going home. He is working on his basic manners and on loose leash walking at Dogtown. Winston enjoys learning new things with training and knows \"Place\

name: Ripley
description: Ripley loves people and does well with all dogs at the Sanctuary. Although he currently needs a lot of work on basic manners, he's a smart dog who learns quickly. He's working on being polite by keeping all four feet on the floor, rather than jumping on people, and is learning \"sit\" and \"down.\" He is also doing crate training. As Ripley learns training cues and gains better focus, he is growing into a loving and sweet boy. Born in 2015, he will jump fences and is considered a flight risk. He has also shown aggression toward cats in the past and cannot live with them. Ripley will need an active home with someone who can keep him safe and secure.

name: Marilyn Monroe
description: Marilyn loves to greet people while carrying her favorite squeaky ball in her mouth. She's a big fan of fetch and will play until your arm is tired. She enjoys the company of people as well as joining them on hikes, especially if there is water around. An active girl, Marilyn also enjoys exercising on our underwater treadmill during hydrotherapy. She also has fun romping with other dogs during play dates. Marilyn is very smart and learns quickly. She likes to put her smarts into practice on the agility course here in Dogtown. Although she loves being active, Marilyn can also relax and soak up all the petting and affection you can offer and is just waiting for the right person to take her home where she can have a happy balance of activity and relaxation.

name: Mortimer
description: Mortimer is a young handsome friendly guy. At only 38 lbs, he's the perfect medium sized dog to go places with you. Although we're not entirely sure what breed he is, he has an adorable pouty lip, is mostly white with brindle markings on his eyes and has an athletic body. He loves playing with toys and enjoys going on car rides. Already knowing sit and down, he's a super quick learner and loves to learn new tricks. He enjoys meeting people and dogs. Currently living with three other dogs at the sanctuary, they spend the majority of the day wrestling and playing with toys. He'll make a fantastic friend no matter where life takes you and no matter what you're in to!

name: Whiskey
description: Whiskey is a cute young 1-year old pup that is on a mission to get adopted. He is very polite and will charm you with his sweet and gentle personality. He is also super playful and when he is not playing with other dogs, he is focused on getting yummy treats. Whiskey can be slightly nervous when meeting new people, but with the help of treats he will quickly become your best friend. He is working on crate training and walking with volunteers every day. If you have the chance to cuddle with him, Whiskey will thank you in the form of 1000 kisses! Whiskey is an active pup with lots of energy and is ready to go with you to his forever home.

name: Brewer
description: When Brewer sees a familiar face, his entire back end starts wiggling with that infamous \"boxer wiggle\". A friendly and sweet guy, Brewer enjoys being around people. He also likes going for walks and relaxing outside. Born in 2016, he came to Best Friends from local animal control after being picked up as a stray. Brewer knows how to sit, and he walks nicely on a loose leash using a harness. One thing that is very special about Brewer is his unique ability to adapt to his run mates. With a young playful, rambunctious dog, Brewer loves to romp, jump around and play. With the older dogs, he completely mellows up, enjoying gentle play or just laying next them for some quiet time. Brewer is a really nice dog who can't wait to settle into a home of his own.

name: Savannah
description:
Savannah came to us so dehydrated she was in severe kidney failure and unable to make milk for her puppies.  We were told she had only hours left to live. Yet she remained sweet, trusting, and strong in her will to live.  With loving care by our amazing rescue team Savannah is now a healthy, happy girl.  She enjoys walks and playing with her doggie friends (she is a bit of a boisterous play pal so a dog with equal energy would be best).   Savannah has gone home with several of our volunteers and all have remarked that she was a total pleasure and very well behaved. 
 Please give this amazing dog a chance for a kind, loving furever home.
All RSQ Dogs are chipped, fixed and up to date on shots before adoption.
To learn more about RSQ Dogs or to fill out an adoption form for any of our animals, check out the RSQ Dogs website at https://www.rsqdogsutah.org/animals-for-adoption.

name: Georgia
description:
Sweet Georgia is a 1-2 year old heeler mix and her personality fits the breed.  She is happy, active and gets along well with other dogs.   If you're looking for a hiking buddy or a new best friend, come check out Georgia 
All RSQ Dogs are chipped, fixed and up to date on shots before adoption.
To learn more about RSQ Dogs or to fill out an adoption form for any of our animals, check out the RSQ Dogs website at https://www.rsqdogsutah.org/animals-for-adoption.

name: Phillip
description: Phillip is young adventurous dog. With his perky ears and classic bullseye eye-patch, he would be your perfect Instagram model. He would make a great camping, hiking or running buddy at only year of age and 55 lbs. Phillip walks nicely on leash and already knows sit. He loves treats and is highly motivated to learn more tricks. Due to some herding instincts, he may do best in a home without young children. He can be shy at first with new people but loves treats and is happy go walking with new people. He loves to play with other dogs and would enjoy having other dogs to play with.

name: Feebee
description: Feebee is a bit nervous when she first meets strangers, but once she warms up to you, she's super affectionate and fun. Feebee can be silly, too. She sometimes gets the 'zoomies' when she's around her caregivers and feeling especially happy. She gets equally excited to snuggle or to go for a walk on the trails. FeeBee was born in 2013. She'll likely have an adjustment period once she gets to her new home, and she'll need time and patience as well as routine and structure in order to thrive. Feebee also needs a person who can introduce her to strangers safely. At Dogtown, Feebee is working on meeting new people outside of her room, and she'll need to continue this training in her new home. At the Sanctuary, she's also working on meeting other dogs to see if she can make dog friends here. Feebee already knows quite a few training cues, and she loves to show off her skills. If you have some time and patience, FeeBee has a lot of potential to share with you.

name: Mark
description:
We think Markie is about 5 years old, he weighs about 10 pounds and he appears to be a cross between a silky terrier and a Chinese Crested. He hasn't been well socialized so he is a nervous little guy, but once he knows you he will relax and he is a great little dog. He loves to go for walks, he's fairly independent but still likes to snuggle some.

If you would like to meet Markie in person he will be at PetSmart on Saturday from 12 to 4.

If you are interested in adopting him please fill out an application by clicking on the link on this site.

name: Tulsa
description: Our sweet boy Tulsa has it all. Beautiful eyes - check! Soft silky ears - check! Adorable nose - check! Tulsa is a fun and affectionate dog who loves the attention of his caregivers and the volunteers who visit. He has a jovial personality, who simply wants to bask in the warmth of kind words and tender petting. Tulsa gets along well with his doggie run mates (both male and female) and enjoys gentle play. He has nice leash manners and enjoys walking the trails around the sanctuary. Tulsa has a calm demeanor and will be perfectly content sitting by your side while you watch television or read a good book. He has some environmental allergies, which are under control thanks to a prescription diet, daily medications, and a monthly bath. Tulsa may require a little extra care, but he will repay you in kind with years of love, devotion, and companionship! He is a special guy just waiting for a special family to make him their own.

name: Liberty
description:
Liberty was surrendered by her owner along with her 3 sisters.  She was born early March 2019, is a hound mix and weighs about 30 lbs. She is a sweet, friendly, adventurous puppy who does well on a leash and enjoys playing with other dogs.  With some training and daily exercise, Liberty would make a loving addition to any family. 

All RSQ Dogs are chipped, fixed and up to date on shots before adoption.
To learn more about RSQ Dogs or to fill out an adoption form for any of our animals, check out the RSQ Dogs website at https://www.rsqdogsutah.org/animals-for-adoption.

name: PRINCESS
description:
Princess could have easily been named after an Egyptian pharaoh with her striking âeyelinerâ. This young adult has a lot of life ahead of her and would love to find someone interested in continuing the basic obedience training sheâs learning in foster care (she already knows âsitâ and has mastered puppy dog eyes). 

She is a solid girl, but not too tall, and is as affectionate as she is smiley! Princess enjoys being around her people and will do best in a home without small children. Having another dog as a companion and playmate could be ideal. 

We aren't completely sure what breed blend Princess is but did learn in our adoption center that she's a skilled jumper â though she hasnât displayed the same when around baby gates in her foster home. Given her abilities, a person or family looking for a walking/hiking companion, or with a tall-fenced yard for her to be outside off-leash would be best. Knowledge or experience with strong breeds would be a bonus for Princess. 

??Princess is spayed, microchipped, and vaccinated; her adoption fee is $125. ??

Contact Alison by text at 541.936.1766 (or leave a voicemail for a call back) or email admin@becauseanimalsmatter.com if you would like to learn more or to schedule a meet and greet for you (and your dog).

name: ROCKY
description:
Rocky is a handsome young dog, dark gray in color, and about 3 years old.  He's very sweet although a bit cautious at first but warms up quickly.  He would be ok with older, respectful children but no toddlers please.  He would do best with another dog as he does have some separation anxiety.  He knows some basic commands and enjoys trips to the dog park.  Would like walks and car rides.  

Rocky's adoption fee is $125.  To make an appointment to meet him, contact Phyllis at 435-705-9227.

name: HARLEY
description: Harley is a sweet, loving, loyal young dog that is good with dogs.  He's a \"tweener\" meaning he's between a little dog and big dog and is the perfect size.   He is good with older children but we don't have young children to test him with.  We believe he would be fine with a child of any age as long as the child is respectful as he's very sensitive.  He is housebroken with a doggy door, likes to go for car rides.  He is young and his worst habit seems to be jumping when he's overly excited but he may still chew up a few things although he does seem to focus on appropriate toys.  His adoption fee is $125.  To set a time to meet Harley please call or text Julie at 435.773.5209.

name: Princess Mojo
description: Princess Mojo is the most adorable tap dancing dog in the west! She loves to tap-tap-tap her little paws in excitement, whether to go for walks, seeing her favorite people, or in anticipation of meal time, which she thinks is quite magical. She is playful and ready for adventure, but also loves her cuddle time, and is adorable in soliciting belly rubs. The loud boom-booms during thunderstorms make her nervous, and some soothing music and comfort during storms helps her feel better. Everyone who meets her loves this adorable peanut, and we know that you will, too!

name: Remington
description: Remington is a big dog with a big personality. He loves people and wants to spend a lot of time hanging out with them. Born in 2013, Remington prefers humans to dogs. So, he will need to be the only dog in his forever home. He has shown guarding tendencies with other dogs but not with humans. Remington really dislikes brooms and cannot be counted on to help with the cleaning. He is currently working on crate training at the Sanctuary, but he has not perfected the training yet and will not be able to fly to his new residence. Affectionate and easy going, Remington is looking to become someone's new best friend.

name: Watts
description: If you're looking for the world's greatest detective Watts is the dog for you! The world can be a bit overwhelming for Watts at times so to help with his confidence his caregivers have been doing nose work and hiding treats for him to find. He has quickly become a master sleuth and can figure out any puzzle. Because he can get overwhelmed at times, his ideal home would be quiet with a family that would allow him to do things at his own pace. He is a great companion who will respect your space and although not overly affectionate, when he is in his element with the people he loves he is happy and enthusiastic. He has lived with other dogs and mostly keeps to himself so he would make a great companion for another dog that isn't looking for a lot of attention. Watts is looking for that perfect person to help him enjoy life and grow into an amazing confident dog!

name: Timmy
description: Gentle, affectionate Timmy is a hugger and a leaner. He just wants to be close to people, and he is happy to do whatever you are doing, whether it's lounging, hiking, training or running. At Dogtown, he has been improving his dog skills, and he's gotten along great with pretty much everyone. Timmy was born in 2016 and came to the Sanctuary from a shelter in Texas. He can be a little nervous in new situations, and he likes to jump up and offer hugs, so he is working on his manners and on keeping all four feet on the floor when he greets people. Timmy is crate trained and does great on walks. Because he is smart and loves learning, he has been doing agility training at the Sanctuary. Sweet Timmy is searching for an active home and is sure to make a wonderful companion. Timmy has a very generous sponsor who will cover his adoption and transport costs.

name: Trudy
description: Sweet, sweet Trudy has so much love to give. Here at the sanctuary, she greets her caregivers every morning with a wiggly hello, a tail-wag, and a great big smile. When she first arrived, she was very fearful of new people and it took a lot of treats and walks to gain her trust. In the time Trudy has been at the sanctuary, she's grown leaps and bounds with her confidence in meeting people. While she can still be a bit weary of strangers at first, she quickly warms up and becomes a fast friend. Once Trudy is comfortable, she stays right by your side just waiting for pets and attention. She is also a fantastic co-pilot, and settles in on car rides really nicely! For treats, she loves to show off her tricks, like \"sit, \"lie down, and \"shake. Trudy has done really well here living with other dogs and we think she'd like a dog companion or two, although in the end, most of her attention goes to the humans in her life.

name: SAMSON
description:
âLittle Samson (or Zippy as we call him) is the sweetest little guy!  At 12 years (?) young his age does not affect his energy.   He will be your little shadow, follow you around the house and sit on your lap at every chance.  While his back legs make it so he cannot jump up, it doesn't stop him from happily dancing when he sees you.  He does well with going potty out doors as long as he is let out,  he even scratches at the door to let you know he's finished!  We have discovered that he is either very hard of hearing or deaf, but again it doesn't slow him down.   He gets along with other dogs,  big and small, not sure on cats but given his disposition,  not much will affect this little guy. He just wants a lap and love, anyone would be lucky to have him! ?â

To find out more about Samson call or text Julie at 435.773.5209.  Samson is eligible for adoption through  the Seniors Helping Seniors program.  Ask Julie for the details.  His adoption fee is $100.

name: Caine
description: Looking for a young, fun loving k9 companion? Caine may just be the perfect furry friend for you! This 2-year-old athletic fella is hoping to find an adult-only household where he can really shine as a wonderful companion. Caine has a lot of energy but knows how to contain it when necessary. Caine enjoys extra cuddles and attention, car rides and long walks. He avoids pulling on his leash while walking although he will attempt to chase the occasional lizard or rabbit. Fortunately, because he's quite person-focused, his attention is easily redirected to his handler when on leash. If the weather isn't suitable for walking, Caine loves a good car ride and knows the etiquette of staying in the backseat. Watch your cheeks though, because he will sneak in kisses from the back seat from time to time! Caine is bound to make a great companion especially for someone with an active lifestyle looking to include a four-legged friend in their activities.

name: Aurora
description:
Beautiful Aurora spent her first year tied up to the back of a truck.  She was surrendered by her owners because she was too big.  She had been adopted earlier in the summer but was returned due to issues with their other dogs. 
 She had done well with other dogs in her previous foster home. 
 Aurora is a one year old Great Pyrenees (yes, they are big dogs) and is good with preferably older children (due to her size).  A meeting with your dog is recommended to make sure they will play well together.  
She is up to date on vaccines and previously spayed.  Take a look at those soulful eyes and see if you can't find a place in your heart for this sweet girl.

All RSQ Dogs are chipped, fixed and up to date on shots before adoption.
To learn more about RSQ Dogs or to fill out an adoption form for any of our animals, check out the RSQ Dogs website at https://www.rsqdogsutah.org/animals-for-adoption.

name: Boyd
description: Boyd may be a big boy but he still thinks he's a lap dog and loves all the attention. He likes to cuddle and get scratches all over. His favorite thing is covering your face with sloppy kisses. At the Sanctuary, he lives alone, but he has spent time in a home with other dogs of all sizes and did very well. He even passed a small dog test at the Sanctuary. He cannot live with cats, however. Boyd was born in 2013. He can sometimes get overexcited, but he has made huge improvements since coming to the Sanctuary. If you're willing to take the time to get to know a great guy, Boyd would love to meet you.

name: Aiden
description: With a wagging tail and a wiggly body, Aiden greets everyone he meets like they are his best friend. He is happiest when he is with people and getting lots of love and attention. Born in 2012, Aiden came to the Sanctuary from a shelter in Texas. He is charming and enjoys snuggling, cuddling and car rides. He has a lifelong medical condition, Intervertebral Disc Disease, and needs to have limited physical activity. Leashed walks that are long are fine, but he needs to refrain from running and jumping. Aiden needs physical therapy twice a day to help with his condition that will need to continue once he is in his forever home. \"The greatest thing you'll ever learn is just to love and be loved in return,\" seems to be Aiden's motto.

name: Bossco
description: Bossco is a happy, energetic young dog. He loves people and is always happy to see you. He is very smart and loves learning new things. Bossco is an enthusiastic about life in general but he gets especially excited to do nose work, a fun search and scenting sport. Since coming to the Sanctuary, Bossco has become an expert at it. Born in 2017, Bossco has some respiratory issues that limit his ability to go for walks with the leash clipped to a collar or certain harnesses, but he is currently trying a new harness that seems to help. He loves to run around in open spaces, do agility and get attention. Bossco gets very jumpy and mouthy when he gets excited, and he can jump fences. He's working on being calm for leashing, not jumping on people and staying calm while getting attention. When it comes to attention, Bossco will want to be the center of it in a home of his own. He would do best as an only pet so you can give him all your love. He will give you all his love in return.

name: Henna
description: Henna is attentive, playful and goofy at times. While she enjoys her walks, hikes and adventures, she also likes a balanced life and enjoys her downtime. Born in 2009, Henna has interacted well with the dogs that she has been introduced to at the Sanctuary. She would do best in a home with experienced dog owners who are willing to continue her present basic training and work with her on reactivity to other dogs and strangers. She is a tad picky when it comes to her dog friends, preferring males. However, if you are up for taking a chance on her, Henna is up for taking a chance on you.

name: Buster
description: Buster is a happy, energetic pup who loves people. He has never met a stranger. He loves to get scratched and to go on long walks. He has a lot of energy and would make a great hiking companion, but he also enjoys time alone and knows how to entertain himself. Buster gets overexcited easily and becomes jumpy, especially when people are trying to put his harness on. He can also be reactive toward other dogs while he's on a leash. He has been working on staying calm during times of excitement, and he has developed a routine with his caregivers at Dogtown. Buster was born in 2017. He has some mild skin and respiratory issues, but they don't slow him down. He is very smart and will need a person or family who will continue helping him work on being calm. An active home where he can be the one and only, without other dogs or cats, would be ideal for him. Life is already exciting for Buster, but nothing would make him happier than finding a home to call his own.

name: Daniel
description: Daniel is quite an affectionate guy and will climb right into your lap. Once he gets comfortable there, you may have to lure him off with treats. He is a loving dog who bonds strongly with people. Daniel is nervous during storms. He also has some sensitivity in his hind end, so he does not like to be handled there and will give clear signs that he is uncomfortable. However, he loves pets around the head and chest. An energetic guy, Daniel enjoys walks and would do best in an active home. Because he can jump fences, he will need a secure enclosure. He would also do best in an adult-only home due to the sensitivity of his hind end and the fact that he has bitten in the past. Daniel can be picky with his doggie friends, but he can live with other respectful dogs. Born in 2017, he came to the Sanctuary from a shelter in Texas. At Dogtown, he is working on crate training and name recognition. In the right household, this sweet and sensitive guy will make a great companion.

name: Ducky
description: Ducky is a total goofball who loves to make silly faces and give kisses. After being rescued during Hurricane Harvey, he's been so happy and excited about every part of life. Born in 2014, Ducky is the perfect blend of affectionate and independent. He loves spending time with people on walks, and he is a great hiking buddy. During downtime, he is totally content to play with his toys on his own. Ducky can get very excited and jumpy with people he likes, but he can also get overwhelmed and nervous with petting. Ducky has a history of guarding his food, and he has bitten in the past to protect it. He's made significant improvements with all the training he's done at the Sanctuary, but his new person or family will need to keep working with him. Once the food bowl is put away, Ducky is the most happy-go-lucky character. If you're looking for a dog who knows how to be the class clown, he would love to meet you.

name: Water
description: Water has the best dance moves. She'll literally do somersaults to get belly rubs. She loves going for walks and working on yummy food puzzles. Water was born in 2017 and is a survivor. She was treated for distemper and heartworm here at Best Friends, and she is now healthy. When Water arrived at Dogtown, she was extremely shy and afraid to be touched or walk on leash. She's since learned to walk on leash and is now fabulous on walks. Although she is still shy and fearful with strangers, she is gaining confidence, and she now loves getting pets, especially under her chin. As she continues to learn and understand that she is safe, she has become a super snuggly, wiggly and silly girl. It is so fun to watch her progress and try new things every day. She will need continued training to get comfortable with people, noises, experiences and handling, but she is doing very well and is interested in learning. Her ideal person will be patient, understanding and willing to work with her. Water is generally calm and a wonderful cuddle bug. She enjoys being active, but she also appreciates hanging out and relaxing. On top of all that, she'll keep you laughing with her silly antics and her wiggly dances.

name: Griz
description: Griz loves stuffed toys, has an energetic and playful nature and enjoys walks. Although he can be timid and fearful with new people, he is a sweet boy who warms up quickly. Once he does, you'll have all the love you could ever want. Griz was born in 2017. He has done well with all the dogs he's met at the Sanctuary, though he does seem to prefer females. Griz is practicing some basic training and manners at the Sanctuary, and he will need to continue practicing these skills once he's in a home. He is a charming boy who will make a great companion.

name: Tulip
description: Tulip is energetic and very playful. She is affectionate and really enjoys her people time once she is comfortable with them. Born in 2015, she lived with another dog in her previous home. At the Sanctuary, she has not yet found a good match, so she lives alone. While an active home is best for her, she has no problem settling down and enjoying being petted. Tulip understands basic training cues and is comfortable being harnessed and walked on a leash. She does get excited when she is out walking and sees other dogs and gets too close to them. Tulip would be happiest in a home that indulges her need to have fun and play.

name: Baritone
description: Baritone is so brave. Even though he is shy and fearful, especially around people, he is willing to step up and try new things. He currently does not like to be touched at all, but that may come later. Baritone loves to play with other dogs and needs a home with a confident dog who will enjoy his company and help to show him that people and new things are OK. Baritone was born in 2018. At the Sanctuary, he is working on crate training, hand feeding, socializing with volunteers and walking on a leash. He is a very sweet dog who just needs a little encouragement to show his personality and find his way in the world.

name: Sophia Loren
description: Sophia Loren is a wonderfully sweet, calm and gentle senior lady. She enjoys the company of people and loves going for strolls around the Sanctuary. She has excellent leash manners, though she doesn't like to hurry. Although she was born in 2008, Sophia has a playful side, which her caregivers discovered when she met a young puppy who became her roommate. Sophia followed her around the yard and wanted to play, which was very sweet to see. She has been considerate to all the other dogs she's met at the Sanctuary and has passed a cat test here. Sophia came to Best Friends from a shelter in Arizona. She would do well in a quiet, low-key home. She'll be the perfect companion to keep you company while watching TV, reading a book or simply snuggling on the couch.

name: Jungle
description: Jungle is gentle and affectionate once he feels comfortable with people. He can be shy and fearful with strangers at first, but he warms up quickly and loves the company and attention of people he knows. At the Sanctuary, he sometimes gets scared when new people enter his room or his yard, but he does much better with meeting new people outside of his area. He is also quite smart and has good focus. He learned training cues such as 'sit,' 'wait' and 'down' very easily. Born in 2017, Jungle is playful and has done well with other dogs he's met at the Sanctuary. At Dogtown, he's working on crate training and socialization. He's looking for a patient and understanding person or family who will help him feel comfortable and safe when he's making new friends. Jungle currently has heartworm disease. That means he will need to undergo treatment at the Sanctuary unless an adopter is willing to take that on independently.

name: Dakota
description: Dakota is sweet and curious. She is shy and nervous when meeting strangers. However, she warms up quickly when treats are involved. She likes going for walks on the trails in Dogtown with new people, if they are respectful of her shyness and don't try to pet her too much too soon. Since she is a bit fearful of new people and other dogs, she will need to meet the residents of her new home first at the Sanctuary, as well as any other dogs that presently live in the home. Born in 2017, Dakota came to the Sanctuary from a shelter in Texas. She had heartworm disease and has finished up her treatment. She is very food motivated and enjoys enrichment activities with Kong toys and snuffle mats, which help her gain confidence. With a little patience, Dakota is likely to become a braver and more confident sidekick.

name: Tennessee
description: Tennessee loves toys and people. He is playful and gets along well with other dogs. Born in 2015, Tennessee came to Best Friends from a shelter in Texas. This little pocket pitty is always trying to make his human friends laugh with his silly antics. Tennessee enjoys having dog friends and is playful and full of life. Tennessee is currently working on crate training, loose leash walking and clicker training at Dogtown. Youthful and vivacious, Tennessee can't wait to show you how much zest for life he has.

name: Inky
description: Inky is extremely loving and loyal with people. She loves to sit with you and get lots of petting and attention. She always wants to be around people and is happy to be doing whatever you are doing. In the car, Inky will relax and enjoy the ride, and on a leash she walks nicely. Inky was born in 2013 and came to Best Friends from a shelter in Louisiana. She has some medical challenges, including heartworm, for which she is being treated at the Sanctuary. Inky is healing and is ready to experience a home of her own. She has a real zest for life and will be a fun and loving companion.

name: Montana
description: You might find Montana perched on her chair inside her room in Dogtown. It's adorable to see, and it seems like Montana loves the view from higher up. Montana is welcoming and friendly, wagging her entire body when she sees a human friend. She is playful, silly, and really enjoys attention from people. When you enter her room, Montana will get down from her chair and be ready to snuggle. Born in 2012, Montana came to Best Friends from a shelter in Texas. She had heartworm disease and just finished up her treatment. She likes to play with other dogs here at the sanctuary, but she has been known to guard things from other dogs. She hasn't shown guarding tendencies with humans, though. Montana is currently working on clicker training, which she shows off when she happily greets the Dogtown tours. Stop by and meet Montana. She just might wag her way into your heart.

name: Spice
description: This girl has much more sugar than spice in her personality. She is a very affectionate dog who meets people nicely and loves being with them. Born in 2012, she came to Best Friends after the rescue organization she was living with closed its doors. She has a deformity with her hips that makes her stiff, so she really enjoys being a couch potato. Spice understands basic training cues such as 'sit,' 'lie down' and 'stay' and does well living with other dogs at the Sanctuary.

name: Mrs. Potts
description: This former stray has a lot to say, but when she's with people she melts and is so sweet. She always has the biggest smile on her face when she is cuddling with someone. She's super smart, enjoys food puzzles and is eager to learn. She has done great learning basic training cues with volunteers. Mrs. Potts can be slightly anxious in new places and cars seem to worry her. As soon as the engine is turned on, she barks and will bark until the engine is off. She will also chase cars if given the chance. Her caregivers at the Sanctuary are working with her to increase her comfort level with vehicles. She can be picky with her doggie friends. When first meeting new dogs, she is very forward and can show a bit of aggression, but if the other dog remains calm and non-threatening she relaxes and loves to play. She is wonderful on walks with her doggie roommates, but she can be reactive and will bark and lunge toward other dogs she sees when she's on a leash. Her caregivers are using yummy treats and training to keep her focused while walking past other dogs. Mrs. Potts was born in 2017. She has an old pelvic injury and may need surgery to correct it. Although she's not in any obvious discomfort or pain, she skips on that leg periodically and should not do strenuous hikes. She'd love an active home with a yard, especially one that has a tall, sturdy fence, and a person who loves to cuddle.

name: Smokey
description: Smokey is shy with people, but he loves walks and food so that is the key to his heart. He needs time to get comfortable in new places and with new people, but he will accept treats and warm up quickly. He is not yet comfortable being petted or handled by people, but he loves doing activities with other dogs and learning from them. Smokey absolutely adores other dogs here at the Sanctuary. He is very active and playful when he's around them, and they help him build his confidence. Smokey was born in 2014 and came to Best Friends from a humane society in Idaho. He can jump fences, so he is considered a flight risk. In a former foster home, he was a bit of an escape artist, so he will need a home with a secure enclosure and someone with a watchful eye. At the Sanctuary, he is working on crate training, getting into and riding in a car and getting more comfortable with new places. He already walks well on a leash. Smokey will need some time to adjust to a new home, but with time and patience he will make a wonderful companion.

name: Kira
description: Kira has the most soulful eyes. She loves to sleep in piles of blankets and to be petted and read to - in face, this is how you can find Kyra hanging out with volunteers any day of the week. Born in 2008, she is a sweet senior dog who enjoys long car rides more than just about anything else in the world. Kira was originally living in a shelter and came to Best Friends through a rescue organization in New York. Kira can be picky about living with other dogs, but she lives happily with her friend Russ with whom she came to Best Friends. She's looking for a comfortable home that is easy to move around in and has plenty of blankets for her to curl up in.

name: Duchess
description: Duchess has a really sweet personality and wants attention and affection from humans. She has also shown good dog skills here at the Sanctuary, though she seems to prefer males. Duchess was born in 2016 and came to Best Friends through local animal control. Not much is known about her past other than that she may have growled at men in her previous home. Dogtown caregivers have not seen that behavior here. Since arriving at the Sanctuary, she has been working on socialization with volunteers and other people she doesn't know to increase her comfort level with strangers. Duchess would love to get to know you and be part of a loving household again.

name: Nevada
description: Nevada is quite the happy-go-lucky dog and enjoys being the life of the party. He loves playing with his toys and other dogs. Born in 2017, Nevada came to the Sanctuary from Best Friends Houston. He has done very well on his play dates, engaging the other dogs in play but respecting their need for a break. As a result, Nevada has gotten stellar marks on his report card from the behavior consultants. With his sense of adventure and fun, Nevada would do best in an active home with other dogs. He is working on refocusing training with treats during his walks, and is learning that seeing the lizards, but not chasing them, means yummy rewards. Dashing, friendly and energetic, Nevada is always ready to socialize.

name: Selena
description: Meet Selena! Isn't she just gorgeous? She always has a big smile on her face and loves to be around people. Selena has an old hind end injury but this does not stop her going on her inquisitive walks (ok she may chase a lizard or two). She is a great car passenger and likes to look out the window to see what is going on in the neighborhood. Although, she lives with another dog, she can be picky with her doggie friends. What is wonderful about Selena she is mellow and easygoing, she would love nothing more than to go home and hang out with you.

name: Russ
description: Russ is a friendly older gentleman (born in 2008) with a wonderful disposition. He has adoring eyes that can melt your heart. He takes life at an easy-going pace and would love to be in a home where he can be pampered, sleep in a pile of blankets and go on short walks. He loves treats, but his favorite thing in the world is being cuddled. Russ's favorite activity is \"movie time\" in our socialization room, where he gets to snuggle up on a couch with volunteers while they all enjoy watching movies together. Russ was originally living in a shelter and came to Best Friends through a rescue organization in New York. He is looking for a comfortable, quiet home that is easy to get around in and doesn't have too many stairs.

name: Chex
description: Chex is extremely shy, but each day he is slowly coming out of his shell and beginning to trust people. He does well with other dogs, and his doggie roommate is helping him to gain confidence around people. Chex enjoys pets from people he is comfortable with and has been doing well walking with Dogtown volunteers to help improve his social skills (he will sit and nose touch your hand). Chex is a smart pup who has shown great strides - he will now jump into a car without hesitation, and is well-behaved for rides around the sanctuary. He likes his treats and has a good appetite. Born in 2018, Chex came to Best Friends through local animal control. This sweet pup is making significant progress in trusting people, but will need an understanding person or family to show him that he is safe. As his confidence increases we have no doubt Chex will make a wonderful addition to any family.

name: Audrey
description: Audrey is a very affectionate dog with a tenacious spirit, working hard to overcome the effects of Valley Fever that left her with weakness and some paralysis in her hind legs. Through physical therapy and a lot of TLC, Audrey is now able to stand and walk, and she continues to make progress each day. She has a strong determination that is an inspiration to everyone who meets her. Born in 2015, Audrey came to Best Friends from a shelter in California. She is incontinent from the effects of Valley Fever and is on long-term medications. Despite what her body has been through, Audrey is strong and can pull on a leash, so she walks on a harness at the Sanctuary. She gets along with most other rambunctious, playful dogs she's met at the sanctuary, but does not do well with feline friends. With people, Audrey is affectionate, loving and goofy, and she will make a wonderful companion.

name: Mauve
description: If you want a dog who doubles as a blanket and is happy to cuddle with you 24/7, then Mauve is your girl. She's a gentle soul who wants nothing more than to be petted and snuggled for as long as possible. She will sit on your lap and ask for pets for hours if you let her. Mauve was born in 2012, and she doesn't do much running or playing. She's perfectly happy with short walks. She's very mellow but can get sassy and bark for attention. Mauve is so people oriented that she does not like to share people with other dogs. At Dogtown, she has guarded people and the gate from other dogs. She has some separation anxiety and has previously chewed on door frames when she was alone but could hear people nearby. Mauve came to Best Friends from a shelter in Texas. At Dogtown, she is working on crate training to help manage her separation anxiety. She is also on supplements to help improve her skin and coat. She would do well with a person or family who is home most of the time, so she does not need to be left alone for long periods. Mauve might be your perfect match if you're looking for a dog who'll love to veg out with you. Mauve has a generous sponsor who has covered her adoption fee.

name: Pup Pup
description: Pup Pup is a very expressive dog. He always has a gentle demeanor and loves every person he meets. Born in 2015, he has that perfectly-balanced perfect energy level where he would be happy to go for a jog or a hike or stay home and cuddle on the couch all day. Pup Pup was born in 2015 and came to the Sanctuary from a Best Friends Network Partner. He's a loving companion who can't wait to have a home of his own. Pup Pup has a generous sponsor who will cover his adoption and transportation fees.

name: Apollo
description: Apollo was born in January 2018 and doesn't have much self-confidence yet. Since coming to the Sanctuary, he's let down his guard with some of his caregivers. He's still nervous around new people but is a friendly guy at heart. He'll sit next to some folks for petting and share a tail wag on occasion. Apollo is interested in going for walks and will let people to leash him up. At first, he only wanted to walk if his doggie roommate went with him, but he's been working up to solo walks. While he's on the Dogtown trails, he relaxes as he begins to explore all the different smells, and his caregivers have been trying to encourage him to enjoy these outings. Next, he'll be working on getting more comfortable climbing into vehicles so that, eventually, he can enjoy rides too. Apollo has a good appetite and his favorite 'dessert' is cream cheese. He doesn't mind the snow, and during the winter he would chase after snowballs thrown near him. He's done well with all dogs he's met at the Sanctuary and seems to gain confidence by watching them. He still has a lot of puppy energy and would do best in an active home. Because he's shy and fearful with people, he may try to run away, so Apollo will need an understanding person or family to show him that he is safe. Once he gains confidence, he'll make a playful and fun companion. Apollo has a generous sponsor who will cover his adoption fee.

name: Swift
description: Swift was born in 2016 and came to the Sanctuary from a Best Friends Network Partner with a litter of puppies. After caring for her puppies, she began working on socialization and basic training cues. Now that all of her puppies are all grown up, it is her turn to shine. Swift enjoys long walks and riding in the car. She also loves being petted and snuggled by people she knows. Swift is sometimes nervous when first meeting other dogs but warms up after going on a walk with them. She is currently living with two male dogs at the Sanctuary. Swift does enjoy the company of dogs her size to play with. Swift has a generous sponsor that has offered to cover her adoption fee.

name: Roper
description: Roper is a really fun dog underneath all his uncertainty. He seems to have slightly compromised vision, so sometimes he approaches people with caution. At other times he is extroverted, bouncy and playful, and he is funny and endearing with his goofiness. Roper is shy and fearful with strangers, and he can be reactive to them when he is behind a barrier such as a fence. It's usually best to meet him while he's out walking on a leash. Once he gets comfortable with people, he loves to be doted on and to play. Roper was born in 2012 and came to Best Friends from a rescue organization that was closing its doors. At Dogtown he is working on meeting new people with more confidence, and he is having play dates with other dogs to practice his dog skills. Roper would love to go home with a person or family who can continue helping him build his confidence.

name: Dingo
description: Dingo loves toys and can be playful, yet he also has a very gentle and calm nature. With people, he is affectionate and easy-going. He also walks very nicely on a leash. Dingo was born in 2013 and came to Best Friends from a rescue organization in Florida. At the Sanctuary, he is working on crate training and basic training cues. Due to an old injury, he currently takes prescription medication for pain. Because Dingo has shown aggression toward other dogs in the past, he cannot live with them and must be the only dog in a home. If you're looking for a calm, quiet dog to be your one and only, Dingo would love to meet you.

name: Trix
description: Trix is active, excited about life and loves the great outdoors. She's always ready to play fetch, go for walks or run around. Because she's shy and fearful with strangers, especially men, she's considered a flight risk and needs a secure fenced yard and a person who can keep her safe. Other than that, Trix is pretty low-maintenance. She may make you work to earn her trust at first, but once she warms up to you, she's super sweet and will lavish you with affection. She's been great with other dogs that she's comfortable with here at the Sanctuary, and she is very attached to her canine roommates. Sometimes, she's hesitant to go for walks with new people if her dog friends aren't with her. But at Dogtown, she's working on getting more comfortable meeting strangers, going places without her doggie roommates and eating her meals when there are strangers around. Born in 2018, Trish came to Best Friends though local animal control and is ready to move on to a home of her own.

name: Teddy
description: Teddy has so much love to give, he can barely contain himself. He'll sink into your lap and gaze up at you adoringly. When Teddy can see people, but not be right next to them, he will bark to ask for love and attention. At Dogtown, he is learning that being quiet gets him even more affection, as well as yummy treats. When he meets new dogs, he almost immediately starts licking their faces while wiggling as hard as he can. Teddy is a dog who loves very deeply and would be so happy to finally have a home and a person or family of his own. Teddy has a generous sponsor who will cover his adoption fee.

name: Hercules
description: Hercules is a super playful dog who loves meeting new people at the Sanctuary. At Dogtown, he loves meeting and playing with new dogs and has demonstrated amazing dog skills. He will adapt to other dogs' play styles, but he does love to roughhouse, run and jump around. He spends some of his time in our Headquarters offices, and snuggling on the couch is his favorite past time. Hercules was born in 2016 and came to the Sanctuary from a Best Friends Network partner shelter in Florida. Because he has bitten in the past, he will need a dog-savvy, adult-only household. An active home would also be best for Hercules, though he does know when it's time to chill out and relax.

name: Sundance
description: Sundance's name fits him perfectly. He has a unique personality that will make you fall in love with him. He also dances with excitement when he's happy to see you. He is shy and fearful with strangers, but once he knows you, he will always greet you with a smile and gaze at you in a loving way. He can be a little quirky, and his caregivers say he is like a wiggly cat in a dog's body, but that's what makes him so endearing. Born in 2013, Sundance came to the Sanctuary from a Best Friends Network Partner in Indiana. He guards food and is not comfortable with strangers entering his room or yard. He does better meeting them outside of his area first. At Dogtown, Sundance is doing great with going to his 'place' to wait for his food and with trading his bowls to reduce food guarding. He does not enjoy a lot of handling, especially by new people. He will accept occasional pets but prefers to just do a happy dance around you. He is also difficult for medical handling. He has become comfortable enough with day-to-day handling that he can be harnessed for walks, and he is working on muzzle training for upcoming vet appointments. When it comes to other dogs, Sundance can be picky and seems to prefer females. If you're looking for a dog who dances to his own beat, Sundance would love to meet you.

name: Manuel
description: Manuel is a goofy, happy dog who loves attention and is always ready to go out and have fun. At the Sanctuary, he loves people and playing with other dogs. He is eager to learn new things and very food motivated, so training him is fun and easy. Manuel was born in 2015 and came to Best Friends from a shelter. He has shown guarding behavior with food and toys and will guard them from people and other dogs. He can be jumpy and mouthy when he's excited, especially when he's getting harnessed up for a walk, but he is working on this at Dogtown. He learns quickly and is also working on sitting nicely at his gate, going to his 'place,' lying down and waiting for his food bowl. Manuel really loves going on adventures, so an active home would be best for him.

name: Abner
description: Abner is a big, goofy hound who doesn't know much about life yet. Born in 2016, he came to Best Friends from a shelter in Texas. He is a bit nervous of new people and new situations and has the potential to be a flight risk if he gets really scared. Abner is just learning how to walk on a leash, so he often runs to and fro trying to see and smell everything. He can be reserved at times and playful at others. At Dogtown, he's getting lots of exposure to new things and new situations. As he's gained confidence, he has started seeking attention from his caregivers. Abner would love a home with a patient person or family who can help him keep building his confidence and finding his way in the world.

name: Rad
description: Rad's caregivers say she is a bundle of joy, because she's so happy and energetic. Born in 2015, Rad came to Best Friends from a small local shelter. At the Sanctuary, Rad loves making new dog friends. She's also very smart and enjoys learning new things. Rad had heart surgery and came through it with flying colors. She has been doing great since then, though she still needs to take heart medication. Rad loves going on sleepovers, and her hosts say she's a wonderfully cuddly and well-behaved guest. She has a sweet, happy face and so much love to offer the person or family who chooses her. Rad has a generous sponsor who will cover her adoption costs.

name: Eliza
description: Time, patience and yummy treats is the winning combination for Eliza. Because she is shy and fearful, the best way to become her friend is to sit quietly in her room while offering her treats and letting her decide when she wants to approach you. Born in 2015, she came to Best Friends from a shelter in New Mexico. She is at her best when there are other confident, friendly dogs around to help her feel braver. When there are a lot of unfamiliar dogs and people coming and going close by, it is stressful for her. At Dogtown, Eliza is working on learning to trust through hand feeding. She is also working on leash walking, which she enjoys. Eliza is looking for a calm and understanding person or family. A quiet home with a predictable routine and other dogs who can help build her confidence would be best for her. She is considered a flight risk, so she'll need a secure space and someone who can watch over her and keep her safe while she learns about the world.

name: Mercer
description: Mercer was born in 2016 and was found as a stray. Mercer can be a nervous guy, so it takes some time to win him over, but yummy treats help! Although Mercer is shy with people, when he bonds with a dog he's willing to go with them almost anywhere, because they boost his confidence. He's done well with all the dogs he's met at the Sanctuary. Mercer is an active boy who would be a great adventure buddy. At Dogtown, he's working on building relationships with his human friends and has come a long way toward getting comfortable with people who take the extra time with him.

name: Delta
description: If you want a jogging buddy or hiking companion, Delta is your girl. She is always up for an adventure and loves to get out and explore with her people. Besides her endless energy, she is also very smart and a fast learner. Delta really enjoys clicker training and agility and would love to find an active home where she could learn new things. If you can tire her out, she then likes pets and affection. Born in 2017, Delta came to the Sanctuary from a Best Friends Network Partner. She is reactive to other dogs on leash and would do best as the only dog in a home. She has also exhibited a high prey drive, so we are unsure how she would do around small animals. Delta is the kind of dog who will thrive with an active and dog savvy person. In the right situation, she will make a wonderful companion.

name: Barat
description: Barat is a gentle giant, but you wouldn't have known that when he first arrived at the Sanctuary. He used to be very nervous and would bark at everyone who entered his room. He's made amazing progress since coming to Dogtown, and he now greets everyone with a smile and a full body wiggle. He's very mellow and low key and loves snuggling and getting attention. Born in 2015, Barat once lived in a home where he spent most of his time outside. Now that he's loved and cared for, he's thriving. He does still have anxiety, which can make him a flight risk, and he's attempted to escape from his yard at the Sanctuary by trying to chew through fences and bend gates open. He does a lot better when people he's comfortable with are around, but he'll need to find a home where he can be in a secure place when his people aren't home. Barat can be picky with his dog friends and will guard crates and food from other dogs. He's also shown aggression toward cats and can't live with them. At Dogtown, Barat continues to work on his social skills with people and on getting comfortable in new places and in the car. He would love to be in a home where he can truly be part of the family.

name: Josie
description: Josie is very excited about life and wants nothing more than to be with people. This friendly girl is always happy to make new friends and learn new things. Josie is like the Energizer bunny, so she'll need a very active home with a person or family who is up for lots of training and enrichment. She does calm down nicely in quiet environments and is very easygoing on car rides. Born in 2015, Josie came to Best Friends from a humane society in Colorado after she was seized from a dog fighting situation. She has a tick-borne illness that causes her to have very low blood platelets. Because of this condition, Josie must be extra careful to avoid any potentially harmful situations. She also lives alone at the Sanctuary and will need to be the only dog in a home, since her condition can be transmitted to other dogs. Although Josie has a heart murmur that needs to be checked regularly, it does not require medication at this time. At Dogtown, Josie is working on impulse control and staying calm when her caregivers enter her room or put on her harness.

name: Fenway
description: Fenway is eager to be brave and loves to learn new things. She's shy and fearful with strangers at first but is working on her confidence. She loves water, so in the summer she sits in her baby pool for a good portion of the day. Because she also loves all things soft and fluffy, she likes to collect her blankets in one big pile to sleep on. Born in 2016, Fenway is a distemper survivor. She came to Best Friends from a shelter in New Mexico as a puppy mom. She loved playing with her puppies, and she now enjoys playing with other adult dogs. She also loves to do agility with her doggie roommate and will follow him around the agility course. She would do great in a home with another friendly dog who could help show her the ropes and help boost her confidence. Fenway is currently doing a lot of confidence and trust training at the Sanctuary. She is a willing learner, especially if you reward her with yummy treats, and she is learning that new people, walks and car rides are all good things. She has already picked up on leash walking and is learning basic training cues such as 'sit' and 'down.' Fenway would do best in a home with a person or family who understands shy dogs and can give her time to adjust and progress at her own pace. She is looking for someone who can give her a little guidance and show her that the world can be a fun and safe place.

name: Irene
description: Irene was rescued during Hurricane Harvey and later came to Best Friends from a humane society in Utah. At first, shy and fearful with strangers, but now she warms up quickly and turns into a silly goofball. Her little body wiggles with joy when she sees her human friends. She loves to play with other dogs at Dogtown, and she has been a good role model for her doggie roommate. Irene loves to have weekly play dates with new dogs! She even passed a cat test at the Sanctuary.

name: Buddha
description: Buddha is a big, goofy boy who loves to hang out with his people. He's the perfect mix of energetic and laid back. He loves to play with stuffed toys and roll around in the grass. He's also content to lay on his bed or by your feet while you are hanging out. He's a bit of a comedian and will certainly make you laugh. He's a lot of fun to cuddle and pet. He loves to go on car rides and sits nicely watching the world go by. He's crate trained, housetrained and walks nicely on a leash. Buddha was born in 2010 and came to Best Friends from a shelter in Los Angeles. He has anxiety and cannot live with other animals as he has shown aggression toward them in the past. He can be very reactive to other dogs and will bark, whine, jump or potentially try to escape to get to them. He can also be reactive towards people through a barrier like a door or fence if he does not know them. At Dogtown, Buddha is working on a training plan to help him be less reactive towards dogs. He is also working on calm greetings when people enter his space. The training plan and ongoing support would be provided to his new home. Buddha is on some prescription medications that help him be calmer. He had orthopedic surgery in 2018 and still takes medication for that. Buddha would be the perfect companion for someone who wants a single pet and who is willing to keep working on his training.

name: Francine
description: Francine is such a lovable dog and so sweet. She is always happy and has loved everyone she's met at the Sanctuary. Francine also loves to learn new tricks and training cues. She is very smart and picks up on things quickly. Although she enjoys long hikes and would make a great hiking partner, she is up for anything you want to do, even if it's just hanging out and snuggling or going for a car ride. With other dogs her size or larger, she has great skills, and she would do well in home with them. However, Francine had an incident with a small dog in the past and can't live with them. She also cannot live with cats. Because of her prey drive, she'll need a home with a secure yard, so she can't escape to run after little critters. Francine was born in 2015 and is working on her crate training at the Sanctuary. Because she is so happy when she is with her people, she will make a great companion.

name: Jacko
description: Rescued from a property during a dog fight bust in Colorado, Jacko came to Best Friends from a humane society. At Dogtown he is affectionately called 'Jack Jack.' He adores his toys and treats them like his babies, carrying them around and sleeping with them on his bed. Jacko is playful with new dogs once he has gotten to know them, but he also enjoys sunbathing outside with his roommate at Dogtown. Because of his past, Jacko can be nervous meeting new people, especially if he is meeting them for the first time in a small space. He is more confident meeting people outside in an open space and during a walk. Since walks, treats and toys are some of his favorite things, he will trust new people more quickly if they offer him one of these things. He does take treats nicely, and he is eager to learn new things when treats are the reward. Once he is friends with you, Jacko will run right up to you and stop directly in front of your feet to ask for pets and scratches. He can be a very quiet dog and does not 'talk' very much, unless other dogs are 'talking,' too. He is usually a slow walker, but he loves to run when he feels up to it. Recently, Jacko learned to use a ramp to get into a car. He loves lying down and relaxing in the car and is an excellent passenger.
