Fred was born in 2011 and came from a rescue in Arizona that was closing. He was diagnosed with a spinal condition and takes some medication to help him feel comfortable. Because he's still a bit insecure and anxious, he'll need to find a home with someone who can continue to help him build his confidence, keep up his training and guide him through successful introductions with both people and other dogs. But Fred promises he's worth it. Fred has a generous sponsor who has offered to pay for his adoption fee.

name: Elwood
description: Elwood is a bright-eyed Lab/hound mix who is full of energy and just raring to conquer the world. Born in 2012, Elwood came to Best Friends from a humane society in Wisconsin. As you might imagine, the hound in Elwood has blessed him with an awesome nose and he loves to play \"find it,\" while the Labrador in Elwood has provided him with a brain that's eager to learn. In fact, training is one of Elwood's favorite activities. He's already learned commands for sit, down, shake, place, wait and hand targeting! He's an amazing dog. Since Elwood was a pup, he has suffered from noise and storm phobias. This has decreased over time, but has not been eliminated. He also has PTSD from an unfortunate accident that happened at the humane society he was at previously. But when Elwood sees a familiar face, his tail begins to wag uncontrollably and his whole body fills with excitement. He just has to let people know he's happy! He also loves playing with other dogs has lived with a variety of sizes and breeds. Elwood's forever home will need a secure back yard, as his phobias have driven him to jump short fences and open latches in the past. He would do best with a dog savvy, patient person. If you can offer this guy the love and guidance he needs, he'll quickly become your biggest admirer. Will you give Elwood the forever home he's always wanted? Elwood has a generous sponsor who has offered to cover a portion of his adoption costs.

name: Milo
description: Milo likes to play with rope toys, fetch, and do other energetic activities. He's a little hesitant when meeting new people, but he is adorable and fun to be with once he warms up. With other dogs, he can come on a little strongly, but he really just wants to play and will take correction from them. He was born in 2012 and was picked up as a stray. He has arthritis in both his front legs and sometimes limps a little. But long-term medications keep him happy and running around. Milo is hoping for a home with someone who will enjoy his fun-loving nature. Milo is part of our Single Pets* program! That means that he is eligible for a free flight home and waived adoption fee! Milo also has a generous sponsor who will pay for positive reinforcement training. *Single pets do best as the only dog or cat in the home.

name: Roady
description: Looking for a smart dog who loves to learn? Roady knows basic training cues and is crate and muzzle trained. He's also learning leash manners. While he loves going for walks, he is reactive to other dogs while he is on a leash. However, Roady is working hard with his caregivers to improve his leash skills.An affectionate dog, Roady adores people. He enjoys hanging out and going for rides. His favorite things in life include snuggles and belly rubs. He also loves food puzzles and chew toys. Roady can be picky with his doggie friends, and it takes him a while to feel comfortable even with the right ones. But once he does, he can hang out and walk with them with ease. Roady was born in 2010. He was found as a stray before he came to Best Friends and is eager to find a forever home.Roady is part of our Single Pets* program! That means that he is eligible for a free flight home and waived adoption fee!*Single pets do best as the only dog or cat in the home.

name: Akita
description: Akita is a sensitive girl who can be shy and fearful with new people. It doesn't take long to get into her good graces, however. Once you do she's the sweetest, happiest, most fun-loving dog. Born in 2011, she's silly, playful and active. Akita has a tendency to guard her food, and she does not do well with cats. She currently lives as a single dog at the sanctuary, and that's what seems to make her happiest. Do you have room in your heart for a shy, sweet and sensitive girl? If so, Akita would love to meet you.

name: Monaco
description: Monaco isn't the easiest guy to get to know, but he sure makes it worth the effort it takes to befriend him. Once he's comfortable with people, he gives them his absolute all. Born in 2011, Monaco struggles with confidence and will need a person who can continue his caregivers' work in helping him build it. He's a little bit picky with his doggy friends and does better with those his size. Monaco would excel in an active home where he can rely on good guidance and support from his person.As part of our Single* pets adoption special, Monaco qualifies for free adoption and a free flight to his new home!*Single pets do best as the only pet in the home.

name: Winter
description: Winter came from a shelter in Los Angeles, where she was feeling very intimidated. Luckily, she trekked out to Best Friends here in Kanab, Utah, where her real personality is peeking through. She can act shy at first, but once she gets to know you with treats and a walk, she's warm and inviting. Winter does a happy wiggle dance whenever she sees her friends. Winter loves people, and if you have other dogs, that would be wonderful. She's great with them! Winter also loves her walks and loves to play in water. All Winter wants is a forever home with someone to love. Winter has a generous sponsor who will cover her adoption fee.

name: Tarlton
description: Tarlton had a rough life before he came to Best Friends. He was named for the construction yard where he was found. Perhaps because of something in his rugged past, he shows some guard dog behavior. He needs a slow introduction to new people, but once he gets to know them, Tarlton becomes the most affectionate dog. He loves to give slobbery kisses and to climb in people's laps, even though he really doesn't fit.Tarlton was born in 2006 and is on a special diet for allergies. He knows tricks like \"roll over,? \"twirl? and \"crawl.? He's a world-class cuddler and bed-hog, though he also enjoys long walks. Tarlton will make an amazing friend for a dog-savvy person who can give him a little guidance. He's a sensitive guy who craves love, and he can't wait to give his heart to someone special.Tarlton is part of our Single Pets* program! That means that he is eligible for a free flight home and waived adoption fee!*Single pets do best as the only dog or cat in the home.

name: Boxer
description: Boxer's name fits him because his favorite thing to do is to shred cardboard boxes. He is one of those dogs who is always happy. Boxer loves going for walks and is very polite on the trail. He meets people easily at the Sanctuary and is a sweet, loving boy. When in a home, Boxer loves his people so much that he sometimes guards them from other people and dogs. While he does not have this issue here at the Sanctuary, he will sometimes guard food and toys. This is easily managed by offering him trades of other foods or items. Thunderstorms often make Boxer uncomfortable and nervous, so it is best to give him his space during storms.Born in 2011, Boxer takes prescription medication. He is currently on a regular diet mixed in with a weight management regimen, but that is not necessarily required for a home environment. With doggie friends, he is picky and prefers females. At Dogtown, Boxer is working on meeting new people and on being comfortable in groups of people; the goal is to decrease the likelihood of him guarding his friends. All he wants is to have his own person that he can love all day, every day. Could that be you?

name: Kenya
description: When Kenya sees someone she knows, she does a happy dance, wiggling around and folding her body in half. Then she'll sit at your feet and ask to be petted. Born in 2006, Kenya came to the sanctuary from a Utah shelter. Here at the sanctuary, she and her trainers have been working hard on some behavior issues. Although she is calm and friendly when meeting people on a leash, she is protective of barriers and can seem a bit fierce on the other side of a fence or gate. She has bitten before, so she needs a very understanding person who is willing to work with her on her barrier issues. Although she loves to play with toys and with people, she does not get along with other dogs, so she would do best as an only pet. Kenya is looking for a home with a dog-savvy person (or people) who can see her potential and will continue to work with her. She would be thrilled to meet you if you think she might be a good fit! Kenya is part of our Single Pets* program! That means that she is eligible for a free flight home and waived adoption fee! *Single pets do best as the only dog or cat in the home.

name: Shocky
description: Shocky can be a handful, but she's full of fun and joy, she just needs someone to share it all with! Shocky really needs some stability in life, too. She was rescued in the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina as a little puppy. Somebody adopted her immediately, but then gave her up! Next, she went to a rescue group, and then, well, this girl has just had no earth under her feet. She needs a really dog-savvy handler to keep her from redirecting or snapping in stressful situations. She loves to be petted and cuddled but not on her hips, which are starting to hurt these days. Shocky knows \"sit\" and she comes when you call her. She can be a little hit-or-miss with other dogs and would do best as the only dog in the home. She's a happy girl who just needs some stability and really needs a place she can finally call home. Shocky has a generous sponsor that will cover half of her adoption fee.

name: Chaplin
description: It takes Chaplin a little while to get comfortable around new people, but once he does, he will show his silly, goofy side. He has an adorable face, very expressive ears, and is a bit of a ham. He's the perfect travel buddy, as he loves to sit next to you and relax in the car. Chaplin has some difficulty with handling, especially when it comes to medical exams. He can be anxious in new situations, and storms scare him. Chaplin does not do well with cats or small dogs, but is okay with dogs his size so long as they give him his space when he is feeling uncomfortable. Chaplin was born in 2008, and is looking for a home with a patient and understanding person. He'd love to jump in the car with you and go anywhere you go.

name: Grace
description: Grace is a sweet girl who is dreaming of having someone to hike with. She was born in 2011, but hasn't lost the energy she had in her younger years. Car rides are one of her favorite things, and because she is so smart, she also really enjoys her training sessions. Grace tends to be a little defensive around new dogs in the beginning, but she likes having their company once she knows they won't hurt her. She can also be protective of her home when strangers come to visit. She'll need a person or a family who can understand that and help her work through it. Underneath her defensiveness is a loving, happy and affectionate girl who can't wait to be someone's best friend.

name: Yuma
description: Yuma is a joy to have around. She gets really excited to meet people (her second favorite thing behind toys). But she's been learning that it's much more polite to lie down and wait for people to come down to her than to jump up and greet them. Politeness gets you lots of tummy rubs and back scratches, and that's all Yuma wants in life (and maybe a few appropriate toys). Born in 2008, Yuma is bright and healthy, but with some sensitivity to the sun. She doesn't do well with other dogs, so is looking to be your one and only. She is very gentle and calm in a home setting. She knows tons of cool tricks and is always ready for something new! Yuma has a generous sponsor who will cover her adoption costs.

name: Safira
description: Treats and baby talk are the way to this girl's heart. Safira can be a bit shy and fearful with people she doesn't know, but, with a little time and patience, she will give her trust. And, once she trusts people, she loves them. Born in 2011, Safira is an active, playful girl. She loves toys, especially tennis balls and her big Jolly ball. Fetch and swimming are two of her favorite things. Safira has overcome her fear of cars and enjoys golf cart rides around the Sanctuary. She eats a prescription diet and prefers male dogs to other females. She'd love a home with someone who will take the time to get to know her and who will enjoy her playful, silly side.

name: Joy
description: She could either be totally attentive or daydreaming. Who can tell by those ears? Actually, Joy offers the best of both worlds! Her attentive side is eager to please people. She already knows sit, stay, down and come. All she wants in return are love and tummy rubs, which bring us to - her dreamy side! Those belly scratches send her right into a fantasy world. Those eyes are usually laser-focused, but you can just see her zone out under the spell of your touch. Her dreams are filled with wishes for love and belly rubs from a person of her very own. Joy has Babesia, a blood disorder usually picked up from a tick bite. Because it can be transmitted among dogs, Joy must be an only child. But she's ready and willing to give you as much love as an entire pack! Born in 2006, this smart, outgoing gal also loves to run and play. Everyone needs more joy in their life; how about bringing this Joy into yours? Joy has a generous sponsor who will pay for the transportation costs to her new home. This dog is featured as part of our BLISS (Behavior Lifelong In-home Support System) Program. Through this program, you will receive pre- and post-adoption training advice from one of our behavior consultants, as well as a training plan specifically tailored to the dog's transition into your home.

name: Cassandra
description: Cassandra is a beautiful girl who loves her people. She can be shy with strangers, but once she gets comfortable she loves being petted by everyone. When she sees her friends, her whole body wiggles and her tail doesn't stop wagging. It doesn't take long to get to know her. The best way to win her over is to take her for a car ride. Car rides are Cassandra's favorite thing in the world. She sits in the passenger seat and tries to hold your hand during the whole ride, and she will smother you with kisses. You can also give her some treats, take her for a few walks, and she'll be your friend in no time. If you have treats, she'd also love to show you all the tricks and training cues she knows. Born in 2009, Cassandra is still pretty active. At the Sanctuary, she does well with dogs her own size, but she does not do well with small dogs. Cassandra is a sensitive girl who can be nervous in new places, so she'll need a person or family who will be patient, go slowly with her and show her that new places are not so scary. She'll also need someone who will give her some time to get comfortable and learn the routine in a new home. She loves to go on walks or for a dip in her pool, but she is also content to hang out or take a nap in her crate. She'd also be more than happy to snuggle with you and give you lots of kisses. Cassandra has a generous sponsor who will pay for her adoption fee.

name: Avon
description: Avon is super sweet with her people and loves belly rubs once she is comfortable with you. She is a sensitive girl and needs someone that understands she needs time to meet new people and adjust to new situations but usually a few walks and tasty treats will do the trick. Even at nearly 11 years old, Avon is fairly active. She loves her walks and walks like a perfect lady on leash. Avon is also super cuddly and would love to curl up next to you on the couch. When it comes to dog friends, Avon prefers dogs that will give her space and be ok with her being the boss. When Avon was younger she ate a ball of yarn and ended up having some of her intestines removed. She needs a special diet (Racheal Ray Nutrish) as well as daily supplements that aide in digestion. Since Avon takes some time to make new friends, she does require adopters to come to the sanctuary and meet her. All we want is for this sweet senior dog to find her forever home, she definitely deserves it! If you know anyone that may be interested, please share!

name: Jet
description: Jet loves to play fetch, and if you tell him \"closer\" he will walk up and drop the ball beside you. He enjoys water and likes to play with the hose. Jet in the past nervous and fearful around men but warms up with treats and walks. Jet should meet any potential doggy housemates before going home with them. He would prefer a home without cats. He does enjoy leisurely walks and lounging outside in the sun. Jet is looking for a person who can help him feel loved and safe. If that sounds like you, Jet will be waiting to meet you.

name: Loki
description:
Back in March, we received a call about a terrible hoarding situation in California. 30 dogs had been living unattended in a motor home. To avoid euthanasia, RSQ took in 6 of these pups.
Loki is a perky 13 years young.  He loves the great outdoors whether laying in the sun or sunflowers.  He is getting more used to people & enjoying their attention and has recently gone to a foster home.  Wiith patience and love these dogs can become your best friend and most loyal companion. A second chance for a normal life is all these little guys want.
All RSQ Dogs are chipped, fixed and up to date on shots before adoption.
To learn more about RSQ Dogs or to fill out an adoption form for any of our animals, check out the RSQ Dogs website at https://www.rsqdogsutah.org/animals-for-adoption.

name: Chance
description:
Back in March, we received a call about a terrible hoarding situation in California. 30 dogs had been living unattended in an RV.  To avoid euthanasia, RSQ took in 6 of these pups.
Sweet Chance, a young pup, is still skittish around people but can be held and will sit with you.  With patience and love Chance could become your best friend and most loyal companion. A second chance for a normal life is all that Chance is asking for.  
A home with no small children would probably be best as quick movements or sounds make him nervous.  He does not become aggressive when nervous,  just tries to get to a safe place.  As he is staying with a foster family, please give us a call if you would like to meet Chance.
All RSQ Dogs are chipped, fixed and up to date on shots before adoption.
To learn more about RSQ Dogs or to fill out an adoption form for any of our animals, check out the RSQ Dogs website at https://www.rsqdogsutah.org/animals-for-adoption.

name: Brownie
description:
Back in March, we received a call about a terrible hoarding situation in California.  30 dogs had been living unattended in a motor home.  To avoid euthanasia, RSQ took in 6 of these pups.  
Brownie is about 2 years old.  He is still skittish around people but he wants so badly to play.  With patience and love these dogs can become your best friend and most loyal companion.  A second chance for a normal life is all that Brownie is asking.  
All RSQ Dogs are chipped, fixed and up to date on shots before adoption.
To learn more about RSQ Dogs or to fill out an adoption form for any of our animals, check out the RSQ Dogs website at https://www.rsqdogsutah.org/animals-for-adoption.

name: Mikie
description:
ADOPTABLE!
Would you look at that sweet face?! 
Mikie is available for adoption and ready to go home with his forever family. 
He is a 4 yr old male Pitbull, with a fantastic personality. Mikie is well behaved, with an enthusiastic love of life! He is housebroken, walks great on a leash and loves to play ball. He is a great travel partner and loves to go on car rides and hikes. Mikie loves kids and would be a great family dog. 
Mikie has lived with other dogs in the past, but he can be dog selective. We recommend that Mikie go to a home with no other pets. 
Mikie is neutered, current on vaccinations, and microchipped. Adoption fee is $35. 
Come meet him today at the LaVerkin Shelter!

name: Jude
description:
Jude is a 1 year old black lab mix with amazing golden eyes.  He's got a playful personality and gets along beautifully with children and other dogs.  He walks very well on a leash and knows his basic commands.  Jude would make a great hiking companion and somebody's best friend.  
Jude is currently staying with a foster family with small children and other dogs.  He is thriving in a home environment.  If you would like to meet Jude, please give us a call.
All RSQ Dogs are chipped, fixed and up to date on shots before adoption.
To learn more about RSQ Dogs or to fill out an adoption form for any of our animals, check out the RSQ Dogs website at https://www.rsqdogsutah.org/animals-for-adoption.

name: Marshall
description:
Marshall is 2+ years old with a very sweet, friendly personality.  He is  active, energetic, and strong.  He would make a perfect hiking partner and loves to hang out in the pool.
Marshall is an accomplished jumper and escape artist so a secure high fenced yard is necessary.  He can be a bit dog selective but enjoys playing with dogs of equal energy levels.  With the proper training and exercise, Marshall will make a wonderful addition to your home.
All RSQ Dogs are chipped, fixed and up to date on shots before adoption.
To learn more about RSQ Dogs or to fill out an adoption form for any of our animals, check out the RSQ Dogs website at https://www.rsqdogsutah.org/animals-for-adoption.

name: Zuri
description:
Zuri is a 2.5 year old Boxer mix who just wants some love and an opportunity. A young and very active pup, Zuri is a sweet girl who craves love and attention but can be selective about other dog friends. 
Sweet Zuri LOVES her toysâ every time she sees you, she cannot wait to show off her newest toy, and also LOVES hiking-  she does great off-leash. Though she doesnât love ALL other dogs, she is great with any dog off-leash hiking.

She is great with people, but a little skeptical about children- and she likes to dig!
And this is why our Zuri girl has not been adopted. Zuri needs to find a family without younger children or cats, though we do think both of things can be worked on in her new family with the right amount of patience, care, and training.

She just needs someone to give her a chance. And take the time to work with her beautiful imperfections.

All RSQ Dogs are chipped, fixed and up to date on shots before adoption.
To learn more about RSQ Dogs or to fill out an adoption form for any of our animals, check out the RSQ Dogs website at https://www.rsqdogsutah.org/animals-for-adoption.

name: Maya
description:
Maya is a 4 yr old pug/chi mix. She is roughly 17 pounds and loves evryone. She us very playful and gets along with other dogs (but is dominant) so other dogs in the home need to be non dominant. She does fine with cats. She loves to play in water and enjoys her plastic pool to play in. She also enjoys cuddling with her foster. She is dog door and crate trained. She is also fully vetted. For more info please call 435-215-9282 (leave a vm) or email 
soutocsp@hotmail.com

name: SABRINA
description:
After being hit by a car, little Sabrina spent 8 weeks in a cast while her bones healed.  She's 10 years old, but loves to adventure by car, trail or river.  Snuggles are her favorite, but she's no couch potato.  Sabrina lives with several big dogs and enjoys their company.  Never once have we heard her bark.  Sabrinaâs bones are now healed but weâve learned that she has an enlarged heart and a leaky bladder.  Sabrina does require daily medication for her heart but nothing stops this little dog from living life to it's fullest. And Sabrina doesnât urinate on the carpet but will on tile and she also sleeps through the night without urinating. 

To meet Sabrina or find out more about her, contact Andrea or A.J. at 612-756-2374.   Sabrina's adoption fee is $100.  Sabrina is eligible for our Seniors Helping Seniors Program.

name: Ellie
description:
Ellie loves people of all ages and always wants to be with them â even if it means jumping a six foot fence to get to them! She's an Australian cattle dog/ border collie mix and she needs mental and physical exercise to keep her happy. She is picky about canine companions and her prey drive can be a little active, so a home alone or with larger calm dogs would be best. She does seem to do well with young puppies.

Ellie has been looking for a new family for nearly a year and a half. Can she be your Ellie?

Ellie is currently in a foster home; you can check her out at https://www.instagram.com/queen_elliebelle/

All RSQ Dogs are chipped, fixed and up to date on shots before adoption.
To learn more about RSQ Dogs or to fill out an adoption form for any of our animals, check out the RSQ Dogs website at https://www.rsqdogsutah.org/animals-for-adoption.

name: Jon Bone Jovi
description: Jon came from an owner turn in due to allergies. We are not exactly sure on his breed but that is the closest we are thinking, Other than dang cute. He is about 5 years old and very sweet, but he does take awhile to warm up, but nce he does he is very attached to his person. He does good with dogs of all sizes and cats. He has to have a home without young children. He is already fully vetted including a recent dental and ready for a home. For more info please call 435-215-9282 or email soutocsp@hotmail.com (email preferred).

name: Shelby
description: Shelby is a sweet cairn mix. She is around 8 months old and looking to be the queen of her household. She does great with non dominant dogs but can get somewhat possessive over her person so an only dog or another mellow non possessive dog home would be best for her. She does fine with kids, but over 6 is preferred. She is an active and happy dog. She loves walks and to play but then also loves to come home and cuddle with you. She is completely house broken and uses a doggie door. For more info please call 435-215-9282 or email soutocsp@hotmail.com

name: Fanny
description: Fanny is a sweet little girl. She is shy, but does great once she has some time to settle in and get used to her surroundings. She was rescued from a situation with too many dogs and did not get a ton of one on one, but she has made strides in her foster home and has blossumed into a sweet little girl. She is extremely playful and loves toys. She loves to chase and play with dogs and cats that are close to her size. She would do great at the dog park. She is great with dogs of all sizes and cats. She would do best in a situation without young kids, she is fine with older kids and teens. She is already spayed, chipped, fully vaccinated, and dewormed. She is a sweet girl who just needs a chance to settle in. For more info please call 435-215-9282 or email soutocsp@hotmail.com

name: Moogan
description: 'I love adventures! I am the king of tug o' war and would play fetch all day! I'm a great hiker, able to scale the highest mountains. I play great with toys and can entertain myself. I am a very loyal boy.' Moogan is easily introduced to new people by bringing him an exciting new toy to play fetch with. He has a vision impairment, so he does not like to be startled. He loves to rough house and play with other dogs, but he doesn't do well with cats. He was born in 2013. Moogan is looking for an active person to play fetch with him. He promises to be loyal for life.

name: Thor
description: Thor is a strikingly handsome boy with a full-body wag. He always has a smile on his face, and his silly antics often make his caregivers at the Sanctuary laugh. He is super smart and loves training. Thor will quickly show you his array of tricks he knows, including high five, down, shake, touch, and is always wanting to learn more! Born in 2009, he still has lots of life and love to give. Thor does prefer to live with female doggie friends. Thor came to Best Friends from a shelter in New Mexico. He's been working hard with Dogtown caregivers and trainers and is ready to find a home of his own.

name: MOCHA
description: Little Mocha was adopted a couple of years ago with her friend Lexington, unfortunately their owner lost her home and was unable to take them with her when she moved. 5 lbs of sweetness very easy going and would love a home of her own. Her foster mom says she is very well behaved. If you would like to meet Mocha or even better get a cute little pair with her buddy Lexington please contact AdoptAnimalNetwork@gmail.com Pictures will be up this Sunday

name: LEXINGTON
description: Little Lexington was adopted a couple of years ago with her friend Mocha, unfortunately their owner lost her home and was unable to take them with her when she moved. 6 lbs of sweetness very easy going and would love a home of her own. Her foster mom says she is very well behaved. If you would like to meet Lexington or even better get a cute little pair with her buddy Mocha please contact AdoptAnimalNetwork@gmail.com Pictures will be up this Sunday

name: KNUCKY
description: Knucky was left at NSPCA because he didn't do well with other dogs and just left in the back of shelter. Lucky for him a volunteer decided he just needed training and proper socialization which he is getting from a wonderful trainer now. It has made a world of difference in this dogs life and we are looking for a one pet home to give Knucky a real home life and not the shelter life he had for a very long time. Training is included until Knucky graduates with honors so he can be the best dog he can be. If you are interested in giving this boy a home please contact AdoptAnimalNetwork@gmail.com.

name: KOLMAN
description: So adorable!  This 4 month old puppy was adopted from us a couple of months ago.  Unfortunately, the adopters didn't realize the commitment of a puppy.  They do require training and a lot of time and effort.  This little guy loves to romp and play!  He loves other dogs and people of all ages.  And did you see how beautiful his eyes are?  If you would like to meet this little guy, please email AdoptAnimalNetwork@gmail.com.

name: PENNY LIBERTY
description: Sweet, tender Penny was left out on the streets pregnant, and had her adorable puppies at the shelter. This little girl is only 46 lbs, very short and small for a pit bull. Be prepared to get a lot of love from this girl, all she wants is a home of her own. She is an absolute sweet heart and does gets along with other dogs and seems to love every one she meets! Penny Liberty was adopted to a great loving home with another dog and everything went well for almost a year then she started getting jealous of the other dog. Penny just needs a home and family of her very own. If you would like to give her a chance to be loved please contact AdoptAnimalNetwork@gmail.com

name: Luna
description: Young, talkative and ENERGETIC, I'm playful, outgoing, and a genuine cuddlebug. I have dance moves like you've never seen before, and I am a champion fetcher. Toys make me sparkle and food makes my heart swell. I'm the perfect addition to YOUR family. Maybe take me home today?

name: Beta
description: I know I appear quiet when you first meet me, but I like to take my time getting to know people. Change isn't always easy, but I try to make the best of each situation, because I know finding the right person will bring a joy to both our lives unlike any other. I'm well-mannered, calm, committed. Won't you open your heart and home to me?

name: Chewie
description: I'll take on the world with a bang! Playful, talkative and energetic, I've got the typical puppy personality! I'm into adventure and very courageous, but I love snuggle time with my person too. If you're ready for some entertainment in your life take me home today!

name: Fern
description: I'm looking for a human that can praise my successes, gain my trust and help me boost my confidence (I'll let you in on a secret ... treats help!). It may take me a little time to adjust to new surroundings but I have a feeling we'll be best friends in no time. Meet me today!

name: Marley
description: Looking for a best friend? What a coincidence, so am I! I'm loyal and want to make my person feel like the most important person in the world. I aim to please and like to go with the flow-I can be your snuggle buddy or your running buddy and I will always be up for any adventure.

name: Bella
description: Looking for a running buddy? Or hiking buddy? Or road trip buddy? Look no further! I can do it all-run, swim and be your adorable companion at the same time. I love being active and getting my exercise in-think you can keep up with me, hooman?

name: Luna
description: I'm a likeable, entertaining one who believes in going with the flow. Nice and easy is how I roll-nothing gets me down! I'm friendly, social, and curious. Good music, long naps and daily playtime make my perfect day. Care to join me?

name: Ben
description: Hi my name is Ben! I think everything is fun, interesting and meant for play, especially you. Anything you do, I'll want to do too. With my own brand of surprises, life with me will keep you constantly on your toes, and the fun is guaranteed.Exercise: High EnergyDogs: I love to make friends. Let's meet!Children: I would do best with older kids but lets meet!Cats/other small animals: Unknown

name: Blue
description: Hi, my name is Blue! I'm a naturally playful, curious, and trusting canine. Take me for a big walk every day; give me something to do. After my job's done, I'll curl up in front of the fire with you in the evenings. I'm a fun-loving, happy-all-the-time, glass-is-half-full kind of dog looking for someone who loves to laugh and play around. Must have a great sense of humor and some time to spend with me. I'm a dog on a mission to please you. From: Lyon County Animal ServicesExercise: High energyDogs: I like to play, let's meet!Children: I would be best in an adult only householdCats: Unknown history to SPCA

description: A little sweet, a little shy, I'm the kind of gal who needs someone to be patient with me and let me warm up to them slowly. Change is a big adjustment for anyone, and I'm working on letting my affection show. Just know I'm charming, friendly and curious. Give me a chance-visit me today! I know you won't leave without me!

name: Harper
description: I'm so sweet I guess you could say I'm sweeter than sugar! Adorable, charming, and social, I want a lively, playful home with someone who will give me as much affection as I desire! I may take a bit to open up to you but then BAM! My personality is out and you better be ready for it! Could you be a match for me?

name: Brutus
description: No need to clean your glasses-I really do look THIS good! Sure, I used to be a Hanes model but now that I'm retired I just want to be a dog and lounge around on your couch. I'm a social bug (check my Facebook, over 1,000 friends!) so I'd love a social family. Will you friend me today?

name: Jasmine
description: Jasmine is a sweet girl who is very shy at first. She has been doing much better but her ideal home needs to give her time to adjust. Jasmine came to us very pregnant, she has delivered and all her puppies are adopted. She is about 1.5 yrs old, not real big and a true love. she is okay with some dogs and needs proper introductionOur dogs are spayed/neutered and utd on shots before adoption unless medically not advised by our Vet.

name: Neptune
description: Marco? Polo! Come find me! I'm ready and waiting, whether for a good game of fetch or just a little snuggle time, I'm here! I'll be your best friend with no questions asked, stand by your side through anything, and provide a better snuggle buddy than your human equal. I'm doggone good all the way around so meet me today!

name: Leo
description: Have I caught your eye? Good! My look is unique and my personality is too! I'm playful and energetic-hence, I need an active, adult person to take me home! I'd like to meet the entire family (including any doggies) before making a commitment to you, but ultimately, if you're ready for a new relationship in your life take me home today!

name: Duke
description: I am Duke! I am a husky through and through. I like talking to people. I have a lot of energy that I get to expel running around outside. I am looking for my loving forever home, please come by Pet Network and meet me so we can have fun together.

name: Quanta
description: Quanta is a very sweet young lady. She loves to give kisses. She is a bit timid of men but eventually warms up and loves people. Come in and hang out with Quanta at Pet Network!

name: Gigi
description: Meet Gigi! She is a bit shy at first when she meets you but once you get in Gigi's circle you get smooches! She is a very sweet girl. If you are looking for a smaller dog with some personality then Gigi is for you! Come by and say \"hello\" to Gigi and get a kiss!

name: CHARLIE
description: Charlie is 2 years old, he needs an active home. He does well with other dogs, but no cats, livestock or small pets please. Charlie walks nicely on his leash and loves to cuddle and enjoys being brushed. Charlie like most huskies needs a runner system when outside alone.

name: Shadow
description: So I may not be able to hear you, but I can definitely feel you! My ears have aged and so have I so Please go slow, but it's made my touch gentle, my attention more keen and my heart bigger. I'm playful and social, too! I hope a special person will give me what I give them-unconditional love. Take me home today!

name: Paisley
description: Hi, my name is Paisley! I'm a Shy yet charming canine searching for patient owner with relaxed lifestyle. Looking for gentle guidance to help me come out of my shell. Treat me sweet and kind and I'll blossom. description: Beth is a sweet Shepherd mix who came to us with puppies. Her babies are weaned and adopted and now it is her turn. No livestock please or cats. name: Dallas
description: Silly, kind, and curious- that's Dallas! This big goofball loves to spend time with his people and has been good around other shelter dogs. He loves to play ball, sit for treats, and meet new people. Dallas needs a person willing to take him on outings and adventures to get his energy out, he wants to see all of the things and smell all of the smells! Spend a minute with this sweet boy and you will fall in love. Come by HSAR to meet him!

name: Baxter
description: Baxter is a friendly and active 2 year old cuddle bug. He walks well on a leash and has been good with other shelter dogs. This guy will sit for a treat and is very intelligent; we could see him being very teachable. He would be great for an active family and would enjoy going out for walks, hikes, or runs. Swing on by to meet the boy of your dreams!

name: Raven
description: Our dogs are spayed/neutered and utd on shots before adoption unless medically not advised by our Vet.

name: Helen/A399637
description: Helen is a double merle, she is deaf and has some vision issues. Helen is in training with Ashley her foster and is doing phenomenal. She is ready for a home that can handle high energy and deaf. Helen does have a very small trachea and needs to be watched for coughing and cannot have a collar for walking, she needs a harness. Another dog would also be on Helen's list of wants.Our dogs are spayed/neutered and utd on shots before adoption unless medically not advised by our Vet.

name: Popeye
description: Popeye is great with dogs and cats. He is full of spunk and loves toys and chasing sticks. We saved Popeye from euthanasia and when he was busted out of the high kill shelter he wrapped his little legs around his savior to give a big thank you hug. Popeye is approximately 3 yo, around 40 pounds, neutered, and UTD on shots. Let's get Popeye into his furever home!!! If interested in adopting Popeye, please fill out an adoption application at tahoewarf.com and contact Sam for more info (775) 338-6631.

name: Buba
description: I may appear timid but get to know me and you'll see I'm a genuine lap dog with a love for affection. I'm the complete package I do get nervous easily, so I may shake and stumble, but I promise I'll be OK. Change isn't easy, but when I'm in the comfort of a good home with your attention I'm woofingly fine. Won't you open your heart and home to me?

name: Astro
description: Always poised, elegant and sophisticated, I'm someone who will be by your side no matter what. I know when you need me, I know when you need time for yourself. I'm friendly yet quiet, gentle yet playful, affectionate yet independent. I'm looking for a long-term relationship. Are you in?

name: Flo
description: Flo! Our sweet senior girl! She loves cuddles and is good with other dogs. Learning to tolerate cats. She's super sweet, loves to snuggle and great with other dogs. Still unsure about cats. She loves going for walks and riding in the car. If you are interested in adopting these sweet senior, please fill out an application at www.tahoewarf.com and call Emily at 707-367-3328.

name: Freya
description: Ms. Freya, aka the chocolate croissant, is available for adoption! This little snack is 55 pounds of sugar! Approximately 3 y/o lab mix, Freya is the whole package. Good with other dogs and kids. She loves to play and will appreciate a canine companion who can match her energy level. She's good as an only dog too. House trained and knows basic commands. In her downtime, Freya likes to soak up some rays in the yard with her favorite stuffie. She would also make an excellent running partner. Not a fan of cats. If interested, please fill out an adoption application at Tahoewarf.com

name: Rose
description: Sweet Rose is looking for her home. Approximately 3 y/o, Ms. Rose is everything you could want in a companion. Sweet, gentle, good with other dogs and kids, and of course, beautiful. Just look at those eyes. An excellent hiking partner and an overall friend. If you are interested, please fill out an application at www.tahoewarf.com and contact Erica at 775-443-0026.

name: Mr. Mastiff Mix
description: *** COURTESY LISTING *** PLEASE CALL OR E-MAIL THE PERSON LISTED. DO NOT CONTACT WARF AS WE HAVE NO FURTHER INFO. This handsome Mastiff pup, is approximately 80-85 lbs. Approximately 3-4 years old. Was tested with people and other dogs... did great but was a little afraid of small dogs. He's sweet! Very friendly! Not sure about cats. Looking for a new home immediately, or foster. Contact Tiffany. 206-369-5440, muirrel@yahoo.com.

name: Sevi
description: *** COURTESY LISTING *** PLEASE CALL OR E-MAIL THE PERSON LISTED. DO NOT CONTACT WARF AS WE HAVE NO FURTHER INFO. Sevard Sevi has been in a foster home since November 18, 2018. He is roughly 20 months old, DOB approx 10/10/2017. He was the last remaining pup after the Maddie's Fund event that took place at Pet Network that November weekend. He had been picked up by the Carson City animal control at 9 months. He was on a kill list when Pet Network brought him up to Incline Village. He was in the shelter for 4 months before we opted to foster him. Sevi has learned a lot since moving in with us. He is a much better behaved, and better trained dog since his first day here. I have spent many hours with him, and hired a professional trainer to help as well, and I feel he is much more adoptable after 7 months then he ever would've been if kept at the shelter. He loves human contact, snuggling (in bed-only with my daughter's!!) and he has a great understanding of commands. He loves to play and run around, and enjoys everyone that we welcome into our home. He gets overly excited over children, so only older, respectful kids. He is leash aggressive, so we either take him into remote locations for walks or get his zoomies out running around our large fenced in yard. He loves other dogs, but does not read dog language very well, so proper intro is imperative. Finding him the right play mate is a challenge. Not recommended with cats, as he seems to have a hunting dog instinct. He may be a mix of either Weimaraner or Rhodesian Ridge Back, as well as Pit. He has learned find it games that put his nose to the ground and gets him super focused. More about Sevi: He is very energetic. He is on a lamb/rice formula food, due to chicken allergy and has sensitive skin. He does not like to be tethered to anything, as we learned this in one of his training sessions. Poor Sevi has had a very rough start to his life. Hopefully the right home is out there for someone with dog experience looking for an active, loving companion. Please contact Pet Network, 775-832-3880, email: adoption@petnetwork.org.

name: Nolan
description: *** COURTESY LISTING *** PLEASE CALL OR E-MAIL THE PERSON LISTED. DO NOT CONTACT WARF AS WE HAVE NO FURTHER INFO. Nolan is a lover boy! Seriously! I can't sit down for a second without Nolli-Canoli running over to lean on my leg, or try to climb in my lap. He's an 85 lb Rotty mix that thinks he's a lap dog!! DOB 3/8/2013. He loves love. And you can't help but love him! Neutered, microchipped, house trained, crate trained and current on his vaccinations. He is great with other dogs and plays in the yard with an 8 lbs Chihuahua. NO CATS. E-mail: pawprintzrescue@gmail.com. All of our animals are up to date on their vaccinations, spayed/neutered, microchipped, and have had a physical exam. At adoption we provide; veterinary records and vaccine certificates, castration certificate, lifetime lost animal support, leash, collar, ID tag, and a familiar toy or blanket to help them settle in. We also keep in contact and try to help with any issues that may need to be additional support. Adoption Requirements: Application, Interview, Home Check Adoption Fee: $200.00 *Age is always a guess with rescue dogs but here at Paw Printz we believe everyone should have a birth day so when the vet guesses at their age, we work out what would be a good birthday for each dog and make it so! *He is diabetic and requires daily insulin* This dog is located in Bakersfield, Ca MORE ABOUT NOLAN Pet ID: Nolan House trained Spayed/Neutered Current on vaccinations Prefers a home without: Cats Primary Color(s): Black Secondary Color(s): Brown or Chocolate Coat Length: Short

description: *** COURTESY LISTING *** PLEASE CALL OR E-MAIL THE PERSON LISTED. DO NOT CONTACT WARF AS WE HAVE NO FURTHER INFO. This is Frankie. DOB 9/4/2013. He is looking for his forever home. About 4 yrs old. Beauty boy. One blue eye, one brown. High energy. Alpha male. Gets along with other properly introduced dogs. Neutered, current on vaccinations, crate trained, house broken, knows some basic obedience, good on a leash. Super fun boy! Loves his toys and will usually bring them to you to play. NO CATS! MORE ABOUT FRANKIE Pet ID: Frankie House trained Spayed/Neutered Current on vaccinations Prefers a home without: Cats Primary Color(s): White or Cream Secondary Color(s): Black Coat Length: Short

name: Lance
description: *** COURTESY LISTING *** PLEASE CALL OR E-MAIL THE PERSON LISTED. DO NOT CONTACT WARF AS WE HAVE NO FURTHER INFO. I am Sir Lancelot, but they call me Lance. DOB 7/22/2005. I love to play, especially with my rope toy, and man do I love to run. I am a big goofy boy as you can see from my pictures. I am so handsome, and I give the best kisses of all time and will snuggle with you for hours (once I get to know you). If you are on the computer or just sitting down watching TV I will put my head on your lap and wait for attention. They think I am a Brittany spaniel/ golden retriever/ pointer mix. That's a pretty good combination of brains and beauty if I do say so myself. Oh and, personally I don't know what the problem is, but the people say I have to mention this, so here goes. I'm kind of afraid of some things and my initial reaction is, well, to bite. It's just a warning bite. It doesn't usually break the skin, but I guess it can be scary for some people. I immediately regret it but sometimes I just can't help it. Plus, those little people who are very noisy and get all up in my face while getting even louder and sometimes shrill! Yeah. They really scare me! I don't like them very much at all! Um, children, I guess, is what the people call them. So if you don't have any of those, (children), that would work best for me. No children. That's what the people said I had to tell you. So, I did. But the lady I'm with now knows all about it and can tell you all that 'detail' stuff about me when you come out to see me. The bottom line is I am a good boy! So be sure to send an email to: pawprintzrescue@gmail.com and request an application. Lance has trust issues, so needs a special home. No kids, No cats. All of our animals are up to date on their vaccinations, spayed/neutered, microchipped, and have had a physical exam. At adoption we provide; veterinary records and vaccine certificates, castration certificate, lifetime lost animal support, leash, collar, ID tag, and a familiar toy or blanket to help them settle in. We also keep in contact and try to help with any issues that may need to be additional support. Adoption Requirements : Application, Interview, Homecheck Adoption Fee: $200.00 This dog is located in Bakersfield, Ca MORE ABOUT LANCE Pet ID: Lance House trained Spayed/Neutered Current on vaccinations Prefers a home without: Cats and Young Children Primary Color(s): Brown or Chocolate Secondary Color(s): White or Cream Coat Length: Long

name: Pippa
description: Sweet Pippa is in need of a loving foster home. Saved just minutes before euthanasia, Ms. Pippa stole our hearts. She is approximately 3 years old, house trained, knows basic commands, and loves to give kisses. Plus, look at that smile ?? Pippa needs to be an only dog at the moment so she can have some time to settle in and learn how to introduce herself. Pippa says she doesn't love cats but does love snuggles. If interested in giving this sweet girl a second chance, please fill out a foster application at Tahoewarf.com and contact ericaroth1@gmail.com or (775) 443-0026.

name: Molly
description: Top Urgent Home Needed ! This is breaking my heart! Miss Molly is around 5 years old, spayed, UTD on shots, sweet, playful but mellow and loves humans. Unfortunately, she is not good with other dogs. WARF pulled her from a high kill shelter after her owner turned her into the shelter for skin conditions She was taken into foster and then adopted by the fosters, but they went on a trip out of town and we boarded her and we never heard from then again!! Abandoned and sad, she is a currently with a foster who loves her but can't keep her. She just wants to follow you around, snuggle and hang out all day. She will watch you constantly but stays out of your way. She'll wait for you at the window until you come home. Rarely does she bark. House trained and great in the car. Contact Tahoewarf.com, Wylie Animal Rescue Foundation on Facebook or call Amy @ 949-290-7951 or Donna at (775)846-3773.

name: Liona
description: *** COURTESY LISTING *** PLEASE CALL OR E-MAIL THE PERSON LISTED. DO NOT CONTACT WARF AS WE HAVE NO FURTHER INFO. Liona Liona - Tibetan Mastiff (DNA tested) Approximately 3 yrs old in 2018 Found in field as a puppy. Liona is about 120 pounds of confidence. She is very protective and has no problems putting her mouth on your arm to make sure you know that is not a behavior she is happy with. Even though she has never broken the skin, it is a behavior that can be very unnerving for anyone not familiar with this breed. Then, once a bond is established, she will absolutely protect what she considers hers. Her family, her home, her yard. And she is big enough and intimidating enough to give anyone pause. In new and unfamiliar situations she will watch. She is intelligent enough to figure out most situations. Which, of course, has lead to her being called an escape artist. Being such a loyal and devoted companion, when in a new environment she tends to want to leave and find her way back to her people. Crate doors, no problem. Fence gates, make sure they are locked! It takes her about a month to 'settle in' and stop looking for a way out. Until then it is best if she is not left outside unattended or that any new or unknown individuals try to touch her head. Once you have her trust however, a good scratch behind the ears and a kiss on the nose are expected. Without these, you may end up with a large, heavy and slobbery head being plopped down in your lap. And with intelligence comes the knowledge that she can slip those puppy eyes up at you and have you wrapped around her front paw. Liona is a spayed female, current on vaccinations, heartworm negative and on preventive medication, house trained, crate trained, good with property introduced dogs. She should not be in a home with cats or small children (only due to her size). Characteristics Loyal, protective, Intelligent If you are interested in adopting Liona, please send an email to PawPrintzRescue@gmail.com and request an application. Adoption Requirements: Application, Interview, Home Check This dog is located near Fresno, Ca All of our animals are up to date on their vaccinations, spayed/neutered, microchipped, and have had a physical exam. At adoption we provide; veterinary records and vaccine certificates, spay or neuter certificate, lifetime lost animal support, leash, collar, ID tag, and a familiar toy or blanket to help them settle in. We also keep in contact and try to help with any issues that may need to be additional support.

name: Linus
description: *** COURTESY LISTING *** PLEASE CALL OR E-MAIL THE PERSON LISTED. DO NOT CONTACT WARF AS WE HAVE NO FURTHER INFO. Linus is about 5 years old. Male, neutered, Lab/Pit mix breed, vaccinated, microchipped, crate trained. Initially he is afraid of people. He barks and backs away. But once he gets to know you, he has more love to share with you than you can believe. Full of energy, full of love. Good with other dogs, though tries to be dominant initially, so proper introduction is a must. NO cats. Contact Cyndi, pawprintzrescue@gmail.com for adoption or Christina, harisudha108@hotmail.com for rescue.

name: Jojo
description: Sweet Jo Jo is in need of a loving foster and forever home. Jo Jo was pulled just minutes before euthanasia. At no fault of his own, Jo Jo's foster situation fell through and now Jo Jo is looking for a warm place to decompress ASAP. Jo Jo is a catahoula mix, approximately 10 years old. He is good with other dogs, but is looking for a home with calm dogs only as he needs some peace and quiet while he gets over the stress of shelter life. Jo Jo loves roaming the yard, soaking up his freedom. More than anything Jo Jo wants to be where the people are. If interested in giving this sweet senior boy a second chance at life, please fill out a foster application at Tahoewarf. com and contact Erica at (775) 443-0026 or ericaroth1@gmail.com or Sam a5 775-338-6631.

name: Genesis
description: Genesis is a beautiful, energetic, playful girl. She is a bit pushy but does get along with other dogs after a warm up period, but not with cats!! She is great with people. She would love to get into a foster as she is now boarding, but a permanent home would be even better. If you are interested in fostering or adoption, please fill out an application at www.tahoewarf.com. To adopt call Sam at 775-338-6631.

name: Luca
description: *** COURTESY LISTING *** PLEASE CALL OR E-MAIL THE PERSON LISTED. DO NOT CONTACT WARF AS WE HAVE NO FURTHER INFO. Luca is a Courtesy Listing. Please email Paw Printz directly if you are interested in Luca at: PawPrintzRescue@gmail.com Luca is one of those dogs whose picture you see online and fall so madly in love with him you think you couldn't love him anymore. Then you meet him, and your heart explodes. He is that lovable. Luca is a little shy at first, he has had his heart broken by unworthy people in the past, so patience with him at first is the best way to win his heart. But once he warms up, you get the full Luca experience. He will adore you just as much as you adore him, 70 pounds of total adoration, devotion and kisses. Had a bad day? Luca can help. He can lounge around and watch a movie with you or lift your spirits with a little rousing game of fetch and tag in the backyard with his Kong. He will plop his big fat head in your lap, look up at you with those gorgeous green eyes and you can see how much he loves you and wants to make life better for you. This guy will touch your soul and you will know love. His favorite toy is his Kong. When he is nervous it acts like a binky for him. He is very smart and listen well. He just wants to please and make his person happy. Luca is a Mastiff/Bully mix about 3 or 4 years old (as of 2018). He weighs in around 70 pounds, which is all solid muscle. He is neutered, current on vaccinations, microchipped, good with properly introduced dogs, but especially good with the ladies. His has beautiful green eyes and a shiny. gorgeous fawn colored coat with white markings. He hasn't had any prior experience with cats so we suggest a home without any feline companions, or maybe a very dog savvy cat. He is house trained, crate trained, good on a leash, knows basic obedience (but can have a bout of 'bully hearing' when sniffing something especially interesting in the yard lol), loves car rides and is an all around good dog. Because of his size, we recommend a home without small children. He can get very exuberant in his play and may accidentally knock small children down. We want both Luca and his new family to be happy so a home experienced with bully breeds is a must. Adoption Process: Application, Interview, Homecheck Adoption Fee: $250

name: Bella And Coco
description: *** COURTESY LISTING *** PLEASE CALL OR E-MAIL THE PERSON LISTED. DO NOT CONTACT WARF AS WE HAVE NO FURTHER INFO. Meet Bella (D19-083) and Coco (D19-084)! These two girls were transported to us from another shelter to help save their lives. Bella is a 10 year old Pit Bull and the mother of Coco, a 6 year old Pit Bull/Lab mix. They have had a very difficult life and are looking for a caring family to adopt them and give them all the love they need. One of Bella's hind feet was cut off at a young age, but she still can walk around just fine! They are very accustomed to people and love to be around them. They are exceptional dogs that have had a tough life and deserve a good home. Come meet them and fall in love with them like we have! Transportation can be arranged to approved home. Bella and Coco are both available for adoption at the City of Escalon Animal shelter. 25100 E River Rd Escalon, California 95320 Phone: 209-838-9908 Thank you for considering these two shelter pets in need! E-mail contact: cpascale@cityofescalon.org. http://Escalonshelter.petfinder.com.

name: Galena
description: *** COURTESY LISTING *** PLEASE CALL OR E-MAIL THE PERSON LISTED. DO NOT CONTACT WARF AS WE HAVE NO FURTHER INFO. Foster Home Needed ASAP. Galena is a 3 year old, female Aussie mix, with boundless energy. She's medium-size, about 50 lbs. Her current owners work long hours and and can't give her the attention, training and exercise she deserves. She will be spayed once she is in an approved foster home and before she can be adopted out. Galena is dog friendly, house trained and could be a good candidate for herding or agility. RuffRiders Foundation is willing to have her listed in their rescue for adoption, but first she needs an experienced and skilled foster person who is able to work on getting her to be the best dog possible. Anyone out there with the knowledge to do that and who is up for the task? You will enjoy the satisfaction of seeing Galena thrive due to your efforts. Contact Kristian, ruffridersrescues@gmail.com, 775.400.1218.

name: Joey
description: Joey is an 11 year old sweetheart whose dad had to go into assisted living and could not take him. A kind neighbor has been caring for him and we have found him a safe place to be fostered, but if anyone can take him into their heart and home for his last years, it would be amazing. he is a super, super sweet boy. He does get slightly anxious/ shows signs of separation anxiety (just whines for a few seconds if you aren't paying attention to him but then stops and lays down or carries on). He also did attempt to dig under our side gate into the front yard, but our front yard is gated as well so he wouldn't have gotten anywhere, but maybe just an another anxious sign. He is really spry in his older age, as he plays with our other pup in the video attached. He likes playing around but also enjoys laying and napping on the couch next to you, he has even snuggled with us on our laps a couple times. His owner will pay for his care as he can, but just wants Joey safe. He is great with kids and dogs but not so good with cats. If you are interested, please contact Cami at (775) 684-9802 or ccsimpson11@gmail.com. Help this love live out his last years in a happy safe place. Please fill out an application to foster or adopt at www.tahoewarf.com.

name: Conner
description: *** COURTESY LISTING *** PLEASE CALL OR E-MAIL THE PERSON LISTED. DO NOT CONTACT WARF AS WE HAVE NO FURTHER INFO. Conner is a beautiful, sweet, loving Pit mix brindle boy. He is about 6-7 years old and weighs about 60-65 pounds. He is house broken, crate trained, vaccinated, microchipped and waiting for his loving forever home to show up. Super sweet with people; stand-offish with unknown dogs. With proper introduction warms up quickly. NO cats. Plays ball. Absolutely loves the water and car rides. He is summer fun in one beautiful package. He thinks he's a tiny lap dog and is always trying to crawl up in your lap. If you're not in the chair, he crawls up and waits for you. He will chose getting love and pets from his person, over everything else: Treats, food, toys, all go by the wayside and are not as important as getting attention and love. Contact Cyndi, pawprintzrescue@gmail.com for adoption or Christina, harisudha108@hotmail.com for rescue.

name: Gigi
description: Gigi is a 4 year old, highly energetic pit/lab mix. She loves people but isn't too fond of other animals so must be the only dog. She would be good with older kids but due to her rambunctiousness, little kids might get knocked around. If you are interested, please fill out an application at www.tahoewarf.com and contact Sam at 775-338-6632.

name: Scout
description: *** COURTESY LISTING *** PLEASE CALL OR E-MAIL THE PERSON LISTED. DO NOT CONTACT WARF AS WE HAVE NO FURTHER INFO. Scout is a 16 month old, 49 lb., mostly Australian Cattle Dog with a bit of Aussie Shepherd mixed in. He loves to play ball, and hang with his people. When Scout is familiar with someone, and knows they are friends, he adores them and will celebrate their arrival with a a happy puppy greeting. However, he is very fearful around people he doesn't know. He would thrive in a quiet, adult-only home, as a companion for a person or couple, who live in the country and rarely have visitors. Scout is great when meeting other dogs and loves to play with them, but when in the same home, he can be competitive with other dogs, and he would be best as an only dog. In a calm situation, Scout is a very playful, relaxed and happy. He is sweet and loving with people he knows. He likes to be in the same room with his person/people, but doesn't need to be underfoot. At home, he is a very quiet and will rest in his bed or beside you. He also sometimes like to snuggle, and will sit or lie down with his back touching you, sometimes deciding to groom your hand or leg. Although he is still just a pup, Scout is a fairly moderate energy dog. He is satisfied with a few daily sessions of fetching the ball and a good walk. He does NOT need tons of exercise. He is a very alert, observant, highly intelligent dog, who learns new things quickly. He has excellent eye contact and checks in with you frequently. Scout has taken basic obedience training and knows the commands Sit, Down, Wait, and Shake. He walks very nicely on leash and loves walking out on trails. He is also completely housebroken and rides quietly in the backseat of a car. We do not recommend him around cats or chickens, as he wants to chase. We also believe that he was traumatized and terrified as a very small pup, and has some PTSD. Fast movements or unexpected noises make him extremely nervous and panicky. All training with Scout must be rewards based, positive reinforcement. Negative corrections or punishment based training methods will NOT work with him, and will achieve the opposite of what you want. He has a deep seated fear of strangers. if a person the the street looks at him or reaches out to pet him, Scout will shrink away in fear. At home, if strange vehicles and people approach the house, he will bark and howl in alarm. If unknown people enter the house, he will bark, growl and lunge at them. He is especially wary of children, and would not do well around them. If he is properly and positively introduced (with treats) to new people away from his territory, he will be fine if everyone walks back to the house and enters together. Strangers must ignore him, but drop tasty treats to show him that they are not a threat to him. With other dogs only (NOT with people), Scout is a resource guarder. He will chase other dogs away from his people, food and toys. If another dog stands up to him, as a parent would to a naughty pup, Scout will respect that dog. Otherwise, in his home, he is territorial with easy going dogs, if they are near his people or resources. His respect for another dog is on an individual, case by case basis and as he gets to know the dog over time. He is completely fine and respectful with people around his resources (food, toys, etc.). Scout requires a quiet home in the country. His nightmare scenario would be a busy urban area, on streets bustling with people and fast moving vehicles whizzing past just a few feet away. If he cannot hide, he will tremble with fear, and will attempt to chase fast moving cars. If a situation proves too much for Scout, and you stop/hold him back from lunging out at the cause of his stress, in his panic he will redirect onto a pant leg, pulling and ripping the material. We believe that his adrenaline and cortisol levels shoot up quickly, and depending on the amount of stress he has experienced, it can take him a full 24 hours or more to recover from the terror and trauma. When he feels safe and secure at home and with his people, Scout is a great companion. He is happy, playful, loving and cuddly. He needs very experienced, patient, loving people with a quiet, calm situation, and who have the willingness and understanding to work with a pup with PTSD. Scout would be best as only dog. No young kids, cats or livestock. Needs an experienced, adult home only. If you are interested in meeting Scout, please begin our process by going to this link: http://hittgv.org/index.php/adopt, to download and print the form to be completed. If you have questions, please email us at doghouse@hittgv.org or leave a message at (707) 583-9583.

name: Poncho
description: Hi I'm Poncho and I'm a PUPS Graduate!!! Aged many years to perfection, medium bodied and well-rounded, I'm ready for you! I'm a sweet one who has learned some things over the years: I enjoy long naps in the sun, walks in the park and just being with my human. I'm also social and just love people! I also learned, however, that I'd do best in a home where there are no other animals or children, but don't worry, because I'll be the best kid you'll ever have! Meet me today!

name: Weta
description:
Weta and her sister Wahnee are about five months old now, so they are a bit larger than in these photos, but are still just as cute.Weta is the Western Shoshone word for 'Bear' and Wahnee means 'Fox'. Weta has a stubby tail, kind of like a little brown bear. They are a mix of Pitbull, Rottweiler, and Labrador. Super friendly and silly, they love to play and are good with kids and dogs. Probably okay with dog-experienced cats if properly introduced.All of our dogs are available for a $200 donation. This includes them being spayed/neutered, micro-chipped, and fully vaccinated.
To adopt a dog, we require an approved pre-application, as well as a securely fenced yard. This means an actual, physical, fence. 'Invisible' fences are not acceptable, sorry. If you live in an apartment and do not have a yard, we are not able to adopt to you.
Please contact us at: dogtownmutts@gmail.com for details.
Please note: we typically do not do 'out of the area' adoptions. This would be any location more than 60 miles away from the Reno/Carson City area.

description: Our dogs are spayed/neutered and utd on shots before adoption unless medically not advised by our Vet.

name: Honey/A415659
description: Our dogs are spayed/neutered and utd on shots before adoption unless medically not advised by our Vet.

name: Humphrey
description: Did my smile catch your eye? Good! Now, that I've got your attention, know my fabulous, happy-go-lucky personality will bring a lot of happiness and smiles to your life! Every day! But, truth be told, I'll be smiling a lot more when I have my own place (with you as my roommate!), so get to it!

name: Thor
description: Friendly, affectionate and gentle is how I roll, so much so that I can't sit still-I'd rather be head-butting you to pet me. I enjoy the simple things in life-playtime with you, cuddling on the couch and naps on your pillow. Will you give me the attention I crave? I'll give it back-threefold!

name: Zena
description: I'm ready to have a tail-wagging, good time! I'm seeking a bonding experience with the perfect person who will give me time to come out of my shell. You know, someone to help me become more social, maybe a walk or a car ride-the possibilities are endless and I'm ready. Once I open up, you'll see I am loyal, fun-loving and a ball of fun. Doggie bonding coming right up!

name: Pepe
description: Pepe is an approximately 6 to 7 year old Poodle. He came to us when his mom was in a very bad accident with his brother Zoee. Pepe takes a little time to warm up to people and can get a little snappy so we will not place with children. He would be fine with another dog his size.Our dogs are spayed/neutered and utd on shots before adoption unless medically not advised by our Vet.

name: Bo
description: Dr. DOGtastic here and I'm ready to diagnose you. Lonely? Feeling like something is missing? Looking for someone to love you unconditionally? I can fix that! I provide friendship, love, loyalty and even entertainment, all with no side effects. I'm known for unlimited smiles and laughter, awesome pics for your Instagram and more. Visit me and see what this dog... can do for you today!

name: MOBIL
description: Mobil 1 year old Border Collie x Cattle dog, look at that tail wag, wag, wag! Mobil wants to please his person and will florish in a patient home.

name: Maddie
description:
Name:  Maddie  #4734
Age: Aprx 1 year
Color:  Red
Coat:  Smooth 
Sex:  Female/Spayed
Size:  Micro Mini â 9 lbs.

Cat friendly!

This beautiful young lady was found wandering the mean streets in Oakland California on a beautiful but hot day in mid-July.

Frantic outreach to locate the owner failed, no collar, no chip, nothing. Fliers were posted, messages out on Facebook etc did not find this girls family. 

Was she dumped because she had a hernia that needed repair, dumped because they could not afford surgery? Who knows, but we were delighted to be able to help this little girl out.

During Maddies brief stay in Oakland she was given love and good food, even making friends with the kind ladyâs cat! She loves cats.

She is full of energy, loves to play with others, runs like the wind, barks rarely, sleeps all cuddled up in a bed by herself right now, but she really wants to get into the big bed. She is good on a leash, but needs a little more time to be confident.
Maddie just had her staples out from the hernia repair and spaying, all vaccines are now current, and she is looking to find a new home with at least one other dachshund in it.

Maddie does not like the crate, but she is quite reliable in the house.

If you have a place in your heart for Maddie, please contact foster mom Dawn at dawnaa@pacbell.net

An application and home check are required.

Adoption donation for Maddie is $400.00

name: Angelos
description:
Angelos is a very handsome guy, with one brown eye and one blue eye. He is about two years old. He was found living at the dump on the Duck Valley Reservation.
He is very friendly and likes everyone he meets. Walks pretty well on a leash, and is eager to please. Angelos can be a little bit protective of his food around other dogs, probably because he had to fend for himself in the past.
Angelos is super smart and would do great in obedience class. All of our dogs are available for a $200 donation. This includes them being spayed/neutered, micro-chipped, and fully vaccinated.
To adopt a dog, we require an approved pre-application, as well as a securely fenced yard. This means an actual, physical, fence. 'Invisible' fences are not acceptable, sorry. If you live in an apartment and do not have a yard, we are not able to adopt to you.
Please contact us at: dogtownmutts@gmail.com for details.
Please note: we typically do not do 'out of the area' adoptions. This would be any location more than 60 miles away from the Reno/Carson City area.

name: Thena
description:
Thena is about a year old, and is now ready for a forever home. She is good with dogs and kids, and was curious but not aggressive with the cat at our vet's office. Housebroken, leash trained, and always ready to play, Thena would be a great addition to an active family.All of our dogs are available for a $200 donation. This includes them being spayed/neutered, micro-chipped, and fully vaccinated.

name: Vickie
description: Anybody want to play? Vickie is a very sweet lady that's ready to meet her fur-ever playmate and family. Playtime is her favorite time of day and anytime is playtime! Tennis balls (or any ball for that matter) seem to be the object of choice at this particular moment but she's open to suggestion; maybe a squeaky or rope toy will offer some variety! She also loves water and is ready for new adventures. Are you? Come find out at High Sierra Animal Rescue!

name: Duke
description:
Hi I'm Duke - and I am one handsome boy don't you think?  I know many of my basic commands and walk really well on leash.  I love the ball but am still thinking about whether I should give it up to you.  I love the water!  I may be protective so a meet and greet with any other dog will be important.  So far I've been a real good boy around other dogs at the shelter - even said hello to a couple.  I'm house-trained, good with kids and GOOD WITH CATS.  I will need some activity to keep me happy and content.

By the way, I'm neutered, microchipped, and current on all shots -- all ready for a new home.

For more information about me, please call the Douglas County Animal Care and Services (DCACS) at 775-782-9061 or the Douglas Animal Welfare Group (DAWG) at 775-267-7325. Or come meet me at the Douglas County Animal Shelter (please call first to make sure I'm still at the shelter). Click on Douglas Animal Welfare Group below for the address and directions.

ALSO A \"MEET AND GREET\" WILL BE REQUIRED IF THERE ARE ANY OTHER DOGS IN THE HOUSEHOLD. 

ONE LAST THING! If you rent, you will be required to provide written approval from your landlord that you can have a dog. It needs to be specific, i.e. all dogs okay, no big dogs, specific breeds restricted, etc.

name: Domino
description:
Domino
This pretty girl needs a forever home. She is a boxer bulldog mix. She is potty trained and amazing on a leash. Crates make her panic and she can get pretty nervous when she canât be around people. She does well in a 10'x10' kennel and is good with other dogs but can have some leash reactivity. She would like a home with a yard and maybe even a doggy door so she can go in and out as she needs too. She will be up-to-date on shots microchipped and spayed. If interested in Miss Domino please fill out an adoption application

Adoption Fee: $250

1 yr old female Boxer Bulldog Mix

For more information and pictures, or if you're interested in adopting me, please visit:  www.boxersandbuddies.com.  All of our dogs are FAMILY COMPANIONS!

Our adoption requirements are:

You must be 21 years of age

Attendance at a professionally run obedience course is a requirement of adoption! 
We do not adopt out dogs as gifts

name: Jack
description:
Hi I'm Jack and I'm pretty much pure Labbie at heart!  Got ball?  Then you all you got to do is throw it - again, and again and again... ha!  Life doesn't get any better than that.  And like all good Labbies, I love the water and being toweled off.  I am house-trained, good with most dogs, love people of all ages, but they are not sure about cats.  They say I'm 10 but I sure don't act my age!  I will need some activity to keep me happy, but all you gotta do is stand there and throw the ball or let's go for a walk.  

By the way, I'm neutered, microchipped, and current on all shots -- all ready for a new home.

For more information about me, please call the Douglas County Animal Care and Services (DCACS) at 775-782-9061 or the Douglas Animal Welfare Group (DAWG) at 775-267-7325. Or come meet me at the Douglas County Animal Shelter (please call first to make sure I'm still at the shelter). Click on Douglas Animal Welfare Group below for the address and directions.

ALSO A \"MEET AND GREET\" WILL BE REQUIRED IF THERE ARE ANY OTHER DOGS IN THE HOUSEHOLD. 

ONE LAST THING! If you rent, you will be required to provide written approval from your landlord that you can have a dog. It needs to be specific, i.e. all dogs okay, no big dogs, specific breeds restricted, etc.

name: Sandie
description: Have I caught your eye? Good! My look is unique and my personality is too! I'm playful and energetic-hence, I need an active, adult person to take me home! I'd like to meet the entire family (including any doggies) before making a commitment to you, but ultimately, if you're ready for a new relationship in your life take me home today!
