name: Theo/A404718
description:
Theo is a male Bull Breed mix right around a year old. He likely has some Heeler or a similar breed in him. Hes a large athletic guy who would be perfect for an active family. He thinks every person he meets is his friend, although he tends to be a more independent dog rather than a Velcro dog. He will ask for some love and then move on to his own activity. He loves toys, treats and booty scratches.

Theo is currently in board and train at Evolved K9 Training where he is learning some great manners. Just some of the training he will come with includes crate training, here, sit, down, place, stay and walking nicely on the leash. He will come with 3 free training classes for his new family, and our contract will state a requirement to attend those classes with Theo. This is a pretty sweet deal to get free training and he does need it.

Theo is fine with respectful children, he would do best in a home with older children as he doesnt realize his own size. He is good with other playful and friendly dogs, hes a no for cats and extremely small dogs. He is neutered, vaccinated and chipped. He will be ready to go home in approx 2 weeks (after training).Our dogs are spayed/neutered and utd on shots before adoption unless medically not advised by our Vet.

description: Sweet Shepherd mix puppies. Require homeowners, socialized with other dogs.Our dogs are spayed/neutered and utd on shots before adoption unless medically not advised by our Vet.

description: Our dogs are spayed/neutered and utd on shots before adoption unless medically not advised by our Vet.

description: Attention seniors looking for a lap dog! Sweet Princess is still searching for a home of her own and her adoption fee is waived for our senior for senior program! Princess is a senior Pomeranian/mini American Eskimo mix, good with other dogs, needs a secure yard. She will come with free grooming for life at Crazy Cat Dog Grooming and Canine Academy. Please email Sumdawnanderson@gmail.com for more information and any questions!Our dogs are spayed/neutered and utd on shots before adoption unless medically not advised by our Vet.

name: Pancake
description:
Please welcome Pancake to ResQue.
She is a very friendly girl, estimated to be about 3 years young black lab mix and definitely still acting like a youngster.
About 50lb, loves treats and food, and playful with other dogs. 
She loves standing up on you and giving hugs as you can see Our dogs are spayed/neutered and utd on shots before adoption unless medically not advised by our Vet.

name: Shelby
description: Everyone please give a warm welcome to Shelby, she is a 2 year old Heeler mix. She weighs about 50lbs and is a ball of lovable energy. Shelby came to us very timid of new people, but she absolutely loves other dogs. They bring her right out of her shell. She enjoys being chased and will steal toys from her foster brothers to help initiate the game. She wants to be right by her foster family's side and is sometimes considered a tripping hazard. Shelby will be ready for adoption after she is spayed.Our dogs are spayed/neutered and utd on shots before adoption unless medically not advised by our Vet.

name: Hero
description: Our dogs are spayed/neutered and utd on shots before adoption unless medically not advised by our Vet.

name: Murphy
description: Murphy has moved to.. \"Hey you wanna meet me\"? He'll be adoptable after the 21st but he'd be happy to do a meet and greet. He is a Redbone Coonhound, great with dogs, kids, cats, needs a buddy to hang with and would love to go hiking, camping, walking with his new people. He can be an in your face with other dogs so a tolerant K9 friend would be best. He also is a little needy at first but he's been through a lot of changes in his life, he needs patience and understanding. He's about a year old.Our dogs are spayed/neutered and utd on shots before adoption unless medically not advised by our Vet.

name: Luna Lovegood
description: Aged many years, full-bodied and fabulous! I'm a social one, chatty and fun-loving. I just love people! I reach out and ask for attention often, and because of this, I prefer a home with no other pets. But who are we kidding, you won't need them because you've got me! Meet me today!

name: Jasmine
description: Age is just a number, I say! I'm friendly, affectionate, curious and energetic! I still love to play and I'm very intrigued as to what is going on around me. Fun-loving and always up for a good time, I know I'd be a great fit for you!

name: Chimnethy
description: Young and vivacious, I'm playful, outgoing, and a genuine cuddlebug. I have dance moves like you've never seen before, and I am a champion napper. Toys make me sparkle and food makes my heart swell. I'm the perfect addition to YOUR family. Maybe take me home today?

name: Titan
description: If you're looking for a dog that will stick by your side no matter what,Titan is your guy! He will be your very best bud and follow you around for comfort and affection. He's very excitable and has been described as a \"happy go lucky\" dog. He loves to be outside and is extremely curious and smart. He has already gotten better about walking on the leash and will surely be a pro in no time, he is very treat motivated! Stop by and get to know this guy, he may just win your heart over!

name: Charlie
description: This handsome 12 year old man goes by the name of Charlie. Looks, intelligence, and a charming personality are just the start of what this guy has going for him. He'll shake his tail as soon as you say \"hello\" and will gently look up in your eyes like a perfect gentleman. Charlie really just needs someone who will give him a comfy corner to curl up in while he nudges their hands for more pets. He's a very sweet guy and he is very much looking forward to meeting you!

name: Yeti COURTESY LISTING!
description:
The following dog is not, nor has he ever been, part of our rescue.
We are listing him to help with his rehoming as a courtesy to his current owners.

If you are interested in finding out more about him, please contact the person listed at the end of the following set of notes (provided by his owner, Kenny):

His name is Yeti and his information is below:

1. He is 5 and his birthday is in November. He weighs about 65lbs.
2. He is Neutered. When I brought him back from South Korea, the Korean government required him to be neutered in Order to export him.
3. He is up to date on vaccinations as of May of this year.
4. He is not treated monthly for anything, as none of those are currently in my area and there are no signs of anything.
5. No known issues. Last Vet check was beginning of 2018 when I moved from Vegas to northern Reno.
6. He behaves normally around all. He doesnât like to be âtrapped/blockedâ in. I currently have him around my 2 other dogs whom my ex wife is taking. He is also around other animals from my ex wifeâs mom.
7. Normal routine consists of pretty much outside all day. I live on 40 acres and he runs around it all. He exercises outside all day with the other dogs. He only eats once a day, and it is currently at night around 2000 hours.
8. He is both an inside and outside dog. Does great with both.
9. He knows sit, down, come. He pulls slightly on a leash, but nothing over the top. When he sees other dogs, he is just curious. Wants to smell and normal stuff dogs do.
10. He likes to be pet and loved. The only sensitive part is his tail. When we found him in Korea, he had a rubber band around his tail. The doctors had to cut it to make it healthy. That is the only part about him that is sensitive. You can see it in the photos.
11. He rides in cars fine. Back of trucks too. He hates the vet. Doesnât like to get shots, but it is possible. Can be lifted. Just marks his territory a lot.
12. He has not bitten anybody or any other animals that I am aware of. I just came back from overseas after a year, and my ex wife didnât say anything.
13. No separation anxiety or behavioral issues that I know of. He is kennel trained and dog door trained.
14. I adopted Yeti while I was stationed in Korea. I rescued him from a meat market. He has had all American veterinary care in Korea and well as in the states. Up to date on all shots. The reason Iâm rehoming him is because I got divorced right before my deployment and now that I am back, with the divorce and child support, I can no longer keep a place that can an animal can accompany me. I have to downsize my current lifestyle and living expenses in order to keep my head above water. I have had Yeti since 2014 when he turned 1.
15. I have not contacted any other rescues as of this moment.
16. Best method of contact is 702.823.9275 or kenny032004@gmail.com
17. Address: Reno NV, 89510.

name: Dosha
description: Aged many years, full-bodied and fabulous! I'm a social one, chatty and fun-loving. I just love people! I reach out and ask for attention often, and because of this, I prefer a home with no other pets. But who are we kidding, you won't need them because you've got me! Meet me today!

name: Sydney
description:
Sydney

***************Sydney was born deaf***************************

Sydney is a typical Boston Terrier - if you don 't know what that means, please research Bostons. They are high-energy, high intelligence, stubborn, and the best personalities you will ever encounter, but they ARE personalities.

Sydney was born deaf and has NO volume control. She is a dominant female and has marked (although current foster says she has no issues with this or general house-training). She is crate trained and we are working on obedience training.

Sydney is a wonderful dog - but Boston Terriers aren't for everyone. If you're familiar with the breed or ready to tackle a challenge, please put in an application today!
?
Adoption Fee: $250

4 year old - Female Boston Terrier?

Breed:Boston Terrier  
Age: 4 years
Size: Small
Gender: Female????

Good with:
Dogs: Yes
Kids: Older
Cats: Unknown????

For more information and pictures, or if you're interested in adopting me, please visit:  www.boxersandbuddies.com.  All of our dogs are FAMILY COMPANIONS!

Our adoption requirements are:

We only adopt pets within 4 hours of Reno
You must be 21 years of age
All current pets in the household MUST be spayed/neutered and current on shots (yes, we do call and verify this information)
We do not place female boxers with other female dogs
Attendance at a professionally run obedience course is a requirement of adoption! 
We do not adopt out dogs as gifts

name: Edgar
description:
Personality: Gentle, Mellow & Cuddly
Age: 10 Years Old
Size: 52 lbs

Edgar is a goofy old man with so much love to give and heâs ready to give his whole heart to you and your family! Just promise him a life of cookies, neck scratches, and the Nature Channelâ¦ okay fine, you can hold the remote.  You might notice heâs sometimes a little wobbly on his feet.  He might not make it on Americaâs Next Top Dog Model, but heâs otherwise unconcerned with this setback.  Ask an Adoption Specialist for more details.  He is microchipped, neutered and current on vaccinations. 
His adoption fee is sponsored by an admirer!

Edgar is spending some time out of the shelter in foster. If you would like to meet this handsome guy please call 530-587-5948 and speak with an Adoption Specialist for more information.

name: Bernard
description: Meet Bernie! Tall, handsome and intelligent! This kid is looking for a leader and wants something to do! If you've got a spacious property or are an avid jogger/walker and looking for a partner, this just might be your guy! He's pretty stunning in person and would love nothing more than to get out and do... with his human of course! He has been through our Loose Leash Training here at the center and knows quite a few commands. Bernie rides well in the car and is eager to settle into a structured routine and become a working buddy for someone. Adult only home please. Love this kid!

name: Ricky
description: Ricky is a friendly, active, and obedient boy! He has a good grasp of his basic commands and is an absolute love-bug. New people are an exciting and welcome sight for this outgoing gentleman. Ricky loves to get scratches all along his silky, beautiful coat and will roll over and ask for even more pets! Think you're the one for him? Stop by and spend some time getting to know this wonderful guy!

name: Jane
description:
Two mother dogs and their collective litter of 8 pups. These girls and their litters were picked up as strays and immediately placed in a temporary foster home. It was apparent right away that the two mothers were bonded (our thoughts are that they are related, either mother/daughter or sisters). They share parenting duties and co-parent quite well, something that you don't see very often!

These guys have had a rough go of it so far, so now we will let them relax, take a breath and experience being loved, spoiled doggies forever!

name: Sarah
description:
Two mother dogs and their collective litter of 8 pups. These girls and their litters were picked up as strays and immediately placed in a temporary foster home. It was apparent right away that the two mothers were bonded (our thoughts are that they are related, either mother/daughter or sisters). They share parenting duties and co-parent quite well, something that you don't see very often!

These guys have had a rough go of it so far, so now we will let them relax, take a breath and experience being loved, spoiled doggies forever!

name: Chika
description: Class of 2019 here! I just graduated from the PUPS Program, where I was trained by a special team at the prison. I improved the lives of them; they gave me the second chance I deserve. Thanks to PUPS, I know commands, how to greet other dogs (and people), I respect the space of others, and I've got good manners. I've even got a journal tracking my accomplishments! Ask about me today!

name: Buddy
description:
Hi I'm Buddy and I'm one great boy!  I like just about everybody I meet.  I am a little fearful of men when I first meet them, so please be patient with me.  I like most other dogs and just want to play with them.  I really have no need to bark and am a pretty quiet fellow.  I'm house-trained.  They are not sure about cats.  I would do best in a household where children are 6 years or older and know about dogs.  I will need some activity to keep me happy and healthy.  An all around great guy, and somebody will be lucky to adopt me if I do say so myself!

By the way, I'm neutered, microchipped, and current on all shots -- all ready for a new home.

For more information about me, please call the Douglas County Animal Care and Services (DCACS) at 775-782-9061 or the Douglas Animal Welfare Group (DAWG) at 775-267-7325. Or come meet me at the Douglas County Animal Shelter (please call first to make sure I'm still at the shelter). Click on Douglas Animal Welfare Group below for the address and directions.

ALSO A \"MEET AND GREET\" WILL BE REQUIRED IF THERE ARE ANY OTHER DOGS IN THE HOUSEHOLD. 

ONE LAST THING! If you rent, you will be required to provide written approval from your landlord that you can have a dog. It needs to be specific, i.e. all dogs okay, no big dogs, specific breeds restricted, etc.

name: Belle
description: My name is Belle! I am so sweet and lovable with humans and I have a playful, energetic personality. I am extremely loyal too! My only catch is that I refuse to be around any other animals... none. I just want you all to myself!

name: Roxy
description: Queen of the Jungle, that's me! I'm a confident, outgoing gal who likes to spend time with my people. Since I like to be Queen, I'd do best in a home without other pets or children. I love lounging in my pool and being pampered as I choose. Aged many years to perfection, medium bodied and well-rounded, I'm ready for you! I'm a sweet one who has learned some things over the years: I enjoy long naps in the sun, yoga and walks in the park. I'm also social, chatty and fun-loving. I just love my people! I also learned, however, that I do best with adults (no kiddos please), but don't worry, because I'll be the best kid you'll ever have! Meet me today!

name: Peppercorn
description:
Peppercorn

Peppercorn has an unknown history - ditched in the desert in rural Nevada, she was left to starve and die. Some good Samaritans took her in until she was able to be transported to Boxers and Buddies. 

Peppercorn is scared - terrified and has no idea what is happening in her life. This poor girl needs someone willing to take time to help her feel secure, train her and let her know that she will never be abandoned again!

Adoption Fee: $250

1-2 year old female lab mix?

Breed: Lab Mix  
Age: 1-2 years
Size: Large
Gender: Female???

Good with:
Dogs: Yes
Kids: Yes

name: DIAMOND in NEVADA
description:
Meet YTNRâs little Princess, Diamond. Diamond was an owner surrender. She is a senior dog at 14 years young. Diamond has had a difficult life. She wasnât spayed until just recently and then needed a splenectomy due to a benign tumor. She had a dental after she recovered from her spay and spleen surgery. She is also up to date on her vaccines. With all that she needed when we received her, she is now healthy and ready to meet her forever family. She loves to be brushed and get scratched behind her ears. Diamond will need a family that is patient with her as she has cataracts and is deaf. She also wears a diaper due to incontinence. She has plenty of love to share with someone that can be home with her. No children due to her disabilities. If you would like to give her the life a princess deserves, fill out an application with Diamondâs name on it. 
Adoption Donation $200 includes micro chip. Adoption applications can be submitted at www.ytnr.com

name: Sage
description: Sage is very friendly, sweet and incredibly affectionate. She's more interested in people than toys or treats. Energy is something she has plenty of...do you like going for long walks, hikes, or on exciting adventures? Then she might be your perfect sidekick! She's quite the conversationalist and will tell you all about her life...are you a good listener? Stop by High Sierra Animal Rescue and meet this very happy girl, she'll turn your frown upside down!

name: Pumpkin
description: Hi, My name is Pumpkin. I'm a Short Coat Chihuahua mix looking for my forever home. When I was rescued, I was living with 21 of my brothers and sisters in an RV full of garbage. My paws had never touched the ground before! Despite all this, I learned to be friendly and sweet and to trust people; I also get along well with other dogs. I love discovering life outside after being shut inside for so long, and I am ready to learn everything you have to teach me. I am looking for my forever home where I can truly blossom and put my past behind me. Are you ready to make a difference in my life? Because I promise I'll make a difference in yours!

name: Peggy
description:
Peggy has a gentle personality, loving and affectionate with family members, but often reserved or shy with people.  She would do best in an adult home due to her reserved nature.  She is playful with dogs but is not much of a toy player.

Peggy is very dainty (6lbs), gentle, quiet and 3yrs old. She gets along with all size dogs, people and will do just fine in a house with cats! She is healthy and is spayed, up to date on her vaccines and ready to go !  If someone is looking for a small dog Safe Haven is taking applications 

For more information use the on-line application at www.safehavenkennel.com or learn more about her by calling 775-7463-1842 or email barkdogsinfo@gmail.com. The fee to adopt is $100 Safe Haven Rescue Kennel 28 Highway 95A North, Yerington, NV 894470

name: Munchers
description: My name is Munchers! I'm a 4 year old pit bull mix. I'm a sweet and gentle girl with lots of personality! I don't do very good with cats or other female dogs but I love humans!

name: Shandy
description: Sweet and gentle Shandy was thrown from a car and badly injured before coming to HSAR, but this has not altered her friendly and loving spirit. Despite her scary past, this sweet lady enjoys meeting new people and is full of joy and affection. She is obedient, eager to please, and knows several commands--especially if there's a treat being offered. She enjoys walks and is up for adventure, but mostly she wants to give you big hugs and make you smile. She loves to run and will often get the zoomies when she's out in the yard. If you are looking for a loyal and affectionate friend, Shandy would love to meet you! She is truly a diamond in the ruff! We are also seeking a foster home for Shandy as she recovers from surgery on 7/10.

name: Brownie
description:
Hi I'm Brownie - One handsome boy wouldn't you say?  I'm still getting used to this shelter life and am pretty scared, so you'll need to take it slow if you come meet me. I'm improving by the day though. I'm house-trained, good with some dogs, unknown about cats.  I would be best in a household where children are teens and above since I'll need humans who understand and know how to interact with me.  I'll need some activity to be happy.

By the way, I'm neutered, microchipped, and current on all shots -- all ready for a new home.

For more information about me, please call the Douglas County Animal Care and Services (DCACS) at 775-782-9061 or the Douglas Animal Welfare Group (DAWG) at 775-267-7325. Or come meet me at the Douglas County Animal Shelter (please call first to make sure I'm still at the shelter). Click on Douglas Animal Welfare Group below for the address and directions.

ALSO A \"MEET AND GREET\" WILL BE REQUIRED IF THERE ARE ANY OTHER DOGS IN THE HOUSEHOLD. 

ONE LAST THING! If you rent, you will be required to provide written approval from your landlord that you can have a dog. It needs to be specific, i.e. all dogs okay, no big dogs, specific breeds restricted, etc.

name: Hershey
description: Queen of the Jungle, that's me! I'm a confident, outgoing gal who likes to spend her time with people. Since I like to be Queen, I'd do best in a home without other pets and children. Take a walk on the wild side and take me home today!I'm also a graduate of the PUPS Program, where I was trained by a special team at the prison. I helped them; they helped me. I aim to please. I've even got a journal tracking my accomplishments! Ask about me today!

name: Thor
description:
Thor is about 6 years old, and he's a Boxer/Pittie mix. Came to Dog Town after his owner's untimely death. He's great on a leash and is a very friendly, cool dude. Good with other dogs, and likes kids. Might be okay with cats if safely introduced. He likes going for car rides, and has an awesome personality.All of our dogs are available for a $200 donation. This includes them being spayed/neutered, micro-chipped, and fully vaccinated.
To adopt a dog, we require an approved pre-application, as well as a securely fenced yard. This means an actual, physical, fence. 'Invisible' fences are not acceptable, sorry. If you live in an apartment and do not have a yard, we are not able to adopt to you.
Please contact us at: dogtownmutts@gmail.com for details.
Please note: we typically do not do 'out of the area' adoptions. This would be any location more than 60 miles away from the Reno/Carson City area.

name: Brandy
description: Brandy is a very special lady. Her foster family says she is PURE LOVE! She is currently in a foster home with 3 other dogs, 2 cats, and 2 humans. She is blossoming in this environment and so full of energy and love. She enjoys playing with dogs and takes correction from them well. She does well with cats, too. She is super affectionate and wants to follow you everywhere. Brandy likes to go for car rides and settles down quickly. Brandy is shy at first when meeting new people. She has struggled with fear of strangers for a long time and needs consistency and patience from her forever family. Once she gets to know you she will cuddle up and be your best friend! Brandy would do best in a home with other playful dogs and no small children. She may excel at agility training and is very treat oriented. Brandy is waiting patiently for her forever family, could it be you? Give us a call to meet this special girl.

name: Roxie
description: Roxie is the name and playing ball and tug-o-war are her games! Friendly, silly and sweet, she's counting on her new forever family to provide guidance and kindness with lots of love and patience mixed in for good measure. She's been good with other dogs so far. She's intelligent and responds well to commands, especially when treats are involved. Drop by High Sierra Animal Rescue and get to know her; she might be what's been missing from your life!

name: Katie
description:
Looking for a buddy to binge your favorite shows with? Katieâs got your back (or more likely, your lap)! 

Do you know what you get when you adopt a senior dog? You get a family member that knows the rules already and appreciates life and the love you give them. All theyâre really looking for is a soft place to sleep and a gentle hand, their exercise needs are minimal but the love they still have left to give is at its maximum during senior years.

Our sweet little Katie loves people, sheâs ready with the kisses and is quite affectionate. She lived with one family her whole life until circumstances changed and she found herself homeless. She settled into the Pawsibilities routine quickly and bounced right back, eager to love and be loved. 

Katie (Lady Katherine of the Valley)
Chihuahua Mix, Spayed Female about 7 years young
Katie would prefer a home with other small dogs or being an only dog (she knows sheâs a princess and wouldnât mind being your only dog to spoil). She seems to really like cats!

She appreciates when people take their time and are gentle with initial meetings, after that though, youâll have yourself a velcro dog! She walks fantastic on a leash and literally just wants to be your shadow.

name: Xuxa
description:
Xuxa is a six month old, Husky mix pup and will probably be medium-large when fully grown. Momma is a medium-small cattle dog mix. She is very friendly and smart, good with dogs and kids, should be okay if raised with cats. All of our dogs are available for a $200 donation. This includes them being spayed/neutered, micro-chipped, and fully vaccinated.
To adopt a dog, we require an approved pre-application, as well as a securely fenced yard. This means an actual, physical, fence. 'Invisible' fences are not acceptable, sorry. If you live in an apartment and do not have a yard, we are not able to adopt to you.
Please contact us at: dogtownmutts@gmail.com for details.
Please note: we typically do not do 'out of the area' adoptions. This would be any location more than 60 miles away from the Reno/Carson City area.

name: Kylo
description:
Kylo

Kylo was brought to us as a result of a hoarding case. He hasn't had many experiences and will be required to take classes with our professional dog trainers to work on his confidence and help him become the dog he is meant to be. 

Kylo is a loving and happy dog. He likes to play and is working on housebreaking. He IS A 100 POUND PUPPY - so he has puppy behaviors like chewing and needs a family willing to help him learn. 

Kylo has a severe leg injury and we will be providing more information soon.

Due to his age and breed, he will be placed with a neuter contract and future appointment scheduled for when he is a year old. At that time, you're able to include stomach tacking at a discounted rate if you would like that piece of mind. We will be requiring a $300 deposit that will be refunded once he is neutered.

Adoption Fee: $250 (plus refundable neuter deposit)

10 month old male Great Dane

name: Toffee
description:
Toffee

Toffee is a very calm, sweet and gentle Boxer Mix. She is nervous and adjusting to her new foster home. She isn't excited to see or play with other dogs, but she isn't aggressive to them
. 
She will need love, patience and confident building to help her understand that she will never again be abandoned and alone. 

Adoption Fee: $250

5 yr old female Boxer Mix

We do not adopt out dogs as gifts

name: Maisey
description: Maisey is my name! I'm the quiet type that needs some time to warm up to you. But once I do, here comes the love! I don't do very good with other female dogs but I definitely can hang with the boys! Let's be best friends!

name: Maya
description: My name is Maya! I am a 6 year old German Shepherd mix and I am so happy! I'm a very smart girl and can't wait for you to teach me things. Although I'm a social butterfly with kids and other people, I don't do so well with other female dogs or cats. I'm extremely sweet. Take me home!

name: Rowdy
description: My name is Rowdy, but don't let the name deceive you! I'm more of the shy and gentle type. I'm 5 years old and need a forever home. I'm quiet and easy going, but I definitely need a person that wants me around all the time, as I don't like to be left alone much. Come and get me!

name: Todd
description: My name is Todd!! I am a sweet young boy that needs a good home! Although I was scared at first and had to be convinced to be rescued, I am ready to find my forever person. I do great with female dogs, but not so much with other males. Please take me home!

name: Canton
description: If a companion is what you're looking for, then I'm the best pet for you! I'll commit with no questions asked, because all I want is someone to lay next to or nap with, someone to rub my belly, and someone to love. Simple needs, right? If you think so, take me home today!

name: Marlin
description: Marlin is a smart, silly, sweet guy! He gets along well with other rescue dogs and is happy to show off all of the commands he knows (sit, shake, drop it). Marlin is very respectful while playing and is overall a mellow, easygoing, and loving friend to everyone he meets. He's ready to find his forever home is looking forward to seeing you!

name: Willow
description: Willow is a sweet, thoughtful girl who, once she gets to know you, will smooch your face and give you tons of love. She's super smart and knows a lot already, which she'll happily show you once she gets comfortable. She is looking for a caring, compassionate home that will help build her confidence. Have you got what it takes to be part of her forever family? Come find out at High Sierra Animal Rescue!

name: Ryder
description: Hey there everybody! My name is Ryder and I'm very friendly and loving as soon as I meet new people! I'm extremely gentle with toys and treats and respond very quickly to commands like \"sit\

name: Piper
description:
Four year old female Heeler mix, super sweet and smart. Not a fan of young kids, she has a sparkling personality and does best with male dogs.Piper does have Addison's disease, so she needs monthly injections and daily medication. Very lively and playful, she's going to be a great companion for someone.Email us for more details (dogtownmutts@gmail.com) - we can provide the names of medications and dosage for you to ask your vet about the price of.All of our dogs are available for a $200 donation. This includes them being spayed/neutered, micro-chipped, and fully vaccinated.
To adopt a dog, we require an approved pre-application, as well as a securely fenced yard. This means an actual, physical, fence. 'Invisible' fences are not acceptable, sorry. If you live in an apartment and do not have a yard, we are not able to adopt to you.
Please contact us at: dogtownmutts@gmail.com for details.
Please note: we typically do not do 'out of the area' adoptions. This would be any location more than 60 miles away from the Reno/Carson City area.

name: Bashful
description: Bashful, like his name, can be a bit shy, but he will warm up with patience. He can be pugnacious, so we are working on learning more about him. An experienced dog owner can reach the love bug we know is inside!

name: Baxter
description: Baxter is a sociable, attentive companion who gets along with other dogs. He needs an active household to take him out and enjoy the world! Baxter is currently learning the basic commands and would love to meet the right family for his next adventure!

name: Tessa
description: Tessa was picked up as a stray and rescued 4/9/2019. She is a real sweetheart, good with other dogs and attentive to her people. She is currently learning basic commands. She is waiting for the right one who is ready to cuddle on the couch or go for a run! Or maybe go for a run, then hang out on the couch? You pick!

name: MAX in NEVADA
description:
Meet Max. He is a Cairn Terrier who is just shy of two years old, and is 20 pounds of Dine-o-Mite. He was an owner surrender, Max is just a love bug. He wants to be everywhere his person goes.  He will share a bed with you but also likes the floor.  He loves riding in the car or laying curled up next to you on the couch. Max will need a large fenced yard to run around. He loves to be outside. He knows how to use a doggy door and enjoys the freedom to go in and out. He loves to play fetch and tug-o-war.  He will come with his toys! He is learning commands like âstay, sit, no,â âgo get your ball,â and âget a toy.â Max is good with both larger dogs and tiny dogs, he just wants to play. He is also fine with cats. Max will need an active family to keep up with his youthful ways. He has been around older children and does fine. He is UTD on vaccines, neutered and micro chipped. So, if you are looking for a lively and fun-loving addition to your family, Max is the one for you. Please fill out an adoption application and name Max as your new best friend.
Adoption Donation $500 includes micro chip.  Adoption applications can be submitted at www.ytnr.com

name: Koko
description:
Koko

Buddy and Koko were turned into Boxers and Buddies because their daddy was in failing health, in hospice care and was rapidly declining. His last wish was that Buddy and Koko DO NOT go to the shelter. They were brought to our very best Chihuahua foster home. Their daddy died less than 2 weeks later.

They were terrified and have lost everything: their dad, their home, their security. We would like Buddy and Koko to stay together. They don't deserve to lose each other too.

name: Jordon (1yr old)
description:
Meet Jordon (1yrs old McNab mix) *N. NEVADA*
Jordon is more of a women's dog who loves being with you.  He is SWEET loving and happy energetic boy who is bouncy/mouthy and dog friendly and needs a happy bouncy dog companion. He would make a great partner for anyone who has a fenced property and would enjoy his company at home or out and about.  He loves his off leash runs and water play.

Jordon will need a home that can help to be a wonderful adult dog and not be worried about men.  He is not experienced with the outside world and needs a gentle family he can look up to and help him learn about the world.  Jordon is concerned about men and fast moving children so he would need a mellow understanding home with older children.

For more information on Jordon, or to request an adoption application, call 775-463-1842 or email barkdogsinfo@gmail.com www.safehavenkennel.com Jordon is neutered, micro chipped and up to date on his shots. The fee to adopt is $100.

name: Ginger
description:
Personality: Active/Athletic, People Oriented & Goofy
Age: 6 Years Old 
Weight: 64 lbs 

Ginger is one smart, pretty and naturally energetic dog with a lot of ability. Ginger is refining her âsitâ and âstayâ, and is eager to learn more. With a little patience and training she will be an excellent addition to any active home. She is ready to meet her forever friend and spend the summer exploring the trails around Lake Tahoe. Ginger must go to a home without small animals. Ginger is microchipped, spayed and current on vaccinations. 

Her adoption fee has been sponsored by a generous supporter of HSTT!

name: Perry
description: Some call me pampered, but I just know what I likes. A lap to sit on? Most definitely. Endless pats? Without a doubt. A steady flow of treats and attention? Why sure, if you are offering! Joking aside, I really am looking for a person who I can spend my time with and shower with affection. Maybe it's you?

name: Sadie
description:
Hi I'm Sadie - Wouldn't you agree that I'm gorgeous?!  I'm a very sweet happy-go-lucky girl who likes to give doggie kisses to everybody I meet!  I'm ready to go, go, go with my little butt wiggling the whole way!  You give me a lap, and I'm happy to snuggle though.  I am house trained. ** I can get pretty jealous of sharing my adults with the wee ones, so please NO CHILDREN for me. Also - Sorry NO CATS for me!  They were put on this earth to chase, right?!  I get along with some dogs.  I'll need an active household to keep me happy since I have so much energy to burn.
**PLEASE NOTE: Sadie MAY be able to JUMP A 6-FOOT FENCE but we have seen no evidence she is inclined to do this.
By the way, I'm spayed, microchipped, and current on all shots -- all ready for a new home.

For more information about me, please call the Douglas County Animal Care and Services (DCACS) at 775-782-9061 or the Douglas Animal Welfare Group (DAWG) at 775-267-7325. Or come meet me at the Douglas County Animal Shelter (please call first to make sure I'm still at the shelter). Click on Douglas Animal Welfare Group below for the address and directions.

ALSO A \"MEET AND GREET\" WILL BE REQUIRED IF THERE ARE ANY OTHER DOGS IN THE HOUSEHOLD. 

ONE LAST THING! If you rent, you will be required to provide written approval from your landlord that you can have a dog. It needs to be specific, i.e. all dogs okay, no big dogs, specific breeds restricted, etc.

name: Layla
description:
Layla

8 year old female Boxer

Layla was returned to us after YEARS of adoption because her adopters husband \"doesn't like the dog\". 

Layla is a WONDERFUL dog. She is calm, playful, sweet, housebroken, crate trained and AMAZING! 

Whoever is lucky enough to adopt this little girl will be blessed!

Rocky is about 13 years old, but he is still very active and healthy. He's got great manners and is always ready for an adventure.
Rocky is protective of his humans, but is fine to take out in public. He's good with other dogs, and loves having his butt scratched. Goldie will still need a patient human, who will let her adjust on her own schedule to a new place. She is good with other dogs, but we don't recommend her for a home with cats or young kids.

description:

description:

She is very playful and affectionate, and walks great on a leash. She needs to be in a quiet home with no other animals and no children.

She LOVES to play ball, and will fetch sticks for as long as you are willing to throw them. All of our dogs are available for a $200 donation. This includes them being spayed/neutered, micro-chipped, and fully vaccinated.

description:

Both he and his person had been abused by a man, so Jaxon has developed a distrust of men. He is going to need a responsible owner who will not put him into a situation where someone will get bitten.
He is amazing with women and kids, and would probably do best as an only dog. Jaxson was raised around cats. Other dogs are ok. He is about 3-4 years old. .  Wants to be a house dog.

description:
Cricket

1-2 year old female border collie

Adoption Fee: $250

Cricket is a feral dog that will need months of love, care and dedication. Cricket was left on an abandoned property with 56 other dogs. Not surprising, she ended up pregnant. REALLY pregnant.

?Cricket was put into a foster home where she could settle in and give birth. Cricket's pups have been adopted and Cricket is now learning how to be a family member. Her road will be long and she would love a family to help her learn how to trust.

?Gecko is going to need some time and patience and love before he is ready for his new home. If you think you have the time and patience to help Gecko, he would love to be part of a family and have a home for the first time in his life!

name: Sevard
description:
Sevard is an absolutely wonderful young man full of energy, kindness, love and playfulness. When you look into his beautiful light brown eyes you can see right into his sweet soul. Sevard has been receiving training with her fosters and is doing a GREAT job! When Sevard is not inside snuggling and cuddling with his fosters he can be found enjoying his walks and getting in some playtime with the neighborhood dogs. Sevard would be best fit with a calm family that would get him out on multiple daily walks. If you think Sevard might be the right fit for your family please contact us or come in to learn more about him.  

**Sevard is currently in foster. If you are interested in meeting him please schedule a day and time to come in to meet him**

name: PINKY
description: Pinky is a very sweet girl who seems to get along with other dogs and loves people. She is active and playful and loves her walks. She is between 1-2 years old.

name: Sparky
description: Sparky - Sparky is a 7-8 year old Jack Russell Terrier/Dachsund mix neutered male. He came to Cold Nose Rescue & Sanctuary from a very bad situation, but he is a fun little boy. Very energetic and independent. He will make you smile!

name: Smokey
description: Smokey is a 2 year old spayed German Shepherd female who loves people. She gets long well with most other dogs and loves to play. She knows basic commands and is good on and off leash. She may be a little shy at first but will warm up to a happy home.

name: Shadow
description: Shadow is a 2 year old spayed German Shepherd female. She was rescued from a hoarder, so she is very shy. She gets along with other dogs. An adopter with patience could bring out the loving girl we know is in her.

name: Max
description: Max is a 2 year old neutered male German Shepherd. He is very shy, so please be patient for him to come out of his shell. He is definitely worth the wait! He would do well with other non-dominant dogs.

name: Lucy
description: Lucy is looking for her very own family! She's a sweetheart to humans, but she is VERY dog aggressive, so she must be your one and only pet.

name: Dusty
description: Dusty is a beautiful 5-year old neutered male. He has pannus, a genetic condition that has left him blind. He is great on the leash and would make a wonderful companion to someone with German Shepherd experience. Due to his condition, he must be an only dog.

name: Lydia
description:
Lydia arrived a few years back from a closed down breed (Xoloitzcuintli) hoarding situation.

She is a very aloof girl and very particular about her people. She has a gentle personality, loving and affectionate but overly reserved or shy with strangers and will run and hide.  However if she trusts you, she will jump on the couch for loving, and loves being a lazy house dog.  She does not like neighbor walks, children, and loud noises. Her perfect home would be a person who does not mind a shy but well mannered, housebroken quirky girl.

Lydia is about 6yrs old and about 15lbs and gets along with all dogs but is not a dog playing dog and will do just fine in a house with cats. She is healthy and received a dental. She is spayed, up to date on her vaccines and ready to go with someone who does not mind a dog that hides. 

BUT... WHAT IS LYDIA.. REALLY LIKE?  Safe Haven Lydia. A mellow no bother dog. Scared of strangers except for dogs. Really scared of kids and blonds. Sleeps most of the day and gets her wiggle on around 8pm. Enjoys her evening 'barking at nothing' time. And afterwards jumps on my lap on the couch with poop breath. She sleeps soundly and snores right next to me in bed. She is fully housebroken but will pee inside the house a few times a year just because she can. Loves getting attention when she wants it. Jumps into the car and extremely nervous when it moves. Absolutely LOVES her off leash desert runs and asks to go out for a run anytime of day. Loves treats but refuses to sit or learn anything to 'work for it'. She is a bone hoarder and they can be found in her hiding spots. You will also find little bits of poop there too.

Lydia is available for a new home but does a drama queen nervous display when she is reviewed by people interested in her. She has made the decision she doesn't want to leave Safe Haven but she deserves a home of her own.

Anyone interested in her? It will take a year or two before she stops hiding from you, but once she loves you she loves you. (as long as you are not blond 'cause she will just bark at you) Sigh....

For more information use the on-line application at www.safehavenkennel.com or learn more about her by calling 775-463-1842 or email barkdogsinfo@gmail.com. The fee to adopt is $100 Safe Haven Rescue Kennel 28 Highway 95A North, Yerington, NV 894470

name: FIFTY
description:
FIFTY IS VERY SWEET AND KIND. HE IS DEAF AND MISSING ONE EYE (BIRTH DEFECT) AND ONLY SEES SHADOWS IN THE OTHER. HE HAS A GREAT NOSE AND GETS AROUND VERY WELL. HE CAN BE PICKY ABOUT OTHER ANIMALS SO PROBABLY BEST IF IS THE ONLY PET.

HE WILL NEED A SAFE ENVIRONMENT TO GET AROUND IN BUT OTHER THAN THAT JUST SOME LOVE!!

name: Bell - A
description:
Bell-A (we already have too many Bellas) is our very nice Cattle dog mix who is finally ready for a home.
When she arrived, she was very ill and our vet diagnosed her with Addison's disease. It is now very well-controlled with medication and she is able to live a normal, active life.
Bell-A is only going to be available to a home where she will not have contact with children under 16. We are serious about this, so that means no visiting grandkids, no neighbor kids poking fingers through the fence - no kids, period.
She is an amazingly affectionate, smart, athletic girl. In an adult home, she will be the light of your life. We all love her and are going to make sure she goes to a home that is capable of keeping her safe and healthy. Her monthly injections at the vet run about 125.00 and she will need these every month for the rest of her life.
All of our dogs are available for a $200 donation. This includes them being spayed/neutered, micro-chipped, and fully vaccinated.
To adopt a dog, we require an approved pre-application, as well as a securely fenced yard. This means an actual, physical, fence. 'Invisible' fences are not acceptable, sorry. If you live in an apartment and do not have a yard, we are not able to adopt to you.
Please contact us at: dogtownmutts@gmail.com for details.
Please note: we typically do not do 'out of the area' adoptions. This would be any location more than 60 miles away from the Reno/Carson City area.

name: LOUISE
description:
Louise loves attention and  is a wonderful girl, easy going, but needs obedience lessons for walking on a lead etc. . . Our rescue fee includes: A free bag of dog food/ all vet work done/ 1 nights FREE Obedience training with a professional trainer in the Reno/ Sparks/ Tahoe area. Saint Bernard Rescue info packet. name: EVA
description: Eva: Is a great dog, gets along with other dogs, has had all her shots and is heart worm free. She is Not for the small or light weight person, she can Pull on a lead, and is super strong. She has basic obedience training she know's sit, come. But CAN PULL!!  Not for an elderly or small person.~!!  Her adoption fee is $ 400.00 and comes with all vet paper work, saint info packet and a Free bag of dog food. and a Free one nights professional obedience class in the Reno/ Sparks/ Tahoe/ Carson City area. name: ZIGGY
description: ZIGGY IS VERY SWEET AND LOVES HER WALKS. SHE CAN BE A LITTLE SHY TOWARDS SOME PEOPLE BUT USUALLY WARMS UP AFTER A TREAT OR TWO. SHE IS GOOD WITH MOST OTHER DOGS.

name: Spot
description:
Spot may be a mature girl, but she is still a very active dog who has a lot of energy.
Spot loves humans of all ages, and walks great on a leash. She is a bit hard of hearing, so a new owner will need to learn how to work around that. Having another dog as a guide would be a great thing.
Spot is housebroken, walks great on a leash and likes going for car rides. She is very loyal and affectionate, and good with kids.All of our dogs are available for a $200 donation. This includes them being spayed/neutered, micro-chipped, and fully vaccinated.

name: Mac
description: Meet Mac! Eager, loving, energetic, playful, and loyal. This goofball has come so far since he first arrived at CRCS! He joined us as an inexperienced 2 year old, confused about the world around him. Mac is learning about all what the world has to offer. He's meeting new friends, practicing his basic commands, learning loose leash walking, playing with toys, exploring and more. He has loosened up and is now ready to transition to his forever home. He takes some time to build trust with people, but once he does, he wraps his four paws around you like he'll forever be yours! He is extremely affectionate with those he knows and loves to play with younger dogs and dog friendly dogs. He is on a special training program here at the center and with calm leadership, he absolutely thrives and learns and loves! We invite you down to meet his trainers and learn how we've exposed him to life! His new adopter will need to carry it forward on so that Mac can continue to gain exposure and positive experiences! He is trying really hard not to chase the lizards and small critters, but we do believe there is some terrier in there telling him to \"catch\" \"catch\" \"catch\"! Sorry kitties, that will not go away! A kitty free home is the only home for Mac. Mac's ideal environment will have lots of space to run and play as well as a human that will help slowly expose him to new things. This is a beautiful boy with an eagerness to please his people! Though he has lived with children, the social, busy lifestyle that comes with having children would not be his ideal. We seriously love this kid! Come learn about Mac!

name: Willow
description: Meet Willow! Intelligent, lover of dogs, independent, agile, athletic, and an excellent canine communicator. This pretty lady is our \"go to\" for behavior work and training here at CRCS. She has helped more dogs in our facility (CRCS residents and dogs that come to us for training) than we can begin to describe. It is her job here and she loves it. Her past is that of survival and disconnectedness. After many months in our program, Willow has asked us to help her find something very specific in her forever home and we are working hard to find it! She connects to dogs first and foremost. Her ideal home will have multiple dogs in the home because she needs a \"pack\". It is the key to her success as it will keep her fulfilled, grounded and at home. And we do mean that literally. She plays an important role in the pack and she takes her job seriously. She is the peacemaker, the calm, the leader, the teacher. She keeps it light, respectful, direct and loving. Willow is truly unique and special. Sorry, Willow is not a family dog or a dog for a room-mate setting. It will take time for her next \"family\" to build a relationship with her while she stays at CRCS, then it will take time to transition her home. In order for her to succeed, she will need a bond with all humans and canines in the home before actually going home. Willow is a wise and beautiful soul. Services provided for Willow for life. Age 5 years. 42 lbs.

name: ZOEY
description:
Hi My name is Zoey; I am a reformed fence jumper and digger. My Rescue mom has convinced me that it's not lady like to do that. I am 4-5 yrs old. I would prefer a home with a doggy door as I like to go inside the house whenever I want.  I like male large dogs only. No cats and No foo-Foo Dogs. ( little ones) I have very good manners I sit for my food, will walk nicely on a leash when I am not excited about something. 

The adoption fee includes all shots, heart worm test, neutering, a Home Again microchip and one night free obedience class in the Reno, Sparks, Carson City and Tahoe areas. We also include an information packet and a large bag of dog food. Our adoption fee is $400.00 and we are located in Reno, NV.. name: DAISY
description: Daisy: She is @-4 yrs old. Long Hair  .  Her bad habit is fence fighting with other dogs.  Loves people  But

name: Dusty
description: Meet Dusty! He's cute as a button with a personality to match! Dusty walks beautifully on a leash, rides great in the car and does wonderful out and about walking through the neighborhood or hitting the trails. Dusty is currently in training and our team would love to share more details about what he's working on and his needs moving forward. He is looking for an adult only home that is quiet, patient and loving. This adorable guy is silly, happy and curious and very affectionate. We love him! Dusty loves meeting new dogs while he's out exploring, however we are looking to place him as an only dog. Cats unknown - but we suspect OK. Age 9 yrs. 9lbs.

name: Itsy (Senior Sponsor Needed)
description:
Safe Haven, Itsy. One of our long term sanctuary dogs. She is deaf and one of the âGabbs dogsâ, Itsy is about 15yrs old even with her extreme shoulder arthritis she still gets around. She is looking for a sponsor to support her daily medication and supplements for her arthritis.  She is leash trained and more of an independent dog and as Gabbs dog go, shy with people.  

For more information on Itsy, or to request more information on her contact us anytime 775-463-1842 email barkdogsinfo@gmail.com  Itsy is spayed, micro chipped and up to date on her shots.

name: Goofy (Adoption Fee is Sponsored)
description:
**Adoption Fee is Sponsored** Goofy is a SWEET 9yr old, people loving, happy bouncy (and strong) boy. He enjoys his people and loves his off leash runs. Goofy is very eager to please and energetic and regular exercise is needed. He has come a long way and really could use a home environment to help him take his next steps. He is off-leash trained, loves swimming in a river, enjoys walks with a loose leash and enjoys playing retrieve with you. He would make a great companion for anyone who has a fenced property and would enjoy his company.  **Goofy is not dog friendly and would need to be the only dog/pet in the home**
For more information on Goofy, or to request an adoption application, call 775-463-1842 or email barkdogsinfo@gmail.com  Goofy is neutered, micro chipped and up to date on his shots.  www.safehavenkennel.com

name: Beckett
description: Meet Beckett! Smart, affectionate, athletic and loyal. Oh and he's pretty good looking too! To put it simple, Beckett operates on a mutual respect system with his people. He is your biggest fan when you are his. Speak his language and you'll have a loyal partner to the end. He is at his happiest when he's out exploring, stimulated and exercised right alongside his person. He loves to think and he loves to do! Beckett's ideal home is calm yet active. Beckett's ideal person is confident, intuitive and quiet. He has so much love to give and he's looking for a spacious place to settle down and get back into life. Beckett prefers young female dogs however we'd like to place him as an only dog. Adult only home. Sorry, no kitties please. Age 8. 77 lbs. CHECK OUT BECKETT'S VIDEO!

name: Nubia (Foster Home Needed)
description:
* FOSTER HOME NEEDED - NO OTHER DOG IS A MUST * Nubia came from a free roaming hoarding situation near Mina, Nevada 2013. She is around 8 years old. Nubia is very shy around people but is learning to trust. Nubia had little early socialization and not a dog you can take out and about but more of a home body girl. She just needs someone who will just be soft and kind with her, patient owner is needed to help her learn to trust humans. Nubia walks well on leash and loves to run off lead with her current mentor, Phoenix.  Nubia needs time and patience in a home environment as she has never had a home.

** PROJECT DOG** 
For more information on Nubia, or to request an adoption application, call 775-463-1842 or email barkdogsinfo@gmail.com. Nubia is spayed, micro-chipped and current on her vaccinations.

name: Paisley
description: We love this little gal! Paisley looks like a red fox with a white tip on her long tail. This girl was frozen in fear like a complete statue at the shelter, but has zero aggression when scared. When we got her to the  California Correctional Center Fire House, she started coming out of her shell right away. She loves other dogs, the cat, and people. The shelter staff estimated her age to be 1 year old, but we feel she may be younger. Sheâs a happy, playful, curious, and spunky gal, who bonded with her handler quickly but wants to make a friend with everyone she meets. She does well off and on leash and doesnât stray far from her handler. She learned âsitâ over the weekend and is working on learning her commands. Sheâs a perfect size, not too small to get under your feet but not big enough to knock you down ( about 28 pounds ). If somebody had a hound she would make a perfect fox so they could have a fox and a hound!  Paisley must go to her FOREVER home! To get more information on a Pups On Parole dog, please contact a representative of the Lassen Humane Society at 530 251-7247 or e-mail ilovepopdogs@yahoo.com.  The Pups On Parole Program started in June of 2007 to help give homeless dogs a second chance at finding an adoptive family.  All dogs in the program spent time in our local county shelter, surrendered by their owners or picked up as strays and waiting for their owners to redeem them or to be adopted by new families.   The selected dogs are brought current on vaccinations, spayed/neutered if necessary, micro chipped, and heart worm tested.  They then are taken to the California Correctional Center Firehouse where they are assigned to a trainer/ inmate fire fighter.  These trainers groom and work with each dog and give them the extra time and attention they need to become wonderful family companions.   Most graduates are house trained and know basic obedience commands.  As of December 2018, 535 dogs have been adopted through this program.  To meet any of the Pups On Parole dogs, arrangements must be made in advance.

name: Hershey
description: Here is the handsome âHersheyâ !!!!  He is about two years old and is an unknown breed mixed with Red Doberman Pinscher.  Hershey is a goofy, loveable , playful little guy (if 56 pounds qualifies as \"little\").  Talk about a sweet and friendly guy!  Hershey is a super fun, playful fellow who loves all people AND other animals (heâs the first male our Gus has gotten along with since Buck was adopted). It took Hershey no time to settle in and learn the routine. We don't consider Hershey to be \"high energy\"  when we are watching him relaxing in his outdoor kennel-- but upon his release when he knows it's play tie, he can come up with that playful puppy energy! Due to some previous trauma in Hershey's life, he will need to go to a home where he is not expected to be an \"adventure buddy,\" but rather, he must go to a home where the family is looking for a house dog to love and cuddle.  There's not a mean bone in Hershey's body.  Even during the extensive vet-check, Hershey showed no signs of aggression (even when the vet induced pain).  He is a lover boy, and must go to an equally loving home! name: LULU
description: Lulu is the 2 year sister of Abbey (who is also listed on this Petfinder site for Lassen Humane Society Pups on Parole dogs).  (Abbey and Lulu get along great, and you can adopt them BOTH if you're looking for double trouble and twice the love and devotion.) Lulu, like her sister, is a 2 year old rat terrier and Dachshund mix. She's a little smaller than Abbey, weighing in at 11 pounds (vs. Abbey's 13), but she is as full of love as her sister. She is still getting use to the routine at the California Correctional Center Fire House, and she is gradually coming out her shell. She MUST go to her FOREVER home, hopefully with her sister (but it's not a requirement).  To get more information on a Pups On Parole dog, please contact a representative of the Lassen Humane Society at 530 251-7247 or e-mail ilovepopdogs@yahoo.com. name: Abbey
description: Sweet little Abbey is a 2 year old rat terrier and Dachshund mix who weighs about 13 pounds!  We love this little girl!  Abbey is new to our program and  is still getting use to the routine here, but she is gradually coming out her shell. She enjoys being held (not nippy at all;  we cut her nails on Day 1 and she was fine). Abbey is the 2 year sister of Lulu (who is also listed on this Petfinder site for Lassen Humane Society Pups on Parole dogs).  (Abbey and Lulu get along great, and you can adopt them BOTH if you're looking for double trouble and twice the love and devotion.)  Abbey is curious little thing!  She snoops around, exploring her new world and alerts at all the new sounds of a Fire House. So far she does well with her crate and kennel. She will get introduced to the cat tonight :-) but is still warming up to the bigger dogs. Poor little Abbey is shell-shocked from her last week of scary changes in her life. She needs to find her FOREVER home!  Only one more move (to the home of her permanent humans) is in her future! name: Jersey
description: Sweet, happy Jersey is a 3 year old âEnglish Pointer mixâ who weighs in at around 50lb and doesn't know a stranger. .Jersey is aptly named, as she resembles a cow in her coloring.  We love her! And all she wants is just to BE loved.  She does well with all the other dogs but still is learning how to tone it down for the smaller dogs. She's a happy girl who thrives on pets and desires only to hang out with the many people who are always telling her she's pretty.  Jersey MUST go to her FOREVER home.  She's a lover, and needs a family or person who will be as devoted to her as she will most certainly be to her human.  Jersey is new to our program and this site will be updated when we learn more about her personality.  ***To get more information on a Pups On Parole dog, please contact a representative of the Lassen Humane Society at 530 251-7247 or e-mail ilovepopdogs@yahoo.com. name: Sunny
description: Meet our 1 year old Sunny!  Sunny is a wonderful 52 lb German Shepherd Dog mix who doesn't know a stranger! He already knew how to sit when he got here. Heâs good with our resident cat and all of the female dogs, and easily bonds to people. He doesnât mark inside at all. His handler said he would consider Sunny to be a gentle, low energy dog EXCEPT when opportunities for play come up; then his puppy playfulness comes out!  He does well in his crate and kennel and  is still finding his grounding, is still a little apprehensive of large groups of people, but we are confident that once he settles in and gets to know everybody that will disappear. He's good off leash and sticks with his handler. Sunny is still learning how to walk on leash politely but we certainly will get there.  Sunny is a true ray of sunshine and must go to his FOREVER home, with people who are as committed to Sunny as he will be to THEM. name: Bella
description:
Beautiful Bella is a Labrador Retriever mix of about 8 months old and 56 pounds.  Bella is a little shy and timid but curious.  She completely protested doing anything on the day we brought her into Pups on Parole, but today she is much more comfortable. So far she seems to be a very intelligent dog who thinks over anything before doing it. She hasnât had free roam but all of her interactions with our other dogs have been positive so far. We believe that once she gets into the routine she will have a lot of German Shepherd dog tendencies. Will update soon.  Bella must go to her loving FOREVER home, so call the number below if you are serious about this lovely dog.

name: Gus
description:
Gus is a 1.5 - 2.5 year old Labrador Retriever mix who is super friendly.  That's a good thing, because Gus weighs 74 pounds!  He loves people and other dogs, and even seems to get along well with most other male dogs.   He is learning his commands well (he is super smart) and already walks well on a leash.  Gus is a happy, excited, and rambunctious dog who needs room to run off some of that energy, as well as a family or person who will provide him with his FOREVER home. Gus is sure to give somebody a lifetime of love and loyalty.  If you think you can return to Gus the affection and love he surely will give, please use the information below to find out more about this beauty of a dog.

name: Modric
description:
Adoption fee on this dog is $300.

		Modric is a stunning, dark sable, adult male who is on the smaller side weighing about 60 lbs. He was surrendered when his owner could no longer care for him. We believe he sired both Luis and Clark, two other boys that made their way to us.  It is our understanding that Modric was an outside only dog, but he has quickly discovered there is no better place than inside with his people. He loves to settle in on a nice soft bed, preferably near his human, when hanging out inside. He prefers to be wherever the people are inside, but watch out for your shoes; after spending most of his life outside he hasn't quite learned that shoes aren't for chewing. 
 
		Modric is housebroken with the use of a doggie door. He easily settles into a crate and is happy to sleep quietly for the night in a crate next to his foster mom's bed.  This boy is quickly learning basic commands such as sit, down, bed, and wait at meal time. When Modric is excited, especially when coming out of a crate or kennel, he can get a little jumpy. If you are patient and don't let him call the shots, he will remember his manners and will eventually settle and finally sit on command in order to get in/out. He walks well on a leash and does not have a tendency to pull or be dragged. He is fairly submissive, so a light correction will often help him follow any request or command as he is eager to please.
 
		Modric loves to meet other dogs and gets excited any time he has a chance to meet new friends. He is a very thorough sniffer on first encounter but quickly settles in after meeting them and exploring their scent. He met the other GSD's in his foster home easily and fits in well with his foster pack.  He is now starting to engage & play with the young, playful pack-mate and watching him play makes him appear much younger than his estimated 5 years!  He appears to be just as happy to be near and meet small dogs, but has not spent any real time with smaller dogs yet.. He is VERY interested in watching the outdoor cats from his fenced front yard, and he tends to lose all desire to follow commands or come when called when he focuses on them.   It is uncertain if he can be taught to live with cats or furry critters.

This dog is a Level 2. Please be sure you understand what a dog of this Level requires. Go to our home page for an explanation of the Dog Rating Levels.

For more information and to see when this dog will be attending an Adoption Day, please see our Dogs page on our main website at www.gcgsr.org. 

We operate within a reasonable driving distance from the Greater Sacramento area, the 	Central Valley down to Merced, and Lake Tahoe. A reasonable driving distance is determined by where one of our volunteers is willing to drive within our areas of service. That means we don't adopt out of our area, to Southern California, or Out of State. 


Thank you for visiting!

name: Dean
description:
Adoption fee on this dog is $300.

		Dean is a handsome black and tan boy at around 18-24 months old. He came to us from a local shelter so we don't know much about his background. This stunning boy is young and active and loves to get attention from dogs and people alike. He really believes he is just a giant lap dog and would love nothing more than to snuggle up and get attention from any willing person. He will try and climb/put his feet up to get closer to his person but quickly gets back down when corrected. 

		Dean currently lives with another female shepherd and loves to follow along. Often times when she heads outside to chase the squirrels or just watch the world outside he has trouble deciding whether to stay with foster mom or follow her outside. He can be a bit insistent and pesty when he wants attention, but takes correction well from both humans and other dogs. He does not have a loud bark, but he uses it well and often when excited and ready to engage others in play. 

		Dean is housebroken with the use of a doggie door and has no problem letting you know if he needs to go out. He is learning his basic commands and is learning not to pull on the leash when going out for a walk.  Dean does not like to go into a crate, but once he is in, he quickly settles in and sleeps through the night with no issues. He has not been around small dogs or cats so it is unknown how he would do. 

		With continued training and socialization, this young boy will make a nice addition to a family that is willing to make him a part of their lives.

This dog is a Level 2. Please be sure you understand what a dog of this Level requires. Go to our home page for an explanation of the Dog Rating Levels.

For more information and to see when this dog will be attending an Adoption Day, please see our Dogs page on our main website at www.gcgsr.org. 

We operate within a reasonable driving distance from the Greater Sacramento area, the 	Central Valley down to Merced, and Lake Tahoe. A reasonable driving distance is determined by where one of our volunteers is willing to drive within our areas of service. That means we don't adopt out of our area, to Southern California, or Out of State. 


Thank you for visiting!

Sampson is a 3 year old, tan and black, 63# German Shepherd dog.

Sampson is selective with dogs so proper introductions will be important.  If another dog is in the home, we recommend a calm, submissive dog.  Sampson is selective with cats and he will chase cats.  Proper introductions will be very important before bringing Sampson into a cat home.

name: RIGBY
description:
Rigby is a 6 year old, 21 pound, Terrier Mix who looks an awful lot like a Shih Tzu.  He is black and grey, in good shape but could definitely lose several pounds with a good, consistent diet from a loving family.

Rigby is very shy and reserved during introductions.  But once you put a leash on him or put him on a couch and he knows what you want and what you are going to do, he is VERY happy.  When Rigby feels comfortable, he is independent and curious.  He loved long walks on a leash and to play and roll in the grass.   On the couch, Rigby loved belly rubs and cuddling.

Rigby is okay with dogs and cats after proper introductions.  We recommend rigby not be placed in a home with children.

Staff and volunteers really like Rigby.   He will make anyone a nice companion and takes up only a small space!!   He will fit into anyoneâs home.   Rigby qualifies for our Senior for Senior Program where an adopter over 55 y/o can have the adoption fee waived.

Rigby is neutered, microchipped, hw tested negative, and up to date on vaccines and preventatives. 

RIGBY can be seen at the Placer County Animal Services Center

name: Anna
description:
Adorable Anna came to us from the Sanger shelter where she landed as a stray. Petite 45 lbs, she is good with dogs, and is a sensitive gentle soul looking for a person or family to finally call her very own. She has done great with kids and lived with children 9-15 years old in her last foster home. She travels well in the car, and is treat motivated. Moderate activity level, she will benefit from stability and structure, daily walks and lots of love.

$200 adoption donation includes spay, vaccinations, microchip and utd on monthly preventatives + free wellness exam to banfield vet hospital. 

Interested adopters > > > complete adoption form at 
heartsforpawsrescue.com/adopt

1. Complete form at heartsforpawsrescue.com/adopt
2. We will promptly respond to discuss the match/ potential meet & greet
3. Meet the animal in person (heartsforpawsrescue.com/meet-greet-info)

Follow along at 
facebook.com/heartsforpawsrescue and instagram @heartsforpawsrescue to see all our dogs available for adoption

HFPR is a volunteer run 501c3 rescue with foster homes from Sacramento through the Bay Area. All of our dogs are in loving foster homes so we can learn about them and help pair you with the best match. Looking for capable, committed and qualified Homes to love and care for adopted dogs for their lifetimes.

name: FLASH
description:
Flash is a 2 year old German Shepherd boy. He has a handsome tan coat and  a black muzzle.  He weighs 59#, which is a nice medium size for a Shepherd.   He has a great athletic physique and weight which can be maintained with medium level activity.  Flash is a such a polite, mannerly, great dog that his new owner or family does not need dog owning experience to successfully handle Flash.

Flash starts out a tad shy, but quickly warms up to his usual outgoing, confident, excitable self - pretty much what you would expect from a teenager!!.  He does calm down quickly.   The volunteers and staff are working on his leash training.  We found out that he loves the water.

Flash likes to be petted on his head and back.  He needs to be around more people to reveal more of his personality.  We think he spent too much time alone and away from loved ones.

He is a nice, handsome, healthy dog ready for a new home with people who will love him unconditionally and want to spend time with him and make him a part of the family.

Flash is okay with dogs and cats after proper introductions.  Flash appears to be scared of cats.  Flash will need a secure fence for a play yard.

Flash is neutered, microchipped, hw tested negative, and up to date on vaccines and preventatives. 

Flash can be seen at the Placer County Animal Services Center 
11232 B Avenue, Auburn, CA 95603

Shelter hours:
Monday - Saturday: 10:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. (Adoptions end at 4:30 p.m.)
Closed Sundays and County holidays

name: ROSCOE
description:
Roscoe is a brown and white, 3 year old, Pit Bull Terrier.   He has a handsome combination of markings including a white chest blaze and white socks.
Roscoe has great physique and carriage plus is at a good weight of 74#.

Roscoe is a playful lad with plenty of energy.  He will need medium to high activity everyday - making him a perfect companion to keep you and your family fit and trim.  Roscoe is outgoing, confident and assertive.  His personality is perfectly complimented by a sensitive, independent and affectionate side.

Roscoe is very smart and observant.  He knows how to sit and stay down.  Roscoe is receptive and sensitive to correction making him perfect for a previous dog owner who wants to continue his manners and skills training.

Roscoe is okay with cats and dogs with proper introductions.   When in a playgroup with other dogs, he showed he was pretty rough and rowdy so it would best that if there is another dog in the home that they be submissive.  As always, dogs should be fed separately.

Roscoe loves to be touched, held and petted.   He is attentive to people.  Roscoe loved to play with toys, as if he had  never seen a toy before in his life. He canât get enough! Itâs so cute!

Roscoe is neutered, microchipped, hw tested negative, and up to date on vaccines and preventatives. 

Roscoe can be seen at the Placer County Animal Services Center 
11232 B Avenue, Auburn, CA 95603

Shelter hours:
Monday - Saturday: 10:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. (Adoptions end at 4:30 p.m.)

description:
Meet Bailey Rae

She is a tree walker coonhound/Catahoula mix is, a little over a year old.. Very sweet girl but can be timid at first. She is good with other dogs, cats, birds and children. Especially babies and toddlers. She needs a secure fence yard.

name: Muenster
description:
My name is Muenster and I am 2 years old!
