name: PUPPY - Nemo!!
description:
What is your name? My name is Nemo

How old are you? I am 10 weeks old! Born approx. July 25, 2019

How much do you weigh? I weigh about 15 lbs!

What do you look like? I have a beautiful brindle coat with spots down my front right leg & on my belly.

What do you like to eat? Is everything an acceptable answer? I eat my kibble for breakfast and dinner, then allll the treats during the day!

What kind of personality do you have? Im a spunky little guy, full of energy! But also an amazing snuggler!

Describe your perfect day: Wake up, go potty, scarf down breakfast, chew on alllll my toys, play âfollow the leaderâ with my foster bro, poop, nap so hard with my foster mom, inhale dinner, potty some more, sleep all night, then do it all over again the next day!

What is your favorite toy? I can make a toy out of anything! But rope toys or chew bones are my fave because they donât fall apart so easy & I can play tug-a-war with them!

Do you know any tricks? I am very good at âsitâ especially before getting my food or waiting for a treat. I am slowly learning âdownâ. Not a fan of ânoâ but I have chosen to accept it!

What scares you? Nothing yet! My foster mom has introduced me to a lot! I love the robo vacuum, and I can tolerate the garbage disposal, blender, regular vacuum, hair dryer, and motorcycle! Slow, positive intros set me up to be fearless!

Have you been around children? Do you like them?
I have not but with the right introductions and some set boundaries, I definitely could!

Do you like cats? I have never came across one but my foster mom thinks I would do just fine with them especially since I am still young.

How do you feel about other dogs? I LOVE OTHER DOGS! I have been around them since birth & couldnât imagine life without them around!

If you could be anywhere in the world, where would it be? Outside, for sure! Or taking a nap on the couch. Both are great options!

How is your health? Iâm as healthy as they come!

Who do you live with your foster home and who is your closest companion? I live with my foster mom, foster dad, and big foster fur bro Boris! Mom is definitely my bestie! She just loves taking care of me & my fur bro. No like really, she does! Always feeding us & picking up all our poop! Thatâs love!

Where do you hang out when you are home alone?
I like to hang in my crate with a few toys & a comfy bed! I have only had one accident in there so far too!

Where do you sleep? I also sleep in my crate all night! Naps are taken on the couch though, duh.

Do you like walking on a leash?
The leash is more of a toy to me right now since I canât go on walks yet but I know I could learn with a little guidance & a great role model!

Do you have any \"not-so-great\" habits that we should know about? For instance, do you bark or dig in the yard?
No digging, little barking/whining - only a teensy bit before bedtime or if i feel the need to get your attention to take me out to potty, but lots of chewing/eating things so you have to keep a close eye out!

Are you house trained? (Meaning do you go potty outside) I do! I rarely have any accidents in the house because my foster mom knows my cues & pays very close attention!

Do you like water? To drink? Absolutely. To play in? Still to be determined!

What do you love about your foster family?
I love how much they love me! Everything they do is for my own good or safety! I may not like being told ânoâ or âleave itâ but I know its for good reason! Also, I couldnât have asked for a better foster fur bro! I know I can be a lot for him at times but he puts up with me & I know deep down heâll miss me!

What was your life like before being brought into NorCal Bully Breed Rescue? Well, I have only been with NorCal!! They took my mama in when she had me in her belly!

NorCal Bully Breed Rescue is a foster based rescue with foster homes spread all throughout the Sacramento area. We usually require our adopters to be within a 50 to 100 mile radius of us, depending on the dog, and depending on the home. This is because we need to do a yard check to guarantee that the potential adopter's yard is secure, and also have them be close enough should any behavioral issues arise, and the assistance of our trainer is needed. We are, however, willing to adopt out of our area, including the Bay Area, Tahoe, and even further. We've even adopted out of state on very special occasions. We try our best to match our dogs to the perfect homes, and match them based on their personalities, not their looks. Adoptions are not done on a first come, first serve basis, rather in the order of what homes are the right match for that particular dog. Our adoption fees are based on the dog and range from $200-$350. In the case of senior dogs (6+ years), fees will be waived to the right home. This includes spay/neuter, vaccines, microchip, and deworming (if necessary). 

Nemo's adoption donation is $350.

Interested in meeting Nemo or any of our available pooches?  Complete and submit our adoption application on our website norcalbullybreedrescue.com and we will respond to you within 24 to 48 hours.

description:
Handsome Neo is an approximately 1 1/2-2 yr old black/tan male German Shepherd that was a stray at Bradshaw Shelter. He was severely emaciated and had a horrible case of mange. He has recovered now and his transformation is absolutely amazing.  He is potty trained, has been around children and other dogs without issue. We do not know how he is with cats but he has seen them at the pet store without and reaction.  

Remi is up to date on his shots, is neutered and microchipped. The adoption fee is $4000. We adopt in El Dorado County/surrounding counties. Unfortunately, we DO NOT ADOPT OUT OF STATE EXCEPT FOR RENO (also surrounding areas to Reno within 30 minutes).


If you are interested in adopting Remi please go to www.sngsr.org and complete the application.

The rescue suggests obedience training for all puppies and dogs.

If you have any questions please email us at sierranevadagsr@outlook.com
or visit our website www.sngsr.org. You can also see what we are up to day to day by following our Facebook page at Sierra Nevada German Shepherd Rescue.

Thank you for considering adopting a rescue dog and supporting Sierra Nevada German Shepherd Rescue in our efforts to save lives!

name: Piri Piri
description:
My name is Piri Piri.  I am 2 years and 1 month old!

From Piri's Foster Mom: \"Piri is an absolutely amazing little dog. If I had room for another permanent doggy resident I would snatch her up in a heartbeat. Whoever ends up with her will be lucky to have her. She warmed up to me within the first hour of being home. She's taking a little more time with my husband but now, less than a week later, he can pet her and she'll come to him very cautiously when called. She is so smart and happy and eager to learn. I'm pretty sure she was potty trained before so our \"housebreaking\" was more of a potty training refresher course. She loves her crate and would sit in it all day waiting for treats if she could. We're working on duration of crating and people being out of sight when crated. She sleeps in a crate next to the bed just fine. I don't hear a peep out of her all night.\

name: Jefferson
description:
Jefferson is a 2 year old Australian Cattle Dog Male. He is being re-homed because his owner's life changed and they can't take him with them. He is loved, cared for and a happy ACD boy. 

Jefferson has been started in agility, knows Rally behaviors and had good obedience skills. He loves to ride in the car, is good with other dogs and has manners. 

He's ready to move to his new home as soon as one can be identified. For more information or to arrange to meet the boy, contact performanceresq@att.net or call 530.409.9800. He is fostered in Calveras County.

name: Cooper
description:
Cooper is a sweet miniature boy who came to rescue because his drive level was too high for his senior owners. He has to have a job or he'll get into too much trouble. 

Cooper is great with any dog of any size. Loves kids but if they are too boisterous, he'll go get in a kennel until they settle down. He loves to cuddle and sit on your lap. He's clicker trained and very eager to learn. He loves going to training classes and is a very fast learner. Cooper is both toy and food oriented. 

He came to Rescue and had not been groomed in 6 months or more. He was a matted mess. He hated being brushed most likely because he was matted close to the skin and bushing pulled at those mats. He will allow someone he trusts to groom him and gets better with every grooming. He still isn't excited about having a nail trim but will get there. He'd be best if his owner did the grooming instead of using a service. Otherwise it will take a bit for him to trust his groomer. Once he does, he's fine. 

If you are looking for your next competition agility dog; this is your boy. Cooper lives with large and small dogs. He's eager to please, loves to rid in the car and is ready to learn. He is available to a performance sport home only...agility, dock diving, competitive obedience or rally, etc. His AKC papers are available. 

For more information or to schedule a time to meet him contact PerformanceResQ@att.net or call 530.409.9800

Due to my personality, I'm a better fit for homes with teens/adults.

name: Spark
description:
Adoption fee on this dog is $300.

		Spark is a beautiful two year old, all white female long coat weighing about 65 lbs. She was surrendered to a shelter along with her sister Havana and possible sire Judah when the original owner lost his home. The previous owner indicated Spark had been an outdoor only dog. It is obvious that Spark has had at least one litter of puppies in the past.

		This is one sweet girl who walks well on a leash and craves human attention. She appears housebroken as long as she's not left alone inside without human companionship or a means to get outside for long periods of time.  She is learning house manners and the sit command.  Spark is not food motivated, so praise and affection work best in teaching her new things. She gets along well with the other dogs in the foster home that range from small to large in size.  She has shown signs of separation anxiety by pacing, scratching at windows, and any window coverings in the way.  She doesn't like being out alone and will bolt out the open gate or try to find an escape if given a chance.   Having other dog companions and a dog door for her to go in or out may be the best option for this girl. 

		Spark can be a little timid with new people.  Continued socialization, exercise and training will make Spark into the best companion dog.

This dog is a Level 2. Please be sure you understand what a dog of this Level requires. Go to our home page for an explanation of the Dog Rating Levels.

For more information and to see when this dog will be attending an Adoption Day, please see our Dogs page on our main website at www.gcgsr.org. 

We operate within a reasonable driving distance from the Greater Sacramento area, the 	Central Valley down to Merced, and Lake Tahoe. A reasonable driving distance is determined by where one of our volunteers is willing to drive within our areas of service. That means we don't adopt out of our area, to Southern California, or Out of State. 


Thank you for visiting!

name: ELVIRA
description:
ENGAGING ELVIRA

Elvira is a four year old female Pit Bull. She has a flashy grey and white coat and a healthy, athletic, muscular build.
Alvina is a great size for a Pit Bull. She weighs 57# and has a well-balanced, nicely proportioned body.

Elvira has an outgoing, confident and assertive personality.  She is very friendly and attentive towards people. She loves to be petted all over and accepts hugs. We discovered that she is a couch cuddle bug and loves to get as close to you as possible.  

She walks pretty well on a leash and is doing better on slowing it down and not pulling. 

Elvira is so full of energy and life that she still sometimes jumps up. The staff and volunteers are working with her on her manners so she respects othersâ personal space and doesnât jump up any more.

She is still excitable and gets wound up like a happy, little kid. 

Elvira appears to like other dogs. However, she is very pushy when playing with other dogs in the play yard. This is something that needs to be worked on. in this case she is only somewhat sensitive to correction. Then, after proper introductions, she should do okay with them.

Elvira appears to respect cats and should do okay with them after proper introductions.

Elvira needs an individual or family with some dog owning experience. She is good natured and friendly and has a desire to please and be loved. 

She is smart and knows the command for sit.

She will need an environment where she receives a high level of activity to use up all of her energy every day. 
She is a strong, sturdy dog who loves to move her body. She should do well and bond with her new people in an obedience class to continue to teach her to be easy to handle. She would love to be your jogging or hiking or long walk companion.

Elvira is spayed, microchipped, hw tested negative, and up to date on vaccines and preventatives. 

Elvira can be seen at the Placer County Animal Services Center 
11232 B Avenue, Auburn, CA 95603

Shelter hours:
Monday - Saturday: 10:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. (Adoptions end at 4:30 p.m.)
Closed Sundays and County holidays 

For more information about Elvira, please call 530.886.5541

name: Ponderosa
description:
Ponderosa is a 16 week old male Dachshund mix. He is a young puppy and a bundle of love.  He loves to get belly rubs and lots of petting.  He is crate trained and eats his meals and takes naps in there.  He sleeps through the night in his crate with no fuss. He is house trained but needs to be taken out every two hours.  He is leash trained and loves to take walks after eating.  He loves play time with his toys and his person.  He has lots of hard chew toys that are his favorites. He likes to meet adults and make friends.  He is an extremely smart dog and learns quickly.    He has not been tested with cats. Ponderosa is young and will need a family who is around enough to continue is his obedience and training. 

If you have reached out to us please be sure to check your spam folder for an email from foothillcoordinator@gmail.com! 

Come meet Ponderosa and all the available dogs at the adoption event on Saturday. Adoption events held Saturdays from noon to 3 pm. If you have a resident dog/s please bring them along for a meet and greet. Foothill Dog Rescue does not offer first come, first serve adoptions. Our goal is to find the best match for each dog and family. All interested parties will be interviewed to find the best match. 

Ponderosa not your jam? No worries! Check out all the available dogs on our Facebook page or website (www.foothilldogrescue.org). Chihuahua, terrier, shepherd, pit bull, dachshund, border collie, heeler, pomeranian, shih tzu, labrador, puppy....new dogs come available every week. Follow us on Facebook to see which new dogs will be making a debut at the Saturday adoption events!

He would do better in a home with no kitties as he likes to chase them. He is crate and potty trained and very adorable. Children are too much for Rubio and he would prefer a female household.

I was taken by Scooters when my owner kicked all of us out and we had no where to go. A Good Samaritan took me in to foster and then found Scooters. I love going shopping and on adventures. I do need to lose weight a bit but I am sure there are people who like chunky gals. You can say that I would qualify to be a therapy dog because of my demeanor. name: Carl
description: Carl is a beautiful, easy going boy who likes his people and being indoors in summer. He also likes the water. He's a big guy but love to squeeze in to the kiddie pool to cool off. Carl is a bit lazy and takes his time when he has his daily walk. he would fit well with an active family with older kids or no kids who would include him in their daily activities. If you'd like to meet Carl please text us or call or email, telling us about yourself and where you live and the life he would have living with you.

name: GOLDEN
description: Special needs for this sweet boy. We are working on healing some awful wounds due to a dog figth. He is in rehap right now and he is having surgeries to help him heal. He needs a compassionate owner who wants the responsibility of looking after a special needs dog. He is 10 years old but he is such a grateful boy. We adore him. Please submit an application if you are interested in talking to us about Golden. www.havendogrescue.org

name: Lacy
description:
Lacy is white with spiky thin hair and weighs about 4-5 lbs.  She appears to be about 10 months old. She is spayed. microchipped and has had her vacinations. 

Poor Lacy will need an adopter who has no other pets, or a pet who is quiet and not interested in playing with her. She is afraid of everything. Pets, noise, people, other dogs. She came from a central valley shelter injured. They 'think' she was hit by a car, but I'm wondering if it is really a case of abuse.  She had a broken tail which has now been amputated half way down. When the hair grows back you probably won't notice the half gone tail. She also had a pelvic injury and a wound on her hip which has healed nicely.  

Even though her physical wounds have healed for the most part, her mental wounds still exist.  She will need a patient, gentle and loving owner who will handle her with great thoughtfulness.  It appears that Lacy was held a lot or carried by a human and she feels comfortable being held.  But she needs socialization with people and pets so she can regain her self esteme and confidence. It will take time and patience.

If you are interested in adoption for this sweet little girl, please go to the website; k9bestfriendsforever.com and fill out an application.  Pictures will follow soon.

name: Heiny
description:
Heiny is tiny (about 3-4 lbs) but he was called Heiny because he was injured and his head was so swollen he looked like a Hyena. The swelling is gone, he is healthy again, neutered and vacinated.  He is high energy, sweet and handsome.  I am told he is 'dearlike' which means something to Chihuahua experts. We just think he is cute.  He likes his next door cell mate, likes to playwith her and is affectionate.  

Heiny came from a central valley shelter as he was living with a homeless person. He had the head injury and our nice Roseville vet rescued him from euthanasia to help Heiny out.  Now That Heiny is well again, the vet needs to place him in a good home where he will be loved and watched over so he will be safe. 

If you are interested in adoption, please call TRINA at the Cirby Sunrise Veterinary Clinic in Roseville at 1-916-780-0551 and discuss your interest and find out more about Heiny.  His adoption fee will be $200.00 and even though this does not cover Heiny's vet expenses, we will know he is in a safe and loving home. He is totally ready to go to his new home now.  Give Trina a call as Heiny won't last very long in foster care, he is toooooo cute! Pictures to follow soon.  1-916-780-0551

name: Mikey
description:
Mikey and his siblings came to us from Fresno California as an accidental litter from the owners female dog and the neighbors male (we are working with the family to get the parents fixed).

They arrived shy but sweet, gentle and wanting to trust. In a few short days they made great strides and are normal puppies who love toys, wrestling with their siblings, and love other dogs. They will do fine in a home with cats and would do best with respectful kids 10+.

Will need experienced homes with the time to commit to puppy training, socialization and life long companionship.
Preference to homes with 
- Experience raising dogs
- Friendly role model dog in the home
- Flexible work schedule/time to dedicate to young dog
- Willingness to enroll in training
- Home owners w yards 

$375 adoption donation â vetted, microchipped, dewormed, flea tick treated, up to date on age appropriate shots & available with spay / neuter agreement (please review adoption policies.) Adopters are responsible for lifelong vetting and finishing  age appropriate puppy shots.

Follow Facebook.com/heartsforpawsrescue

Once I was out of the kennel I am a perfect lady. I donât like to be kenneled or confined but who does? I am super sweet and if you give me my space I will warm up to you and love you lots. He is neutered, vaccinated, microchipped and heartworm tested negative. King loves his pool on hot days. He came to us with a female chow who has been adopted. Now it is King's turn to find a wonderful loving home! Will this be you? He has a happy wagging tail and is a playful boy once he gets to know you.  Please submit an application on King by going to www.chowsplus.org

name: P'nut
description:
Pânut is a scrappy 7-year-old lab/pit mix who needs to be the only dog in the house (no cats, either)! Sheâs a strong-willed, loving, energetic girl who gives everything her all. Her favorite things to do are playing fetch (especially in the water like Tahoe or a pool!), snuggling up to her humans, sunbathing in a backyard or under a window, watching TV very attentively, riding shotgun in the car, and exploring the neighborhood on walks. Sheâs super attuned to her humansâ moods. She loves attention and is very attentive herself.

 Pânut was originally a rescue (I got her 3 years ago) who Iâm guessing wasnât socialized very well and therefore is pretty anxious in certain situations. Sometimes sheâll act nervous and growl/bark at new people (sheâs never bitten a person) until she gets comfortable or, more rarely, goes into timeout to calm down. She has struggled with resource guarding which can be addressed through training that I unfortunately donât have time or energy for. Over the years, she has bitten two dogs (whoâve lived with her and was otherwise friendly with) when they have tried to take her ball or food. She sometimes gets into stuff she shouldnât (mostly food and fun stuff like cardboard) when sheâs left alone too long or when sheâs bored. This can be solved by moving things out of her reach and/or more training.

An ideal home would have someone who can walk her daily and play fetch in the backyard or at a dog park frequently. Ideally they wouldnât be away at work all day, or if they are, there are others who can check in on her or give her attention throughout the day.

 I know in my heart of hearts that Pânut is a good girl who just wasnât taught how to deal with her anxiety. She has made so much progress over the few years Iâve lived with her and Iâm so proud of her! Everyone she meets can tell sheâs so full of love that she just wants to share with everyone - especially through licks and cuddles.

Interested adopters > > > complete adoption form at 
heartsforpawsrescue.com/adopt

1. Complete form at heartsforpawsrescue.com/adopt
2. We will promptly respond to discuss the match/ potential meet & greet
3. Meet the animal in person (heartsforpawsrescue.com/meet-greet-info)

Follow along at 
facebook.com/heartsforpawsrescue and instagram @heartsforpawsrescue to see all our dogs available for adoption

HFPR is a volunteer run 501c3 rescue with foster homes from Sacramento through the Bay Area. All of our dogs are in loving foster homes so we can learn about them and help pair you with the best match. Looking for capable, committed and qualified Homes to love and care for adopted dogs for their lifetimes.

name: Marina
description:
Marina is a 2 year old male terrier/doxie mix. He is potty-trained and likes to go on walks and walks well on a leash. He sleeps quietly in a crate at night but also loves to snuggle with you in bed at night. He has been respectful of a dog savvy kitten who enjoys playing with dogs.  It's his friend of choice in his current foster home.  His first visit to Folsom Lake he walked right into the water and swam so he might be a dog who really enjoys the water. Marina is nervous around unknown humans.  It takes him a few days to warm up to a new human but once he knows you he is full of fun. Children would be too much for this shy little guy. A well matched playful mentor dog in his new home would be ideal.  A home with prior shy dog experience would be perfect.  Take your time letting this fun little guy warm up to you and we know he will win your heart. 

If you have reached out to us please be sure to check your spam folder for an email from foothillcoordinator@gmail.com! 

Marina is available for private meet and greets and does not attend our adoption events.  If you have a resident dog/s please bring them along for a meet and greet. Foothill Dog Rescue does not offer first come, first serve adoptions. Our goal is to find the best match for each dog and family. All interested parties will be interviewed to find the best match. 

Marina not your jam? No worries! Check out all the available dogs on our Facebook page or website (www.foothilldogrescue.org). Chihuahua, terrier, shepherd, pit bull, dachshund, border collie, heeler, pomeranian, shih tzu, labrador, puppy....new dogs come available every week. name: DUDE
description:
Dude is a brown, young, small, two year old Pit Bull Terrier who weighs about 53#.  Dudeâs handsome face shows he may have a little Boxer in him.

Dude starts out a little timid and reserved, but quickly warms up to people.  He is independent, sensitive to correction and gentle.  He appears to not have spent a lot of time with people.  He does not understand toys so if you want a clean slat, Dude is the one for you.   Dude is very trainable and like any young animal should be taken to dog obedience for socialization and manners training.   He would make you proud.

The volunteers love Dude.  He is easy to walk and a sweet boy.  He likes to walk fast but responds if you want to slow down.  Dude remains calm around people and responds very well to corrections.  He is very friendly and receptive to body and head pets.  Around other dogs, Dude can be easily excitable

Dude is neutered, microchipped, hw tested negative, and up to date on vaccines and preventatives. 

Dude  can be seen at the Placer County Animal Services Center 
11232 B Avenue, Auburn, CA 95603

Shelter hours:
Monday - Saturday: 10:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. (Adoptions end at 4:30 p.m.)
Closed Sundays and County holidays 

For more information about Dude, please contact 530.886.5541

name: SIMON
description:
Simon is a young, tan and white, male Pit Bull Terrier Mix, weighing 53# and is about 1-1/2 years old.  He looks to me like he has some Labrador Retriever in him because of his facial features.  Simon has a beautiful coat and is a handsome boy.

Like any healthy young one, Simon is rambunctious, confident, excitable and assertive.  He likes to lick to show his love and is a little mouthy and can jump up into your personal space.  Luckily along with those youngster characteristics, Simon is independent, confident, affectionate and lovable.  He totally is into people and squarely centered on what you want him to do and how he fits in.  Simon loves to be petted and played with.

Simon knows how to sit and down and is learning his leash manners after he spends lots of fun time running in the play yard.  His age and personality is perfect for dog training classes.  He needs a strong pack leader and someone with dog experience.   He will need high activity exercise on a daily basis.

Simon is not sensitive to correction around cats and pulls towards them.  We do not recommend Simon be around cats in his new home.  Simon is pushy, mouthy and a little rough on introductions to other dogs so we recommend he be around submissive, tolerant, non-reactive dogs in multi-dog homes.   Proper doggy introductions will be very important. We always recommend that dogs in multiple dog families be fed separately.

Simon is neutered, microchipped, hw tested negative, and up to date on vaccines and preventatives. 

Simon can be seen at the Placer County Animal Services Center 
11232 B Avenue, Auburn, CA 95603

Shelter hours:
Monday - Saturday: 10:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. (Adoptions end at 4:30 p.m.)
Closed Sundays and County holidays 

For more information, please call 530-886-8841

name: BILLY
description:
BILLY MY BOY

What a beautiful little lad this Pit Bull puppy is. He is so cute and has the prettiest brown eyes and dark markings that I enjoyed just staring at him. That is when he was standing still, which took awhile as he is highly energetic, active and rambunctious. All the qualities one would expect from a 6 month old. He has a light tan coat with a cream colored chest and cream socks. He weighs 53 #.
Billy is HAPPY and full of life. 
He is also smart and likes people so he is as attentive as he can be and he listens to you and will sit for a treat! We taught him that in the 20+ minutes we had with him in the photo room. Bright lad.
Billyâs personality is outgoing, excitable, confident and assertive. 
He is also affectionate and so willing to learn.
He is independent by nature and  he is a big strong boy. But we got the sense that the more time he spends with the staff and volunteers the more he is learning that pleasing people is a good thing and nets pets and treats and TOYS.
Billy loves toys. I think they are a novelty to him.

Billy is learning to respect othersâ personal space and not jump up, be mouthy or lick.

He is okay with other dogs with proper introductions. It is currently unknown how he will be with cats.

Billy needs lots of leash training, because it is totally new to him and he pulls hard. 
Billy will need a life with a high level of activity in it. He will thrive with structure and fun and would benefit greatly from obedience lessons.
He needs a dog savvy experienced owner or family. He is fun to be with and is healthy and beautiful. He would love a fenced, outdoor play area where he could play and run and use his energy. Come by the shelter and meet this magnificent, active pup. Dogs this age get adopted quickly.

Billy is neutered, microchipped, hw tested negative, and up to date on vaccines and preventatives. 

Billy  can be seen at the Placer County Animal Services Center 
11232 B Avenue, Auburn, CA 95603

Shelter hours:
Monday - Saturday: 10:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. (Adoptions end at 4:30 p.m.)
Closed Sundays and County holidays 

For more information, please call:  530.886.5541

name: MORRIE
description: Morrie is a little shy, but looking for a special forever home to spend his days. Despite his age, he is still active and enjoys being the center of attention.

name: Tarzan
description: Meet Tarzan! Tarzan is about 3 years old and ready for an adventure or to chill with his human! We believe he is a Lab/Pit mix. This sweet boy loves to play ball, play in the water and loves his pool! Tarzi will just plop into the water to cool off. He is excellent on walks, loves to run in the yard and roll in the grass. Car rides are not his favorite but he is learning. He is crate trained and knows the word \"bed\

name: Lollie!!
description:
LOLLIE NEEDS TO BE AN ONLY PET FOR A SOLO PERSON. 
SUPER SIMPLE. 
DO NOT APPLY FOR HER IF YOU DO NOT MEET THOSE TWO BASIC REQUIREMENTS.
THANK YOU. ??)??????

What is your name? Lollie

How old are you? About 8 years old (a/o 9/04/2019)

How much do you weigh? Around 20 pounds. Iâm definitely a smaller sized French Bulldog.

What do you look like? I look like a big muscular dog in a tiny dogs body ???. Oh and also, a cow.?

What do you like to eat? Pretty much anything. I eat kibble during meal time but LOOOOOVE snacks. Any snacks. Even fruit and veggies. Give them to me. Give me all the snacks. ?

What kind of personality do you have? Iâm extremely moody and temperamental and really only like having things my way. Is that a problem??

Describe your perfect day: Iâm a pretty independent dog. I donât require much attention. BUT if you really want to show me a good time, I LOVE going for car rides. 
I love a good Starbucks drive through... 
But I canât do that âpuppachinoâ nonsense because my short snout canât fit in a cup. 
So give me a grande lid filled with whipped cream and Iâll be your BFF...

I like going to Home Depot but also need you to be conscious about other dogs that may be there. I act like a real turd-nugget sometimes when I see other dogs so itâs best you just take me down a different aisle. Sorry. ???? (Not sorry...)

I also sometimes LOVE meeting people in public, but also sometimes HATE it. 
My foster mom can help you read my body language so you can tell the difference. 
Itâs super obvious when Iâm in a good mood, and EVEN MORE obvious when Iâm not. ?

USUALLY I love the attention in big stores like Home Depot. People flock to me and I eat it up. Itâs when Iâm in smaller spaces that I canât handle the attention. Like at the Smog & Go, where the waiting room is tiny and not open. I donât like being approached in places like that. So youâll just have to keep me close to your side and let people know that I donât like strangers.

What is your favorite toy? I love stuffed toys. I like to chew on them for hours. I donât shred them. I just chew on them. I call it âself soothingâ. The one downside to giving me toys is I am a bit possessive and wonât want to give them up if you try to take them away. So just let me have my time with my toy, and when Iâm done I will let you know. Thanks in advance for understanding!?

Do you know any tricks? I know how to snort really hard and blow snot out my nose, most often when I am close to a human face. Does that count?

Oh!! And I skip when I walk!!! People comment on it all the time. Itâs super adorable. And it counts as a trick!!!!

What scares you? Too many things at once. 
Too many people. Too many noises. Too many animals. Too many things. 
I act up when Iâm overwhelmed. 
I guess you can compare it to someone with anxiety?
I just need a mellow environment and Iâm happy as a clam. ??

Have you been around children? Do you like them?
I do not. I actually donât like kids at all. They stress me out and I want to bite them. But letâs get real here... that sums up about 50% of the population. So how you gonna make me out to be a bad dog when itâs NOOOORMAL to get stressed out by kids?
Right?
Whoâs with me on that one?
Anyone??
?

Do you like cats? I donât know. But probably not. I donât like other dogs all that much and cats are just like small dogs. But jerks. So I guess thatâs a no?

How do you feel about other dogs? Not so great. 
Over the past three years in my foster home, I have learned to tolerate the larger dogs that live here. They donât bother me, they donât get in my space, and they are not pushy. So I deal with them. 
But I absolutely HATE the other small dogs in my foster home. I plot their death on a regular basis and if I was allowed to take them out, I would. Unfortunately, I have a horrific underbite and I am not allowed near them. Which makes it that much more difficult to plot their demise. Oh but I can dream....

If you could be anywhere in the world, where would it be?
In my forever home with the person that loves me and understands me enough to just let me be me. Training wonât fix me. 
CBD oil wonât fix me. 
Iâm just how I am. And I need to find someone who loves me unconditionally. 
Because I swear to you, Iâll make up for all the bad traits I have by being your most loyal, most loving little badass sidekick you ever dreamed of. 
Iâll be your very best friend. 
Iâll go everywhere with you. 
Iâll listen to your complaints about your tough day at work. 
Iâll sleep next to you at night and cuddle you. 
Iâll never let you down. ??

How is your health? Fantastic. Iâm a perfectly healthy little evil minion.

Who do you live with in your foster home and who is your closest companion?
My foster moms. Theyâve kept me safe for 3 years and have put up with all my âquirksâ, but have also figured out that itâs just me. Itâs just how Iâm wired. And they love me anyway, even though Iâm a little challenging sometimes. ??????

Where do you hang out when you are home alone?
In my crate. I feel really secure there and since thereâs lots of dogs in my foster home, Iâd rather not have them in my space.

Where do you sleep? In my crate. 
But when Iâve been babysat by other people, Iâve loved sleeping in bed with them. Iâve been told Iâm a great cuddler. ??

Do you like walking on a leash? Yes. I love it very much. But Iâll need you to tell people not to pet me because sometimes Iâm GREAT with strangers and sometimes I try to bite them. 
It really kind of depends on the day. 
So if you could just keep me (and them) safe by keeping their hands OFF of my tiny body, that would be amazing. And Iâd so appreciate you for it. ??

Do you have any \"not-so-great\" habits that we should know about? For instance, do you bark or dig in the yard?
Well hereâs where I need to attach my resume. 
And the reason that as a highly sought after designer breed, Iâm still in a foster home after three years. 
I like to think Iâm like a fine wine... ? 
I get better with age. ?

I have a really unique personality. I get really overwhelmed and stressed out with too much going on at once. 
I donât like other animals in my space and tend to âlash outâ if they get too close to me. 
Yes, I go after them. 
Can I hurt them? Probably not. I have a wicked underbite. But would it start a major dogfight? 
ABSOLUTELY. 
So itâs because of this that I need to be an only pet.

Along those lines, I also get pretty overwhelmed at more than one person in my life. 
I really donât know if itâs a resource guarding, jealousy, or just wanting to have my person all to myself, but more than one person just doesnât do it for me.
Itâs kind of like the wires in my brain are crossed, and I forget really quickly that Iâm friends with a person, and when they come near me when Iâm with another person, I freak out.
It honestly really sucks. 
I wish I wasnât like this. 
But I am, and you gotta take the good with the bad. 
Iâm a really great little dog that has a ton to offer for the right person. It just has to be a single person with no other pets. Iâm hoping thatâs not too much to ask for, because Iâve been waiting my WHOLE LIFE for that person.

Are you house trained? (Meaning do you go potty outside). 
Well... yeah. I mean for the most part. But Iâm also a frenchie and I heard we donât have to play by the same rules as âregularâ dogs. 
Iâm sure itâs an easy thing to teach me. 
But if youâre gonna get mad at me if I pee on the floor when you donât let me out, Iâm definitely not the dog for you.

Do you like playing in water?
YES!!!! Finally something I can say YES to!!!
I love water. I have a kiddie pool that I jump into on hot days. I like the lake. The river. You name it. Just donât let me go out too far. I have tiny little legs!!!

What do you love about your foster family?
Well for starters they have too many damn dogs. 
And their house is super crazy.

Oh wait. What do I LOVE about them?
Oh. Ok....

Well I love that they have kept me safe even though Iâve been a super difficult little dog.
Itâs not my fault though!!

They have a lot of dogs, and I donât like other dogs. 
So theyâve made accommodations for me and kept me safe and as happy as possible while Iâm here.

They take me out a lot so Iâm not stuck in my crate all day. 
They take me on road trips when they run errands and they take me hiking (when itâs not too hot out) and to the lakes and rivers in the area on their days off. I LOVE IT!!!

During the evening they have me spend time outdoors in a large kennel so I can be AROUND my foster parents and their other dogs, but not I have to be right in the middle of all the commotion.
I actually LOVE company, as long as Iâm not being forced to interact. 
Weird, I know. 
I especially like to roll on my back on my bed and scratch myself while I listen to Bob Marley. If there werenât lots of other dogs around and it was just me and my human, I could do the same thing. Just without the kennel. That really sounds wonderful...

What was your life like before being joining NBBR?
Ugh. To be honest, it was shit. Originally I was raised in a home with my brother. Our owners went through a divorce and my mom moved out, leaving me with a very abusive dad who took out his anger over the divorce on me and my brother. We were locked in closets for days on end, and I got kicked around pretty badly. I am extremely sensitive on my hind end, and even though I have no injuries, tend to freak out if anybody tries to push me along or move me with their foot. I scream super loudly even if Iâm not being touched. 
It just scares me. 
So I act out.

For the rest of the story, copy and paste this link:  https://www.facebook.com/norcalbullybreedrescue/posts/2333298180122709

name: MARLEY
description:
My New Friend MARLEY

What a pleasure it was today to meet Marley, a lovely, strikingly attractive, sweet, young female Pit Bull. 
Marley is a 3 year old, healthy, muscular girl who weighs 58 # and has a shiny, silver grey and white coat and beautiful grey -green eyes. 

Marley has an outgoing, confident, independent and assertive personality.  
She is affectionate and is friendly and attentive towards people.
She likes to be petted and accepts being touched and hugged. Marley can be excitable and slower to recover, but on the other hand she is sensitive to verbal correction.

The volunteers and staff have complimentary feedback about how nicely she walks on a leash. 
They are working on her other doggie manners so that she respects peoples personal space and doesnt jump up or lick or be mouthy. Marley is smart and she is trying hard to learn how to behave in a way that pleases. She is receptive to training and sensitive to correction. 

Marley will be fun to train. She knows how to sit and shake hands. She is potty trained. She has good eye contact when you relate to her. 
Marley loved sitting right next to us on the sofa for petting and cuddles.
She took great pleasure in trying every toy in the room that we gave her to play with. The squeaky ones delighted her and she jumped up on the sofa and had so much fun making noise with them! It seemed like it might have been the first time she had ever had this kind of play time. So cute to watch.

Marley appears to like other dogs and with proper introductions should do okay with LARGE DOGS. 
We recommend that dogs in multiple dog families be fed separately.

Marley needs a home with NO CATS. 

Marley will need a life filled with high energy activities. She will benefit greatly from obedience training, which will cement a healthy bond between her and her new person or family. 
She will do great with dog savvy, experienced owners. She is ready to become your new friend and add sweetness and fun to your life.
 
Marley is spayed, microchipped, hw tested negative, and up to date on vaccines and preventatives.  Marley can be seen at the Placer County Animal Services Center, 11232 B Avenue, Auburn, CA 95603

Shelter hours:
Monday - Saturday: 10:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. (Adoptions end at 4:30 p.m.)
Closed Sundays and County holidays 

For more information about Marley, please call 886-5541

name: Raja
description:
My name is Raja.  I am 9 years and 3 months old.

Raja is an incredibly special gal, who truly just needs someone to love! She is that wonderful age where she's both up for outings, and happy to snuggle at home. We've found her to be confident and easy going with other dogs, and quite easy to walk on leash, too! But her true passion is petting. All she really wants is for someone to shower her with affection, and tell her what a gorgeous gal she is. Raja (like most dogs) finds being in the shelter quite stressful, so if you pass by her kennel she may make a ruckus, but don't let that deter you - ask an adoptions counselor to meet her, and you'll soon find a velvety soft snuggle pup, waiting to become the devoted companion you've been looking for! 

My adoption fee was sponsored by a loving fan!

I lived with dogs in my previous home.
I don't have a history with cats, but may do well with them with a slow introduction.
I don't have a history with children but may do well with them.

I am affectionate but totally down to sit by your side majestically as nothing makes me more proud than to be side by side with my people. Come and meet me today and please get me out of my kennel, I am not a happy guy when in my kennel, I belong in a home, asap!

name: Cristiano
description:
Adoption fee on this dog is $300.

		Cristiano is a three year old black and tan male. He was surrendered to a local vet so not much is known about his background. We do know he previously lived with a small dog and has greeted all sized dogs nicely since coming into rescue. He is currently living with a female shepherd. They only play occasionally, but he does love the companionship of having her around. 

		Cristiano is housebroken and has pretty nice manners while inside, but if left unsupervised he may help himself to the trash can if the opportunity presents itself. While he will sleep in a crate at night he does not like to be left alone in the crate and may cry loudly or attempt to get out if left alone. He will prefers to sleep freely on a dog bed in his foster moms room at night. 

		Cristiano is still learning to heel and walk on a leash without pulling.  He is also learning basic commands and to sit and wait for his meals. Cristiano has shown signs of pretending not to know basic commands such as sit when asked by new people. If you stay firm and consistent, he will eventually give in and sit. This boy is pretty food motivated as well so if he discovers he won't get his meal until he obeys he will cave in. 

		Cristiano can get a little jealous when he sees the other dog getting attention. He often needs a reminder to sit and wait his turn. 

		Cristiano will do best in a home that will include him in their daily activities. Continued training and proper leadership is essential to help him flourish and become a wonderful addition to the family.					


This dog is a Level 3. Please be sure you understand what a dog of this Level requires. Go to our home page for an explanation of the Dog Rating Levels.

For more information and to see when this dog will be attending an Adoption Day, please see our Dogs page on our main website at www.gcgsr.org. 

We operate within a reasonable driving distance from the Greater Sacramento area, the 	Central Valley down to Merced, and Lake Tahoe. A reasonable driving distance is determined by where one of our volunteers is willing to drive within our areas of service. That means we don't adopt out of our area, to Southern California, or Out of State. 


Thank you for visiting!

name: Thomas
description:
***SPECIAL NEEDS ADOPTION ***
Born on July 4th of this year, Thomas and his litter mates are now 8 weeks old.  While his litter mates were thriving, we noticed Thomas was starting to fall behind.  Thomas was diagnosed with Megaesophagus.  Megaesophagus is an enlargement of the esophagus which limits the ability for food to move into the stomach. Great Danes, along with several other breeds, are predisposed to this condition.  We are working closely with our vet to determine how best to treat Thomas going forward and ensure he gets enough nutrients.  Like most special need dogs, Thomas doesnât know he is different.  He is learning to eat in an upright position and remain upright for an extended period after eating. He is a typical happy go lucky puppy who loves people and playing with his siblings.  We are looking for a very special home for Thomas. Someone familiar this condition would be ideal.  All puppies require someone around enough to teach them manners and proper behaviors.  Thomas will require a bit more attention during feeding time. We know that special home for Thomas is out there.  Please share to make the connection between Thomas and his perfect home happen. 

If you have reached out to us please be sure to check your spam folder for an email from foothillcoordinator@gmail.com! 

Thomas not your jam? No worries! Check out all the available dogs on our Facebook page or website (www.foothilldogrescue.org). Chihuahua, terrier, shepherd, pit bull, dachshund, border collie, heeler, pomeranian, shih tzu, labrador, puppy....new dogs come available every week. Follow us on Facebook to see which new dogs will be making a debut at the Saturday adoption events!

name: Daisy
description:
Hi, my name is Daisy and if you're looking for a sweet, adorable, willing to please, young lady then I might be your gal.  I've been living with a family for the past year who love me but just don't have the time it takes to give me what I need.  I am being rehomed due to a change in my family and I'm waiting with my owner in Reno, NV.  I need someone with some GSD and training experience. And definitely someone interested in taking me to a training class or two.    I'm a very good girl, I just need a little work...  I've lived with  3 cats and while we're not BFF's I was OK living with them.  I just want to play. I am good with other dogs.   I love to go for walks and walk pretty well, however, I could use some loose leash practice.... I know Sit, Down, and can give you my Paw.  If you want a dog who loves to play Fetch, well, that's Me!  I've lived with young children from 2-4 years old but can be a bit rambunctious for them, so children 10 and up might be better. I am house trained, crate trained, as I'm still a puppy, and I'm excellent drving in the car.  I'm current on vaccinations, heartworm negative, spayed and microchipped.

Daisy is being rehomed due to a change in the family and is waiting with her owner in Reno NV
If I sound like a great match, then please contact my friends at EDCGSR and fill out an application at http://www.edcgsr.com/adoption-process.html

name: Ranger
description: Ranger is a very handsome and loving boy! He is very energetic and will need to be adopted into a home that has plenty of room for him to run. He can be a bit high strung if he doesn't release his energy, so an experienced adopter is preferred. Ranger is very smart and knows multiple commands. He is potty trained, neutered and up to date on vaccinations! Ranger does not do well with cats or other dogs and will do best in a home without children. He will surely make an excellent companion for anyone who has the time to work with and spoil this gorgeous German Shepard. Ranger is very unhappy in a kennel environment and can't wait to find a forever home!

name: Koda
description: Koda is such a sweet and smart little boy! He is very intelligent and knows how to sit on command. He loves attention and has lots of energy, so he will need to be adopted into a family that has the energy to match! Koda has already been neutered and is up to date on vaccinations and preventatives.

name: Robert Tippi & more
description: Puppies 6 of them , mom is a doxie mx , who knows who the daddy is , they are adorable , socialized , loved in a foster home with other dogs and cats .  If you are ready for a puppy , ask for a meet & greet .   email forpetsake@sbcglobal.net ask for an application or call  (530) 263-3331  located in Grass Valley CA   (530) 263-3331  Secure fenced yard required .

name: Jimmy
description: Jimmy is a terrier /pug mx , unique looking , very sweet boy .  Older kids over the age of 10 , he is shy  .  He gets along with other dogs , walks on a leash.  He has a brother that looks just like him , together they are adorable .  email forpetake@sbcglobal.net , ask for an application ,  call (530) 263-3331 ask about Jimmy .  also ask about his brother Timmy .

name: Timmy
description: Timmy is a happy sweet boy , he is shy , once he feels safe the tail will wag !  He is small , unique color fur ,  he has a brother that looks just like him.  Timmy is great with other dogs ,  Loves car rides  .  Needs a little training , secure fenced yard required .  We do home checks .  email forpetsake@sbcglobal.net ask for an application .  Contact us at (530) 263-3331  Timmy is located I Auburn CA . He will be at the upcoming Adopt-a-thon Sat.  Sept . 7th Petco Grass Valley 672 Freeman Ln .  Grass Valley CA  11-3:00  come meet him .  Call for another time to do a meet & greet .

name: Samson!
description:
What is your name?
Samson

How old are you?
Maybe 2 or 3 years old.

How much do you weigh? 
58lbs.

What do you look like?
Everyone tells me Iâm very cute. Iâm mostly grey with some strategically placed white patches.

What do you like to eat?
Everything! I really like treats and anything can be a treat. A treat could be a treat, or just a little bit of my kibble, or people food, or an ice cube. Iâm not very picky.

What kind of personality do you have?
Iâm very sweet and just want to be around my people most of the time. I like to play and go for walks, but also donât mind laying at your feet if thatâs what you need me to do.

Describe your perfect day:
First Iâd have breakfast. Then go for a nice walk. After that I like to take a nap for a couple hours. Then maybe have some play time in a yard before another nap or just quiet hangout time with my person. After that an evening walk then just dinner and hangout time till bed.

What is your favorite toy?
I really like stuffed toys. Iâm pretty gentle with them too. They wear out eventually but I donât pull the stuffing out of them or anything.

Do you know any tricks?
I can sit, lay down, and stay (as long as you donât go too far). I will also wait until you give me permission to eat food you put on the floor and will (usually) walk into my crate if you tell me âkennelâ. My foster mom is still working on come with me, but I donât like to venture too far from my people anyways.

What scares you?
New people coming into the house. Sometimes Iâm a little apprehensive with new people other places too, but itâs mostly just the house.

Have you been around children? Do you like them?
I havenât been around small children. My foster mom has to cousins (12 and 14) that come over almost everyday and play with me. Iâm great with them, but they know thereâs a strict no roughhousing/fighting rule around me because I can be protective. I also get excited sometimes and am not terribly aware of my size so itâs probably best if Iâm not around small kids.

Do you like cats?
My foster family has two cats. Iâm only allowed around them if Iâm on a leash, but I donât pay any attention to them even if they run right by me.

How do you feel about other dogs?
I do well with other dogs with proper introductions and supervision.

If you could be anywhere in the world, where would it be? 
Wherever my people are.

How is your health?
Great! I have some allergies, but thatâs no big deal.

Who do you live with your foster home and who is your closest companion?
My foster mom, her grandma and two cats. I like my foster mom the most, but Grandma is also nice.

Where do you hang out when you are home alone?
In my crate.

Where do you sleep? 
Mostly in my crate.

Do you like walking on a leash?
YES! I love walks! Theyâre my favorite part of the day and I am very well behaved. I mostly just want to smell everything.

Do you have any \"not-so-great\" habits that we should know about? For instance, do you bark or dig in the yard?
I can get excited and jump on people. Also Iâm protective of the house/my people so you have to be very cautious with strangers. Itâs important that Iâm kenneled or in another room when people first come in the house, but I seem to adjust after some time and a few treats.

Are you house trained? (Meaning do you go potty outside)
Yes.

Do you like water?
Only to drink. Iâll tolerate a bath but thatâs it.

What do you love about your foster family?
They spend lots of time with me and give me lots of treats. Mostly just that they saved me.

What was your life like before being brought into NorCal Bully Breed Rescue?
I was dumped in a park near my foster familyâs house. I was very, very skinny and afraid of people, so sheâs pretty sure I wasnât being treated very well. My foster family has shown me lots of love though, and Iâm really excited to find my forever home!

NorCal Bully Breed Rescue is a foster based rescue with foster homes spread all throughout the Sacramento area. We usually require our adopters to be within a 50 to 100 mile radius of us, depending on the dog, and depending on the home. This is because we need to do a yard check to guarantee that the potential adopter's yard is secure, and also have them be close enough should any behavioral issues arise, and the assistance of our trainer is needed. We are, however, willing to adopt out of our area, including the Bay Area, Tahoe, and even further. We've even adopted out of state on very special occasions. We try our best to match our dogs to the perfect homes, and match them based on their personalities, not their looks. Adoptions are not done on a first come, first serve basis, rather in the order of what homes are the right match for that particular dog. Our adoption fees are based on the dog and range from $200-$350. In the case of senior dogs (6+ years), fees will be waived to the right home. This includes spay/neuter, vaccines, microchip, and deworming (if necessary). 

Samson's adoption donation is $200.

Interested in meeting Samson or any of our available pooches?  Complete and submit our adoption application on our website norcalbullybreedrescue.com and we will respond to you within 24 to 48 hours.

name: Groot!
description:
What is your name? I am Groot!

How old are you? 1

How much do you weigh? 14lbs

What do you look like? Erm..cute? Brown, short legs, slight overbite with big expressive round eyes

What do you like to eat? I like dry kibble for everyday. Iâd do ANYTHING for chicken and peanut butter

What kind of personality do you have? Iâm a happy, active and independent puppy. I like to play and cuddle but I am also good at entertaining myself.

Describe your perfect day:
Start with morning potty outside followed by cuddle time with momma and breakfast. I like playing with my foster siblings and play tag. I like to eat 3x a day. Naps and play during the day and a treat right before bedtime.

What is your favorite toy?
I LOVE toys. Any of them! I like picking them up and showing momma how cute I am when she gets home.

Do you know any tricks?
Iâm quite talented. I know sit, lay down, stay, kiss kiss and might even dance for you when Iâm compensated well. I donât want to admit it but I understand âquietâ and ânoâ very well.

What scares you?
Very loud noises. I used to be scared of vehicles but not anymore.

Have you been around children? Do you like them?
No children in the house of foster momma.

Do you like cats? 
Iâm not sure.

How do you feel about other dogs?
I get along well with my 2 foster sibs. I LOVE to run and chase and play tug of war.

If you could be anywhere in the world, where would it be?
Sitting on mamas lap outside with the sun on my face.

How is your health?
Active, strong and healthy

Who do you live with in your foster home and who is your closest companion?
I live with foster momma and papa, and 2 puppers, Leelu and Data. I like playing with Leelu most because she likes to run and plays tug of war with me. I also love my solo times with foster momma.

Where do you hang out when you are home alone?
I have my private space in the kitchen/living room. My kennel there is left open inside the gated area. I am a quiet boy when left alone. I only bark when somebody wants to break in.

Where do you sleep?
My crate. You tell me âinsideâ and itâs automatic but I do it even faster with a treat.

Do you like walking on a leash?
Yes! I like to take my time walking and sniffing everything. But I can jog along up to a couple miles!

Do you have any \"not-so-great\" habits that we should know about? For instance, do you bark or dig in the yard?
I am protective of my treats. But I am learning I donât have to be scared or protective of it. Toys keep me away from breaking anything.

Are you house trained? (Meaning do you go potty outside) yes! I prefer going outside to potty but Iâm ok with pee pad too. I WILL let you know if I have to go.

Do you like playing in water?
Sometimes. I like chasing the water from the hose when foster momma is cleaning the patio. I LOVE baths, does that count?

What do you love about your foster family?
Momma makes sure that I get my solo time with her. My sibs are fun to play with. I love emptying the toy basket and playing with every single toy in there!

What was your life like before being joining NBBR?
I was surrendered to be killed because of biting. But NBBR wasnât given full background on how the behavior happened. Momma thinks I have been abused.

In my foster home, the only time I showed aggression was around treats. And it only happened 3x in the first 3 weeks. Nobody was ever hurt. And no fighting with my foster sibs as well. I am being trained to learn that I donât need to protect my treat. I did not get aggressive in the open. Only when Iâm inside my kennel. I like to be left alone until Iâm done with my treat.

The bad behavior was corrected by foster momma patiently showing me that I wasnât going to get hurt. She ignored me when I growled and left me alone to eat. The training I went through is being told to âleave itâ so I donât go for a treat thatâs right in front of me, then she gives me a different treat when I listen.

Once I was good with that, we moved on to taking the current treat from me. Sheâll give me a treat, come close, when I growl she tells me ânoâ and shows me she has another treat and tells me to sit. I sit and she gives me the new treat while taking the old one. We practiced this 3x a day for two weeks! No more growling. I donât get any treat at all if I donât follow what she says.

??SPECIAL NEED:??

I cannot be adopted by first time dog owner. This is because I am still a puppy and have been through a lot. I have a big personality that tests limits sometimes. I need someone to be in charge who can lovingly teach and show me my boundaries in the home. I am very loyal and protective of my family and great companion pupper.

NorCal Bully Breed Rescue is a foster based rescue with foster homes spread all throughout the Sacramento area. We usually require our adopters to be within a 50 to 100 mile radius of us, depending on the dog, and depending on the home. This is because we need to do a yard check to guarantee that the potential adopter's yard is secure, and also have them be close enough should any behavioral issues arise, and the assistance of our trainer is needed. We are, however, willing to adopt out of our area, including the Bay Area, Tahoe, and even further. We've even adopted out of state on very special occasions. We try our best to match our dogs to the perfect homes, and match them based on their personalities, not their looks. Adoptions are not done on a first come, first serve basis, rather in the order of what homes are the right match for that particular dog. Our adoption fees are based on the dog and range from $200-$350. In the case of senior dogs (6+ years), fees will be waived to the right home. This includes spay/neuter, vaccines, microchip, and deworming (if necessary). 

Groot's adoption donation is $200.

Interested in meeting Groot or any of our available pooches?  Complete and submit our adoption application on our website norcalbullybreedrescue.com and we will respond to you within 24 to 48 hours.

name: Reagan!
description:
GREAT WITH CATS, CHICKENS, AND OTHER DOGS!!

Are you looking for a gorgeous girl who is good with dogs, cats and even chickens?! Then look no further because Reagan is your girl!!!

What is your name? Reagan

How old are you? Iâm about 6 years old.

How much do you weigh? Iâm about 60lbs.

What do you look like? Iâm mostly brindle with a white belly and chest, some white on my feet, a black muzzle and black around my eyes which make my eyes stand out.

What do you like to eat? Anything and everything! I get kibble at meal time and training treats, bits of cheese, veggies, or meat when I do good. Those are my favorite! I also sneak over to the chickenâs crumble when Iâm outside and they share with me! There hasnât been anything I havenât liked yet.

What kind of personality do you have? Iâm told that Iâm the sweetest, most lovable girl ever! I make friends everywhere I go. Iâm a big pleaser. I always check in with my human to make sure that theyâre happy with what Iâm doing. I would take belly rubs and pets over anything and will stare into your eyes the whole time youâre petting me. Iâm calm when Iâm in the house or my crate but love walks, hiking or chasing my ball outside!

Describe your perfect day: My perfect day would be waking up with my family, going outside to stretch and potty, then have breakfast. Then go for a walk around the neighborhood before coming back for a long nap. After my nap we would play in the backyard, Iâd lay out to sunbathe on the lawn and then fetch my ball until it was dinner time and get one more nap in. After dinner I would hang out in the yard while my foster mom waters everything then itâd be bedtime.

What is your favorite toy? My favorite toy right now is my blue solid kong ball! I take it in my crate with me so it doesnât get lost and love chasing it outside. Iâm told Iâm not very gentle with stuffing filled toys, apparently Iâm not supposed to shred them... who knew??

Do you know any tricks? I know sit, down (lay down), stay, and I know not to jump up on people! I know when Iâm told âeasyâ while being given a treat to take it gently from my humans hand. My foster mom swears I know what âgo pottyâ and âdinnerâ mean. I also know to fetch the ball but Iâm still learning drop... I prefer keeping the ball until I get belly rubs and then Iâll let you grab it from my mouth. Win-win.

What scares you? I donât like super loud noises or the hose.

Have you been around children? Do you like them? My human foster sister is 9 and we have lots of fun. I havenât been around any babies or really young children but I probably would really like them too. I like all people because people = pets and belly rubs!

Do you like cats? YEP! I know to be gentle with them. I just wish theyâd play more instead of lying around the house all day.

How do you feel about other dogs? Dogs are okay with slow proper introductions. I love my older foster dog brother, my little foster dog sister is kind of crazy and a lot to handle sometimes.

If you could be anywhere in the world, where would it be? Anywhere with people, especially MY people.

How is your health? My health is great now! I was rescued from the shelter with a tumor on my neck that I was going to be âput to sleepâ for.... whatever that means. But I got lucky! NBBR came for me and got me the best care. I had surgery to remove it all. Iâm now all healed up and they say I have a clean bill of health!

Who do you live with in your foster home and who is your closest companion? I live with my foster mom, foster dad, my foster human sister, my older foster dog brother, my younger foster dog sister, two older foster cat sisters and five really big foster bird sisters that the humans call chickens. Iâm closest to my foster mom because she works from home and spends allll day with me!

Where do you hang out when you are home alone? I stay in my crate when my humans arenât home. I actually like it in there... I have bones to chew on, my ball and a comfy bed that is all mine.

Where do you sleep? My crate.

Do you like walking on a leash? Yep! A leash means I get to go on a walk. Every once in awhile Iâll pull a little if I smell something really good or see people that obviously really want to pet me but I know not to drag my human.

Do you have any \"not-so-great\" habits that we should know about? For instance, do you bark or dig in the yard? My foster mom says not really, she says I behave better than my foster dog brother and sister! Iâm not a big barker but sometimes Iâll chime in when the other foster dogs bark but my foster mom says thatâs not my fault because my little foster dog sister usually starts it over nothing and Iâm just backing her up.

Are you house trained? (Meaning do you go potty outside). Of course, Iâm 6! Iâve only had one accident since I came to my foster home over two months ago. Iâm very proud of that because it makes my humans happy! Iâll go potty before bed and hold it for up to 8-9 hours until morning and I go outside. On the rare occasion I forget to go potty while Iâm outside before bed.... Iâll whine for my human to let me outside to go potty really quick.

Do you like water? I like drinking water and putting my feet in the water but Iâm not a big swimmer.

What do you love about your foster family? I love that they have taken such good care of me and spend so much time with me. They make me feel safe. Theyâve also taken me to do lots of new things like camping and riding in a boat.

What was your life like before being brought into NorCal Bully Breed Rescue? I was adopted from the shelter as a puppy by my old family but returned six years later to the same shelter when I got the funny lump on my neck. I was at that noisy, scary shelter for about a month before NBBR came and saved me! I have been at my foster home ever since and Iâm finally ready to find my forever home with a family that will love me no matter what!

NorCal Bully Breed Rescue is a foster based rescue with foster homes spread all throughout the Sacramento area. We usually require our adopters to be within a 50 to 100 mile radius of us, depending on the dog, and depending on the home. This is because we need to do a yard check to guarantee that the potential adopter's yard is secure, and also have them be close enough should any behavioral issues arise, and the assistance of our trainer is needed. We are, however, willing to adopt out of our area, including the Bay Area, Tahoe, and even further. We've even adopted out of state on very special occasions. We try our best to match our dogs to the perfect homes, and match them based on their personalities, not their looks. Adoptions are not done on a first come, first serve basis, rather in the order of what homes are the right match for that particular dog. Our adoption fees are based on the dog and range from $200-$350. In the case of senior dogs (6+ years), fees will be waived to the right home. This includes spay/neuter, vaccines, microchip, and deworming (if necessary). 

Reagan's adoption donation is $200.

Interested in meeting Reagan or any of our available pooches?  Complete and submit our adoption application on our website norcalbullybreedrescue.com and we will respond to you within 2-4 business days.

name: Blake
description:
Blake is a very laid back gentle giant .  He requires routine , stable quiet environment .  No toddlers , older children are fine .  He likes his space .  he is not a back yard working dog ,   he loves to be with his humans .  He needs time to adjust .  Once he bonds he wants to go back to where he use to live .  Time and patients are needed .  Lots of walks , minimum of two a day , he loves his walks .  He is totally housebroken , walks well on a leash , he has a stubborn side to him and he is very large .  If you are interested in him email forpetsake@sbcglobal.net   ask for a application .    He is a amazing dog .  Look up the breed  Ackbash , see if this is the dog for you .  It is not cookie cutter . he is a family dog . loves to be with his human .  BTW  he does smile and it is so great to wake up to . 
 (530) 263-3331

name: Baby
description:
My name is Baby and I am 10 years old!

Baby is a staff and volunteer favorite!! She absolutely LOVES to go for walks and walks nicely on a leash. When she gets out into a socialization yard, she will bounce around happily like a puppy! Baby knows Sit and loves treats. She is also said to give a big kiss to anyone who takes her out on a walk to say thank you: it's the sweetest! She is a big, happy wiggle worm who would love people of her own to go walking with. Is it you?

\"I don't have a history with dogs, but bring your dog down to meet with me to see how we get along!\

name: JACK
description: Hi, my name is JACK and I'm a neutered 10-month-old male.  My sister, Jill and I were brought to rescue because our owners could no longer keep us and a local vet called the rescue lady to ask for help.  We were going to be put to sleep because no one wanted us.  I am a sweetheart and affectionate and love to cuddle.  I do need secure fencing and it would be great if you could fall in love with my sister too so we could stay together, but we understand if you can't do that.  I love to go for walks with the volunteers and ride nicely in the car and was a good boy for the vet.  I'm young, handsome and ready to have a home that will love and take care of me.  I would be suited for a small farm and have been around other animals.  Do you think you could love and keep me forever?  I just want to be loved, is that so bad?  I'm just a baby.

name: JILL
description: Hi, my name is JILL and I'm a spayed 10-month-old female.  My brother Jack and I were brought to rescue because our owners could no longer keep us and a local vet called the rescue lady to ask for help.  We were going to be put to sleep because no one wanted us.  I am a sweetheart and affectionate and love to cuddle.  I do need secure fencing and it would be great if you could fall in love with my brother two so we could stay together, but we understand if you can't do that.  I love to go for walks with the volunteers and ride nicely in the car and was a good girl for the vet.  I'm young, pretty and ready to have a home that will love and take care of me.  I would be suited for a small farm and have been around other animals.  Do you think you could love and keep me forever?  I just want to be loved, is that so bad?  I'm just a baby.

name: LUCY
description: Hi, I'm Lucy and I'm about 2-3 yrs old and spayed.  That's why I'm wearing my pink jacket.  It keeps me from licking or scratching my spay stitches.  I was found tied with a chain to a box in a field after being there for over a year.  Most times I wasn't fed or watered.  I was frightened when I arrived here at the rescue, but I'm not anymore.  I love the attention and seek it out.  I follow the rescue lady everywhere in the yard and want to tell her how grateful I am.  She feeds me great food and cooks me and the other chicken that she puts in our meals.  And the treats here are glorious.  I had no idea life could be so wonderful.  The rescue lady promised me that someone would come and love me and that I will get the kind of home I should have had.  I am sweet, love to go for walks and get brushed and will snuggle you. I'd be fine around older children or an adult home.  Cats are OK and some dogs are too.  I need secure fencing and I need a home where someone will be there to spend time with me. I'm a quiet dog and sometimes I worry when I'm alone but I'm doing better every day.  I could love you if you let me, I really do want to trust and be loved too.

name: Scooby
description: Scooby is a very cool dog! He is so extremely loving and playful. He is also handsome and smart! Scooby LOVES to play fetch, and will chew up any ball that is not a kong toy. Scooby loves fetch so much, that he gets to be protective and possessive of his toys. If he is adopted into a family with another dog, the adopters will need to exercise plenty of caution when he has his toys! Scooby LOVES cats! He has already been neutered and is up to date on all of his vaccinations.

name: DeeDee
description: DeeDee is a very affectionate and energetic little girl. DeeDee is a special case as she was ceased by animal control officers from a terrible situation, found starving with her siblings. This is why she craves so much attention, she just wants to feel loved and secure. DeeDee will need to be adopted into a very patient home, with adopters who are willing to work with her daily and give her the affection she deserves. DeeDee would do best in a home without small children or cats as she gets very excited and jumpy at times. To learn more about this special little girl, give us a call at (209) 984 - 5489.

name: Fluffy Face 8-93-19
description:
Fluffy Face is a playful old man who loves splashing in his pool and playing with tennis balls. With how spunky and energetic he is, you'd never guess he was a senior!

Fluffy Face loves meeting new people and dogs, and can snatch a ball right out of the air! A gentle and adoring dog, he's the ideal family pet.

Fluffy Face is current on his DHPP and rabies vaccines, and is microchipped and heart worm tested negative. Come by and meet him-- he won't be here long!

name: Bella 8-89-19
description:
Are you looking for a patient, affectionate dog that gets along with other animals? Look no further than Bella!

Bella came in to the shelter with 11 other dogs, so she's used to a busy household and rubbing shoulders with her canine companions. Bella is playful and patient with other dogs, and loves to be the first in line to get pets and snuggles from people.

With her striking eyes and friendly disposition, Bella is an absolute catch! She's also current on her DHPP and rabies vaccines, and is microchipped and heart worm tested negative. Come by Sammie's Friends to meet her today!

name: Gruntz 8-88-19
description:
As you can see, Gruntz is a beautiful dog. What you can't see is that he's also a great one!

Friendly and outgoing with both people and dogs, Gruntz is an easy boy with a lot to say. In true husky fashion, he likes to sing songs back in his kennel, though he quiets down once he's the center of attention.

Gruntz enjoys playing in the yard with his human and doggy friends, and going for his daily walks. When he's not running around, Gruntz enjoys a real good chew on a bully stick, or a nap in an air conditioned room.

Gruntz is current on his DHPP and rabies vaccines and is microchipped and heart worm tested negative. Come meet this handsome man before someone else snatches him up!
