name: Dewey
description:
DARLING DEWEY

Dewey is a 4 year old, male Chinese Sharpei Pit Bull Terrier mix.
He is so cute with all of his Sharpei worried-looking wrinkles and his soulful Pit Bull eyes that when you see him, you just want to get to know him!
He is a stocky boy and weighs 66.5# of muscle.
His coat is black with a hint of brindle mixed in and he has handsome white markings on his chest. 
As soon as we took Dewey in to get to know him and take his photos, our first impressions were that this is a loving dog who is also pushy and demanding! He wants to please and be liked but doesnât know patience yet. He loves to be petted and liked cuddling and snuggling on the sofa. When we introduced him to stuffed animal toys he buried his face in their softness like he had never experienced such fun and pleasure. It was adorable to watch.
Dewey is excitable and it takes him awhile to calm down. He has a bundle of energy that needs to be directed towards proper channels. He will need a life with medium to high level activities.
He needs to continue to learn how to walk properly on a leash as he still pulls and is quite strong.  He is smart and he is so happy to be with people that it is just a matter of time until he makes the connection that walking nicely makes people like him more. He loves treats and will pay attention to you to earn them.

Dewey is very pushy with other dogs and is not very sensitive to correction about this behavior. We think he will do best in a home where he is the only dog.
He will do best in a home with no cats. He becomes intensely focused when he sees a cat and pulls hard to chase them.

Dewey is a handsome, lovable, wonderful guy who needs a dog savvy, experienced person or family to adopt him. He has a fun goofy side to him that is really enjoyable to be around. He is also confident and assertive, and so he needs boundaries and he needs to view his new person(s) as pack leaders. Dewey would benefit tremendously from obedience classes which will guide him in the right direction and form a wonderful bond with his new people. 

Dewey is neutered, microchipped, hw tested negative, and up to date on vaccines and preventatives. 

Dewey can be seen at the Placer County Animal Services Center 
11232 B Avenue, Auburn, CA 95603

Shelter hours:
Monday - Saturday: 10:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. (Adoptions end at 4:30 p.m.)
Closed Sundays and County holidays 

Call tel:  #530.886.5541 for further information on Dewey.

She is loyal and connects deeply to her person. She came to us after her owner passed away. She is looking for some one to love her and be her best friend for her golden years. 

Are you her special someone?

name: Milo (CA)
description:
Little Milo has good reason to think that 7 is his lucky number. When he turned 7 months old, this 7-lb. Rattie mix was rescued from an environment where he had little contact with humans. And after just 7 days, Milo had determined that people weren't so scary after all. He stopped running from his foster mom and started cozying up to her on the couch. Now he's settling in and beginning to work on house-training, walking on leash, and some basic commands. Milo is a good pup, who sleeps quietly in his crate at night and gets along with other dogs as long as they're calm and gentle. (Bossy, rough-housing dogs are scary.) Milo will still need time and patience to overcome his early months of deprivation, but he's fairly certain that a nurturing human who wants to help is reading about him right now. Talk about luck! See more photos of Milo at https://imageevent.com/newrattitude/milo .
Our adoption fee is $175 for adult dogs or $225 for puppies under 6 months old.

If you are interested in adopting this dog,
PLEASE READ THE DETAILED ADOPTION PROCESS information on our website
at www.
NewRattitude.org/adopt/

From there, you can access our adoption application or contact our Adoption Team for more info.

name: Lucy*
description:
Fully vetted, spayed 8 year old female
UTD on vaccinations
Adoption fee $250

Hi there Lucy here, 15 pounds, chi Mix, 8 years old. I am looking to spend the rest of my life peacefully as I was saved by Scooters from a high kill shelter. Since then I have had my dental and have a clean bill of health. I like other dogs and am super sweet but I donât like to be picked up unless I know you well enough. Last time someone picked me up they took me straight to the shelter so I take my time to trust people. I will do well in a home with no children and someone who can dote on me. I have all the time and love in the world to give to you. Can you love me back?

If interested please fill out an adoption application.

name: Lulu
description: Meet Lula! She is a 7 year old spayed female beagle mix and she is just a lump of pure sweetness! Unfortunately we do not have much of a background on Lula as she was a stray brought to the shelter. However someone did a great job on training her! She is potty trained, knows basic commands, is great with car rides, and loves going along on errands. Her two favorite things are snuggles and walks, mainly snuggles. She can be a little shy at first but once she warms up she will be glued to you and melt your heart. Ms. Lula has a small dog body and is believed to be mixed with Rat Terrier, chihuahua, and/or dachshund but her color, tail, and wiggle butt are 100% beagle. She has the cutest ears, one perks up and one lops back! We believe she may have had to fend for herself for a bit as she was food territorial at first and did try to scavenge but with some coaxing and love she has drastically improved. She is good with other dogs but would be great in a home where she can get lots of attention, a lap to lay in, and someone to curl up in bed next to as we do not believe she is crate trained. If youâre looking for a mellow girl with a load of love and personality to snuggle with, Ms. Lula is youâre girl!

name: Gracie!
description:
?Look at the Gorgeous girl Gracie!!! She is now available for adoption!?

What is your name? Gracie

How old are you? About 3 years old

How much do you weigh? About 60 lbs

What do you look like? 
Iâm short and cute ? I have beautiful grey and white fur and beautiful hazel eyes.

What do you like to eat?
Kibble and treats are good but I also like carrots and apples with some peanut butter!

What kind of personality do you have?
Iâm an outgoing girl. Once Iâve warmed up to you Iâll show you Iâm very playful and love to give kisses lots of kisses. 

Describe your perfect day:? 
My perfect day would be getting up to you! Going for a walk, having breakfast and playing in the yard with a friend or toys. Then hanging out with you in or out of the house. Iâm down for anything especially road trips! I love car rides and I stay very calm in the back seat. 

What is your favorite toy? 
I love anything that squeaks  

Do you know any tricks?
I know sit, wait, easy and crate. I love to play fetch too! 

What scares you? 
If you raise your voice because I think your mad at me.

Have you been around children? Yes, teenagers and I love them. I havenât been around younger children but Iâm sure I would love them too. 

Do you like cats?
I am very interested in cats and my foster mom is teaching me to be calm around them. 

How do you feel about other dogs? 
Other dogs are great. I havenât met one I didnât like ?

If you could be anywhere in the world, where would it be ?
With you where ever you go. 

How is your health?
Now Iâm in good shape. My foster mom has taken good care of me. I do have a 2-3 heart murmur, what ever that is, it doesnât slow me down as I run and play like all the other dogs. 

Who do you live with in your foster home and who is your closest companion? 
My foster family consists of my foster mom, my foster fur sisters and fur brother. 

Where do you hang out when you are home alone?
In my crate! My crate is in the family room so I can be near my foster fur sisters and fur brother. 

Where do you sleep?
In my crate in my foster momâs room

Do you like walking on a leash? 
Oh yes! Iâm very good on a leash. I never pull and stay right next to you. 

Do you have any \"not-so-great\" habits that we should know about? For instance, do you bark or dig in the yard? 
Nope, but I will alert bark when I sense you need to know something is going on. 

Are you house trained? (Meaning do you go potty outside): yes, Iâm very good at going potty outside. My foster mom lets me go potty before she leaves for work and again when she gets home. Iâm good and never potty in my crate. Once my foster mom is home and on weekends I use the dog door. I love that thing! 

Do you like playing in water? 
I havenât been to the lake yet but Iâm not afraid of the hose and baths are not a problem. 

What do you love about your foster family? 
I love that my foster mom has been patient with me while I learned the rules of the house. I feel happy and safe there. My fur sisters and fur brother are fun to play with too. 

What was your life like before being joining NBBR?
My human family wasnât the best. They kept me crated and making babies. That was my past and Iâm looking forward to my future with you.

*NorCal Bully Breed Rescue is a foster based rescue with foster homes spread throughout the Sacramento area. We require our adopters to be within a 50 to 100 mile radius of us, depending on the dog and the home. This allows us to complete a yard check to guarantee the applicant's yard is secure, and have the dog close enough should any behavioral issues arise. We are, however, willing to adopt out of our area, including the Bay Area, Tahoe, and even further. We've even adopted out of state on very special occasions. We try our best to match our dogs to the perfect homes, and match them based on their personalities, not their looks. Adoptions are not done on a first come, first serve basis, rather based on what homes are the right match for that particular dog. Our adoption fees are based on the dog and range from $200-$350. In the case of senior dogs (6+ years), fees will be waived to the right home. This includes spay/neuter, vaccines, microchip, and deworming (if necessary).

**Interested in meeting Gracie or any of our available pooches? Complete and submit our adoption application on our website norcalbullybreedrescue.com and we will respond to you within 24 to 48 hours.

I get along well when introduced to other calm dogs with a proper introduction.  Did I mention I love people?  I am a 2 year old, 85 pound male German Shepherd mix with tons of personality. description: Hi Iâm Rocky and Iâm a happy, happy, boy that loves, loves, people!  Iâm a super sweet, 10 month old 55 pound German Shepherd puppy but I need to gain about 10-15 pounds.  I have lots of energy and love to run around the yard and try to catch bugs! but am calm in the house when you want me to be calm. name: zz COURTESY LISTING zz Buddy
description:
Hello, my name is Astrid and I have a small, neutered German Shepherd boy named Buddy. I have lost my home and job and need to return to Switzerland in less then 3 weeks. This is all very heart breaking bit I am not able to bring him over seas with me.
He is a pleaser and the ultimate cuddler. He listens and walks almost perfect on the leash. We had contact with a lot of different people, children, and even cats and he is very mellow. His personality is a little on the any side and I realizes that hiking men with big hats and backpacks and sticks scared him. Other than that, he is perfect.
He is not food aggressive at all and loves the outdoors. He is a great hiker and learned how to swim. But not crazy obsessed about water. He listens so very well and seems to understand what I need and want from him before I verbally address it.
I had him wait in the car for over 1 hour and he just sleeps away, waiting without destroying anything. I love him so much but do not see a future for myself here anymore. Very sad but hopeful to find him a forever home through you. 
702-481-6778

name: Minnow
description:
Gender: Female
Age: ~14 months
Weight: 55 pounds
Energy: Moderate to high
Drive: Moderate
Location: Grass Valley, California

If you like water, you'll love Minnow. This energetic girl took to it like, well, a minnow! At her first swimming lesson, she progressed from zero to full throttle in about 15 minutes, quickly deciding to jump in the pool on her own. Now there's no stopping her. Water makes her silly and happy and playful. She'll retrieve a toy on land if she must, but will fetch gleefully if it's thrown in the pool. Dock diving is an obvious choice for formal sports. When she's not jumping in the pool, she's off exploring with her nose, so competitive nosework is another option. Whatever she does for exercise, she'll need a lot of it, every day.

An active family could play team tag to keep her busy; when one arm gets tired of throwing, someone else's could take over. But fun as she is, Minnow needs more than just play. She needs someone committed to providing her with firm, structured learning, as she can be stubborn if pushed the wrong way. However, with the right approach, Minnow tries hard to learn what's wanted. She's smart and food-motivated. A trainer or someone working with a trainer will help bring out Minnow's best.

One thing Minnow needs work on is barking, or rather not barking. She can't stand being left out, and will make your ears pay for it if you have fun without her. As long as she's included she doesn't bark. Getting her worn out with playing helps too. She's learning to control the barking some, but will need appropriate, consistent training to overcome the habit. Although she has not pottied in the house and she doesn't tear things up when free, she'll need a little work on continuing to learn what's okay in the house and on not tearing up anything hanging on her crate.

Minnow's other main area for improvement is her reaction to some dogs. She tries to dominate them, which is not always well received. Exposure to other dogs while wearing a muzzle seems to be helping her learn to just sniff briefly and walk along. A loving, patient, but firm and knowledgeable person would be perfect for helping her catch up on social skills. She would do best as a single dog or in a home with a larger male.

With people, Minnow is a sweetheart. She loves everyone and especially loves to cuddle. She's great at the vet's, making friends with all the staff, and is fine albeit overexcited with visitors. She's shown no aggression toward children but might try to dominate them if allowed, by jumping on them for instance. Since Minnow is so affectionate she'd probably love to sleep with her people but she accepts a crate at night (and in the car) as well, with a little coaxing to lure her in. Or maybe she'd be happy sleeping on a float in the pool ....

WEST COAST ADOPTIONS ONLY

Must have previous or current, purebred Malinois experience OR other high drive working breed experience

Our adoption process includes- completion of an application, followed by a telephone interview. If that goes well, we will arrange for a home visit.
Adoption Fee: $400.00. Transport along Interstate 5 (Bakersfield, CA to Bellingham, WA) is available but cost not included in adoption fee. 

Please visit www.woofproject.org and fill out an adoption application located here https://www.woofproject.org/application

name: Bria
description: This girl went viral because of a pitiful video that was posted of her, she was scared and trembling.  Never fear, this girl had a foster step up and now sheâs ready to live the good life.  This is what her foster mom says â We like to refer to her as Beautiful beauty queen Bria.  She is completely housebroken, knows some commands like sit and lay, she also catches treats in the air. She goes right in her dog bed at night and goes to sleep at the foot of the bed. She is such a good girl, she will get up in the middle of the night and touch you with her paw to go outside. She loves car rides and she needs lots of love! She is very good around other dogs - Bria is a gentle soul.

name: zz Bailey
description:
COURTESY LISTING 

Bailey is a 4 year old, spayed Plot Hound Mix. She is a healthy girl and up on all her shots and preventatives and a great watchdog. She is sweet, loyal and loving. Bailey loves to run around and occasionally chase the UPS driver from the other side of the fence. Bailey knows some basic commands but could use some additional training. She loves the snow and is good in the water. She is very good working with treats and loves to chew a bone. She comes when called and does not mind being outside or inside whichever you would like. She is known to be a couch dog. We do not recommend another dog in the house. Further, she is known to havea lot of energy at times so she may not be suitable for children. Bailey needs a new home because there is another dog in the house, and a new baby just two weeks ago.

Ryan

name: Magic
description:
Do you believe in MAGIC?
Well here is your chance to add a little magic to your life!

Magic is a beautiful, medium sized, 55 # female Pit Bull Terrier Mix. She is  5 years old, and has a red/brindle coat with a splash of white under her chin and a white blaze on her chest.

She is affectionate and attentive towards people. She is confident, outgoing and independent.  She has a calm nature,  and can be reserved and sensitive. Magic loves to spend time with staff and volunteers.   She has so much love to give. She will be a devoted companion.  

She is very sweet and mellow. She loves to go on walks and has good leash manners. She will walk right by your side.

Magic knows how to sit, but we think she can be taught any obedience skill if enough time is given to training.  
She is smart and is  receptive to correction.  She may get in you personal space but she wants to please so she will listen to what you want her to do.

Magic  wants to pull towards cats and wants to chase, so introductions and selective choices will be important with Magic.  She is somewhat sensitive to correction when being around cats so you may be able to work with her.
Magic is very pushy around dogs but may be OK if the dog is submissive and leaves her alone.  She does not like dogs within her space.  Just like the cats above, she is selective with dogs and proper introductions are a must.  A savvy and experienced dog owner is recommended. 

Magic is a sweet girl who loves to cuddle on the couch and be petted as she snuggles. She also loves to play with toys. We gave her a squeaky toy and she seemed amazed by it, like a little puppy would be, which led us to think it may have been a first for her! Wouldnât it be great to be the person or family who spoils this special dog with toys and attention, maybe for the very first time in her 5 year life ?

Magic is spayed,  microchipped, hw tested negative, and up to date on vaccines and preventatives. 

Magic can be seen at the Placer County Animal Services Center 
11232 B Avenue, Auburn, CA 95603

Shelter hours:
Monday - Saturday: 10:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. (Adoptions end at 4:30 p.m.)
Closed Sundays and County holidays 
Call telephone # 530.886.5541 for further information on Magic

name: FRANK
description:
FRANK SINATRA 2.0

Frank is a strikingly handsome blue-eyed Pit Bull Terrier. He has a flashy black, white and brindle, smooth coat and a muscular 80# body. He is around 7 years old, which qualifies him for our Seniors for Seniors special, where his adoption fee is waived for approved adopters over the age of 55!

Frank might be a little reserved when he first meets you but warms up quickly. In fact we discovered he is a big-time cuddle-bug and he loves to snuggle right up to you on the sofa. He would sit his 80 pounds of love right on your lap if heâd fit!

He is full of confident personality and is getting used to the leash and the staff and volunteers see improvement in his leash manners. They said he is super relaxed and wonderful on the leash. 

Frank is a sweetie and is smart and responsive and sensitive to correction. He is careful and gentle and independent.
He is becoming more relaxed at the shelter and is more friendly and attentive towards people. He was nervous about being touched or petted when he first arrived but you can see by his photos that he is now showing his affection and comfort with people. 

Frank loves balls and gets very excited when he is in the chill room or play yard with one.

He appears to respect cats and should be okay with them after proper introductions.
He should also be okay with other dogs with proper introductions, although he might be shy or a little pushy, and he is only slightly sensitive to correction under those circumstances.

Frank is the complete package. He is beautiful, lovable, smart, warm and affectionate. He has paid attention to expectations during the short time he has been in the shelter and has continued to learn and grow and will easily fit into a new domestic environment.

He will need an adopter or a family with dog savvy and dog owning experience. He will need low to medium level activity in his life.  Frank will make someone a fun, loyal walking companion or a pup who will play fetch in the backyard.

Make Frank - aka Mr Blue Eyes, part of your family and you will have a loyal, sweet companion beside you.

Frank is neutered, microchipped, hw tested negative, and up to date on vaccines and preventatives. 

Frank can be seen at the Placer County Animal Services Center 
11232 B Avenue, Auburn, CA 95603

Shelter hours:
Monday - Saturday: 10:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. (Adoptions end at 4:30 p.m.)
Closed Sundays and County holidays 

Call telephone # 530.886.5541 for further information on Frank

name: Mia (CA)
description:
Mamma Mia, this is one pretty little Rattie mix! Weighing a petite 10 lbs., 1-year-old Mia is quite shy but ever so eager to please her people. She has adjusted nicely to her foster home, and she's sure to fit right into your home too. She gets along with her two female foster sisters, both Rat Terriers, but she's especially fond of her foster brother, a big Golden Retriever! Mia settles down quickly for the night in her crate and walks politely on leash. She's working on house-training and basic commands and making good progress on both. Wouldn't you love to adopt a cutie like Mia? Check out more photos of Mia in her online album at http://imageevent.com/newrattitude/mia .
Our adoption fee is $175 for adult dogs or $225 for puppies under 6 months old.

If you are interested in adopting this dog,
PLEASE READ THE DETAILED ADOPTION PROCESS information on our website
at www.

name: PUPPY - Lukas
description:
Have you been waiting to adopt your very own derp seal?!? Act fast, because? LUKAS ? is available! Young, smart, and water loving ?

What is your name? 
Lukas

How old are you? 
Less than one year old (a/o 7/29)

How much do you weigh? 
About 60lbs

What do you look like? 
I am grey and white with the most beautiful matching grey eyes. My face is white with a grey patch and my body is mostly grey.

What do you like to eat? 
I currently eat Nutro puppy food but my humans havenât found anything I wonât eat yet. I love treats!

What kind of personality do you have? 
I am active and love to play. Once I have played for a while I will lay day and relax while watching a movie as long as I have a bone or toy to chew on. Once the movie is over I am usually ready to play again.

Describe your perfect day: 
My perfect day would be to explore the backyard or go for a walk. Once I have tired myself out I would love to relax near humans. I also love to go for car rides. And I love to eat. I would be happy doing anything with people.

What is your favorite toy? 
I think everything is a toy. I especially love anything I can carry around with me or chew on. I like balls but I am still learning to bring them back after someone gives them to me.

Do you know any tricks? 
I know sit, wait, shake, leave it, and down. I will do just about anything for treats and am eager to learn. My fosters also taught me to ring a bell before I go outside. I havenât learned to use it to let them know when I need to go outside on my own yet.

What scares you? 
I am not afraid of loud noises but Iâm still trying to figure out my humans robot vacuum. It doesnât scare me too much but I am still trying to figure it out.

Have you been around children? Do you like them?
I have only met one small child and I was so excited. My fosters think I would

Do you like cats? 
My fosters donât have any cats so they havenât been able to introduce me to one.

How do you feel about other dogs? 
The shelter says I tested well with dogs. My foster sister is a senior girl and a little cranky. I finally won her over and she plays chase with me! Sometimes I get too excited and she corrects men but I am the perfect gentleman and I do whatever she says.

If you could be anywhere in the world, where would it be? Anywhere with people. I love to go on walks and explore things outside with them.

How is your health? I am in great health.

Who do you live with your foster home and who is your closest companion? 
I live with adults in my foster home. And I love them so much. I donât really know which one is my favorite because I love everyone. I also live with an older resident dog but we havenât spent any one on one time together. She is a bit overwhelmed by my happy disposition.

Where do you hang out when you are home alone? 
When my foster parents are not home I nap in my crate.

Where do you sleep? 
I sleep in my crate

Do you like walking on a leash? 
I love to go for walks and do really well. Sometimes I get excited and have to be reminded to continue on my walk.

Do you have any \"not-so-great\" habits that we should know about? For instance, do you bark or dig in the yard? I am a puppy so my foster parents are constantly reminding me that I can't chew on everything. When I get really excited I try to nibble on anything but they do a really good job of reminding me to âleave itâ and redirecting me. My fosters give me lots of toys but if I am not supervised I have been know to find a shoe. I'm a puppy, remember?

I also like to jump. When I get really excited, I need to be reminded of âoffâ. When my fosters let me out of my crate I get really excited. It helps when they put me on a leash and take me right out side to potty. Usually I have calmed down enough by then that I remember my manners.

Are you house trained? (Meaning do you go potty outside) 
I go potty outside but my foster parents keep a really good eye on me so that I donât have any accidents.

Do you like water? 
I think the hose is the greatest thing in the world. My foster parents are working with me on self control because I am so in love with it that I forget anything else exists when water comes out of it. I have played in a kiddie pool but we havenât been able to go to the river or any lakes.

What do you love about your foster family? 
I love when they take me for walks and scratch my back. If I could be anywhere in the world it would be with people.

What was your life like before being brought into NorCal Bully Breed Rescue?
My fosters arenât really sure what life was like before I came to the rescue. Someone left me tied to a shelter door and they contacted NBBR. My foster said they called NBBR because I am so sweet (and adorable) so they came and rescued me. I was limping when they first rescued me but after lots of rest I am walking perfectly.

NorCal Bully Breed Rescue is a foster based rescue with foster homes spread all throughout the Sacramento area. We usually require our adopters to be within a 50 to 100 mile radius of us, depending on the dog, and depending on the home. This is because we need to do a yard check to guarantee that the potential adopter's yard is secure, and also have them be close enough should any behavioral issues arise, and the assistance of our trainer is needed. We are, however, willing to adopt out of our area, including the Bay Area, Tahoe, and even further. We've even adopted out of state on very special occasions. We try our best to match our dogs to the perfect homes, and match them based on their personalities, not their looks. Adoptions are not done on a first come, first serve basis, rather in the order of what homes are the right match for that particular dog. Our adoption fees are based on the dog and range from $200-$350. In the case of senior dogs (6+ years), fees will be waived to the right home. This includes spay/neuter, vaccines, microchip, and deworming (if necessary). 

Lukas's adoption donation is $350.

Interested in meeting Lukas or any of our available pooches?  Complete and submit our adoption application on our website norcalbullybreedrescue.com and we will respond to you within 24 to 48 hours.

name: Jack
description:
Meet Jack the 9 year old Jack Russell Terrier mix. He is dog friendly, not so good with cats but he sure is sweet.

To adopt please apply online at foac.us or for more information please contact the facility (209)533-3622 Monday-Saturday 10am-2pm

name: Angus
description:
Angus (formerly âTroublesâ) originally found himself at Stanislaus County Animal Shelter in January, 2019. He was healthy and in good shape, and luckily he was also microchipped, so he was reunited with his owners. Six months later, Angus once again found himself at the shelter, only this time his owners didnât come to claim him, and he was in bad shape: his right leg is non-functioning, his spine is out of whack, and he has scars all over his body. Though weâll never know exactly what happened to Angus in the six months between leaving the shelter and coming back, it definitely wasnât good.

In spite of everything, Angus is a sweetheart! His body may be broken, but his spirit isnât; he still trusts people, and isnât reactive to other dogs in non-stressful settings. He is working through some separation anxiety, which isnât surprising given what little we know of his history, and will have his medical needs assessed and addressed before going to a forever home. In general, he just wants to be touched, hugged, scratched, and loved. His resilience is astounding!

To keep up with Angus, check out #SacRDRAngus on Facebook and Instagram @resilientdogrescue

name: Bella
description:
Poor Bella was listed as 8-years-old and pregnant in a local area shelter, where volunteers had taken to affectionately calling her âGrannyâ. She was literally down to her last day on Earth and scheduled to be euthanized at 5:00pm, and lucky for us all she made it out by 4:30pm!

Upon getting Bella in to a vet post-shelter decompression, it was discovered that Bella isnât a mama or granny after all â sheâs actually quite young, and an ultrasound determined that she is not pregnant! Bella has clearly had at least one previous litter, and likely lived a pretty rough life on the streets given the state of her teeth, but thatâs all in the past now! No more puppies for this young thang â sheâs ready to find a forever family who will treat her the way she deserves for years to come!

To keep up with Bella, check out #SacRDRBella on Facebook and Instagram @resilientdogrescue

name: Sugar
description: To keep up with Sugar, check out #SacRDRSugar on Facebook and Instagram @resilientdogrescue

name: Phoebe
description:
Mama Phoebe came to SacRDR from the Stanislaus County Animal Shelter late in her pregnancy; after 48 hours in labor without any progress, her eight large puppies were successfully delivered via emergency c-section!

Phoebe was not a huge fan of mothering, and luckily she wonât have to go through the stress of caring for a litter ever again! Now that her puppies have been weaned and moved into separate foster homes, Phoebe is finally learning what it means to be a rescue dog! She can be a little anxious, particularly when it comes to unexpected loud noises, and is working toward becoming a relaxed, more calm and balanced dog with training. She is a huge lover of all people, and with patience and consistency sheâll make a wonderful addition to someoneâs family.

To keep up with Phoebe, check out #SacRDRPhoebe and #SacRDRFriends on Facebook and Instagram @ resilientdogrescue

name: Harley
description:
Harley came to SacRDR when a foster stepped up to sponsor and take her on as an owner surrender. Harleyâs previous family included kids, dogs, cats, goats, and even a pot belly pig! She would prefer to keep her humans to herself, but could be okay with another dog in the home if itâs the right fit (ideally a calm, confident type who isnât too pushy!). According to Harley, small things are for usually for chasing, though she has had the occasional cat friend.

Harley loves naps and play in equal measure! She is curious, playful, and loves a good Kong or hardy chew at the end of a long day.

To keep up with Harley, check out #SacRDRHarley on Facebook and Instagram @resilientdogrescue!

name: Lola
description:
Sweet Lola and her five 4-day-old puppies were intercepted before they could be surrendered to Stanislaus County Animal Control. Lola spent the first two years of her life in a trailer park with her first family, and had 3 litters of puppies before the park landlord evicted her family. As plans were being made to find a foster for Lola and pups, the landlord ran and out of patience and threatened to kill the dogs if they werenât moved off the property immediately. With time all but run out, an amazing foster home stepped up to the plate, and Lola and her babies were rushed out of danger.

Since coming into foster, Lola has proven herself to be a complete sweetheart! She takes a few moments to grow accustomed to new people, but once sheâs comfortable her true personality comes out, and sheâs a sweet, patient goof. She loves her foster family (especially foster dad and the kids!) and is doing an amazing job taking care of her five chunky pups.

Lola will be ready to begin separating from her puppies once they turn 8-9 weeks old, and sheâll be spayed, fully vetted, and ready to find a wonderful forever home when that time comes.

In the meantime, keep up with Lola and the pups by checking out #SacRDRLola on Facebook and Instagram @resilientdogrescue! Theyâll be listed individually for adoption when the time comes.

name: Bubba
description:
Bubba is currently working on his crate training and general manners. He loves toys, going for car rides, laying in the grass with his people and going for walks on cool nights. 

Bubba seems to be dog selective and needs proper and slow introductions. 

Stay tuned for more information on Bubba as he gets all settled in and comfy in a wonderful foster home.

To keep up with Bubba, check out #SacRDRBubba on Facebook and Instagram!

name: Enzo
description:
Enzo came to SacRDR from Stanislaus County Animal Shelter. This sweet boy is settling into his foster home and learning how to interact politely with the resident big dogs, cats, goats, and chickens!

To keep up with Enzo, check out #SacRDREnzo on Facebook and Instagram @resilientdogrescue

name: MAX
description:
MAX the Magnificent
Max is a handsome, lovable, 3 year old Pit Bull Terrier Mix. He has a flashy black, brindle and white coat with a white blaze on his chest and white paws. I think his mix could be with Great Dane based on the sort of flappy lips he has and the shape of his muzzle. He s a good sized guy, weighing in at 68#.

Max is young, outgoing, and full of life. He enjoys his environment and the people in it. He is truly a sweet, smart dog who will make your home a special place, filled with love and happiness. 

He is loved by the staff who compliment his leash manners and call him a âgood boy.â He likes to roll in the grass. 
Max is affectionate and responsive and sensitive to correction. He knows how to sit and to lie down. 
He is attentive to people and likes to be petted.

Max appears to respect selective cats, although he did give the indication that he will chase cats. Therefore we consider his behavior with cats to be âunknown.â

He does appear to be okay with dogs, although slightly shy. Of course , proper, careful introductions need to be made.

Max will need owner(s) who will help him through his heartworm treatment. He is doing well and can be adopted now (*see Special Needs section) He is a low activity dog currently. When he is well, he will be a medium activity dog.
He will do best with an owner or family with some dog owning experience.

Max is ready to be your dog. He is quick and bright and likes to please. He is learning to respect othersâ personal space and not lick or jump up. After he calms down, his gentle side emerges and he wants to be right by your side. 
He is a completely loyal companion and would love to become part of your world.

Max is neutered, microchipped, and up to date on vaccines and preventatives. 

Max can be seen at the Placer County Animal Services Center 
11232 B Avenue, Auburn, CA 95603

Shelter hours:
Monday - Saturday: 10:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. (Adoptions end at 4:30 p.m.)
Closed Sundays and County holidays 

Call telephone # 530.886.5541 for further information on Max

name: Honey!
description:
Eager to learn and playful, Honey is ready for her forever home! 

What is your name? Honey

How old are you?
My foster parents think Iâm around 7 â in my opinion, Iâm aging like fine wine

How much do you weigh?
Around 60 pounds

What do you look like?
I am light brown with a pretty white chest and feet

What do you like to eat?
ANYTHING you offer me! But not tomatoes

What kind of personality do you have?
I can be quite timid of new people at first, if they take it slow and give me treats I will be their best friend. When Iâm let out of my box I get the zoomies sometimes and I LOVE to play with toys.

Describe your perfect day:
Waking up to a big breakfast and taking a long walk with my owner. When we get home, I would love to have a chew toy, and some snuggle time. If itâs sunny outside, lay outside and work on my tan for a while. At dinner I would love to sit at my ownersâ feet while they eat together as a family and then snuggle up in bed with them at the end of the night.

What is your favorite toy?
I love lots of toys if you play with me!

Do you know any tricks?
I know a lot! Sit, Stay, Down, 360. My foster family says Iâm really smart

What scares you?
New people that come up to me too quick and water.

Have you been around children? Do you like them?
Kids are cool, I donât mind them at all. My foster family has a 1 year old and I hang out on the couch with him and my foster fam.

Do you like cats?
Not so much

How do you feel about other dogs?
I would do best as an only dog in the house

If you could be anywhere in the world, where would it be?
Finally with my forever family

How is your health?
My health is great now! I had a few minor problems; NorCal Bully Breed was amazing and got them all fixed!

Who do you live with your foster home and who is your closest companion?
I live with three resident dogs, my foster mom, my foster dad and my one-year old foster brother. I love my foster mom the most because she snuggles me.

Where do you hang out when you are home alone?
Obviously in my house! My foster parents call it my crate

Where do you sleep?
In my crate

Do you like walking on a leash?
I LOVE walking on a leash, sometimes I get really excited and pull but a pinch collar works great to keep me in line since Iâm so strong.

Do you have any \"not-so-great\" habits that we should know about? For instance, do you bark or dig in the yard? 
I do fence fight if a dog on the other side starts it. I donât initiate anything though.

Are you house trained? (Meaning do you go potty outside)
My foster parents have tile flooring and I havenât had any accidents

Do you like water?
Not really, I will tolerate a bath, but prefer to be dirty

What do you love about your foster family?
I love them because they understand me and keep me safe. They donât have a lot of people come and go which is really nice for me, as Iâm a little fearful of new people.

What was your life like before being brought into NorCal Bully Breed Rescue?
Well I was dumped on a riverbank and had just had puppies. Then I lived outside for a few years through all of the seasons which was hard because I didnât have a lot of human interaction.

NorCal Bully Breed Rescue is a foster based rescue with foster homes spread all throughout the Sacramento area. We usually require our adopters to be within a 50 to 100 mile radius of us, depending on the dog, and depending on the home. This is because we need to do a yard check to guarantee that the potential adopter's yard is secure, and also have them be close enough should any behavioral issues arise, and the assistance of our trainer is needed. We are, however, willing to adopt out of our area, including the Bay Area, Tahoe, and even further. We've even adopted out of state on very special occasions. We try our best to match our dogs to the perfect homes, and match them based on their personalities, not their looks. Adoptions are not done on a first come, first serve basis, rather in the order of what homes are the right match for that particular dog. Our adoption fees are based on the dog and range from $200-$350. In the case of senior dogs (6+ years), fees will be waived to the right home. This includes spay/neuter, vaccines, microchip, and deworming (if necessary). 

Honey's adoption donation is $200.

Interested in meeting Honey or any of our available pooches?  Complete and submit our adoption application on our website norcalbullybreedrescue.com and we will respond to you within 24 to 48 hours.

If interested, PLEASE contact norcalrescuepups@yahoo.com

******************************

Each pet will be is spayed and/or neutered, micro-chipped, and up to date on their vaccinations. 

There will be an adoption fee which helps the organization cover spay costs, vaccinations, medical treatment(s), food and supplies.

All Nor Cal Rescue Pups Rescue dogs are spayed/neutered, are up to date on vaccines prior to adoption. 

Adoption fees vary depending on age of dog. 

All dogs live in private foster homes until they are adopted.

Thank you!

name: Pasha
description: Pasha! Boy has this little gal come out of her shell! She was very nervous when she first came into our care, but after plenty of spoils she has become incredibly playful and loving. She loves treats, toys and sitting on laps. She was recently spayed and is up to date on vaccinations and preventatives.

name: Hercules 7-92-19
description: Hercules is a big boy that would make a great only pet. He loves people and would do best with someone who could spend time and love with him.

name: Otis*
description:
Fully vetted, neutered 1-year-old male
UTD on vaccinations

Adoption Fee $250

Otis is a friendly, sweet 1-year-old Chihuahua/Basenji/Terrier mix.  ???? Absent DNA test it's hard to tell.  He takes a minute to warm up, but then 
he loves to play, is an active little guy who loves everyone he meets.

Otis is a LOVING little guy who deserves a forever home!

name: Bunny
description:
PLEASE DO NOT CONTACT THE RESCUE THROUGH PETFINDER, VISIT PITCREW.ORG AND COMPLETE ADOPTION APPLICATION.

*All of our rescue dogs are spayed/neutered, up-to-date on vaccinations and microchipped*

name: Benji
description:
*** COURTESY LISTING *** Please contact Blake at BlakeWT56@gmail.com if interested in meeting this sweet boy ***

Benji is a 3-1/2 year old sweetheart whose favorite things are pets (boy does he love pets), treats, going on walks, runs and chases, and his favorite red ball. He loves water but hates baths. Benji isnât a fan of having his paws touched, so we make sure to walk him frequently to avoid having to get his nails trimmed. When going on walks, he should always be on leash, heâs a little too interested in exploring. Benji could use some leash training, but does really well not pulling when he has his harness on. Squirrels and birds are really fun for him on walks, he loves to chase them. 

Benji loves other dogs and cats but hasnât been socialized well so he may be overexcited at first, but with a proper introduction, he settles quickly. He has done well around kids, but may be overwhelming to him at first. 

Benji has had issues with separation anxiety and would do best with a family that is willing to work with him on that. He would love to have a stay at home parent since he is happiest with his people close to him .

Benji is such a lover and adores any attention youâre able to give to him. He will return that love with the upmost loyalty. His perfect day just might consist of a good bowl of kibble, a run outside with some pup friends, and endless pets from his people.

name: Gaby
description:
\"Gaby\" is an approx 1-yr old, 50-lb handsome neutered male Terrier mix (perhaps Jack Russell/Pit Bull?) who is exceptionally mellow, affectionate and well-behaved. Gaby is friendly with people of all ages and would be appropriate for very young children due to his calm nature. (Yes, he takes treats gently from hand.)

Gaby is great with other dogs and very playful with select dogs. His foster caretaker has four other dogs and Gaby rough houses constantly with the one female dog. However,  Gaby does prefer hanging out w/ his foster caretaker. See a video of Gaby interacting with  a few other dogs at GSRSV's rescue ranch elsewhere on this page.

We have not seen Gaby around cats but my hunch is that he'd be OK with them. We'll consider a home with cats for Gaby.

Gaby is fully housetrained and very well-behaved inside. He's never had an accident indoors even though it's likely he was kept as an outside dog previously. Gaby does not know  even the \"sit\" command, but I was able to get him to sit in just a minute or so with a biscuit as incentive. Oh--Gaby loves treats, so he'll likely be very easy to train. 

Gaby is good on leash and has great recall off-leash. He does not wander far when off-leash. He rides well in a car; in fact, Gaby LOVES to go for car rides!  

Gaby showed up at an RV park/marina along the Sacramento River in June. All efforts to find his owner failed so the man who found him (a friend of GSRSV's) offered to foster him until we could find him a home.

Gaby is located in Verona (small town along the Sacramento River in south Sutter County). His adoption fee is $210.

name: Cork
description:
Adoption fee on this dog is $100.

		Cork is a unique looking brown long coat male, approximately 3 years old, with one adorable floppy ear.  He was a stray from a local shelter, so no information is known about his past.  From his appearance, he looked liked he'd been on the streets for some time before landing in the shelter.

		In his first foster home, Cork enjoyed playing with the other female German Shepherd who was close to his age.  He is now in a home with another German Shepherd and a terrier mix. When not playing with the terrier he actively seeks out places to lay where it's cool, ie, soft dirt behind bushes.  He will sometimes come when called but not consistently, but usually a food prompt is enough to get him to come. However, when you call him (and he listens) he looks fantastic as he gallops across the yard. He has a very healthy prey drive (squirrels on the fence) so we are uncertain if he could live in a home with cats or small critters.

		He is a great big goofy dog and can be pretty affectionate, but only on his terms. He now allows being brushed.  He is a bit stand-offish and has very little in the way of training and doesn't respond quickly to the basic commands, although has learned to sit before getting fed. He is very food driven and protective of his feeding area. He will allow people to remove his bowl with no issues, but should be fed away from other animals.

		Cork loves wading in the water when taken to Nimbus Lake.  He startles easily whenever a bicycle comes up from behind him.  With time and consistent attention, he will be a fantastic friend and companion for a lucky family. 

		Cork limps occasionally on his right front leg.  X-rays revealed advanced osteo-arthritis in both elbows and his right elbow is more severe from what appears to be an old fracture.  Anti-inflammatories are needed at times to keep Cork comfortable.

This dog is a Level 3. Please be sure you understand what a dog of this Level requires. Go to our home page for an explanation of the Dog Rating Levels.

For more information and to see when this dog will be attending an Adoption Day, please see our Dogs page on our main website at www.gcgsr.org. 

We operate within a reasonable driving distance from the Greater Sacramento area, the 	Central Valley down to Merced, and Lake Tahoe. A reasonable driving distance is determined by where one of our volunteers is willing to drive within our areas of service. That means we don't adopt out of our area, to Southern California, or Out of State. 


Thank you for visiting!

name: Miracle
description: Miracle is a special little girl. She loves to play and is quick to nuzzle up. Miracle is great with other dogs and would enjoy a K9 brother or sister. Miracle is also great around cats! Miracle is very slow to warm up to men, but gets along great with all of our male kennel staff who have been patient with her. She is up to date on vaccinations and preventatives and has already been spayed.

name: Jax-ADOPTED
description: Meet Jax. He became a part of the NorCal family when his owner felt as though he needed more time, attention and training than she could give him. Jax is 2 1/2 years of age. He is a sweet, affectionate, energetic, playful boy. He really needs to be with a young family that can provide the training and attention he needs. He is good with other dogs and would benefit from having another dog to play with. He seems to be a morning boy and is up early, ready to play with his ball and squeaky toys. He really would do well with someone that could take him to agility training. He loves all people, needs lots of walks and is good in the car. He is just a really happy boy!!

name: Beauty
description:
Beauty is an approximately 2-month-old female German Shepherd mix puppy... the best guess since the litter of puppies along with their mother were rescued from Stanislaus Animal Shelter. We don't know who the daddy was. Beautyâs name says it all...sheâs a beautiful little girl and is part of the Disney LItter #2. She along with her littermates (Mufasa, Ariel, Olaf, and Tiger Lily), are now available for adoption. 

We adopt in El Dorado County/surrounding counties. Please note, we DO NOT ADOPT OUT OF STATE EXCEPT FOR RENO (also surrounding areas to Reno within 30 minutes).

If you are interested in adopting Beauty please go to https://www.sngsr.org/steps-to-adopting.html. Please make sure that you wait for the PUPPY Questionnaire to pop up, it can take up to a minute...as both are required. 

Beauty is up to date on shots, will be neutered and is microchipped and dewormed. The adoption fee is $350. 

If you have any questions visit our website www.sngsr.org. You can also see what we are up to day to day by following our Facebook page at Sierra Nevada German Shepherd Rescue or on Instagram at sierranevadagsr.

Thank you for considering adopting a rescue dog and supporting Sierra Nevada German Shepherd Rescue in our efforts to save lives!

We don't know who the daddy was. Tiger LIly is so pretty and sweet. She is part of the Disney LItter #2. She along with her littermates (Ariel, Olaf, and Mufasa), are now available for adoption.

name: Annie!!
description:
What is your name? Annie

How old are you? About a year old

How much do you weigh?
I'm a little girl and weigh about 45 pounds.

What do you look like?
I have tan and white fur, with gorgeous black around both of my eyes, and black lipstick around my mouth that accentuates my beautiful smile. My foster mom tells me that I'm the most beautiful little pittie girl.

What do you like to eat?
Food really isn't my favorite thing but I really enjoy watermelon and a little bit of cheese sometimes.

What kind of personality do you have?
I'm very playful and have lots of energy! I'm friendly and love attention from people. I love to play and play and play with my foster dog brother. When it's quiet time, I'm a lover: my favorite place to be when I'm sleepy is snuggled in a lap or cuddled super close to my foster mom on the couch.

Describe your perfect day:
My perfect day would be spent outdoors: I love exploring and running and napping in the sun. I'd play with my forever family.

What is your favorite toy?
My favorite toys make squeaky noises, so I try really hard to get to whatever is making the noise to find out what it is. I really love harder toys that I can chew on for a long time.

Do you know any tricks?
Iâm very smart! My foster mom & dad are working on basic obedience right now (sit, stay, come, and telling me to get on my bed), and when I understand all of those, they said that they'll teach me how to shake, and more fun things.

What scares you?
I'm brave and not afraid of much. But Iâm not too fond of the hose... And the Roomba kinda scares me so I make sure to yell at it to get away from my foster family.

Have you been around children? Do you like them?
I've only been around children one time and I was okay with them. I think that I'd be better with bigger kids though because I have so much energy.

Do you like cats?
I haven't met a cat yet so I don't know if I'd like them.

How do you feel about other dogs?
I love my foster dog brother because he's so easy-going and lets me do whatever I want. I don't know if I'd get along with another dog that would try to boss me around.

If you could be anywhere in the world, where would it be?
Running in a open field on a sunny day, with the wind at my back and a bone in my mouth.

How is your health?
The vet said that I'm a super healthy little girl!

Who do you live with your foster home and who is your closest companion?
I live with my foster mom, dad, and foster dog brother. My foster mom is definitely my favorite but I also really like my foster-dad.

Where do you hang out when you are home alone?
I have a nice big comfy crate.

Where do you sleep?
I'll either sleep in my big crate or sometimes my foster mom lets me hog the bed.

Do you like walking on a leash?
I'm learning how to walk like a lady on leash. My foster mom and dad are teaching me to heel on their left side and I'm even learning that I need to sit every time that they stop walking.

Do you have any \"not-so-great\" habits that we should know about? For instance, do you bark or dig in the yard? I like to hide shoes... I've even been tempted to chew on my foster mom's slippers and heels... She's learned now that she has to keep her shoes put away so I don't get tempted again.

Are you house trained? (Meaning do you go potty outside)
Since I'm still a young girl, I sometimes have potty accidents in the house if I've been playing for too long and my foster mom and dad aren't paying attention to let me go outside. I'm learning though that I need to go to the door to let them know that I have to potty.

Do you like water?
I don't seem to mind the sprinklers and getting wet, but the hose water kinda scares me.

What do you love about your foster family?
I love that they include me in everything that they do. They take me on walks and car rides (I LOVE to hang out of the window!) and they talk to me while they're working around the house. And I really love my foster dog brother!

What was your life like before being brought into NorCal Bully Breed Rescue?
I don't really remember... I met my foster mom and dad when I was walking down the street one day and they made sure that I had a safe place to stay waiting for my forever home to find me.

NorCal Bully Breed Rescue is a foster based rescue with foster homes spread all throughout the Sacramento area. We usually require our adopters to be within a 50 to 100 mile radius of us, depending on the dog, and depending on the home. This is because we need to do a yard check to guarantee that the potential adopter's yard is secure, and also have them be close enough should any behavioral issues arise, and the assistance of our trainer is needed. We are, however, willing to adopt out of our area, including the Bay Area, Tahoe, and even further. We've even adopted out of state on very special occasions. We try our best to match our dogs to the perfect homes, and match them based on their personalities, not their looks. Adoptions are not done on a first come, first serve basis, rather in the order of what homes are the right match for that particular dog. Our adoption fees are based on the dog and range from $200-$350. In the case of senior dogs (6+ years), fees will be waived to the right home. This includes spay/neuter, vaccines, microchip, and deworming (if necessary). 

Annie's adoption donation is $200.

Interested in meeting Annie or any of our available pooches?  Complete and submit our adoption application on our website norcalbullybreedrescue.com and we will respond to you within 2-4 business days.

name: Remi
description:
Handsome Remi is an approximately 1 yr old black male German Shepherd that was an owner surrender at Stanislaus Animal Services Agency. He was tagged as a bite dog at 6 months old, we aren't sure that was the case and rather just a mouthy GSD puppy. We went out with one of our trainers and he is the only one their personal test dog wanted to play with. He passed our evaluations and his fosters who is also a trainer. He is potty trained, has been around children and people without any issues. We do not know how he is with cats but are happy to test with your resident cat after the application approval. 

Remi is up to date on his shots, is neutered and microchipped. The adoption fee is $350. We adopt in El Dorado County/surrounding counties. Unfortunately, we DO NOT ADOPT OUT OF STATE EXCEPT FOR RENO (also surrounding areas to Reno within 30 minutes). 


If you are interested in adopting Remi please go to www.sngsr.org and complete the application. 

The rescue suggests obedience training for all puppies and dogs. 

If you have any questions please email us at sierranevadagsr@outlook.com
or visit our website www.sngsr.org. You can also see what we are up to day to day by following our Facebook page at Sierra Nevada German Shepherd Rescue.

Thank you for considering adopting a rescue dog and supporting Sierra Nevada German Shepherd Rescue in our efforts to save lives!

name: MOSELY
description:
MOSELY is a handsome, brindle and white Pit Bull Terrier.  He is about 4 years old and  weighs 47# which is a great size for a Pit.  He has beautiful markings and a muscular, athletic build.  

Mosely is an energetic, healthy boy.  He is  strong and  staff and volunteers are working on his leash manners so that he walks nicely without pulling. 

 He is people oriented and friendly.  He pays attention and is trying to understand what it takes to fit in.

Because he is a two year old, he gets wound up like a little kid,  so he needs consistent and patient training to become an obedient guy with nice manners who respects othersâ personal space.   He is super smart and very receptive to correction.  He makes strong attachments to people as he tries to find his forever owner.  
It would be great if Mosely continues with obedience training to learn what it takes to become a member of a family and not the boss!
He is sharp and wants to please and already knows how to sit.  

Mosleyâs attitude towards cats is somewhere between does not accept and OK with certain cats.  
We always recommend careful and proper introductions with other household animals.   
He is OK with dogs after proper introductions.

Mosley has much to offer a savvy, experienced dog owner or  family who will understand that he is still a youth. He is a sweetheart and all the energy put into him will be rewarded with a fun, loyal, wonderful companion.

Mosley is neutered, microchipped, hw tested negative, and up to date on vaccines and preventatives. 

MOSELY can be seen at the Placer County Animal Services Center 
11232 B Avenue, Auburn, CA 95603

Shelter hours:
Monday - Saturday: 10:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. (Adoptions end at 4:30 p.m.)
Closed Sundays and County holidays 

Call telephone # 530.886.5541 for further information on Mosley

name: Judah
description:
Adoption fee on this dog is $300.


		Judah is a very handsome 5 to 6-year-old, all white long coat male weighing about 70 lbs. He was surrendered to a shelter along with Spark, Havanna and another male when the original owner lost his home. Judah is possibly the sire of the other three white dogs. The previous owner indicates Judah had been an outdoor only dog. 

		He is one very, very sweet and nice boy! He walks well on a leash, is crate trained (he really doesn't like it) and learned the use of the doggy door within minutes of showing him where it was. As with the others that were surrendered with him, Judah craves human attention but is not obnoxious about it. He has learned that indoor living is the best and has learned to have impeccable house manners. Also, Judah loves to swim and fetch sticks and balls thrown in the lake.

		Judah is very smart and can be a bit pushy/bossy with other large dogs, but has blended in well with his foster pack of three other German Shepherds. He has been to play dates with a mix of large and small dogs and acted appropriately when meeting them and playing with them.

		He is not a dog for the first time German Shepherd owner, but will excel at being a loyal and loving companion to a family that knows the breed and is able to provide leadership, structure, exercise and guidance. Judah has moderate energy and is satisfied by daily walks of about 2 miles. 

		When Judah arrived at his foster home, his foster dad noticed that his left back leg turned in towards his body a little bit. When he was neutered, we x-rayed his hips and found that he has hip dysplasia. We are in the process of getting him vetted, to determine the best couse of action to correct the hip dysplasia. He does not seem to be uncomfortable or in pain, probably because he has had this condition his whole life.

		If you're looking for a well-mannered, sweet, gorgeous white long coat and have experience with GSDs, you should snatch this boy up before his foster dad keeps him! Please adopt him as I really don't need four dogs!!!!!

This dog is a Level 3. Please be sure you understand what a dog of this Level requires. Go to our home page for an explanation of the Dog Rating Levels.

For more information and to see when this dog will be attending an Adoption Day, please see our Dogs page on our main website at www.gcgsr.org. 

We operate within a reasonable driving distance from the Greater Sacramento area, the 	Central Valley down to Merced, and Lake Tahoe. A reasonable driving distance is determined by where one of our volunteers is willing to drive within our areas of service. That means we don't adopt out of our area, to Southern California, or Out of State. 


Thank you for visiting!

name: Zelda A.
description:
Adoption fee on this dog is $300.

		Zelda is a high energy, spirited, happy, sweet girl about 3 or 4 years old. She is not a dog for a first-time owner but would be a great addition for a family with German Shepherd or similar breed experience who understands the need for structure, leadership, and training.
		
		Zelda gets along well with the other dogs in her foster home but you won't have squirrels or cats in your yard if she has her way. She is missing some front teeth but recently had her dental issues taken care of. Now she is ready to find someone with the dedication to direct her energy in a positive way.

This dog is a Level 3. Please be sure you understand what a dog of this Level requires. Go to our home page for an explanation of the Dog Rating Levels.

For more information and to see when this dog will be attending an Adoption Day, please see our Dogs page on our main website at www.gcgsr.org. 

We operate within a reasonable driving distance from the Greater Sacramento area, the 	Central Valley down to Merced, and Lake Tahoe. A reasonable driving distance is determined by where one of our volunteers is willing to drive within our areas of service. That means we don't adopt out of our area, to Southern California, or Out of State. 


Thank you for visiting!

name: Dozer
description: Dozer is an amazing dog , he gets along with other dogs , better to have him with dogs his size or smaller .  He seems to get nervous around large dogs .  He is a Jack Russell Terrier mx , walks well on a leash , rides well in the car .  Very loyal to his person .  Again Amazing dog , great companion,  email forpetsake@sbcglobal.net request an application .  We will get back to you regarding a meet & greet .  530 263-3331  So worth meeting him .  he is a perfect size , not to small and not to big .  Secure Fenced yard required ,  No out of state adoptions

name: Windy 7-8-19
description: Windy is a sweet girl who loves people. She settles down and loves just hanging out.  She also has the perfect amount of energy to go on walks and hikes. She has a wonderful sweet personality and would make a great companion.

name: Butter Cup
description:
Hi my name is Buttercup. I am looking for my furever home. 
I am a 5-6 yo yellow lab, am UTD on all my shots an spayed.

I had to leave my other family, as it was a violent, abusive situation to my \"best friend,\" a lil girl, mom, and family. They were able to find a safe haven, but they were not allowed to bring me with them.
I need a special place, as I suffer from effects due to the abuse that my previous family an I suffered.
I now live at the Foac Adoption Facility, all my special friends come in an walk me  an play ball. I also love to go for car rides, and am very well behaved in the car.

I love to catch a tennis ball, an will \"nose the ball to you to play.\" 

Due to what happened, I am a bit leery of people. I want to like you, but have to do this on my terms. I am a bit selective about dogs, some I just don't trust. I also have trust issues with cats. To be honest I would prefer to have my new family let me go at my own pace. And I would show you what a loving, sweet girl I can be.

 To adopt please apply online at foac.us or for more information please contact the facility at (209)533-3622 Monday-Saturday 10am-2pm

name: Tobbie-ADOPTED
description:
This amazingly sweet, mellow, easy going guy came to us from a Sacramento Shelter, when his family could no longer care for him. Although, a little bit older than I am sure you were looking for, Tobbie is a happy, affectionate, healthy boy (he does take a thyroid pill and has slight cataracts.) Tobbie  would fit right into your family and make you smile everyday. He gets along with everyone, people and dogs alike and is a joy to be around. 

If you are interested in Tobbie, please contact Janet at janetleigh44@gmail.com

name: Petey
description:
Meet Petey:  This beautiful boy needs a new home.

This dog needs a foster home because his owner reduced him as a pup and now that he is older the landlord wants him out because their lease is for three dogs Nd Petey is number 4.

Petey will be one year old in August (estimate).  He was thrown in a pile a trash from a car across from our house.  They retrieved him and cleaned him up and then he got parvo but they nurses him back to health.   He is good with kids and other dogs. Cats scare him. He has separation anxiety so he would do best with someone who stays home most of the time.  He is truly medium sized at 30lbs.

name: Roxy
description: Roxy is a 3 year old Boxer/Pit mix. She is house, potty and crate trained. She knows all basic commands (sit, stay, lay down, shake, etc). Great on walks, still needs a little work, but is very well mannered. She doesn't jump up on you, so would be good with kids. Will be good with most dogs, if properly introduced.

name: Arnold 7-12-19 B
description:
Arnold is a staff favorite with a shining personality and expressive face. Arnold loves his stuffed toys so much he often brings them on his walks. When he gets excited in the mornings, he runs around in circles howling. He's also spoiled rotten-- he loves being hand fed and snuggled and kissed!

Arnold is easygoing and gentle with his people, and wants to be the center of your world. He's such a special boy, it's easy to give him that!

Arnold is vaccinated, house trained, and microchipped. Come by and see what an amazing dog he is!

name: Keisha 7-7-19 A
description:
Looking for a bouncing bug of lovin'? Look no further than Keisha!

Keisha does great with other large dogs, and simply adores cats. She loves to bring you her stuffed lion when you walk through the door, and snuggle under the covers with you after a long day.

Because of her age, she isn't able to do long hikes, but she loves to go for walks around the block or rides in the car. A couch potato at heart, Keisha is ready to binge watch your favorite show, or keep you company while you read a great book.

Her zest for life is outmatched only by her love of food-- any food. She's happy to help keep the kitchen floor clean while you're cooking, and she's always ready to give you kisses if you're having a bad day.

Keisha is current on her DHPP and rabies vaccines, as well as heart worm prevention. She's ready to go home with the new love of her life-- YOU!!

name: Darla!!
description:
What is your name?
Darla

How old are you? 
Maybe 6

Are you a boy or a girl?
Girl

Do you know where your family came from (Breed question)?
My foster mom thinks Iâm a pit bull/ mastiff, I'm a big girl, with just as big a heart!

How much do you weigh? 
75 pounds (Iâve gotten a bit too chunky so I'm on a diet)

What do you look like? Iâm a adorable hunky girl. I have a dark brindle coat, broad shoulders, big brown eyes, and a big ol' smile

What do you like to eat? 
A mix of grain free and non-grain free dog food.

What kind of personality do you have? 
I am a pretty lazy girl. I like to lay in my crate, and lay next to my foster mom. Maybe take a stroll around the neighborhood. Iâm a happy girl and like to politely meet people.

Describe your perfect day? 
Binge watching the latest murder mystery on Hulu with a forever best friend. Maybe take a break to lay in the sun. Food and treats.

What is your favorite toy? 
I have a chew bone i like to chew. Iâd rather snuggle.

Do you know any tricks? 
Looking absolutely adorable at all times. I am learning to sit, and I am learn boundaries, for example- I donât cross through the open kitchen door unless my foster mom gives me the go ahead.

What scares you?
Not a huge fan of the vacuum but otherwise take things in stride.

Have you ever been around children? 
I have had no problems with children of all ages when my mom takes me on walks. I really like the kids in our neighborhood. Even though Iâm a big girl I am slow and careful.

How do you feel about other dogs? 
I don't mind other dogs, I can take or leave them. I spend a lot of time with my foster brother (a small excuse of a dog) he's fine but I donât have unsupervised time with him or other dogs.

Do you like cats?
Maybe too much, I would do best in a home without cats.

If you could be anywhere in the world where would it be? 
In the air conditioning, being lazy, knowing I have a furever home

How is your health? 
The vet has given me a bill of good health.

Who do you live with in your foster home and who is your closest companion? 
My foster mom, her small resident dog, and a cat (mom keeps us separated since Iâm very interested in him). Foster mom is the best. She gives me lots of snuggles and love.

Where do you hang out when you are home alone?
I am alone quite a bit when mom is at work. I stay in the kitchen area of the home (mom has it sectioned off for me, and I sleep in my crate /kennel 99% of that time.

Where do you sleep? 
In my crate/kennel.

Do you like walking on a leash? 
The people who had me before didnât teach me any leash manners. Foster mom is working on training me to walk at heel but Iâm a bit of a tug boat. I do like going for walks but Iâm also happy just sleeping all day.

Do you have any not so great habits? 
Iâm still working on getting better at all the good dog habits of sit, wait, stay, etc. I am very willing just need consistency.

Are you house trained? 
Yes! Iâve never had a accident even when foster mom has a long work day.

Do you like water? 
I donât mind getting hosed down for a bath or playing in the kiddie pool but I donât think I would be a good swimmer.

What do you love about your foster family? 
Snuggles, food, and love.

What was your life like before being brought into NorCal Bully Breed Rescue? 
I ended up in the shelter on death row but the shelter staff fought for me because they saw how sweet I was and then NBBR came to rescue me! Now Iâm ready for a family of my own.

NorCal Bully Breed Rescue is a foster based rescue with foster homes spread all throughout the Sacramento area. We usually require our adopters to be within a 50 to 100 mile radius of us, depending on the dog, and depending on the home. This is because we need to do a yard check to guarantee that the potential adopter's yard is secure, and also have them be close enough should any behavioral issues arise, and the assistance of our trainer is needed. We are, however, willing to adopt out of our area, including the Bay Area, Tahoe, and even further. We've even adopted out of state on very special occasions. We try our best to match our dogs to the perfect homes, and match them based on their personalities, not their looks. Adoptions are not done on a first come, first serve basis, rather in the order of what homes are the right match for that particular dog. Our adoption fees are based on the dog and range from $200-$350. In the case of senior dogs (6+ years), fees will be waived to the right home. This includes spay/neuter, vaccines, microchip, and deworming (if necessary). 

Darla's adoption donation is $200.

Interested in meeting Darla or any of our available pooches?  Complete and submit our adoption application on our website norcalbullybreedrescue.com and we will respond to you within 2-4 business days.
