name: Ginger Blossom* Sr. Sweetheart
description:
Grass Valley, Ca
Home2home-nc on facebook

Update: to our great sadness, Ginger has been diagnosed with probable cancer. She could still live 6 mo iot more. Her robust strength is going to help her thrive for awhile. 
We still would like to find her a family to love and love her. She is in great spirits.
Expenses will be covered. You only need to add love and a comfy atmosphere.



Senior LOVELY Staffy mix girl
67 lbs


Ginger was born in 2010. She is just the nicest, calmest, wonderful gal.
Ginger loves dogs, cats, children, walks, traveling in the car.
She knows lots of commands and always wants to please. Lives to meet new people. She would be a great shop dog or just a wonderful companion for anyone who loves a good solid dog.

This girl has so many good years ahead of her. Hoping someone will see her beauty and be proud to stand beside her. She is a very young senior, still in touch with her â inner puppy.â

Ginger was abandoned and just hung out for 2 months making herself comfortable on peoples porches and lawns. Never one to complain, she made the best of a bad situation. She finally caught out attention and we went and picked her up.
Spayed, shots and good teeth.

If you think Ginger would make a good addition to your family, email me at caindenises@gmail.com or call 530-955-5111.

name: Coco*
description:
Fully vetted, UTD on vaccinations
8 years old, 7 pounds

Adoption Fee $250

Meet Coco
Hi, I am an 8-year-old chi, 7 pounds. I was rescued from a hoarding situation and I had 7 mammary tumors removed and dental done. I have separation anxiety so I need someone who will be with me most of the time. I am very affectionate and good with cats and dogs. I think I deserve a second chance in life where I will not be neglected and will be cared for. Can I be your princess? Please fill out an adoption application if you would like to adopt me.
Location Sacramento CA

name: Jake
description:
Say hello to Jake!  Jake is 2.5 to 3 years old and a very handsome male GSD! It takes a little time (5min.) for him to meet new people, but this guy warms up quickly. He is a easy-going boy who needs a family with patience and one that will help him grow his confidence.  This attractive dude is good with other dogs and loves people.  He basically wants to sit in your lap.  A training class or two would be a great start as this guy is learning to walk on a loose leash, wait at thresholds and the Place command. He is friendly, takes treats nicely and just wants to be someone's main squeeze. Are you ready for the next GSD love of your life!!! Everyone at Jake's last vet appointment thought he was amaaing!

If you would like to foster Jake, then please click on the Foster button and fill out our application. We will contact you!

Jake is UTD on all vaccinations, heartworm negative and neutered. If I sound like a great match, then please contact my friends at EDCGSR and fill out an application at http://www.edcgsr.com/adoption-process.html

name: Frankie  Adoption Pending
description:
Adoption Pending on Frankie

Application to meet Frankie at www.chowsplus.org

Meet sweet boy Frankie!  He is such a handsome mix weighing 52 lbs. Frankie is a sweet playful boy who knows sit, shake, and down. He LOVES playing with other dogs so a home with a playmate for Frankie would be great. 
A home without cats is needed since Frankie is a little too interested in them.
We are not positive on his breed. He may be a mix of husky, akita and chow.
He is very friendly and has been fine with kids ages 11 and up.

Frankie is a smart boy that learns quickly. He is house trained, rides great in the car, loves to be with people and around 2 years old. He is neutered, microchipped and vaccinated and ready for his new forever home.  He is located in Sacramento. If you are interested in meeting him you can submit an application at:
www.chowsplus.org

name: Nigel
description:
Nigel is a 5 year old Old English Bulldog. He's around 60 lbs which is a great size for a household. Nigel found himself at the shelter after his family abandoned him when they got a new puppy. Nigel was shut down at the shelter and extremely sad so we gave him a second chance at life. He's in a foster home getting the love and care he deserves but he needs a loving forever home immediately. He loves people and will give you all the snuggles you can possibly need and he is a great companion animal. It's pretty hard to resist his smooshy bulldog face and he seems to know this by smiling up at you luring you in! Nigel is fun but moderate to low energy, making him ideal for someone who is not super active or just prefers to stay home. He's is neutered, microchipped, up to date on vaccinations, heart worm negative and house and crate trained. 

Child appropriate? Nigel would do best with older children, probably 10 and up, who could enjoy playing with him. He can get excited when playing so smaller kids might be too much for him. 

Other dog appropriate? Nigel does not react to dogs at all when walking by them or seeing them but he has shown some negative behaviors if allowed to play or interact. We feel he would be best as the only pet in the home.

Cat appropriate? Absolutely NO kitties for Nigel.

How is he with strangers? Nigel has done fine meeting strangers and seems happy to see people. 

What is his play style? When playing with people he can get a little excited and jumpy or start to hump but other than that he likes to fetch a ball and play tug. He tires out fast so he does not need a lot of high energy play to wear him out. 

Does he like toys? Nigel seems to enjoy nylabone toys for chewing and he likes tug toys. He will play with stuffy toys but loses interest more quickly with them.

Does he like water? Nigel does not seem to be a fan of water. He seems afraid of the hose and will not go in the pool. He would not likely make a good lake dog!

Does he like car rides? Nigel loves car rides and he rides very well. He's calm and sits on the seat and enjoys looking out at his surroundings.

Exercise level needed? Nigel wears out pretty fast from activity so a neighborhood walk or some ball time in the yard is about all he needs. He can overheat easily during hot weather as bulldogs often can. He's an easy dog to have in terms of exercise because he doesn't need to be taken for a long run or anything to get his energy out. 

Behavior issues? Nigel can be frightened by loud noises so he needs to be contained during thunder storms or when fire works occur. He can also be afraid of big trucks or fast moving objects. This is not a behavior issue but is worth noting. When stressed or overexcited he will hump, which is not an appealing behavior but he does respond to a firm \"No\" when redirected to stop. Sometimes he needs to hear it several times but will stop. We do believe that after being given enough time to adjust in a home, this behavior will minimize. Humping is often a sign of stress for a dog and poor Nigel has had a lot of stress in his life and he needs stability.

Medical issues? Nigel has no known medical issues.
?
Skills? Nigel knows how to sit, lay down, shake and roll over. He's a smart cookie and learns fast!   

Special/endearing things? Nigel is a very sweet, attentive boy. He enjoys back scratches and snuggles and being as close as possible. He is what we often call \"velcro dogs\" dogs who are just drawn to people and prefer being nearby at all times. He's curious and will follow you throughout the home so you'll never be lonely! Nigel's adorable underbite will melt your heart when he stairs up at you and offers you his paw. He's a super smarty and he learns quickly so if you're looking for a dog you can have fun with obedience skills, Nigel would be perfect! Nigel had a home for the first five years of his life that was not ideal for him. He did not receive the care he deserved and then he was dumped at the shelter. He was extremely sad and wondering where his family went so it would be great to get him back into a home where he can get and give the love he so very much wants and deserves.

Ideal home? The ideal home for Nigel would be one where he has a big back yard with a solid wood fence where he can run and play and be a dog. Nigel never had that growing up and was contained to a tiny yard or in the house and that is no life for a large dog. He likes to lay in the grass and relax and having a nice big back yard would be great for him. His home needs to be other pet free as he prefers to be the star of the show. A home where he can get a lot of love and be a true member of the family, being allowed to live inside, snuggle on the couch, sleep in his caregivers room, things like that. He loves people and loves being close and would really enjoy a family who includes him. A caregiver who works from home would be awesome for him as he doesn't love being alone. The ideal home would be one on the quieter side because Nigel can be scared of loud noises and activity. Lastly, he would prefer to stay home or go on car rides vs. going into public places and being taken everywhere. That kind of lifestyle would be too stressful for him so someone content to let Nigel kick it at home most of the time would be great :)

name: Rocky 6-67-19 A
description: Playful and loves people.  He does well with bigger dogs. He is would be  a great hiking partner.

name: JENNA
description:
JENNA is a LOVE

Jenna is a calm, mature, black, Pit Bull Terrier with a white chest blaze on her shiny black coat.  She weighs 78# and is approximately 18 months old.  She loves to be petted and spend time hanging out with people.  

She is outgoing, energetic and confident.   Jenna is a medium activity girl and would do best with an owner with some dog experience because she is young and teachable.

Jenna is inquisitive and playful and Has a mellow personality.  She is learning her leash manners currently and knows how to sit and stay.   Investing time, love and training in Jenna will result in a loyal, fun, healthy, lifelong companion.

Jenna is OK with cats after proper introductions.   She is selective with her dog friends so proper introductions with be important.  She would benefit from doggy playgroups with the same dogs.  We always recommend that dogs be fed separately in a multiple dog home.   
When you meet Jenna, you will enjoy her positive, sweet, personality. She is looking for a forever home where she can continue to learn and love and be loved.

Jenna is spayed, microchipped, hw tested negative, and up to date on vaccines and preventatives. 

Jenna can be seen at the Placer County Animal Services Center 
11232 B Avenue, Auburn, CA 95603

Shelter hours:
Monday - Saturday: 10:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. (Adoptions end at 4:30 p.m.)
Closed Sundays and County holidays 

Call telephone # 530.886.5541 for further information on Jenna

name: Koenig!
description:
?Courtesy Post?

Are you a little slow to warm to new people? Tired of this fast paced crazy world? Koenig might be your spirit animal! Read on below to learn more about Koenig and how to apply to adopt your next BFF ?

What is your name? Koenig (which means King)

How old are you? About 1.5 years old

How much do you weigh? Roughly 60lbs

What do you look like? I am beautiful! My fur is light caramel color and my eyes are a light hazel. I am not too big or small.

What kind of personality do you have? I take a while to warm up to new people. I can be very particular! If you have a lot of people coming to visit or you are constantly on the go, I am NOT the dog for you. A quiet stable environment would be the healthiest place for me. Once I like someone I am a great companion, I just need time!

Describe your perfect day. Probably playing with other dogs and having lots of snacks.

What is your favorite toy? All of them!

Do you know any tricks? I know basic commands like sit, but can still learn!

What scares you? New people, but nothing else in general.

Have you been around children, do you like them? I would do best in an all adult home.

Do you like cats? Cats? No thanks. I would probably chase them.

How do you feel about other dogs? I like them! I get along with all the dogs in my current place.

If you could be anywhere in the world where would it be? A nice yard would be pretty cool.

How is your health? I am very healthy!

Do you like walking on a leash? I can walk well but would take a lot of practice and a strong leader to get me into outside walks since I am afraid of new people. It might be more fun for me to play ball in a yard or play with other dogs in my backyard.

Do you have any not so great habits that we should know about for instance do you bark or dig in the yard? Outside of my fear of new people not really.

Are you house trained? Yes, I sure am.

Do you like water? Sure I do!

What do you love about your current family? I have been in temporary housing for a little while. It is ok because I get food, play time and a bed, the people here take good care of me but it isnât a home.

What was your life like before being rescued by your current family? I am crashing at a kennel for now. My first home had a combined family and they were unable to manage my special needs with theirs. The place where I have been taken when my owners were out of town knew I deserved a chance so while I wasnât the right fit for my prior family I deserve a home with the right person!

We are, however, willing to adopt out of our area, including the Bay Area, Tahoe, and even further. We've even adopted out of state on very special occasions. We try our best to match our dogs to the perfect homes, and match them based on their personalities, not their looks. Adoptions are not done on a first come, first serve basis, rather in the order of what homes are the right match for that particular dog. Our adoption fees are based on the dog and range from $200-$350. In the case of senior dogs (6+ years), fees will be waived to the right home. This includes spay/neuter, vaccines, microchip, and deworming (if necessary).

name: Cuddles*
description:
Fully vetted, spayed 5 year old female
UTD on vaccinations

I would like to thank all the people who donated to my surgery. Due to your kindness, I look happy and new. I am forever grateful but now I need my own home. Will you help me find one?


Hi my name is Cuddles. I am a 5-year-old, 10 pounds terrier mix. I was rescued by Scooters as a part of a hoarding case. I suffered traumatic injury to my lower jaw months ago and because the injury was not treated in time now the vet says my jaw cannot be repaired. But all this doesnât stop me from being a happy normal dog. I eat normally. I like my food to be a bit wet so itâs easier for me to eat it using my tongue. I like to drink lots of water. I love to cuddle in bed and play with other dogs so having another playful dog is a must for me. I am super friendly. Scooters got me a dental. The vet took out all my rotted teeth and repaired my nasal passage so that food doesnât get stuck in it. I am looking for a special person who will adopt me and love me forever so I forget all that I have been through. If you are that person please fill out an adoption application

name: Nino
description:
Hi,  I am Nino !

I   am a handsome looking guy  around 5 years old.
I love  people of all ages  and other dogs of all sizes  
I love the security of my crate  but am just as happy to run around the house with my humans.
I am a real man's dog but I love my foster momma too
  I do sit  and  give high 5  !
I really love going for my daily walks  and runs. I am housetrained and use a doggie door.
When not playing or snuggling with my humans  you can find me chillin in the house or where ever my human is 
I like to go for truck rides for a new adventure because we get to see a lot of things but my favorite thing is just to be around my family. I would love a home with a retired person since I love being with my person. 
I am good for the groomers and the vet. :)
 Come meet me!
Submit an application on me at  www.chowsplus.org

name: Stella!!
description:
What is your name? Stella

How old are you? About 3 years old

How much do you weigh? 70lbs

What do you look like? 
Iâm a black beauty with a little bit of white on my chest. ? Oh and I have beautiful brown eyes.

What do you like to eat?
Kibble, treats and apples with peanut butter are good and I love to snack on carrots.

What kind of personality do you have?
Iâm a quiet girl and a bit shy but will be your BFF once I trust you.

Describe your perfect day:? 
My perfect day would be getting up to you! Going for a walk, having breakfast and playing in the yard with a friend or toys. Then hanging out on the couch with you watching a little tv and taking a nap if that is what you want to do but Iâm down for anything.

What is your favorite toy? 
I love anything that squeaks !

Do you know any tricks?
I know sit, wait, easy, leave it and play.

What scares you? 
If you raise your voice because I think youâre mad at me. I'm sensitive like that.

Have you been around children? No I havenât while in my foster momâs house

Do you like cats?
my foster mom says itâs best that I donât live with cats.

How do you feel about other dogs? 
Other dogs are great. I havenât met one I didnât like ?

If you could be anywhere in the world, where would it be ?
With you where ever you go.

How is your health?
Iâm in great shape. My foster mom has taken good care of me. Iâm at the perfect weight and have nice soft hair.

Who do you live with in your foster home and who is your closest companion? 
My foster family consists of my foster mom, my foster fur sister and fur brother. I love being with them all.

Where do you hang out when you are home alone?
In my very own bedroom.

Where do you sleep?
In my open crate in my foster momâs room

Do you like walking on a leash? 
Oh yes! Iâm very good on a leash Iâve been told. I never pull and stay right next to you.

Do you have any \"not-so-great\" habits that we should know about? For instance, do you bark or dig in the yard? 
Nope, but I will alert bark when I sense you need to know something is going on.

Are you house trained? (Meaning do you go potty outside): Absolutely! 
I go potty outside before my foster mom leaves for work and again when she gets home and before we all go to bed. Iâm good and never potty in my room or in my crate. Once my foster my is home I do come and go as I please through this thing called a dog door my foster mom has and itâs amazing!

Do you like playing in water? 
Yes! I love to go to the lake and we have a kiddy pool in the backyard too.

What do you love about your foster family? 
I love that my foster mom has been patient with me while I learned the rules of the house. I feel happy and safe there. My fur brother and fur sister are fun to have around too.

What was your life like before being joining NBBR?
I was found in a cemetery after I had 7 babies. I was so skinny and hungry when I came to live with my foster mom. Now Iâm healthy, happy and looking forward to the future with you.

name: Buddy - The Chamer
description:
Buddy - The Darling Charmer 

Little Buddy has had a rough start, he was found roaming the streets of LA starving and dirty.  A kind individual was able to pick him up and bring them to a local shelter.

He sat in the shelter for a very long time since he was extremely afraid of people and did not trust anyone.

We rescued him and have been helping him blossom into a darling little munchkin.  He can still be a little shy but he has come a very long way.

He does well with older children and most dogs big and small.  The BEST home for him to thrive in would be a very quiet environment with stay at home person.

If you have a big heart for a beautiful little guy that needs tic then Buddy could be the perfect fit.

name: Tequila
description:
Tequila is a 5 years old Chihuahua mix. He is microchipped and up to date on all vaccines. He is a vocal guy and likes to talks to the people he meets. He will come up to his person looking for attention and to play. He likes to be held, but can be a little shy when meeting new people.

Tequila could use a foster home while waiting for a perment home.

name: FRANCO
description:
FRANCO HITS THE MARKO

Franco

Franco is a friendly, attentive, strong, handsome, and intelligent 6 year old Pit Bull Terrier male.  It is evident that he has had  prior training because he knows basic commands as well as some cute tricks, including how to sit, lie down, stay, rollover, shake, play âbang, youâre deadâ and DOUBLE high five.   He also walks pretty nicely on a leash for a big, strong dog. 

Franco is in great physical shape.  Francoâs coat is a rich silver gray (with a small splash of white on his chest) and he weighs 66#.  Franco will need a life full of  a medium level activities; he is muscular and athletic. Because he is 6 years old, he qualifies for our Senior for Seniors program where adopters over 55 y/o have his adoption fee waived.

Franco is outgoing and confident. He likes to be petted and he likes to be with people.  He is very affectionate and friendly and wants to be your pal.  
He is receptive and sensitive to correction. Staff and volunteers are working with him on all of his doggie manners. He is very gentle. He wants to be loved and express his love for you. 

He likes to chill cuddled up next to your side.  He likes to be close.  He is very bright and tries to please and be responsive to what is expected of him.  He is a quality dog and an absolute keeper!   

Franco is okay with certain dogs and is selective and can be a little pushy, so proper introductions would be important.  He appears to respect cats and  is OK with cats after proper introductions.

Franco shows every indication of being a devoted companion and loyal best friend. He likes toys and knows how to play fetch.  Are you that special person for him to belong to and make a fun, wonderful life with? Come down and meet him. You will not be disappointed by this wonderful dog.

Franco is neutered, microchipped, hw tested negative, and up to date on vaccines and preventatives. 

Franco can be seen at the Placer County Animal Services Center 
11232 B Avenue, Auburn, CA 95603

Shelter hours:
Monday - Saturday: 10:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. (Adoptions end at 4:30 p.m.)
Closed Sundays and County holidays 

Call telephone # 530.886.5541 for further information on  Franco

name: Roxie
description: Roxie is playful, fun and in excellent health. Nine is just a number for her. Happy Tails came to her rescue after being surrendered to the shelter by her previous people. She was depressed in the kennels there and was not available for adoption because of it. Once she was in her foster home she blossomed into a very sweet and loving dog almost immediately. It was magic! She potty trained and takes direction well. She loves long walks, but is also comfortable cuddling up with you on the sofa. She would do equally well in a home with a lot of activity or in a quiet setting. She loves to be with her people and does not like to be alone at night. She will need to be placed in a home that will not crate her overnight. She will do best in a home without other pets â especially cats â and does not mind being alone during the day. Open your heart and home to this wonderful dog who is ready for her forever home!

name: Archie
description: Archie is new to our rescue, but is a very sweet, lovable boy. Follow his story on our Facebook or Instagram using the hashtag, \"#SacRDRArchie

name: FARGO
description:
FARGO is a two year old Grey Siberian Husky. Fargo is young, affectionate, great on a leash, spayed and up to date on shots.  

Abandoned in the country, Fargo was brought to us by a cowboy on a cattle ranch.  He and a companion dog ran up to him and they followed him back to his truck.  He rides well in the car, leash trained, good with people and dogs,  He will make a great family dog!  

His adoption fee is $300.  Give us a call for more information at 916-207-4807

name: Arizona
description: Arizona has only ever known love, she trusts everyone, and the world is her happy place. She is a double merle, six month old puppy, and was born deaf and blind. Arizonaâs confidence is absolutely remarkable. She happily maneuvers around her foster parents house and yard with ease, always manages to find her toys, the water bowl, and any crumb that may have dropped on the floor. Arizona loves her tummy rubbed almost as much as giving her foster moms kisses. She does great with her furry foster siblings, including the cats. Arizona will need an adopter that is willing to continue working with an experienced trainer so she will continue to be a happy and confident girl. If you are interested in adopting the sweetest girl in the world, please send us an email for a link to the questionnaire.

name: Bilbo (bobo)
description:
He is 7 years old and neutered, Chihuahua/mini pin mix. He is
Sweet and very loving. He needs to have some teeth pulled, it is hard for him to eat regular food. He eats soft food. Should eat fine once his dental work is done. He knows a few commands such as sit and stay and how to walk on a leash, we are not sure of his of life before but we  guess it may have been rough since he doesn't know how to play, or what a ball is or even toys. He would love to enjoy the company of a loving permanent home.

To adopt please apply online at foac.us or for more information please contact the facility at (209)533-3622 Monday-Saturday 10am-2pm

name: Toby
description: Laid back â Easygoing â Good Natured â Handsome. These are just some of the adjectives that my Foster person uses to describe my personality! Hi, my name is Toby. Iâm a 110 lb, gentle giant with soulful brown eyes and a disposition to match. I have a beautiful, thick tricolor coat. Just some of my great qualities include walking on a loose leash, housetrained, crate-trained and well-mannered with all people I meet. I would do best in a home with older children. My ideal home would be quiet and slightly active. You see, I was rescued from Yolo County Shelter by the wonderful volunteers at EDCGSR. They heard I needed double elbow surgery, so they invested in me and provided the care I needed. I am on the mend and showing my personality! Iâm somewhat interested in other dogs, but have a high interest in little animals, so cats are probably a no. My Foster mom says I have an excellent nose and love to sniff every inch of my surroundings. My ideal furever home would be with someone who is home most of the day and enjoys hanging around a quiet home. If youâre looking for a sweet and gentle spirit who will devote his life to giving you love and affection, then reach out and meet me. Iâm current on all vaccinations, heartworm negative, microchipped and neutered. If I sound like a great match, then please contact my friends at EDCGSR and fill out an application at http://www.edcgsr.com/adoption-process.html

name: Raspberry!!
description:
What is your name? Raspberry

How old are you? About 2 years old

How much do you weigh? About 55 lbs

What do you look like? Iâm a beautiful girl with the prettiest brown fur and a white chest. I also have a white spot the the top of my head.

What do you like to eat? For breakfast and dinner I eat Taste of the Wild With salmon. But, I really like treats and anything with peanut butter.

What kind of personality do you have? I have a good amount of energy and LOVE to play. But my foster mom does tell me Iâm the sweetest girl and I love climbing into someoneâs lap and getting all the love.

Describe your perfect day: My perfect day would start with playing in the yard and then Iâd come in for breakfast. After that Iâd like to play some more, maybe take a nap and then wake up and play some more!

What is your favorite toy? I love toys! My foster mom has this thing called a flirt pole and itâs my favorite! But really I love all toys but I donât like to share them.

Do you know any tricks? I can sit, lay down and shake. Iâm also learning this thing called Wait

What scares you? Nothing really, Iâm very brave!

Have you been around children? Do you like them? I love kids but my foster mom thinks I should be in a house with bigger kids because sometimes I get excited and jump on people

Do you like cats? I love to stalk them! But I should probably be in a home without cats

How do you feel about other dogs? I love to play with other dogs after proper introductions of course, but I donât like to share my toys so toy-free playtime is best when thereâs another dog to play with.

If you could be anywhere in the world, where would it be? Iâd love to be outdoors playing with my forever family

How is your health? When my foster mom got me from the shelter my ear was so infected that it was completely swollen shut. My foster mom has taken great care of me and with the guidance and medication from an amazing vet.... my ear is better. I will need allergy medication and my ear flushed once a week but Iâm totally worth it!!

Who do you live with your foster home and who is your closest companion? I live with my foster mom and two little girls. I also have 2 foster dog brothers and 2 cats that live here.

Where do you hang out when you are home alone? I stay in my crate when no one is home

Where do you sleep? I sleep in my crate, itâs comfy in there

Do you like walking on a leash? I really love going for walks. I have a special collar I wear and as soon as I see my foster mom grab it, I get really excited!

Do you have any \"not-so-great\" habits that we should know about? For instance, do you bark or dig in the yard? Sometimes I get really excited and jump on people, Iâm working really hard on that but I just get so excited. Another bad habit I have is I am obsessed with the cats that I live with, really obsessed,stalk them obsessed. Iâm also working on not yelling at other dogs I see, but I just get so excited

Are you house trained? (Meaning do you go potty outside) Yes!

Do you like water? Iâm not really sure about water but I do like warm baths

What do you love about your foster family? I love that they give me attention and treats, lots of treats! Also my foster mom sings âRaspberry the Dogâ to me in the tune of Princeâs Raspberry Beret (sheâs weird but I like it).

What was your life like before being brought into NorCal Bully Breed Rescue? I was at the shelter with a bad ear infection but as soon as I got to my foster home they took care of me and got the help I needed to get my ear to heal and now Iâm ready to find my forever home.

*NorCal Bully Breed Rescue is a foster based rescue with foster homes spread all throughout the Sacramento area. We usually require our adopters to be within a 50 to 100 mile radius of us, depending on the dog, and depending on the home. This is because we need to do a yard check to guarantee that the potential adopter's yard is secure, and also have them be close enough should any behavioral issues arise, and the assistance of our trainer is needed. We are, however, willing to adopt out of our area, including the Bay Area, Tahoe, and even further. We've even adopted out of state on very special occasions. We try our best to match our dogs to the perfect homes, and match them based on their personalities, not their looks. Adoptions are not done on a first come, first serve basis, rather in the order of what homes are the right match for that particular dog. Our adoption fees are based on the dog and range from $200-$350. In the case of senior dogs (6+ years), fees will be waived to the right home. This includes spay/neuter, vaccines, microchip, and deworming (if necessary).

**Interested in meeting Rasberry or any of our available pooches? Complete and submit our adoption application on our websitenorcalbullybreedrescue.com and we will respond to you within 24 to 48 hours

name: Farah, super loving
description:
Contact: mariannagilshteyn2005@yahoo.com
Farah is an amazing girl who truly enjoys the companionship of the humans and large dogs. She is extremely smart, loyal and the great Cuddler. She loves going for a walks, playing fetch and belly rubs.

If you are looking for a great addition to your family, Farah is your girlie!

name: Farah
description: If you're looking for an awesome, extremely smart, active pal , Farah is your girl. She walks well on a leash and loves people and has the cutest personality ever! . She likes big dogs but not little ones. Her favorite activites are playing ball, going on walks and belly rubs. Farah is a little bit lonely and bored here. she's looking for an active family that will include her in their activities. She's not a dog that can spend long hours in a backyard with nothing to do. If you'd like to meet Farah, please email us a tell us how life would be for Farah living with you. 9/13/19 7:55 PM

name: Moby
description: Moby is convinced that NOBODY WANTS HIM.  He is 3 yrs old and is sweet, easy and laid back and always wags his tail.  He loves to eat his dog cookies and lay his head against you.  Moby is happy and loving and just happens to have chronic dry eye --a not so uncommon autoimmune condition in dogs.  He needs daily eye medications, but lives a happy, healthy life--just like any other dog!  His eyes have improved but, he will still need daily eye drops.  He is so easy that he just sits there and lets you put the drops in his eyes and then looks for the dog cookie he's come to expect!  This guy needs a front porch in the summer and a fireplace in the winter to hang out on.  He's so easy you won't even know there's a dog around.  He's a very handsome guy.

name: Summer
description: Summer is a very affectionate, playful, and protective girl. She's about 2 1/2-3 yrs old and is spayed and current on vaccines and heartworm prevention.  She enjoys tucking her head into your lap for some love and attention. She seems to be a quick learner and tries hard to please us. She loves going on walks and accompany some of the other rescue dogs who go for walks together.  She has a protective nature and is outgoing.  You can talk her out of most things fairly easily and enjoys spending lots of time outside.  She enjoys attention and is very sweet.  She's tolerant of cats, mostly and will tolerate most male dogs.  She should be in an adult home that enjoys a quiet setting without chaos. She is a beauty and not very big at all...good things come in small packages!

name: Logan
description:
Logan joined the NorCal family with his brother, Parker, (also posted). He and his brother and sister (already adopted), needed to leave their home when their family separated.

Logan is a sweet, affectionate, healthy, 5 year old boy that needs to have a family that can be home with him the majority of the time and provide some training, long walks and attention.

 Logan appears to have been the dominant leader of his sibling pack and would be at his best as an only dog.  He doesn't like to share his food or treats and can be reactive.

If you are interested in Logan, please contact Janet at janetleigh44@gmail.com

name: Ginger
description:
Ginger is around 4 years old and is currently in a foster home. Ginger is a super sweet girl who needs an active home who will play with her and appreciate her playfulness and zest for life. She is extremely loving and really bonds with her people. Ginger has been through obedience training and has really learned a lot and needs a family who will continue to help her practice her manners. She does well when left alone in the house and is used to having a dog door to the back yard. She really enjoys snuggling on the couch and spending time with people. She is spayed, up to date on vaccinations, crate trained, house trained and microchipped. 

Child appropriate?  Ginger has loved all the kids she has met so far. She greets everyone very happily but can get a bit overexcited and will jump on children because she is excited to play.  She has been great with the 8-9 year olds in fosters old neighborhood. Older children that can play tug of war would be best as Ginger loves to tug!

Other dog appropriate? While Ginger has not had a ton of dog exposure in her foster home, she has played well with other dogs around her size. She has not been around small dogs to play with and we would not recommend a small dog as Ginger likes to play and her size might be intimidating for a small dog. Ginger would enjoy the company of another friendly, medium energy dog who likes to play.

Cat appropriate? Most likely not. She has not been in a house with a cat and the neighbor cat would tease her while on top of the fence. 

How is she with strangers? She loves people and is friendly with everyone she has met.  She wants attention from people. 

What is her play style?  With people she loves to play tug of war with a rope or toy that is big enough. That seems to be her favorite game and enjoys someone strong enough to give her a good, honest tug!  With other dogs, she likes to run and chase but does not appear to enjoy super rough and tumble play from another dog.

Does she like toys? She loves toys. She chews up stuffed toys and carries them around. She does not chew shoes or slippers. She likes sturdy balls and squeak toys.

Does she like water? Ginger seems to do ok with water but prefers to wade around vs. jump in. She has not had a kiddy pool so we aren't sure about those but she might enjoy one.

Does she like car rides? She loves riding in the car and sits nicely when riding. She pretty much just enjoys being with people so being in a car puts her right where she wants to be!

Exercise level needed?  Ginger loves to  run in the yard and would enjoy some yard playtime with her human family or another dog. Her favorite pastime is playing tug of war to get some energy out. She is medium energy so will need daily exercise of yard play time or brisk walk/run. She will chase a toy  or ball and bring it back but not always drop it for fetch.

Behavior issues? She gets very excited when people come to the house and will still jump on them to get attention until they pet her.  She can also be pushy with wanting attention. She only barks when someone is in the yard or at the front door. She will obey when told to stop when it is other dogs next door.  She likes to lick but will stop when asked to do so. Ginger can get overstimulated when out in public, excited to see other dogs, sometimes people, and this can impact her leash walking. She needs more exposure to the world to curb this excitement and a family who can be patient with her. 

Medical issues? She has \"Happy tail Syndrome\". She wags her tail so hard it can split from hitting something hard. 

Skills? She waits to get on the couch or bed until given permission to do so.  She sits and waits for permission. She can sit, shake and sometimes lay down.  She can wait  and stay if she is not over excited by a person at the door.  She wants to have the attention.     

Special/endearing things? She sits upright beside her foster mom on the couch and watches T.V.  She likes to snuggle.  She puts her paw or head on you. She wiggles her butt while wagging her tail when she is excited to see humans.

Ideal home?  Ginger's ideal home would be with adults and some older kids that can play tug of war with her or adults that have time to play with her. An active home would be best because she is still young and energetic. Another dog that is similar in energy and play style would be nice for her. She likes to sleep with her human on the bed so a home who will allow her to be a true member of the family, couch time, etc...would be ideal.  Ginger would need a fenced back yard where she can run around and play.

name: Luna*friendly, smart, confident
description:
Luna is fostered in Grass Valley, Ca.
Please don't respond on Petfinder.
For Application click here:
https://nevadacountypaws.org/forms-menu/adoption-application/
Home check and small adoption fee
Email caindenises@gmail.com

Looking for a best friend that can go everywhere with you? A snuggly confidant that will love you back every moment of every day? Quiet, but playful, good traveler, and will accept your friends and family instantly? Smart little gal who listens? Here she is!!!!!!

Hi! 
My name is Luna. I am 6 years young, and I weigh 5.5 lbs. I am what you call a pure Chihuahua. I have an unusual soft rusty brown coat with white feet. I am sweet and loving, a great little snuggler at bedtime. I rarely bark, and am housebroken. 
You should also know that I am bold and brave with dogs and cats of all size. Don't underestimate me. I can chase a Rottweiler back to his bed if I need too! 
I was raised by my mom as an only dog, and love being your everything!  I am playful and like my toys. I like all people immediately. I'm being fostered with all size dogs and it's going well.
Sadly, my mom had some difficulties with housing, and thinks I need a more stable home. She loves me, and took very good care of me.

Home2home-nc on facebook is trying to help me find a new family. 
I am spayed, all shots and healthy. 
Are you my new family? Probably best there be no kids undee 12. I am not a toy, and tiny dogs can be at risk of injury with very small kids.

Please call my foster mom Denise at 530-955-5111 and lets talk!
Nevada City, Ca

name: Sasha!
description:
What is your name? Sasha Fierce!

How old are you? About two

How much do you weigh? A compact 50lbs

What do you look like? Have you seen me? I am gorgeous! I am short and stout and my brindle colors are fabulous.

What kind of personality do you have? I am a very sweet girl, I warm up to the ladies right away and by warm up I mean I am in your lap or at your feet whenever possible. I have lots of energy, and am playful and happy!

Describe your perfect day. Food, treats and lots of play time with my people or my dog friends. Maybe even a short run if you are up for it.

What is your favorite toy? All of them! Especially balls, I can entertain myself if I have a ball. I toss them up, and catch them and then roll them around, itâs pretty funny.

Do you know any tricks?
I do not know a ton of tricks yet, still working on it!

What scares you? I can be timid of new men but warm up pretty quick, just pet me and give me attention. On walks loud cars can freak me out a little, but I am fine after they pass.
Nothing else really scares meâ¦â¦not even that weird vacuum thing.

Have you been around children, do you like them?
I have been around some smaller kids I do pretty well, I still play nibble, which I am working on and improving daily and can be a little rambunctious so older kids would be best unless, the parents are around to make sure I donât knock the rugrats down!

Do you like cats? Cats? Not sureâ¦I do not react to them when on my walks so maybe with proper introductions.

How do you feel about other dogs? I like them A LOT, my favorite thing to do is play w/ my older pup brother. I leave my dogs sisters alone unless they want to play with me first. I would do well with a dog who likes to play!

If you could be anywhere in the world where would it be? Wherever my humans are, I love when they are around unless I have a playful dog to roll around with.

How is your health? I am in wonderful health!
Who do you live with in your foster home and who is your closest companion.
My foster humans, my foster dog brother and 2 two-foster dog sisters. Foster mom is my favorite, I sit right in her lap when I can, but Ralphie my foster pup brother is a close second. He lets me play wild with him.

Where do you hang out when you are home alone? In my large crate with toys! This is a safe and cozy place! I whimper a little at first but settle down quickly. If I am an only dog I can probably just lounge on the couch while you are gone. I am not destructive and am potty trained.

Do you like walking on a leash? Foster mom says I excel at this, I walk without pulling and I run like a champ.

Do you have any not so great habits that we should know about for instance do you bark or dig in the yard?
I may bark a little at new men or be a little shy with new people at first. I dig in the dirt sometimes but not in the grass, thatâs good though right?

Are you house trained?
Yes! In fact, I have only had one accident in the house and itâs not really my fault I stood by the door but fosmom didnât make it in time. I tried to tell her!

Do you like water? 
Not sure, bath time is ok I guess.

What do you love about your current family? They give me so much love, hugs and kisses, I have lots of toys to keep me busy and I sure do enjoy another dog to play with. I also appreciate that they are patient as I grow into a mature pup! I have some things to learn still because of my life on the streets but I sure am sweet.

What was your life like before being rescued by your current family?
I donât like to talk much about it because the past is the past right? But I was likely a great companion to someone in Tijuana until I was attacked by a man with a machete, he hurt my head and back but luckily a kind person took me to a vet, I recovered and became a ârescueâ?....I even got to fly in a plane to Sacramento with Pilots N Paws to my new foster home, it was pretty cool. I have shut that door and moved on to my new fierce and fabulous life. I am healthy, happy and ready for a forever home, thanks to NorCal Bully Breed Rescue.

*NorCal Bully Breed Rescue is a foster based rescue with foster homes spread all throughout the Sacramento area. We usually require our adopters to be within a 50 to 100 mile radius of us, depending on the dog, and depending on the home. This is because we need to do a yard check to guarantee that the potential adopter's yard is secure, and also have them be close enough should any behavioral issues arise, and the assistance of our trainer is needed. We are, however, willing to adopt out of our area, including the Bay Area, Tahoe, and even further. We've even adopted out of state on very special occasions. We try our best to match our dogs to the perfect homes, and match them based on their personalities, not their looks.

Adoptions are not done on a first come, first serve basis, rather in the order of what homes are the right match for that particular dog. Our adoption fees are based on the dog and range from $200-$350. In the case of senior dogs (6+ years), fees will be waived to the right home. This includes spay/neuter, vaccines, microchip, and deworming (if necessary).

Sasha's adoption donation is $200.

Interested in meeting Sasha or any of our available pooches? Complete and submit our adoption application on our website norcalbullybreedrescue.com and we will respond to you within 2-4 business days.

name: Ava (Adoption Fee Sponsored)
description:
Meet Miss Ava. Ava is approximately 6 yrs old, spayed, very clean and respectful in the house. Barks very rarely, but is very alert. Also has good recall. Due to prey drive no cats. She seems to be ok with little dogs and absolutely loves people. Did we mention Ava's adoption fee is sponsored to the right home???? We want only the best for her. This gentle girl deserves to be in a loving home. 

If you are interested in adopting Ava please go to www.sngsr.org and complete the application. 

The rescue suggests obedience training for all puppies and dogs. 

If you have any questions please email us at sierranevadagsr@outlook.com
or visit our website www.sngsr.org. You can also see what we are up to day to day by following our Facebook page at Sierra Nevada German Shepherd Rescue.

Thank you for considering adopting a rescue dog and supporting Sierra Nevada German Shepherd Rescue in our efforts to save lives!

name: Griffin
description:
Meet Griffin our newest bundle of lovable energy. This sweet 5 year old boy will jump in your lap, give you kisses and follow you everywhere. He loves to go for walks, car rides and will instantly become your best friend. 

Griffin needs to be in a home with someone that can be home with him the majority of the time and provide needed training and attention. He needs a yard for him to run and play. He also thinks he is \"top dog\" so would be at his best as an only dog.  Griffin is a healthy, happy boy and ready to find his forever home.

If you are interested in Griffin, please contact Janet at janetleigh44@gmail.com

name: Precious
description:
We saved \"Precious\" from Stanislaus Animal Shelter literally hours before she was scheduled to be euthanized. She approximately 3-4 years old and 67 lbs. She is friendly, full of energy and spunk. She's an absolute joy.  If you're looking for a dog that alerts or will bark, she's your gal. 

Precious is up to date on shots, is spayed and microchipped. The adoption fee is $350. Please note, we DO NOT ADOPT OUT OF STATE EXCEPT FOR RENO (also surrounding areas to Reno within 30 minutes). 

If you are interested in adopting Precious please go to www.sngsr.org and complete the application. 

The rescue suggests obedience training for all puppies and dogs. 

If you have any questions please email us at sierranevadagsr@outlook.com
or visit our website www.sngsr.org. You can also see what we are up to day to day by following our Facebook page at Sierra Nevada German Shepherd Rescue.

Thank you for considering adopting a rescue dog and supporting Sierra Nevada German Shepherd Rescue in our efforts to save lives!


She is ready to go to her forever home so please go to https://www.sngsr.org/steps-to-adopting.html and fill out an application.
Video:
https://youtu.be/coRNd5moyEI

name: Jack
description: Jack gets along with other dogs , he welcomes them in his life , he gets along with cats , kids , he loves loves loves his human .  He is all Min Pin .  He thinks he is a human   If you are interested in Jack  email forpetsake@sbcglobal.net   or call for  a meet and greet (530) 263-3331

name: Farah!
description:
If you are looking for an awesome, mature, sweet-as-pie best friend, look no further!! Farah is your Girl!!

Through no fault of her own, sweet Farah spends her days alone in a backyard. Farah is currently in a rescue with many senior dogs where she doesn't exactly fit in because she has a bit more energy than her senior peers.

Farah is a spry and healthy 5-7 year old that loves people, going for walks and playing ball. Farah is very well behaved, walks great on leash and loves being around people! ?

Read more about Farah in her bio below!

What is your name?
Hello there! My name is Farah!

How old are you?
Thatâs a good questionâ¦.I was found as a stray and the shelter thinks I may be 7 years old.

How much do you weigh?
Psssttâ¦.are you supposed to ask ladies about their weight? Between you and me, I am a healthy 46lbs.

What do you look like?
Iâm a beauty! I am a tri-colored lady with a white beauty mark on my face. I have gorgeous brown eyes that draw you in and melt your heart. ?

What do you like to eat?
I enjoy dry grain free beef kibble.

What kind of personality do you have?
I am a sweet and loving girl that loves to go for walks and play ball. I LOVE belly rubs and being around people.? I am energetic, but not without manners; I know not to jump on people or behave like a spaz.

Describe your perfect day:
My perfect day would hands down be hanging with my human(s), going for a long walk or hike, getting some belly rubs and then just chillaxing.?

What is your favorite toy?
The ball is my #1 favorite toy!

Do you know any tricks?
I am very smart! I know how to open my crate and open doors with levers.

What scares you?
So far, I havenât found anything that frightens me.

Have you been around children? Do you like them?
I havenât been around kids since Iâve been in the care of the rescue, but I did see kids (7/8 years old) at the park and they seemed kinda fun!

Do you like cats?
Honestly, I have not seen one since Iâve been in foster care, so Iâm not sure. But I can tell you that I love to chase squirrelsâ¦they are like furry balls!

How do you feel about other dogs?
I know for sure that I like well mannered big dogs, with a proper introduction of course!?

If you could be anywhere in the world, where would it be?
I would be with my forever family enjoying life!?

How is your health?
I'm in great health!

Who do you live with in your foster home and who is your closest companion?
Right now I am living at an in home rescue with other dogs and adults. Itâs not an ideal living situation for me. I am really sad and lonely all the time because I am by myself in the backyard all day.?

Where do you hang out when you are home alone?
I stay in the backyard by myself.?

Where do you sleep?
I sleep in my crate in the house.

Do you like walking on a leash?
I love to go for walks and I am a fantastic leash walker!

Do you have any \"not-so-great\" habits that we should know about? For instance, do you bark or dig in the yard?
Iâm a good girl. Iâm not a barker, digger or jump on people kinda dog.

Are you house trained? (Meaning do you go potty outside)
Of course! Potty is for outside only.

Do you like water?
Iâm not sure if I like to swim, but I know for sure that I like to drink water.

What do you love about your foster family?
They saved me from the shelter and are taking care of me while I find my forever family.

If youâre interested in meeting Farah, please jump on our website and fill out an adoption application!!!
Norcalbullybreedrescue.com

(Sacramento and surrounding areas please) Farah's adoption fee is waived

name: Luna
description:
Luna will be graduating the PUPP PROGRAM this month with her k-9 doggy good citizenship. She is looking for her forever home.

Luna is a one year old female, born April 2018.Â  Luna is about 55 pounds, she is a  German Shepherd mix. She is a sweet girl, housebroken, and would love to be inside a home with her person.Â  She plays very well with other dogs and will play fetch.Â 
To adopt please apply online at foac.us 
To foster or for more information please contact the facility at (209)533-3622 Monday-Saturday 10am-2pm

name: zz Nessa (Courtesy Listing)
description:
COURTESY LISTING 

Beautiful & Sweet Nessa Needs a New Home 

She is a love sponge and just wants all the love you have to give. She has her basic commands down, learns quickly and is eager to please humans. She is high energy and needs walks or runs every day. She would be a great running/jogging partner. Take her in and she will be a wonderful family member as an only dog. I have another female dog and they are not getting along, and it breaks my heart to lose her. Female 2.5 yr/old spayed & current on shots. Please share far and wide and let me know if you, or anyone you know, might be interested. My heart is broken. 925/457-6260

name: Gabriella*
description:
Fully vetted, spayed 7 year old female GSD
UTD on vaccinations

Adoption Fee $250

Hi my name is Gabriella. I am a 7 year old German Shepherd, 70 pounds that was dumped with my puppies at a high kill shelter. Another rescue came and took my puppies and decided not to take me as I tried to protect my puppies. I did not eat and cried for several days. Finally I heard the volunteers saying that Scooters was coming to pick me up. I was confused and scared I didnât know what that meant but I went with my foster mom. It took sometime for me to warm up to her but today I am healthy, happy and learning to trust people. I am good with cats but not good with other dogs. My foster mom has taught me a lot of commands and is working with my shyness. I am very laid back.

If you have a cozy bed for me, a TV, love and food please fill out an adoption application

name: Fudge
description:
Meet Fudge!  He is a young mix of perhaps retriever.lab, and maybe chow. He was rescued from a high kill shelter and doing wonderful in his foster home. He has been great with the other dogs in his foster home. Fudge has a beautiful multi colored unique coat. He has learned manners now and enjoys going for walks to the parks. Great with people and would make an excellent new family member in a home without cats. Fudge enjoys being close to his people and getting cuddles!
An application is required and can be submitted at www.chowsplus.org

name: Chance 4-3-19
description: What a great dog!!!! He is so loving and quiet and sweet. He would love to just hang out all day while you garden or read a book on the porch. Would make a great companion for any family.

name: Cleo
description:
What is your name?
Cleo

How old are you?
My foster parents tell me I'm around six but I pretty dang spunky ?

How much do you weigh?
About 60 pounds

What do you look like?
My foster mom says I look like a land seal. I'm a pretty stinking cute low rider with a beautiful white and grey coat. My face is starting to go a little more white with age but it adds a level of sophistication.

What do you like to eat?
Oh my! I LOVE FOOD! I eat, well pretty much everything. My favorite treat that foster mom makes me is my Kong frozen with a peanut butter, banana and yogurt mixture! Yum-yum! Although for breakfast and dinner I'm eating Costcoâs beef and sweet potato dog food. ?

What kind of personality do you have?
Iâm pretty silly! I pretty much always have a goofy smile on my face! I hop and skip around when it's dinner or breakfast...did I mention I love food? Even though I'm not a puppy anymore I still have a lot of energy and I love to play with toys! And oh my I love love love walks! ?

Describe your perfect day:
Oh wow! My perfect day? Well it would start with some morning pets and kisses. Then I would take a nice long walk and come home to a good breakfast. Then I would jump up on the couch with my human and nap. After nap time a much needed play session would happen. Then an evening walk followed with dinner. I really just enjoy being with my people. ?

What is your favorite toy?
I love all of my toys and I like to play with them all at the same time! So much fun! Foster mom gets a bark box every month for me and my dog foster sister so I have a lot of toys! If I had to pick one it would be my squeaky ball! ?

Do you know any tricks?
I know sit! I sit really well when I see a treat! Foster mom is working on shake but I havenât figured that one out yet.

What scares you?
Not a whole lot! I like to follow the vacuum around while Mom is cleaning. It's fun watching her clean up after my toys!

Have you been around children? Do you like them?
I have not been around children. So I'm not sure how I would do.

Do you like cats?
They are pretty cool! They smell funny and are fun to chase. But if mom tells me to stop I will. (She is no fun). I like to groom the fat one. ?

How do you feel about other dogs?
They are okay. I get along with my foster sister but she let's me do my thing. I would probably prefer to be an only dog so I get all of the attention or, a dog that isnât really high energy because Iâm too old for that puppy nonsense.

If you could be anywhere in the world, where would it be?
With my human(s). I think I spent a lot of time alone so now I like to spend as much time as I can with my humans getting pets and cuddles.

How is your health?
Itâs pretty good! I do have a torn ligament on my back right leg but I get around amazing on it! In fact you can't even tell anything is wrong!

Who do you live with in your foster home and who is your closest companion?
I live with my foster mom and dad and my foster uncle (he's pretty cool I love playing and laying with him). I also live with my dog foster sister and a bunch of cats! I'm not picky with who I'm with with as long as they give good pets.

Where do you hang out when youâre home alone?
In my crate.

Where do you sleep?
I have been spoiled and sleep in bed with my uncle but know how to sleep in my crate. ?

Do you like walking on a leash?
I think I'm new to walking on leash so I'm still learning manners. But I love walks!

Do you have any not-so-great habits that we should know about? For instance, do you bark or dig in the yard?
I like to talk when I'm being ignored but mom tells me to stop and I do. Sometimes I bark at the squirrels! But hey they are teasing me! They keep telling me good girls don't put their dirty paws on clean tables. But I am a good girl so don't know what they are talking about. Although they have found a spray bottle works well for correcting my bad behavior!

Are you house trained?
Very much so, unless thereâs torrential flooding, lightening, hail and thunder outside.

Do you like water?
I love to drink it!! Bath time is okay.

What do you love about your foster family?
I love when they play with me! But I also love when they cuddle me and give me the best pets. But what I love most is how much they love me!

What was your life like before being brought into NorCal Bully Breed Rescue?
I was found wandering the streets of Oakland. Luckily I got picked up and taken to a shelter where my foster parents drove down to get me right before Thanksgiving! So you can only guess what I was thankful for that year! But I'm not looking back on my past I want to move forward and spend the rest of my life happy and with my forever family!

NorCal Bully Breed Rescue is a foster based rescue with foster homes spread all throughout the Sacramento area. We usually require our adopters to be within a 50 to 100 mile radius of us, depending on the dog, and depending on the home.

This is because we need to do a yard check to guarantee that the potential adopter's yard is secure, and also have them be close enough should any behavioral issues arise, and the assistance of our trainer is needed. We are, however, willing to adopt out of our area, including the Bay Area, Tahoe, and even further. We've even adopted out of state on very special occasions.

We try our best to match our dogs to the perfect homes, and match them based on their personalities, not their looks. Adoptions are not done on a first come, first serve basis, rather in the order of what homes are the right match for that particular dog.

Our adoption fees are based on the dog and range from $200-$350. In the case of senior dogs (6+ years), fees will be waived to the right home. This includes spay/neuter, vaccines, microchip, and deworming (if necessary).

Cleo's adoption donation is $200.

Interested in meeting Cleo or any of our available pooches?  Complete and submit our adoption application on our website norcalbullybreedrescue.com and we will respond to you within 2-4 business days.

name: Grace
description:
Grace is a compact, sweet, smart pit bull mix. She is only about 18 inches off the floor, on all four paws, weighing in at 45 pounds. She is a bodybuilder extraordinaire with a bark to match. She is reserved and hesitant with strangers, likely due to mistreatment and abuse. When Grace was found, she was hiding out under a bush in an apartment complex. She was skin and bones and starving, all the while feeding an entire litter of puppies. However, that life is far behind her now, she is one of the happiest, kissiest dogs youâll ever meet! Gracie Lou is looking for a home with consistency. She needs people she can rely on, who will work with her and love her endlessly. She has been let down too many times and will require a very stable environment. She is safe at her foster home until the right person or family comes along to carry her off into the sunset.

To keep up with Grace, check out #SacRDRGrace on Facebook and Instagram!

name: Pongo
description:
Pongo has been through a lot; originally found by a Good Samaritan sitting at a freeway exit ramp, he spent nearly a year in foster care before finding himself back at the shelter through no fault of his own. After months on the adoption floor, Pongo was adopted, but returned within a week. He deteriorated in the shelter, and was at risk of being euthanized at any moment when he came to SacRDR. Pongo can take a bit to warm up to new people, but when given a little time and space to decide a new human is safe, his sweet, goofy personality comes through! Pongo is currently receiving treatment for sensitive skin and urinary issues, but will be ready for a forever home!

To keep up with Pongo, check out #SacRDRPongo on Facebook and Instagram!

name: Scrambles
description:
What is your name? Scrambles

How old are you? 2 years old

Are you a boy or a girl? Iâm a manâs man ?

Do you know where your family came from (Breed question)? Iâm definitely a pit mix but no one knows what Iâm mixed with other than a unique blend of âBALL!â ? and âdonât bother me, I have things to do.â

How much do you weigh? 40lbs

What do you look like? I am DAMN handsome! I have honey colored fur with very distinguishing white patches. And you may have noticed my awesome ear.

What do you like to eat? Nutri Source

What kind of personality do you have? You know, I feel like I relate to cats really well, emotionally anyhow. Iâm only interested in affection every so often and Iâm definitely not super snuggly. Iâd rather be in the room with people than ON them so Iâm basically the definition of THE BEST ROOMMATE EVER. Unless you want to play with me and then itâs GAME ON! Otherwise, Iâm pretty happy just chilling out near my people.

Describe your perfect day? Iâm definitely a foodie but not the obnoxious, take 15 pictures of my food bowl and make the foster mom-person late for work kind of foodie. ? Point being, I really like breakfast and dinner and treats, not necessarily in that order. Throw in some play time outside with a few toys. Nap time is always great. Maybe a few pets and more time outside wishing I was a human rugby player.

What is your favorite toy? I am partial to the Nerf Tuff Tug X-Ring. Itâs a ball with stuffing, it doesnât get any better than that. ?

Do you know any tricks? I know how to be stubborn but not necessarily impossibly stubborn. For me, itâs more of a game of whoâs teaching who. I did learn to use my crate and sit though. But really, thatâs because Iâm a civilized dude, not because itâs a trick.

What scares you? The thought of a bunch of screaming tween girls trying to kiss me and dress me up for a Snapchat photo shoot. ? ? ?

Have you ever been around children? Yeah, I live with two 8 year olds. We have an understanding that Iâm âCool Uncle Scramblesâ. I give them pointers on sports, like how to play soccer-dodgeball (my own invention) and proper sprinting technique. ?

How do you feel about other dogs? The shrink at the rescue says that I lack social graces and because of my smaller size and neurological issues, another dog will probably open up a can of whoop ass on me for being clueless and wanting to play in all of the wrong ways. Itâs a mouthful, I know. No dog pals for me. ??

Do you like cats? Iâm not any better mannered with cats and I hear they can cause you to lose an eye or two so probably better that I not have to live with one. ?

If you could be anywhere in the world where would it be? In the yard playing.

How is your health? Itâs great. I have a weird issue with my brain where Iâll randomly fall over when I go on long walks or get overly excited. Iâve seen a neurologist. As long as Iâm not running marathons, Iâm fine. ?

Who do you live with in your foster home and who is your closest companion? I live with my foster mom-person, foster dad-person, two 8 year old-persons, and 2 resident mutts. Iâm closest to my foster mom-person. Sheâs big on manners and boundaries (eye roll). Even though sheâs a hardhead I can tell she digs me.

Where do you hang out when you are home alone? In my crate/man cave.

Where do you sleep? Man cave.

Do you like walking on a leash? Iâm a pro. I like to go down the street and come right back. What can I say, I have good genes and I donât need all that cardio nonsense.

Do you have any not so great habits? I donât have any bad habits. Iâm just not your typical cuddly buddy.

Are you house trained? Gross, dude. Of course Iâm house trained. What kind of interview is this?

Do you like water? Not sure. Might not be the safest idea given my brain weirdness.

What do you love about your foster family? They totally get me and donât try to force lovey dovey stuff down my throat. They seem to genuinely love me though. And I feel safe. ?

What was your life like before being brought into Norcal Bully Breed Rescue? I was at a shelter and the staff there really liked me so they worked hard to get me into a rescue that took medical cases.

NorCal Bully Breed Rescue is a foster based rescue with foster homes spread all throughout the Sacramento area. We usually require our adopters to be within a 50 to 100 mile radius of us, depending on the dog, and depending on the home.

This is because we need to do a yard check to guarantee that the potential adopter's yard is secure, and also have them be close enough should any behavioral issues arise, and the assistance of our trainer is needed. We are, however, willing to adopt out of our area, including the Bay Area, Tahoe, and even further. We've even adopted out of state on very special occasions.

We try our best to match our dogs to the perfect homes, and match them based on their personalities, not their looks. Adoptions are not done on a first come, first serve basis, rather in the order of what homes are the right match for that particular dog.

Our adoption fees are based on the dog and range from $200-$350. In the case of senior dogs (6+ years), fees will be waived to the right home. This includes spay/neuter, vaccines, microchip, and deworming (if necessary).

Scrambles' adoption donation is $200.

Interested in meeting Scrambles or any of our available pooches?  Complete and submit our adoption application on our website norcalbullybreedrescue.com and we will respond to you within 2 business days.

name: Liz
description:

Meet Liz and get a high five from her!

name: Maggie
description: Maggie is an adorableyoung dog that was suffering from demodex. She was a stray and had a close call with the grim reaper at the shelter. She has since been treated and is healing up nicely, has gained some weight, and shes been spayed and is house broken. She would make a great companion for someone who needs a buddy and she does well with other dogs in general. She can be possesive of her owner with other dogs and this is a newer behavior we have started to see. For this reason we think she would be great as an only dog but in general she loves to [play with other dogs.If you would like to meet this young female, please apply at www.havendogrescue.org

description: She has really come out of her shell and is feeling better every day on her limited diet to get some of her weight off.

Dolce is spayed / up to date on shots / microchipped. Best placement for her is into a home without other dogs, kids, or cats. Sheâs prefers to be with just her person. Has always been indoors and always had someone home 24.7.

Barks if the doorbell rings or if someone knocks, won't 
attack. Simply prefers a quiet and mellow environment. Because she's quiet and mellow, just

description:
Hey! I'm Mowgli! I like to run. I like to run really fast! I'm great at running!

I also love food. Gotta fuel up, you know? But I'm not sharing, so don't even ask. No touch-y the M-Bomb's food bowl! That's what I call myself-- the M-Bomb. Doesn't seem to be catching on, though. The ladies here mostly call me sweetie, or baby. Whatever.

I've got a great sense of smell. I can smell everything! I could run and smell and run and smell all day long. Till it's time to refuel again. ;)


Mowgli is neutered, microchipped, vaccinated for DHPP & Rabies, and Heartworm tested negative.

name: Woody
description:
IMMEDIATE FOSTER HOME NEEDED: 

Hello everyone: this is Woody. He is a lab/pit mix. He is a little over a year old. He is neutered, He was rescued from a shelter after being found tied to a tree with a leg so damaged it had to be amputated and taken to a fabulous foster home. He does Incredible on 3 legs and can even go up and down stairs. All anyone says about this sweet boy is how much he likes to cuddle with you.  He is very precious and a very good dog. He does have separation anxiety though as do most shelter dogs. They have had a rough life and been left alone. The foster home he has been at now for a few months has 2 other dogs and they are all starting to fight.  So now it looks like Woody would do best at a home with no other dogs or cats. If anyone can help this sweet 
boy please call me 
Tiffany: 916-761-1002. 
Thank you  Northern Ca.

name: Wilbur
description:
WE WILL BE AT PETSMART, 2705 BIDWELL, FOLSOM (NEXT TO HOME DEPOT) ON SATURDAY, JULY 13 FROM 11-2.  PLEASE STOP BY TO SEE US!

We know that you will fall in love with Wilbur's pictures and then as you read his profile you will realize that sweet looking boy is both blind and deaf. At that point, you most likely will feel sorry for him, but think you could not deal with a blind a deaf dog. Please think again! Wilbur is amazing and without being told, you would not know he was blind and deaf. Wilbur manages his world with ease and confidence.

Wilbur does not like other dogs getting in his face, so would not do well in a home with energetic, active dogs. He loves to chew on nylabones and is great in the car. Wilbur would absolutely love to just lay in your lap and make you feel as though you are the most special person on earth.

If you are interested in Wilbur, please contact Janet at janetleigh44@gmail.com

name: Jack 9-14-18A
description:
Jack is my name, and wiggles my game!
I wiggle my tail. I wiggle my butt.
I'm a wiggle-all-over sort of mutt!
I wiggle with friends, both human and dog,
I wiggle with ball or stuffy or log.
Let's wiggle together, both you and I.
Let's wiggle forever till we think that we'll die!

Jack is neutered, microchipped, vaccinated for DHPP & Rabies, and Heartworm tested negative.

name: Snoopy
description:
\"Snoopy\" is a 70-lb, 1-yo neutered male GSD mix who is happy, loveable and a little goofy. Snoopy is friendly with everyone he meets but will likely be a good watchdog as well. I KNOW that Snoopy will be great with young children; he met two kids (ages 8 & 10) and was literally melting in their arms. Snoopy is very affectionate and loves to snuggle right next to you in bed.

Snoopy gets along fine with other dogs, but he does have a prey drive and doesn't seem to know what a little dog is; therefore, I am seeking a home with no small dogs. (I'm confident that once he realized that little dogs are indeed dogs, he'd be fine with them.) Snoopy prefers to receive attention from humans much more so than from other dogs, so he'd be fine as an only dog.

I have not seen Snoopy around cats, but since he went after a Chihuahua mix, I can't consider a home with cats for him.

Snoopy is housetrained and never had an accident in the house he's in, but he does occasionally get his paws up on the counter if there is food present. He responds well to the \"sit\" and \"lie down\" commands, so apparently he's received some obedience training in his young life. 

Snoopy walks very well on leash and rides calmly in a vehicle. He apparently enjoys water, as he took to the pond at GSRSV's rescue ranch fairly quickly.

Snoopy gets his name from his long snout and the somewhat comical overbite in his muzzle. I'm not sure if his overbite originates from another canine breed (Collie?) but it does not affect his ability to eat normally. 

GSRSV rescued Snoopy from the Stanislaus County Shelter on 6-23-18. He had been at the shelter since May 12; I imagine that he was a staff favorite at the shelter. Nonetheless, his time had run out and he was going to be euthanized so GSRSV appealed for donations to board Snoopy until he could be transferred to a no-kill shelter out of state. Three women came forward with donations to cover his boarding expense. (Thank you Danielle Blount, Diana Cheung and Alicia Navarro!) When I discovered what a sweet dog Snoopy is, I searched for and was able to find a foster home for him so that he wouldn't have to go back to a shelter. 

Snoopy is located in Sacramento. His adoption fee is $210.

name: Charlie
description:
Hi there, I'm...
 Charlie!  I'm  a 3-4 year old 90lb. plus ball of lovable, goofiness.  I love people but will be protective and bark like a typical GSD around strangers.   Well isn't that my job?  I love playing with other dogs, both male and female , but need to be reminded sometimes not to play to rough.  I absolutely  love to play in the water, and run and play with the other dogs. I know Sit, Place, I can walk nicely on a loose leash and I really want to please. I have a very cute smile when I'm excited, I raise my front lip up over my teeth.  I'm a very friendly guy who loves to play fetch and will even bring the ball back!!! Thatâs unusual for GSDâs I've heard.  I once lived in a house before I came to stay at the rescue.  I would love to spend my days playing with other dogs, or playing fetch and then come in and relax on my dog bed.  I'm a pretty versatile gentleman.  My foster parents at the rescue want to keep me, but I'd rather have my own home.  They say I\"m one remarkable German Shepherd Dog.  I am current on vaccinations, heartworm negative, microchipped and neutered, and ready to go.  Could you be my final furever home? If I sound like a great match, then please contact my friends at EDCGSR and fill out an application at http://www.edcgsr.com/adoption-process.html

name: Casper
description: Casper is a very affectionate little boy. He craves a lot of attention and will enjoy a very active lifestyle. Casper has been neutered and is up to date on all vaccinations.

name: Sammy*
description:
Fully vetted, neutered, 3-year old male
UTD on vaccinations
Located in Grass Valley, CA

Adoption fee $250

Sammy is a 12lb 3-year-old Maltese Parsons terrier mix. 
Sami loves long walks and loves to run. He'll snuggle up on your lap and wants to be with somebody that can spend a lot of time with him. He is a little leery of strangers and may take a little time to adjust and warm up. But once he does you will have a loyal loving buddy for life. He is good with children cats and other dogs.

name: Jitterbug Doug 12-108-18
description:
Jitterbug Doug is such a fun loving dog! He loves playing fetch and is a happy go lucky guy. Jitterbug has lived with other dogs and cats and is a wonderful companion. He is even well behaved around children!

Jitterbug Doug is neutered, microchipped, and vaccinated for DHPP & Rabies.

name: Noel
description:
PLEASE DO NOT CONTACT THE RESCUE THROUGH PETFINDER, VISIT PITCREW.ORG AND COMPLETE ADOPTION APPLICATION.

*All of our rescue dogs are spayed/neutered, up-to-date on vaccinations and microchipped*
