pitcrew.org

name: Bear-Bear
description:
Meet Bear-Bear! 
Bear-Bear, aka \"Cuddle Bear\" is looking for a new home. This 6 year old small Golden Retriever mix is approximately 25 lbs., up to date on flea meds, heartworm treatment, and vaccinations. He is neutered, potty trained, and in good health. Bear-Bear loves people and cats, but does NOT do well with other dogs. He would be perfect in a home with a mature retired single person or couple who spend a lot of time at home with no other dogs. and a fenced yard. He is a real home body! Cute and cuddly, hard to resist!
 Bear-Bear likes running in his yard, and going on short walks (he does NOT like long walks). He loves to go for rides in the car, but doesn't like stores or crowds of people. Bear-Bear is accustomed to sleeping indoors at night.

A $50 rehoming fee includes Bear-Bear's leash, collar, harness, dog bowl, bed, blanket, dog towel, food, treats, and veterinary records.

For more information, please contact Drew and Katie in Placerville at (530) 903-8709.

name: DAISY
description:
They call me âCrazy Daisy,â but I am just a spunky, sassy senior. At the experienced age of 10 years, I have lots of energy and a cheerful, enthusiastic personality. I weigh about 40-50lbs and am available to play ball, go on hikes, lay in the sun, and I love butt scratches, too. Iâm very treat motivated, I would be a great watch-dog, and Iâm even housebroken. Cats and other dogs, however, are not my favorite things, although I do love my best buddy, Romeo. He keeps me company and gives me someone to boss around.Â 

Iâm a sponsored dog which means my adoption fees have already been paid, so you donât have to, what are you waiting for?!

To meet or foster please call the facilty at (209)533-3622 Monday-Saturday 10am-2pm 

To adopt please apply online at foac.us

name: ROMEO
description:
I am very true to my name, I love people and Iâm very good natured. I have a moderate energy level and would love to snuggle and watch TV with someone. I also love to play ball and can entertain myself. I enjoy laying out in the sun with my best buddy, Daisy. I am 8 years old, about 40-50lbs, very good on a leash, for walks that arenât too long, and I really love cookies. Although I could be adopted into a home without any other dogs, I do enjoy the company of some particular canines, and would do well with a specially choosen buddy, and Iâm a great greeter for the house. I can be very entertaining with my talking and grunting skills, though I do have some hearing an sight issues due to my age. I am still a champion lover and will be your most loyal friend.

Iâm a sponsored dog which means my adoption fees have already been paid, so you donât have to, what are you waiting for?!

To adopt please apply online at foac.us or for more information please contact the facility at (209)533-3622 Monday-Saturday 10am-2pm

name: Stella
description:
Stella is a 4 years old Pittie mix (around 50ib) that's potty trained, crate trained, and house trained! She is very sweet, super smart, and overall a easy good dog. Not a barker. She is medium energy... good for a family that wants an adult dog and skip through the puppy potty training stage. 

Stella walks really well on the leash, she is very easy to redirect. She would do great in a home with older children. 

Stella is super friendly with everyone she's met, leans in for scratches and affection, prances when she sees kids and has impressive zoomies and somersault skills! She has THE most beautiful coat that is SO soft! She is a love! 

Stella should be a only dog in a home because she is alpha. But she can have dog friends (see photos). 

Stella is vaccinated, microchipped, and spayed. Her adoption fee is reduced to $150. She is currently being fostered in San Leandro. 

If you are interested in meeting Stella, please contact Em Zhu at happytailsfurrever@gmail.com

name: Basil  7-28-19 C
description:
Basil is a sweet girl who is looking for her forever home. She likes getting attention and enjoys going on walks. Basil would love to be a lap dog and bonds quickly to her people. Basil came into our care with Jude after their owner went into a facility and there was no one to care for them. Basil deserves a second chance at a new home. Come and meet her today!

Basil is spayed, microchipped, vaccinated for DHPP & Rabies, and Heartworm tested negative.

name: Pacino
description:
Adoption fee on this dog is $100.

		Pacino is an almost 7 year old handsome sable-colored male, weighing 89 pounds.  He was originally a stray, so nothing is known of his original start in life.  Based on some of his behaviors, ie, teeth chattering when excited, he may have a touch of malinois in him for good measure. He has been in our rescue for 9 months and all of his fosters love him.

		He is housebroken, uses a dog door, and will go into a crate.  He gets along best with other female adult dogs, but can be a bit pushy for other male dogs.  He loves going on walks, but can pull hard if excited about something.  If given a good corrections, he settles back down.  He is also great in the car.  Pacino tries to push boundaries when it comes to some behaviors, ie,  counter surfing and sneaking on the couch when he thinks no one will notice.

		The foster family call him the Squirrel Hunter.  On patrol 24/7, there are no errant squirrels in the yard perimeter!! 

		In public, he is very especially affectionate and loves scratches and pets. Pacino is quick to offer his paw to new folks, so they can get to know him better.   When settled at home, Pacino does not easily accept strangers entering the home.  His intros are best done slowly with him on a leash or from watching in a crate to realize the newcomers are acceptable to the human pack.

		Pacino came to us with bacteria resistant ear infections.  He's had several treatments and been to a specialist.  Currently his ears are clear of infection, although regular ear washes are needed to keep them in check.  We are told he has no hearing from his right ear, but his left ear seems to compensate just fine.  

		This boy would do best in a home that enforces leadership to remind him who is in charge.  Regular exercise, car rides, plenty of affection and play time will make Pacino one happy boy.

		No small dogs, cats or small critters for this boy.

This dog is a Level 3. Please be sure you understand what a dog of this Level requires. Go to our home page for an explanation of the Dog Rating Levels.

For more information and to see when this dog will be attending an Adoption Day, please see our Dogs page on our main website at www.gcgsr.org. 

We operate within a reasonable driving distance from the Greater Sacramento area, the 	Central Valley down to Merced, and Lake Tahoe. A reasonable driving distance is determined by where one of our volunteers is willing to drive within our areas of service. That means we don't adopt out of our area, to Southern California, or Out of State. 


Thank you for visiting!

name: Rusty -  Sweetie Pie
description:
Meet Rusty, the little sweetie pie.

Rusty 
6 yrs old
Neutered
Up to date on shots 
Potty trained 

Total sweetie 
Good with other dogs
Good with children 
Good with kitties 

Chuck is the most docile and sweetest dog ever, he wouldnt hurt a fly. He is very shy and rolls on his back when you try to pet him or pick him up. We believe he was abused and left outside to fend for himself with other dogs before he was rescued which is why he has âmistakesâ in the house âat timesâ, marks. 

He loves having access to the outside, and loves laying in the sun and also loves to cuddle in a warm blanket inside. 

He would thrive with someone who could give him the time, love and patience to break out of his shell.

 He LOVES other dogs and would do best with at least another one as it helps his confidence. He would do best with children old enough to know how to treat and handle a timid dog or a calm home.  Loud noises and yelling scares him.

He is a special boy.!!

 
If interested, PLEASE contact norcalrescuepups@yahoo.com


Each pet will be is spayed and/or neutered, micro-chipped, and up to date on their vaccinations. 

There will be an adoption fee which helps the organization cover spay costs, vaccinations, medical treatment, food and supplies.

All Nor Cal Rescue Pups Rescue dogs are spayed/neutered, are up to date on vaccines and have microchips prior to adoption. 

Adoption fees vary depending on age of dog. 

All dogs live in private foster homes until they are adopted.

Thanks!

name: Sox
description:
Meet Sox, this timid little boy is looking for his new family.

He is a Chihuahua Mix
8 years old
In great health 
8 lbs
Neutered 
Up to date on shots

Good with other dogs 
Good with children
Good with cats 

Sox is a timid little guy. He was not treated very well before being dumped at a shelter. 

We believe he had never seen grass or been outside let alone on a leash. Sox has come a long way but still cowers when being pet and gets scared to be picked up although he is âveryâ sweet. 

He is more independent in his pack since he always gets pushed aside ... he often sits back letting the more confident dogs go ahead.

He would love his own lap. He loves to go on walks although used to be so scared of a leash. He trots and its the cutest thing. He gets along with other dogs and doesnt mind cats. He doesnt bark often but if a new face come over, doorbell rings, he gets scared by a new face, or other dogs start barking, he will join in and its quite a unique bark. We call it the rooster bark. 

Sox loves a warm bed and hates the rain so a potty pad would be ideal for him. 
Sox needs a calm home with patient and understanding people who will continue to work on his confidence. 

Petfinder

If interested, PLEASE contact norcalrescuepups@yahoo.com


Each pet will be is spayed and/or neutered, micro-chipped, and up to date on their vaccinations. 

There will be an adoption fee which helps the organization cover spay costs, vaccinations, medical treatment, food and supplies.

All Nor Cal Rescue Pups Rescue dogs are spayed/neutered, are up to date on vaccines and have microchips prior to adoption. 

Adoption fees vary depending on age of dog. 

All dogs live in private foster homes until they are adopted.

Thanks!

name: Sydney
description:
Sydney is a great little 6 year old girl who came to rescue as a \"medical\" dog in 2012. She had been kicked so hard her femur head was damaged. The great folks at University of California Davis Veterinary School did surgery on her and repaired her leg. It has healed and she runs like the wind. If you didn't know she was injured, you'd never suspect it. 

Sydney was placed with a runner/hiker in our local area but came back to rescue about 6 months ago because her owner went to work with CalFire. She is a wild land firefighter and can be out for weeks or months at a time. She felt Syd needed a more stable living situation. She didn't want her to spend too much time kenneled while she was on a fire. 

Syd is great with dogs. She's good with people but can be a bit slow to adjust to new men. The guy who kicked her was tall. If you're tall, she'll come to you but she'll be wary at first. She'll bark in her crate at new people, but approaches immediately when she's out of it. We doubt this will go away. She's had some bad experiences but she wants to trust and love. Once she knows you, she'll happily climb right into your lap. 

Syd loves to go for rides and has great car manners. She'll hike or run in the forest or just hang with you while you watch TV. She's a buddy dog. She does well sleeping in a crate or on a pillow. She's reliable in the house and knows how to use a dog door. Syd loves toys. She's always carrying something around...toys, pine cones, sticks, etc. She's a toy dog. She's good with smaller or larger dogs, great on lead or off and ready for a new home. 

Syd is fostered in the Placerville area (near Sacramento). If you'd like more information, send an email to performanceresq@att.net.

name: JEDIDIAH
description:
Jedidiah is an adult somewhere between 2 - 4 years old.  A mix of Chihuahua and Dachshund.  For more information or to meet him, call the FOAC Adoption Center 209 533-3622 Monday - Saturday 10 - 2

To adopt fill out an online adoption form at FOAC.US completely and submit  Adoption upon approval.

name: Duke
description:
Duke is a very affectionate big boy.  He loves to play fetch but sometimes forgets to give you the ball.  He gets a long great with older, mellow dogs but would be fine as an only dog too.  He is potty trained and has great recall.  If you are looking for a soul mate, Duke is your boy.

Doesn't dig
Doesn't jump up
Loves toys
Sits
Shakes 
Barks at strangers, otherwise very quiet
Loves to be outside

name: Crew  4-108-19 A
description:
Crew is a tiny man on a tiny mission. His purpose: To fetch every ball ever thrown. Built for speed, Crew is a lean, mean fetching machine. Do you have a ball? Throw it. He'll bring it back, no matter the distance, no matter the obstacle.

Crew loves to play with his sister and mother, and going for walks is another favored pastime. But not as much as playing fetch. Man, he loves to chase those tennis balls...

Crew is neutered, microchipped, and vaccinated against rabies, distemper, and parvo viruses. He has heartworm tested negative.

name: Roxy
description:
Meet Sweet Roxy. We believe Roxy to be around 5 years old. We have dog tested her and she does \"ok\" a little growl here and there. The trainer feels she could be trained to be ok with cats but you have to commit to the training.

Her favorite thing in life is to be with humans!!! She loves affection, walks well on a leash, knows sit, down and a few other commands. 

We adopt in El Dorado County/surrounding counties. Please note, we DO NOT ADOPT OUT OF STATE EXCEPT FOR RENO (also surrounding areas to Reno within 30 minutes).

Please hurry to www.sngsr.org and fill out an application to give her the forever she deserves.

name: Saphira
description:
Beautiful Saphira is the mother of the \"S\" litter and is finally available for adoption. She is approximately 3-4 yrs old and needs someone who will be patient with her to build her trust. She is learning to walk on a leash and knows some basic commands. We aren't sure how she would be with cats. She has been around other dogs. Her new family will be encouraged to continue her training. She loves to cuddle and be with her person 

If you are interested in adopting Saphira please go to www.sngsr.org and complete an application.

We adopt in El Dorado County/surrounding counties. Please note, we DO NOT ADOPT OUT OF STATE EXCEPT FOR RENO (also surrounding areas to Reno within 30 minutes).

name: Edith
description:
Edith qualifies for our âSeniors For Seniorsâ program!!

Whatâs her name? Edith

How old is she? 11 years old

How much does she weigh? 18 pounds (should be 14 but TREATS)

What does she look like? Edith is blonde with short hair, a white muzzle and floppy ears. She is a glorious Puggle.

What does she like to eat? She eats Natural Balance Limited Ingredient High Protein Lamb kibble. She loves treats and is VERY food motivated but her foster mom is trying to help her lose weight.

Perfect Day? Waking up and eating breakfast. Going on walks and being outside. She would love to go for a morning walk and then come home and be lazy or cuddle with her foster family. She also loves, loves, loves car rides and will give you a guilt trip if you donât take her out often. Itâs a very effective guilt trip.

Favorite Toy? She is hilarious and very playful and loves soft stuffed toys. Sometimes she grabs them with her mouth and throws them up in the air. She also loves bully sticks!!!!

Tricks? No tricks for this old gal, just treats please!!!

Where does she sleep? At night she sleeps in her foster momâs room on her bed. She likes blankets and buries her head in them. She likes to be covered up so her foster mom tucks her in. During the day, she has a bed out in the living room. Sometimes her foster mom lifts her on the couch and she snoozes with her friend Tom the Chihuahua.

Walking on a leash? She loves walking on a leash. She drags her back legs a little but that doesnât slow her down.

What scares you? Nothingâ¦.but I do bark at fireworks.

Children? She absolutely loves children!!!!

Other Dogs? She loves other dogs! Verbally, sheâs a bit of a weirdo, loves to alert when she sees other dogs (typical beagle) but she has a TON of dog buddies and when properly introduced, is great around dogs.

Cats? She will chase cats if theyâre in the yard but in the house, she actually does really well with them. Sheâll try to say hi but if they hiss, sheâll respect the boundary.

Not so great habits? Itâs really unfair to call this a habit but Edith has a spinal cord injury. It is believed that she may have been hit by a car at some point in her life. As a result, she is 20% incontinent. What that means is that sometimes she canât quite make it out the door before she has to go potty. She also has accidents when she gets overly excited, (i.e., when her foster mom is putting on her leash to go out because walks are FUN).

Weâre working on feeding her early so she doesnât have accidents in her bed at night but her foster mom canât always get home from work early so sometimes it still happens.

She is very vocal when thereâs another dog in the house but when thereâs not, she is surprisingly quiet.

House trained? Edith is actually potty trained and makes every attempt to get to the door. Her success with having as few accidents as possible will depend on how easily she can get outside when she has to go (i.e., taking her down a flight of stairs is not ideal). The vet recommended that we express her bladder which has actually helped reduce accidents in the house quite a bit.

How is her health? Her health is great! Sheâs a little on the chubby side but we are working on that. Because of her spinal cord injury, she drags her back feet a little. Her back legs are stiff and donât bend very well so she needs to be lifted upstairs. Also, she sometimes cannot fully empty her bladder so her foster mom expresses it.

What does she love about her foster family? She is madly in love with her 8 year old foster sister and all of the friends that come over. Her foster mom lifts her on the couch every morning so she can snuggle with her foster sister before she gets ready for school. She loves car rides and walks.

Life before NorCal? We suspect Edith was loved very much. We have no idea how Edith ended up in the shelter but a dog with mild incontinence issues has almost no chance of being adopted out of a shelter so we had to save her.

NorCal Bully Breed Rescue is a foster based rescue with foster homes spread all throughout the Sacramento area. We usually require our adopters to be within a 50 to 100 mile radius of us, depending on the dog, and depending on the home. This is because we need to do a yard check to guarantee that the potential adopter's yard is secure, and also have them be close enough should any behavioral issues arise, and the assistance of our trainer is needed. We are, however, willing to adopt out of our area, including the Bay Area, Tahoe, and even further. We've even adopted out of state on very special occasions. We try our best to match our dogs to the perfect homes, and match them based on their personalities, not their looks. Adoptions are not done on a first come, first serve basis, rather in the order of what homes are the right match for that particular dog. Our adoption fees are based on the dog and range from $200-$350. In the case of senior dogs (6+ years), fees will be waived to the right home. This includes spay/neuter, vaccines, microchip, and deworming (if necessary). 

Edith's adoption donation is $200 or waived for approved adopters 55 years of age or older.

Interested in meeting Edith or any of our available pooches?  Complete and submit our adoption application on our website norcalbullybreedrescue.com and we will respond to you within 24 to 48 hours.

name: Chula
description: Chula is one of those perfect doggies (decribed by her foster parent ) .  She came from Mexico with a litter of puppies . She is a beautiful ebony black , she shines .    She is so ready for her forever home ,   It will take time for her to adjust , Give her time to realize that her home is her home .  She needs a very secure fenced yard , No children under 6 yrs old , No out of state adoptions   go to www.rescueforpetaske.org  to submit a application .  She is located in Grass Valley CA  No out of state adoptions .  Also you can call us directly at (530) 263-3331

name: Foxy, loves to hug and cuddle
description:
Contact mariannagilshteyn2005@yahoo.com
Foxy
Is about 4 years old vetted and fixed sheâs an amazing girl.
She loves walks and loves children of all ages her favorite things are to hang around the kitchen while you cook and the children when they are playing outside.
She loves car rides and the park.
She knows commands as sit, no, letâs go and sheâs potty trained.
She has been around large and small dogs no cats since we donât have any. However her being around other dogs was short term perhaps a few hours she just ignored them.
Foxy has come along way from her being left to die in a field of fox tails.
Foxy loves to run? and play fetch.

description:

name: Rosie*
description:
Fully vetted, spayed 1 year-old female
UTD on vaccinations, housetrained
Adoption Fee $250
Located in Grass Valley, CA

I am Rosie the beautiful white pit bull. I am 1 year old, 45 pounds and my owners left me at Modesto shelter to pretty much die. They used me as a protection dog. I am one of the lucky ones that made it out. 

I am a very good family dog. Great with kids and little dogs. I am a fierce protector so no one can mess with my people. I like to chew so I would need chew toys. Donât forget I am just a puppy. Obedience classes would also help me. I need a family that can give me time and love. Are you the one for me??

Please contact my foster mom Linda
lindavacc@aol.com

name: PeeWee*
description:
Fully vetted, neutered 1 year-old male
UTD on vaccinations, housetrained
Adoption Fee $250
Located in Sacramento CA

Pee Wee what can I say about me cause I am the best chi in town. I am 8 pounds and a year old. If you are lonely I am the guy for you cause I promise never to leave you. I had a hard life but life is hard and I want to move past how my previous owners mistreated me and dumped me in a box outside the shelter. 

I am pretty sure that there is someone out there who is for me. I am very friendly and good with dogs. I look way better in person than my picture. You know what I mean.

I would love to meet your family. Contact my foster mom as she sets up appointments for me. divsthompson@gmail.com

name: Kayla
description: Kayla is five years old and is such a sweetheart. We think she is a mix of Akita and Border Collie. She loves taking walks and just being with people, is good on a leash, and would make a wonderful addition to any family. She is not good with cats.

name: Cosmo
description:
Cosmo is approx. 2.5 years old and weighs approx. 85 lbs. He was rescued from the county shelter when he was around four months old. He's been with a young man in his late teens, early twenties for the last two years who lives at home with a large family or a family that has frequent visitors. Cosmo has a small \"sister\" dog who does not appreciate Cosmo's puppy play or great looks! ;) They have worked with a professional trainer, even though Cosmo is very submissive to the little girl dog (and most other dogs for that matter too), and Cosmo does great with her, but not the other way around! In addition, there was an incident with a visiting family member and Cosmo's food. 

Due to the incident with the food, we are looking for a new and forever family for Cosmo asap! His ideal home is one without any small or young children (because we can't risk them also tampering with his food). He loves to swim and gets along GREAT w/all other dogs he's met and if you fill out an application to potentially adopt Cosmo, and it looks like a good fit, we will have our professional dog trainer come to you and make the proper introductions there at your home, and also be \"on call\" to assist you with fully acclimating and assimilating Cosmo into his new home, with all family members and your lifestyle! 

Cosmo is neutered, up to date on all vaccines, house and crate trained. First step in the process is to email us at shpssac@yahoo.com and request a Dog Adoption Application. PS The current owner had Cosmo DNA tested and it came back 90% German Shepherd/10% English Setter! PPS Be sure to check out the video of Cosmo playing in water and the last photo in the series especially, as that is Cosmo's \"Baby Picture\"! And here's a terrific video of Cos playing in the water: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NPTzgVdKZkY

name: Lex
description: Oh how I love this boy LOOK AT THOSE EARS ! Lex says ADOPT ME !, Lex is looking for his forever home , he is a great little companion , gets along with other dogs . Gets very attached to his humans , loves to run in a yard & play chase , be on your lap , go for car rides , housebroken .(530) 263-3331  No out of state adoptions .

name: Teddy
description:
Teddy  is a very handsome and sweet young cream  chow. He is good in the house, loves walks, and is good with people. He is medium sized about 50 lbs.

Teddy  likes to play with squeaky toys.  He would do best as the only dog in the home .Teddy likes to ride in the car and will jump right in ready to go.

He is good for the groomer and is a sweetheart once he gets to know you ( typical chow). Teddy Bear is neutered, vaccinated, health examined, microchipped and heartworm tested negative

. An application can be submitted at www.chowsplus.org if you are interested in meeting this super cute boy!

name: Millie
description: Millie is a four year old Staffordshire Terrier and Border Collie mix. We love this little girl and she would be best suited to a family with children. She was raised in a home with children and she misses them. She is a little shy at first but once she gets to know you, she is all kisses and hugs...and loves belly rubs. Millie needs to be an integral part of a family and also loves to play and swim. She is okay with some dogs but would prefer a home without felines.

name: Bailey
description: Bailey came our way after her owner experienced some health concerns and could no longer keep her.  Bailey was her owner's loyal, loving companion, and gave hours of comfort to her owner.  Bailey enjoys the company of other dogs however her true joy is spending time with her foster mom, Suzy.  Bailey can be a little reserved and sometimes scared when first meeting someone new however after allowing time for a meet and greet and time to adjust she's a very happy dog.  Bailey would do very well in a home with someone who is patient and kind, and who would like a loving, loyal dog for a companion.  For more information, please contact her foster mom, Suzy, at beaglesaver1@comcast.net

name: Oliver*
description:
Fully vetted, neutered 11-year-old male
UTD on all shots, house trained
Adoption Fee $250

OLIVER does not want you to feel bad about his blindness!  He is a happy, otherwise healthy little guy who has a lot of life left!

Blind and almost totally deaf, OLIVER lives a happy, full life.  He navigates his world expertly by scent, gets himself outside with ease, and if he gets stuck, he will bark to let you know he needs help.

GOOD with other dogs, GOOD with cats, and gentle, OLIVER is a happy loving little guy.

If you would like to meet Oliver, give Gail a call.  Pretty sure he will steal your heart.

name: Yoda
description:
Yoda is a sweet, smart and loving dog who enjoys being around people.  Although she is approximately 10 years old, she is in good health, has lots of energy and appreciates a daily walk - a couple miles a day! She also loves lounging on her bed, enjoying the sun on the back patio or just hanging out with her people and resting. She also does well riding in a car.

She is friendly with children and adults but sometimes wary around other dogs.  Therefore, we feel Yoda is best suited in a home without other dogs.
Yoda is fully vaccinated (including the new flu vaccine), spayed, micro chipped and potty trained!  

She becomes anxious if left alone so a home where people are around most of the time would be ideal.  She is a jumper - as high as counter tops, furniture and gates. She doesnât bark much but will give a little growl when strangers come to the house but quickly warms up and then allows them to pet her!

Lucky Yoda has had some heartbreak in recent years and would love to find her forever home! She belonged to a family who lost their home in the recent California fires and unfortunately, they were unable to take her with them to their temporary accommodations.  Sadly, she was relinquished to the El Dorado County Animal Services. She was then quickly adopted by a gentleman but her happiness was short lived.  He broke his hip 2 weeks later and she was again returned to the El Dorado Shelter. Unfortunately, she did not do well in the shelter.  It was quite a scary place for her.  Thankfully, a loving foster home was located where her true gentle spirit has blossomed.  In that her health and confidence are now restored, she is ready to find a family to call her own!

name: Thor  5-28-18
description:
Meet Thor! This goof is about 8 years old, and in need of a family!! He is a very sweet boy, who packs a punch of personality in such a small body! Thor is full of smiles, and will do everything to make you laugh. Thor is silly and active, and needs a family that can mirror that.

In his previous home, it was discovered that he is a seizure detection dog! He would be an amazing fit for someone that needed that help. 
Follow this link to read an article written about his super power... http://www.lifewithdogs.tv/2015/04/adopted-pit-bull-is-a-secret-superhero/

 Are you and Thor a match? Come to Sammie's and ask about him!

name: Betsy
description:
Hi, Everyone.  My name is Betsy. I'm a 10-year-old dachshund mix looking for a new home. Mommy says I'm a mix because my nose is too short to be a \"real\" dachshund. I find nothing wrong with my nose. It works just fine. My very long and low body is 100% dachshund. I weigh about 18 pounds. 

I need to find a home with someone who is very patient and will give me a chance to get over all my fears in this scary world and develop my true personality. It's a terrible thing to lose everything I was familiar with and start over at my age. I'm sure I'll adjust, but it will take some time. 

What I do have going for me is I'm excellent with other dogs and I rarely bark, unlike many dachshunds who don't know when to keep quiet. I even finally sat on Mommy's lap, and it wasn't as scary as I thought it would be. I am coming around, you see, but I still need someone with some patience. In return for your patience, you'll have a little girl who will love only you for the rest of her life. 

To learn more about me, please contact my foster mom Suzy at beaglesaver1@comcast.net

name: Suarez
description:
Adoption fee on this dog is $300.

		Suarez is a handsome 18 month old sable male. He came to us through a local shelter so little is known of his background. He originally tested as heart-worm positive but has successfully completed his treatment.
		
		While Suarez can be nervous in new environments and with new people, once he gets comfortable, this young boy is very affectionate and just wants to be with his humans. 

		Suarez is always excited to go out for walks and walks well on a leash. He knows some basic commands such as sit and has learned to sit and wait for his food or to come in from outside.  He appears housebroken and is OK in a crate.

		Suarez is an active boy with a lot of energy. He loves to run around and wrestle with the female Shepherd in his foster home. When excited, Suarez can be very mouthy and doesn't quite understand that playing with humans is different than playing with other dogs.  We recommend no children under the age of 12 for this boy. 
He loves car rides, but needs to trust the person loading and unloading him from the car or he can go into protection mode.  Suarez is neck and collar sensitive, will attempt to correct his human and will do his best to get his way. A quick firm correction lets him know who is in control and having him drag a leash until he learns this is inappropriate is also helpful. 

		This boy will do best with a strong handler who understands the need for constant, consistent leadership    and who will continue his training, exercise and socialization. He would also love another active large dog to play with and help teach him the ropes.

This dog is a Level 3. Please be sure you understand what a dog of this Level requires. Go to our home page for an explanation of the Dog Rating Levels.

For more information and to see when this dog will be attending an Adoption Day, please see our Dogs page on our main website at www.gcgsr.org. 

We operate within a reasonable driving distance from the Greater Sacramento area, the 	Central Valley down to Merced, and Lake Tahoe. A reasonable driving distance is determined by where one of our volunteers is willing to drive within our areas of service. That means we don't adopt out of our area, to Southern California, or Out of State. 


Thank you for visiting!

name: Lola
description:
LOLA'S ADOPTION FEE IS WAIVED FOR THE MONTH OF SEPTEMBER!!

My name is Lola, aka LalalalaLola, Lolita Mamacita, Lowes, Lolo. (My humans love nicknames.) I answer to all of them, especially if there's food or a rubdown involved. My humans called me Lola because I am low to the ground. I think I'm just aerodynamic.

I came to my humans with four itty bitty puppies, which I cared for and played with, until they got their new homes. I am proud to say I raised beautiful, if rambunctious, pups! I think I'm only around 3 years old, so I was a really youthful mother.

My perfect day is: get up; stretch in my crate; eat breakfast; go outside and potty; sunbathe in the backyard (I know all the best places to go as the sun moves); hangout and watch TV with my humans for awhile (especially Animal Planet, I sleep if the news is on); hang out in my crate until the big guy gets home; go for a walk; eat dinner; go potty and watch some TV before bed.

I am learning good manners. I know sit, down, leave it and off. I obey about 80% of the time. I also know to wait for my food and to wait to be invited in the house or out the gate. I am a work in progress. With consistency I'm a fast learner and love to make my humans happy.

I love to fetch exactly 2.5 times, with great enthusiasm. My favorite toy is...I'm not sure. I eat them before I grow to like them. But a frozen cow bone section keeps me happy for months.

I love humans of all shapes and sizes. Cuddling is my favorite game. My humans say I can't hold my licker, but I think they secretly love it. It's really hard to keep all my love inside. I gotta let it fly!

Speaking of flying, I have been known to scale my six foot fence. My humans are working with me on staying inside the fence. I also prefer to be the only dog in the house. I really like watching them on TV, but don't see the need to share my home with them. With all this love, why would you want more than me?

I have a very waggy tail and a happy go lucky disposition. Give me a home and I'll give you all my love and my very best efforts to melt your heart!

Lola should be the only pet in the house. She prefers to be able to only have to share her love with her humans. ???

Here is Lolaâs original post from when she was still in the shelter. She was known then as Godiva. 
https://www.facebook.com/norcalbullybreedrescue/videos/1433646373421232/

NorCal Bully Breed Rescue is a foster based rescue with foster homes spread all throughout the Sacramento area. We usually require our adopters to be within a 50 to 100 mile radius of us, depending on the dog, and depending on the home. This is because we need to do a yard check to guarantee that the potential adopter's yard is secure, and also have them be close enough should any behavioral issues arise, and the assistance of our trainer is needed. We are, however, willing to adopt out of our area, including the Bay Area, Tahoe, and even further. We've even adopted out of state on very special occasions. We try our best to match our dogs to the perfect homes, and match them based on their personalities, not their looks. Adoptions are not done on a first come, first serve basis, rather in the order of what homes are the right match for that particular dog. Our adoption fees are based on the dog and range from $200-$350. In the case of senior dogs (6+ years), fees will be waived to the right home. This includes spay/neuter, vaccines, microchip, and deworming (if necessary). 

Lola's adoption donation is $200, but waived for the month of September!!

Interested in meeting Lola or any of our available pooches?  Complete and submit our adoption application on our website norcalbullybreedrescue.com and we will respond to you within 24 to 48 hours.

name: HOGAN
description:
Hogan has been here over a year because he is shy around strangers.  It only takes him a day to feel comfortable with you.  He's a great dog, just very reserved and quiet.  BUT NO ONE WANTS HIM...which has probably been the story of his life.  His shyness for strangers stems from the abuse he suffered before coming here.  But here he can be animated and likes his walks with the various volunteers. He's an 8 yr old Great Pyrenees/Anatolian mixed breed with lots of love to give.  In his younger years, he was a loyal companion.  He overcame some horrendous conditions and once he gets to know you, he's a big goofy baby.  He's a big dog and is house trained and would be the perfect front porch dog.  He's housebroken and I'm sure he'd be happy to lay by the fireplace and protect the couch.  He'd be perfect in a quiet environment as the only dog although he does like other dogs. His heart is full of love and he'd like to give that to your family.


Note:  Great Pyrenees are considered a Giant Breed.  Average weight can be 100lbs. or more.  They bark, shed and have a wanderlust, so secure fences are a must-have.  They are NOT off-leash dogs and a Pyr off-leash is called a \"dis'a'Pyr\".  Some Pyrs do well with other dogs and some don't because by the virtue of the breed traits they were bred to keep out intruders and can consider some dogs as intruders. While they make wonderful pets and family dogs, they aren't for everyone so be sure to understand and learn about the breed traits of this breed or any breed you might be considering.
