name: Kira
description: Kira is a black and white Labrador retriever female young dog.  She is about 8 months old and weighs 37 pounds.  Her adoption fee will include vaccinations, worming, microchipping and spaying.  Kira has looks, smarts and personality but she is  missing a family.  Kira will be a loyal and faithful companion and will always be there with love and affection so hurry to the Center to meet her.

name: Bambi
description: Bambi is a black a white pitbull terrier.  She is about 3 years old and weighs 43 pounds.  She is already spayed so she is part of our Fixed and Fabulous program and with an approved application can be adopted for $25.  Bambi is our hidden gem of the Center this week.  She is good on a leash and sits and shakes on command.  She is friendly and has an adorable personality.  This sweet girl deserves to find her forever family and if you think you might be that family then hurry to the Center and meet her today.

name: Pistol Pete
description: Meet Pistol Pete...he is a bluetick coonhound looking for a place to call his own.  He is about 1 year old and weighs 48 pounds.  His adoption fee will include vaccinations, worming, microchipping and neutering.  Pistol Pete is sweet and good-natured.  His leash skills are weak but with some practice he will improve.  Hurry to the Center and meet this awesome fellow....he is waiting patiently to meet you.

name: Ponce B
description:
Ponce...he is a little on the shy side but warms up quick. He just needs some TLC. He is adorable with his Blk/ white coat . He is great with other dogs. He is about 5 months old, and 20 lbs. He is such a cutie. Please open you heart, and home to this guy, and show him true LOVE!
ME posted 9/2/19

**It is rare that we know with certainty the ages or mixes that make up our wonderful dogs, but we do our best to be as accurate as possible based upon our many years in rescue.
** Adoption: $325 which covers quarantine, shots, worming, food, medical records, spaying/neutering,microchip and an Alabama State Health Certificate. Transport, if needed : $120.00 We consider the transport to be of great importance and, as such, take particular care of the dogs during the trip from Alabama. We make every effort to arrive with healthy and minimally stressed dogs.

name: Misha B
description:
Meet Misha... this is a sweetie. She has puppy average energy , and lot of kisses to share with you. She loves other puppies, playing, nap time, and being with people. She is about 15 wks. and 22 lbs. She will make an awesome addition to any family. ME posted 9/2/19

**It is rare that we know with certainty the ages or mixes that make up our wonderful dogs, but we do our best to be as accurate as possible based upon our many years in rescue.
** Adoption: $325 which covers quarantine, shots, worming, food, medical records, spaying/neutering,microchip and an Alabama State Health Certificate. Transport, if needed : $120.00 We consider the transport to be of great importance and, as such, take particular care of the dogs during the trip from Alabama. We make every effort to arrive with healthy and minimally stressed dogs.

name: Aiden
description:
Aiden wants you to know he is still available! 
This sweet 7 year old boy still has a lot of love to give. He adores toys and his people. Not a huge fan of other pups but he promises to provide more than enough love. He's great with the tiny two legged hoomans too. 
Aiden is learning his manners and is a pretty low key pup. He's house trained and good on a leash, which is very important because Aiden needs some help losing weight so someone willing to go for walks, play tug of rope, and whatever to burn those calories and get this pup to a healthier weight. 

Thing you have an Aiden shaped hole that needs filling? Go here: sanctuaryanimalrescue.com/adoption-questionnaire-1

name: Patches
description:
Patches! This handsome boy is an adorable pyr-hound mix. He's about 9 months old and an absolute bundle of preciousness. Do you see those freckles?! 

Patches was recently at the Yoga w/ Fur Babies Event and was an absolute hit! He was fun, well behaved, and just a joy to be around. 

This sweet guy is great on a leash, house-trained, and quickly learning his basic manners. He does great with other pups, kids, and people. 

If you would like to add this sweet boy to your family, please apply here: sanctuaryanimalrescue.com/adoption-questionnaire-1

name: Dooley
description:
INTAKE DATE - 8/31/2019
ADOPTION STATUS - Available. Accepting applications at www.weimrescue.com
AGE - 1 year old
SEX - Neutered male
SIZE - Large -Normal breed standard
MEDICAL STATUS - Healthy
HOUSETRAINED - Yes
CRATE TRAINED - Yes
GOOD WITH OTHER DOGS - Unknown 
GOOD WITH CATS - Unknown
GOOD WITH CHILDREN - Unknown

Dooley is a very handsome, well mannered 1 year old. He travelled very well with our transport volunteer. He's a big, sweet, high energy boy who LOVES his ball and is a master fetcher. He is crate trained, housebroken and has some basic training. Applications to adopt at www.weimrescue.com.

name: Ruby
description:
12 week old Female Lab mix - 

RUBY is ready to bond with her family! This litter has the sweetest temperaments! She will be a medium size dog 35-50 pounds. 

Adoption includes first 4 series of vaccines, Bordetella and booster, spayed, rabies, multiple dewormingâs, microchip, and taking parasite prevention.  

Application, Vet reference, Home Visit, and $250.00 adoption fee required. Long distance maybe possible and includes a transporter fee. Email for an application were4dogs@gmail.com

name: Ehlena
description: Hi there, My name is Ehlena. I weigh about 50 pounds, and I'm almost 7 years old. I'm a little shy and timid with new people but I love having a dog friend to help me with my confidence. Once I get used to everyone, I'm just a regular pup who loves to lounge on the couch and romp and play in the yard with my doggy friend. Please consider giving me a little extra time to let me be your new family member. My foster mom says I'm as sweet as can be, I just need a little time to come out of my shell in new environments. Apply to adopt me at https://www.bamabully.org/steps-to-adopt/.

name: Zelda
description:
ZELDA FEMALE AGE 6 MONTHS GRIFFON SMOOTH COAT CHIHUAHUA AGE 6 MONTHS WEIGHT 20 POUNDS MATURE 30 COLOR BROWN BRINDLE COAT MEDIUM SPAYED CHIPPED This is Zelda! She is a fun-loving and playful girl who is quite happy! She's great with people as well as other dogs. Her coat is a gorgeous brindle brown, and her tail is quite curly! What a sweetheart!!! (posted 8/30/19, ME)
**It is rare that we know with certainty the ages or mixes that make up our wonderful dogs, but we do our best to be as accurate as possible based upon our many years in rescue.

name: Loki
description:
LOKI MALE CHIHUAHUA AGE 8 MONTHS WEIGHT 9 POUNDS MATURE 14 POUNDS COLORS TAN WHITE COAT SHORT NEUTERED CHIPPED Here's Loki, a boy always looking for fun. He loves other dogs as well as people. He's an absolute darling who, even when mature, will weigh only 14 pounds. Because of that, please do not apply for him if you have small children in the home. Sometimes they just don't know their own strength! What a delight! (posted 8/30/19, ME)

name: Maya AKA Ms. Mindy *IN THE NORTHEAST!*
description:
I'M LOCATED IN NEW HAMPSHIRE!!! 

Maya was adopted from us earlier this year. She has lots of love and energy. She could play all day! 





COMPLETED APPLICATIONS TAKE PRECEDENCE OVER INQUIRIES! IF you are interested in adopting, the FIRST step is to complete an application! Please email for an Application or copy and paste the following URL: https://fs26.formsite.com/nogreaterlove/form2/index.html Upon receipt of your application, the rescuer and foster in AL will contact you so you can ask any specific questions you may have! If there is more than one decision maker in the home, all of them should be in agreement! 
Thank you for your understanding and consideration and for helping the dogs and puppies in need!
 Adoption Donation: Unless otherwise stated in the pet's bio, our standard adoption fee is $495 which covers age appropriate vaccines (DHPP vax) and (Rabies vax if 12 weeks and older), utd on flea/tick prevention and heartworm prevention, worming, heartworm test @ age 6 months or older, microchip, fostering costs and health certificate. 
Puppy will be adopted on a spay/neuter contract due to size. Within 6 months of adoption up to $100.00 will be refunded when paperwork is sent in showing puppy has been spayed or neutered. 
We do not adopt to anyone under the age of 21

description:

name: Mr. Pearson
description:
MR PEARSON
MALECHIWEENIE CORGI MIXAGE 2 YEARS WEIGHT 17 POUNDSCOLORS CREAM GREY AND BLACKCOAT SHORTNEUTEREDCHIPPED
Mr. Pearson is quite the boy! Check out that ear! He's a very curious lad, and he loves his treats. He loves to play and take the occasional nap.Until he gets to know you, he is rather shy, but then he is your best friend ever! We feel he would be more comfortable with older children in the house. The young ones don't always understand that they might unintentionally hurt such a small dog. Mr. Pearson is a fine boy who will always love to see you come home! (posted 8/30, ME)

name: Abilene 31353
description: Abilene is an 1-year-old female Lab mix. She came to PAHS as a stray who was found out in the county and her owner never came looking for her. Abilene is one gorgeous girl! Her coat is tan and she has white markings. We love her perky Terrier ears! Abilene is such a sweet girl who would be fine in a home with other dogs and children. She currently weighs 33 pounds so she is considered to be a medium sized dog and we don't think she will get much bigger. Looking for the perfect family dog? Look no more--Abilene is ready to go home with some lucky adopter. By the way, she poses like a show dog! ****Please note that when introducing a new dog into a home with children and other pets adult supervision is strongly recommended until the new dog settles in with the family.****Dogs may be adopted for $120. Cat adoption fees are $50. Our adoption fees cover a microchip, microchip registration, discounted spay/neuter certificate, deworming, vaccinations (as age and law requires), and a courtesy vet exam at participating offices. Unless otherwise indicated under 'special needs' our dogs have screened heart worm negative.

name: Novi R - IN NJ !!
description:
Please contact Vickie (dvbrooks57@gmail.com) for more information about this pet.FOSTER MARY ELLENNOVIMALEAGE 20 WEEKSWEIGHT 18 POUNDSMATURE 45COAT SHORTNEUTERED CHIPPEDMEET THE COAT OF MANY COLOR PUPPIES.... THEY ARE ALL SO DIFFERENT! BUT BEAUTIFUL FURBABIES. THEY ARE A VERY PLAYFUL, SWEET AND LOVING LITTER OF PUPPIES . THEY ARE RUNNING AFTER YOU ONE MINUTE , AND LAYING IN YOUR LAP FOR LOVE THE NEXT. THEY ARE FULLY VETTED AND READY TO GO TO THEIR FOREVER HOMES.POSTED 7/19/19 (ME) updated 8/30/19

It is rare that we know with certainty the ages or mixes that make up our wonderful dogs, but we do our best to be as accurate as possible based upon our many years in rescue.**
Adoption: $325 which covers quarantine, shots, worming, medical records, spaying/neutering,microchip

name: Hobo Humphrey
description: Hobo Humphrey is a gorgeous 1 year old pit mix looking for his FURever home! Hobo loves going on car rides and has the sweetest demeanor. He loves everyone and has never met a stranger. He also loves kids and other dogs! However, he would do best in a home without cats. Hobo is up to date on vaccines, heartworm negative, neutered, and microchipped. Call (205) 902-9247 or email jill@wagshomewood.com for more information on adopting Hobo Humphrey!

name: 190982 Twinkle
description:
190982. Twinkle is 4 1/2 months old as of late August 2019 and only about 25 lbs so not going to get a lot bigger. She was found as a stray puppy and no one ever came looking. She is playful, mischievous, good with other dogs and looking for some children she can explore with.

ADOPTION FEES Dogs & Puppies.....$100.00. This Adoption fee includes: mandatory spay/neuter which will be done before you can take your dog or puppy home with you; basic canine immunizations (DHPP-CPV & Bordatella Intranasal); de-wormings; one-year rabies vaccination if old enough; heartworm test if over five months old; microchip from 24-Pet Watch; certificate for free health examination at your participating veterinarian; and a goodie bag chocked full of information, toys, and more.
Yes, there are sometimes exceptions to our normal fee for older dogs or special cases or adoptions of two dogs together. Some of our pets have also been lovingly sponsored by caring people and we will let the approved adopter know about that at the point of adoption. Visit our Website at: http://www.elmorehumane.orgThe staff would also like to remind you that for faster response to inquiries about adoptable animals to have the animals ID#, name & description.This way your questions will be answered in a timely manner.
You can also expedite the adoption process by filling our Adoption Application which you can find at: http://www.elmorehumane.org/HSEC_FORMS/AdoptionApplication.pdf and sending to us either by scanning and emailing to hselco@bellsouth.net or faxing to 334-567-8774.
All pet adoption websites & our shelter management software require that we choose a primary and/or secondary breed for our dogs. While our staff is quite breed knowledgeable, in many cases we are truly making our best guesses as to their breed(s) based on many factors but cannot promise that what we have said is accurate. So taking into account your own parameters for things such as size, coat care, activity level, etc please come and get to know our dog(s) as individuals to see if their personalities and yours are a forever match.
Thank you!Phone: (334) 567-3377 Fax: (334) 567-8774 E-mail: hselco@bellsouth.net

name: 191145 Puppy
description:

name: 190754 Holly
description:
190754. Holly is seven months old as of late August 2019 and only about 30 lbs so not going to get a lot bigger. She is too cute and very playful and loving. She keeps asking where HER family is that is going to give her a forever home!

name: Madison
description: Wooohoooo!  My name is Madison and I am an eight-month-old retriever mix that needs a home. I was picked up by a kind stranger. He tried to help me find my family, but had no luck.  Finally he brought me to the shelter in hopes that they would look for me here.  No one ever came for me and the shelter got me ready to go up for adoption.  I have all of my vaccinations, I am heartworm negative, I have a microchip, and I have been spayed.  I am an active girl that is still young. I will need some one to teach me nice manners, get me lots of exercise, and spend time just bonding with me so I will feel secure!  Do you have time for me?

name: Miracle
description: Howâs it going? Itâs going pretty great for meâ¦.. at least now it is!  I was brought to the shelter as a stray. I was never claimed by my family and now I can go up for adoption.  They think life has been pretty hard for me before arriving at the shelter.  It looks like I have had litters of puppies before arriving at the shelter and I have a scar that runs down the middle of my back.  If I could talk I could tell you exactly what  happened! What ever has happened in my life it has not affected my sweet disposition or my loving demeanor.  While I have been here I have gotten all of my vaccinations, I am heartworm negative, I have a microchip, and I have been spayed. I am a four-year-old terrier mix.  I hope you will come in to meet me. I canât wait to find out what itâs like to have a family and a nice safe place to call home.

name: Adele
description: Hey there!  I am not Adele the famous singer, I am Adele the cute little stray!  I am sitting here at the shelter hoping to find a new home soon.  I was picked up by a Good Samaritan who found me lost and alone! She brought me in hoping my family would claim me. No such luck!  I was never claimed and now I am looking for a new home. I am a two-year-old terrier mix.  I have all of my vaccinations, I have a microchip, and I have been spayed.  One little problem did show up on my health check up. I am heartworm positive. Whoever adopts me will need to have me treated.  If you would like to donate to my treatment that would be so nice! If you would like to foster me or adopt me during treatment well that would be extra special nice!!  FYIâ¦.I am an employee favorite! I won their hearts with my sweet and loving personality! I bet I can win yours too!

name: Kyle
description: Hidy! I am Kyle! I am a young puppy that was rescued by Animal Control. Yep, someone called about a lost puppy in their neighborhood.  I was really glad to come to the shelter where I was safe and well fed.  Now itâs time for me to find a home and I canât wait!  I have all of my vaccinations for my age, I have a microchip, and I have been neutered.  Please remember I am just a baby and like all babies, I will take up lots of you time and patience.  Do you have time for a puppy like me?

name: Butterfly
description: Ohâ¦.hi. I am Butterfly. Well I am not exactly a butterfly, but my name is Butterfly!  I was rescued by a kind stranger who saw me lost and confused.  She scooped me up and brought me right to the shelter so I could safely wait for my family to claim me.  I have all of my vaccinations, I am heartworm negative, I have a microchip, and I have been spayed. I am a seven-month-old terrier mix. I am a fun loving girl that goes by the motto âGO FUN OR GO HOME!â  Others might say that my energy level is a little over the top, I just say I can keep you active and moving if you just keep up with me!

name: Kenzie
description: Well hello.  I am Kenzie.  I am a young heeler/hound mix that is about five months old.  I had a home that I loved, but I just wasnât getting along with the other dog at our house. I guess I was younger so it was decided that I should find a new home.  I have all of my vaccinations, I am heartworm negative, I have a microchip, and I have been spayed. I am friendly with other dogs and I passed my behavior tests with flying colors!  If you are interested in me and have another dog, just bring him or her with you.  Then you can see how well we will get along together!

name: Mitchie
description: Hey Folks!  Mitchie here!  Listen you wonât believe where I was. I was hanging around a day care center here in town.  I loved seeing the kids. They were lots of fun to watch. Well it probably wasnât safe for me to just hang around there, so the teachers called Animal Control.  I rode to the shelter and I have now waited my allotted time. Now I can look for a new home.  I have all of my vaccinations, I am heartworm negative, I have a microchip, and I have been neutered. I am a one-year-old terrier mix. It hasnât taken me long to win the hearts of the staff and volunteers in the short time that I have been here.  I am a joy to be around

name: Tillie
description: Gee hello!  I am Tillie!  I am a four-month-old terrier mix that was recently picked up by Animal Control.  I was so glad to see them.  I hopped up in the truck for the ride in to the shelter.  I was never claimed by my family so now I can look for a new home.  I have all of my vaccinations for my age, I have a microchip, and I have been spayed. Since I am only four-month-old you already know that I am still a baby and will require lots of your time, patience, and love. Are you ready to have a young puppy in your home and all that goes with it?

name: Ben
description:
Ben is an easy peasy 8.5 lb. sweetheart of a guy that looks like a scruffy cotton ball.  Yes, he gets the zoomies when excited! Car rides... absolutely.  House and crate trained.  A true lap lover.  Ben would be just fine in a home with other dogs, kids, and cats too. 
He's ready to be your beau!  Est. DOB June 2009, vaccinated, neutered, microchipped, adoption fee $100.00.
Please submit an adoption application, https://twobytworescue.com/adopting/

name: Jethro
description: Jethro is a tan colored male hound dog mix.  He is about 1 year old, weighs 33 pounds and is heart worm negative.  His adoption fee will include vaccinations, worming, microchipping and neutering.  Jethro is good on a leash and an overall great dog so come meet him at the Center and form your own opinion of this sweetheart.

name: Harry
description: Harry is a male brown hound.  He is 4 months old and weighs 18 pounds.   His adoption fee will include vaccinations, worming, microchipping and neutering.  He is a sweet natured and lovable fellow looking to find his forever companion.  He hopes his new person will love him and include him in all aspects of their life.  This sweet boy deserves to find a perfect family that will love him always.  Come meet Harry at the Center.

name: Heather
description: Heather is a brown hound puppy looking for love in all the right places...so come meet her and see what you think.  Heather is about 4 months old and weighs 15 pounds.  Her adoption fee will include vaccinations, worming, microchipping and spaying when she is old enough.  Hurry to the Center and see this sweet and loving girl just waiting for her new family to find her and give her a life she never dreamed possible.

name: Spud
description:
My est. birthdate is July1, 2019, I'm up to date on vaccines, neutered and microchipped.  Adoption fee $200.00. I can't wait to have a person or family to call my own!
Please submit an adoption application, https://twobytworescue.com/adopting/

name: Idgie
description: My est. birthdate is July1, 2019, I'm up to date on vaccines, spayed and microchipped.  Adoption fee $200.00. I can't wait to have a person or family to call my own!  Please submit an adoption application, https://twobytworescue.com/adopting/

name: Darcy 31215
description: Darcy is an 1-and-1/2 year old female Terrier mix who has already been spayed. She showed up at someone's front door out in the county; and her owner never came to PAHS looking for her. This pretty girl's short coat is black with white markings. Darcy has the most adorable ears!!! One ear up and one ear down makes her unique look simply unforgettable! Her soulful brown eyes are beautiful! Darcy currently weighs 29 pounds so she is considered to be a medium sized adult dog. She is friendly and loves people including children. We believe Darcy would also be good with other dogs. Come out and meet this cute girl with the expressive ears soon! ****Please note that when introducing a new dog into a home with children and other pets adult supervision is strongly recommended until the new dog settles in with the family.****Dogs may be adopted for $120. Cat adoption fees are $50. Our adoption fees cover a microchip, microchip registration, discounted spay/neuter certificate, deworming, vaccinations (as age and law requires), and a courtesy vet exam at participating offices. Unless otherwise indicated under 'special needs' our dogs have screened heart worm negative.

name: Bristol B 6 lbs
description:
Meet Bristol... She is a fiesty girl, and rules the boys. She knows how to get her way.... Lol. She truly is a love, she will curl right up in your lap for love, just a pocket baby. She is good with cats too. She is 15 wks old. No kids under 6 please. Bristol is ready for her FOREVER loving home.
VB posted 8/28/19 Updated 9/8/19

description:
Meet Scooter... he is a little lap buddy. He loves attention. He is 15 wks old.and 6 lbs. He is great with other pups, and cats. He loves to play, run. Those little legs go ninety to nothing, but he always makes his way back to your lap, sweet boy! He is ready for the love! No kids under 6 please.

name: Dixie
description: Dixie is true to her name! Her manners are those of a true Southern Belle. When she goes out for bathroom breaks, she politely waits at the door to be invited back in.  Yes, she loves the yard and will turn over on her back and wiggle in the grass like she's in heaven. But Dixie is happiest when she is in the house with YOU!  On the sofa snuggling or just laying by your feet if you have computer work to do. She likes to be your shadow following you from room to room in case you need help with anything.  Dixie is also a great kitchen companion-- ready and willing to clean your floor of any unwanted food crumbs.  This pretty miss priss has never met a food she didn't love. Haha!   She gets along well with her foster sisters, is friendly to all she meets. Dixie walks gracefully on a leash and would enjoy exploring the park or neighborhood with you. Are you ready for a laid back Southern lady with impeccable manners? Then sweet Dixe is your gal!  Est. birthdate is Feb. 2011, vaccinated, spayed, microchipped, and ready to steal your heart!  Adoption fee $200.00

name: 191213 Hilton
description:
Hilton is a 1-2 year old male Beagle/Chihuahua mix, 21 lbs. He is an active and talkative boy who is good with other dogs. He does NOT do crating and gets frantic to get out. Hilton would a well-fenced yard and room to romp. Not a good candidate for an apartment since he can be so talkative.
This precious dog is one of over 60 we took in from a single voluntary surrender situation. These dogs have lived their lives outside in large pens so are NOT housetrained, not crate-trained, not leash trained. Many are super friendly, and we think will be fine with children but to our knowledge they have never been around children. It will be best for any children to meet them at our Shelter to make sure. Some of these dogs are shyer and may be more suited to adult only homes.
These dogs were all fed well enough but were covered with fleas & lived on dirt, so many do have hair loss as a result. A few have some Demodectic Mange which is NOT a contagious condition; we expect those with Demodex to clear up quickly now that they are spayed and neutered, fully vaccinated, flea free and clean. Going to a home full of love will also help immensely as they leave the stress behind of their previous living conditions and also the Shelter.
All those up for adoption have tested negative for heartworms but it is absolutely vital they be kept on monthly heartworm prevention from your Veterinarian to ensure they stay negative. If you are not familiar with heartworm prevention, please first talk to your Veterinarian so you are aware of the cost (minor considering that it saves lives) and are ready to ensure prevention throughout their lifetime. If you have other dogs and they are not on prevention you will first need to get with your Veterinarian to have your dog(s) tested and purchase prevention for it/them. Heartworm prevention is a BIG DEAL to us and while we are happy to educate, please also talk to your Veterinarian about its importance.
We look forward to all of these dogs being adopted into loving and responsible homes where they will get lots of attention, love and care, and never again have to be miserable from fleas and all of the inclement weather they have endured living outside.
Our adoption fees are $100 for dogs. This adoption fee completely covers the mandatory spay or neuter, basic immunizations, de-worming, microchip, heartworm check, rabies vaccination if old enough, free health exam with your participating veterinarian.
To meet all the great pets at our shelter come to 255 Central Plank Road, Wetumpka, AL, 36092, go to our website at www.elmorehumane.org for more information, email us at hselco@bellsouth.net for an Adoption Application or give us a call at 334-567-3377.
We are open for adoptions Mon-Fri 10-5 & Sat 9-4.

name: Justin
description: During my time spent with a volunteer I was found to be:Did I come to the front of the kennel to greet you? Yes Was I easy to get out of the kennel? YesWas I outgoing? YesWas I afraid to go thru doorways? YesDid I bark at you? NoDid I pull a lot on the leash? NoWas I super interested in other dogs? SomewhatWas I nervous about other people? NoWas I nervous about kids? N/ADid I have a lot of energy outside? YesDid I play with toys outside? NoWas I cuddly? YesDid I go to the bathroom while I was outside? YesDid I have pee/poop in my kennel before I went out? No NOTES: 8/15/2019 - Justin is a very nice large dog. He was very good to walk and seems gentle. I think he would make someone a great family friend.

name: Gibbs
description:
Gibbs is as happy as he looks!  He likes making new friends, playing nice with other dogs, happy dancing, walks like a gentleman on a leash, will sit for treats, and enjoys kennel time. He hasn't been with cats in his foster home, but he does like kids.   In his free time, he loves hanging out in your lap and romping around the yard. Gibbs is certified to be your best friend!  

Est. birthdate 2/12/2018, house trained, vaccinated, neutered, microchipped. Adoption fee $200.00  
Please submit an adoption application, https://twobytworescue.com/adopting/

name: Freckles
description:
Meet Freckles! Freckles is a happy and healthy dog who gets along well with all family members, including small children and other dogs and cats. She is not aggressive towards people, but she is protective of her food around other dogs. Freckles will do well in a home as an only dog or in a home with other pets, she is around 7 or 8 years old. She loves to go on walks and get belly rubs. Freckles is a little chunk of housetrained and leashtrained love. She likes her crate and sleeps in it voluntarily most nights. She is independent, does not need a large yard, and is usually quiet but does do the beagle howl on occasion. She is a couch potato and needs someone who can exercise her regularly. Freckles is not a big snuggler and she does not usually jump up on people, but she can be very affectionate and cover you with slobbery kisses when excited. Freckles is located in Montgomery, AL.

This beagle is microchipped, up to date on vaccines, spayed and on flea and heartworm prevention. Please email rescue@alsosbeagles.com for more information, or complete an application at http://sosbeagles.org/adoptionform.php (send to AL chapter).

name: Addison B
description:
Please contact Vickie (dvbrooks57@gmail.com) for more information about this pet.SPAYEDLAB MIXBORN 4-15-1915- 18 LBSMEET ADDISON... SHE IS A CUTIE PIE, LOVING, AND YOUR NORMAL PUP. SHE IS GOOD WITH OTHER DOGS, KIDS AND CATS. SHE IS READY TO SHARE HER LIFE, AND LOVE WITH HER NEW FAMILY. ADDISON IS FULLY VETTED AND READY TO GO!TN POSTED 7/25/19

name: Lola
description:
This is Lola. She was at a high kill shelter in Alabama. Our foster family went to the shelter to pick up two puppies for our organization. But the 11 year old son of the foster family felt so moved while at the shelter when he walked by Lolaâs kennel...he cried and cried with feelings of empathy and sadness. Lola sitting in the back of her kennel with her head hung low. Hope was no longer something she had. She had given up on everything. She was afraid and very depressed...loneliness was the new norm for her. She came to realize that no one was ever coming for her and that she knew she was going to die in that shelter any day now. The 11 yo foster boy could feel all of Lolaâs emotions in the few minutes of seeing her. He noticed the dogs in the nearby kennels were all jumping at the gate and barking loudly. But not Lola...she didnât make a sound, didnât move a muscle. He told his mom âMom, we canât leave this dog here. She will die in here. No one else is going to save her. Sheâs crying mom.â His mom said yes to fostering her too! We agreed to take her into our adoption program and find her a forever home. 

We met Lola that afternoon. What a gem she is!! She is most kind hearted soul. She oozes gratefulness with every look and movement. She is calm, and she is soothing to your own soul. Something about her draws you to her. She loves children and is like a grandma to them...she lays next to them and just âchecking on them.â She has also taken on to mother the two puppies we rescued. She acts like they are her puppies. She licks them and loves them. 
We gave her a bath...she just stood there in complete contentment while the cold water hose was quickly rinsing her and we lathered her up. She is so trusting of humans. Itâs beautiful. Sheâs a beauty on the INSIDE and OUT! 

Visit our website to apply for Lola! You truly couldnât ask for a better dog. 

WWW.4Legs4Justice.org

name: Barney was Megaladon
description: UPDATED 09/10/19:Barney needs to be placed in a home with kids over 12 years of age. He is OK seeing young kids and sharing physical space with them, but needs to be monitored when young kids go to make physical interaction with him. Barney lived in a home with two kids ages 4 and 6. The 4 year old and Barney did not mix well. When the 4 year old would go to interact with Barney, hugs etc. Barney would growl at the kid. SO! Barney needs to be placed in a home with kids that are old enough to recognize when Barney doesn't like something that they are doing!UPDATED 6/20/19:I wanted to update Barney's photos to reflect his grreat personality. He is happy (smiles while he is outside!) and fun! He loves his ears rubbed and will sit and come for treats. Don't let his size fool you. He is a big old teddy bear. Come meet my buddy today and he'll be your buddy too. Observations of personality and habits of BARNEY by volunteer Sandy Sims who walked and played with him on May 14, 2019:Did I come to the front of the kennel to greet you? YESWas I easy to get out of the kennel? YESWas I outgoing? YESWas I afraid to go through doorways? NODid I bark at you? NODid I pull a lot on the leash? SOMEWHAT This sweet boy was ready to be outside. Was I super interested in other dogs? YES, in a friendly wayWas I nervous about other people? NOWas I nervous about kids? Didn't get to observeDid I have a lot of energy outside? YES, he was very interested in his surroundingsDid I play with toys outside? SOMEWHAT, people and smells are more interestingWas I cuddly? YES, super sweet Did I go to the bathroom while I was outside? YESDid I have pee/poop in my kennel before I went out? NOOther Comments: Don't let his size fool you, BARNEY is a gentle giant. I fell in love with him. He loves his ears rubbed and will look deep into your eyes. BARNEY knows sit and responds well to treats. If you are having a bad day, let his big old smile cheer you up.

name: Jesse James
description: Jesse James was found with 3 of his siblings living with man that lived in a shack. Barely had food and water.

name: Frank
description: Frank was found with 3 of his siblings living with man that lived in a shack. Barely had food and water.

name: Donald (See Memo)
description: During my time in the shelter I have been found to be:Good with other dogs?: Yes - after leash walk. He can over react when he first sees new dogs. Good with cats?: Don't KnowGood with kids?: YesGood with strangers?: YesGood on car rides?: YesGood on leash?: YesHousebroken?: Don't KnowWork for food?: YesWork for toys?: YesEnergy Level?: Med/High

name: Casey (Bonded with Dack)
description: Is there anything sweeter than an old couple who are still in love?  Cute couple alert!  Hi, people, I'm Casey and I'm very much in love with my big man, Dack.  Couldn't do without him; we've been together 11 years!  Our human Dad passed away, and Dack and I need to find a new home together where we can be loved and happy for the rest of our lives.  I'm a very feminine and petite girl who will flirt for treats.  I weigh 45 pounds and I'm pretty agile.  I have a very slight limp because of previous nail bed infections but, goodness, it's like I'm at a spa.  I'm getting foot soaks and medicated baths and mousse treatments on my fur.  We were outside alone most of the time so my skin needs some loving care.  I love other dogs and people and I'm a real adorable girl.  I'm hoping Dack and I will see the end of summer in a new home together; loving each other and our new people.  Bless you all, Casey

name: Dack - Bonded with Casey
description: Is there anything sweeter than an old couple who are still in love?  Cute couple alert!  Hello there, my name is Dack.  I'm a gentleman of senior years and I have a few miseries that come with age.  But I have my girl Casey who lights up my life.  We've been together all our lives; we're 11 years old.  I weigh 80 pounds.  Our human Dad passed away and there was no one to continue taking care of us so we've been welcomed to AGB.  My hearing isn't what it used to be, my ears are infected, and I just had a growth removed from my back knee.  So I haven't been feeling too well.  Casey and I used to spend most of our time outdoors and now we're looking for a place where we can cuddle inside and be cool in the summer and warm in the winter, especially on a comfortable bed.  I'm heart worm negative and vaccinated.  I'm very sweet and friendly.  Besides my sweetheart Casey, I love treats and peanut butter sandwiches.  Maybe you could help me out with a few donations towards my medical costs.  I'd sure appreciate it.  And thank you for letting me stay with my girl.

name: Fancy
description:
We call her Fancy Free because she is definitely a free spirit. She is like a butterfly in a dog body.  

Fancy LOVES everyone she meets and all dogs. Her foster home has dogs who can be dog selective but they all accept and get along with Miss Fancy. 

The perfect home for Fancy would be one where someone is home most of the time as she can get anxious when she is alone. She has some separation anxiety and does best when she knows someone is close by. She also needs another dog to hang with, one her size (41 lbs) or larger...she loves playing and running and needs a playmate.  Not only is Fancy a free spirit but she has the typical Husky trait of escaping. A privacy fence would be important, regular fences would be like not having one at all with this girl. She will NOT do well as an apartment dog or a situation where she would be crated most of the day. She needs human and canine interaction. Fancy is incredibly smart and gets bored easily which can lead to her getting into mischief. She would love to have older children to play with or to be able to go to work with her person. She might just be a great candidate for fly ball or agility.

name: Betsy
description: If you are looking for a companion, Betsy just might be the one for you. She is so happy, loves walks and car rides and just being with her people. She likes most other dogs, lives with her foster family and multiple other dogs and does fine. House trained, crate trained and you can usually find her hanging out in her room during the day if she is not laying at your feet. She does get a little anxious during storms but is fine when she has a person or another dog with her. She would be a great family pet, one with older children or a companion for adults with no children. We expect she will bond very quickly with her new family once she realizes she is loved. If interested in meeting this 65 pounds of love please email us at aarfalabama@gmail.com or text 205-447-6459.

name: Sookie
description:

We believe Sookie is a Rat terrier chihuahua mix. Her mother is pictured and weighs approximately 12 pounds. Sookie is almost 12 weeks old.

name: Romeo 31352
description: Romeo is a 5-month-old male Terrier mix who must be neutered before he is adopted. His short coat is brown with pretty markings. You will notice that Romeo has a 'cherry eye'. A 'cherry eye' doesn't cause him any pain but if you adopt him your vet can advise you on it. Romeo weighs 14 pounds and we believe he will be a medium size adult dog (weighing between 30-60 pounds). He is a bit nervous when you first meet him. Romeo warms up quickly to a little cuddling and kind words. Like any young dog he is active and playful. We know he would appreciate a fenced yard where he could safely play. Romeo is not well leash trained so a little patience will be needed to have him walking on a leash like a pro. True to his name Romeo is very affectionate and sweet. He is going to make a great little family dog who will be good with other dogs and children ****Please note that when introducing a new dog into a home with children and other pets adult supervision is strongly recommended until the new dog settles in with the family.****Dogs may be adopted for $120. Cat adoption fees are $50. Our adoption fees cover a microchip, microchip registration, discounted spay/neuter certificate, deworming, vaccinations (as age and law requires), and a courtesy vet exam at participating offices. Unless otherwise indicated under 'special needs' our dogs have screened heart worm negative.

name: Buck
description: Buck is fantastic with other dogs and LOVES to play especially in a kiddy pool. He likes children too, is a tad bit shy, but is learning puppy skills in his foster home.  Est. DOB is 4/23/2019, vaccinated, neutered, microchipped.  Adoption fee $200.00.  Please submit an adoption application, https://twobytworescue.com/adopting/

name: Acorn
description: Precious Acorn lives in a foster home where she enjoys snuggles and playtime with other dogs. Est. birthdate is April 23,2019, is up to date on vaccines, spayed, and microchipped. Adoption fee $200.00. She can't wait to grow up with a family to call her own!   Please submit an adoption application, https://twobytworescue.com/adopting/

name: Whitlee
description: Precious Whitlee lies in a foster home where she enjoys snuggles and playtime with other dogs. Est. birthdate is 5/19/2019, is up to date on vaccines, spayed, and microchipped. Adoption fee $200.00.  She can't wait to grow up with a family to call her own!   Please submit an adoption application, https://twobytworescue.com/adopting/

name: Pam from accounting
description: Pam from accounting is a sweetie with the most adorable puppy eyes. She loves to wrestle and play chase with her foster siblings.  She a friend to dogs of all sizes and chilren too!  Pam lives in a loving foster home but can't wait to find her own forever family. Est. birthdate is May 19, 2019, expected to be medium size, is up to date on vaccines, spayed, microchipped, and ready to be your girl! Adoption fee $200.00.   Please submit an adoption application, https://twobytworescue.com/adopting/

name: Moose
description: Hidy do! My name is Moose!  I am a big handsome fellow that is about a year old.  I had a family that I loved, but somehow I got out of the yard and was picked up by Animal Control.  I was never claimed by my family.  So here I am looking for a new family to love.  I have all of my vaccinations, I am heartworm negative, I have a microchip, and I have been altered. I am a fun guy that would love to live with an active family! Please make me a part of the family. Include me in all family celebrations and fun times! I know if you adopt me I will have a spring in my step and a song in my heart! See you soon!

name: Pinky
description: Greetings! My name is Pinky!  I am a five-month-old retriever mix that was picked up by Animal Control.  I was so glad to see that truck pull up beside me!  Yep, I was pretty scared out on my own.  When we got back to the shelter I was given a big clean dog run, a big bowl of food, and a nice comfy bed!  I might just have to stay! No, not really! I will move on to a real home, so someone else can take my place here! I have all of my vaccinations, I am heartworm negative, I have a microchip, and I have been spayed.  Remember I am still a puppy and will take up lots of your time and patience, but I will be so worth it!

name: Fifi
description: Hidy do! My name is Fifi! I am a ten-month-old retriever mix that needs to find a new place to hang my leash!  I had a home, but I was picked up by Animal Control and my family decided that I should just find another home.  I have all of my vaccinations, I am heartworm negative, I have a microchip, and I have been spayed.  I am an active girl that would love to have lots of playtime with the family! Say, maybe we could go on some long walks in the evening, or a morning run some days!  I know one thing for sure, I will love you and make you laugh every day!!

name: Alastor
description: Hey there! Alastor here!  I am a one-year-old terrier mix that finds himself out of a home.  I donât know exactly what happened, but my family brought me in because they couldnât keep me.  While I have been here I have gotten all of my vaccinations, I am heartworm negative, I have a microchip, and I have been neutered.  I am a shy boy at first. After I warm up to you, I get very playful! I bet we could spend lots of fun times in the back yard or at the dog park! I think I would love that! You wanna give me a try? What do say?

name: Micah
description: Why hello!  My name is Micah! I am a handsome seven-month-old shepherd mix that was brought to the shelter with Animal Control.  I was glad to see those guys pull up beside me!  I was ready to get in that truck and head in to be cool and safe at the shelter.  We waited for my family to claim me, but no one ever came.  Now I am ready for adoption.  I have all of my vaccinations, I am heartworm negative, I have a microchip, and I have been neutered.  I am still young and have lots of learn. Will you teach me how to be a good dog? I know we are going to be best friends!

name: Marcus
description: Welp! Hi there!  My name is Marcus!  I am sitting here at the shelter just hoping to be adopted soon!  I came to the shelter as a stray and I was never claimed by my family. I am a four-month-old terrier mix. I have all of my vaccinations, I have a microchip, and I have been neutered. I am a really sweet puppy.  Do you have time to train me in good doggie manners? Can you teach me how to walk on a leash? Will you give me all of the exercise and play time that I will need? These are things you need to think about before you adopt me.

name: Ashley
description: OH, Hi. My name is Ashley! I am a sweet four-month-old puppy that needs to find a new home. I had a home that I loved, but my family was moving and I could not go with them. My family knew that the great folks here would do their best to find me a brand new home.  You should know that I have all of my vaccinations, I have a microchip, and I have been spayed.  I am a very sweet girl that will take up lots of your time and patience. Are you ready to take on a puppy and all that it involves?

name: Wiggle Butt
description: Wiggle Butt is a tricolor beagle and hound mix female puppy.  She is about 3 months old and weighs 14 pounds.  Her adoption fee will include age appropriate vaccinations, worming, microchipping and spaying when she is old enough. She is happy and energetic and waiting to meet her new family.

name: Athena 31322
description: Athena is an 1-year-old female Pit Bull Terrier who must be spayed before she is adopted. She has a gray and brown brindle coat with white markings. Athena is such a pretty girl! She currently weighs 49 pounds so she is considered to be a medium sized adult dog. Athena still has a lot of 'puppy play' in her! She is quite active and loves to romp around in our play yard. Athena would need a fenced yard where she could safely exercise and play. She is good with other dogs but we would suggest if you have another dog to bring your dog out to PAHS for a 'meet and greet'. Athena would be fine in a home with older children. She is so frisky she might knock a smaller child down with her cavorting around. Athena is just a great dog who can't wait to be living the family life in her new home. ****Please note that when introducing a new dog into a home with children and other pets adult supervision is strongly recommended until the new dog settles in with the family.**** ****Please note that when introducing a new dog into a home with children and other pets adult supervision is strongly recommended until the new dog settles in with the family.**** WE ARE REQUIRING THAT ATHENA BE SPAYED BEFORE SHE IS ADOPTED AND WE ARE REQUIRING A HOME CHECK BEFORE SHE LEAVES THE SHELTER.Dogs may be adopted for $120. Cat adoption fees are $50. Our adoption fees cover a microchip, microchip registration, discounted spay/neuter certificate, deworming, vaccinations (as age and law requires), and a courtesy vet exam at participating offices. Unless otherwise indicated under 'special needs' our dogs have screened heart worm negative.

name: 191213 Paulie
description:
Paulie #191213 is a 6-month old terrier/chihuahua mix, about 10 lbs. She is very sweet, loves attention and is VERY HIGH energy! She came to us originally with NO hair at all so her coat has recovered wonderfully. Paulie, like her sister Patty, is a very high energy dog and will need lots of room to run and exercise. See below for how we got Paulie:

This precious dog is one of 74 we took in from a single voluntary surrender situation. These dogs have lived their lives outside in large pens so are NOT housetrained, not crate-trained, not leash trained. Many are super friendly, and we think will be fine with children but to our knowledge they have never been around children. It will be best for any children to meet them at our Shelter to make sure. Some of these dogs are shyer and may be more suited to adult only homes.
These dogs were all fed well enough but were covered with fleas & lived on dirt, so many do have hair loss as a result. A few have some Demodectic Mange which is NOT a contagious condition; we expect those with Demodex to clear up quickly now that they are spayed and neutered, fully vaccinated, flea free and clean. Going to a home full of love will also help immensely as they leave the stress behind of their previous living conditions and also the Shelter.
All those up for adoption have tested negative for heartworms but it is absolutely vital they be kept on monthly heartworm prevention from your Veterinarian to ensure they stay negative. If you are not familiar with heartworm prevention, please first talk to your Veterinarian so you are aware of the cost (minor considering that it saves lives) and are ready to ensure prevention throughout their lifetime. If you have other dogs and they are not on prevention you will first need to get with your Veterinarian to have your dog(s) tested and purchase prevention for it/them. Heartworm prevention is a BIG DEAL to us and while we are happy to educate, please also talk to your Veterinarian about its importance.
We look forward to all of these dogs being adopted into loving and responsible homes where they will get lots of attention, love and care, and never again have to be miserable from fleas and all of the inclement weather they have endured living outside.
Our adoption fees are $100 for dogs. This adoption fee completely covers the mandatory spay or neuter, basic immunizations, de-worming, microchip, heartworm check, rabies vaccination if old enough, free health exam with your participating veterinarian.
To meet all the great pets at our shelter come to 255 Central Plank Road, Wetumpka, AL, 36092, go to our website at www.elmorehumane.org for more information, email us at hselco@bellsouth.net for an Adoption Application or give us a call at 334-567-3377.
We are open for adoptions Mon-Fri 10-5 & Sat 9-4.

name: 191213 Patty
description:
Patty #191213 is a 6-month old female terrier/chihuahua mix, about 10 lbs. She is very sweet, loves attention and is VERY HIGH energy! She came to us originally with NO hair at all so her coat has recovered wonderfully. Patty is a very assertive little girl so we recommend she buddy with a dog a bit older and bigger than her as she might be a tad bullyish to a little dog. She is sweet just a bit full of herself.
ADOPTION FEES Dogs & Puppies.....$100.00. This Adoption fee includes: mandatory spay/neuter which will be done before you can take your dog or puppy home with you; basic canine immunizations (DHPP-CPV & Bordatella Intranasal); de-wormings; one-year rabies vaccination if old enough; heartworm test if over five months old; microchip from 24-Pet Watch; certificate for free health examination at your participating veterinarian; and a goodie bag chocked full of information, toys, and more.
Yes, there are sometimes exceptions to our normal fee for older dogs or special cases or adoptions of two dogs together. Some of our pets have also been lovingly sponsored by caring people and we will let the approved adopter know about that at the point of adoption. Visit our Website at: http://www.elmorehumane.orgThe staff would also like to remind you that for faster response to inquiries about adoptable animals to have the animals ID#, name & description.This way your questions will be answered in a timely manner.
You can also expedite the adoption process by filling our Adoption Application which you can find at: http://www.elmorehumane.org/HSEC_FORMS/AdoptionApplication.pdf and sending to us either by scanning and emailing to hselco@bellsouth.net or faxing to 334-567-8774.
All pet adoption websites & our shelter management software require that we choose a primary and/or secondary breed for our dogs. While our staff is quite breed knowledgeable, in many cases we are truly making our best guesses as to their breed(s) based on many factors but cannot promise that what we have said is accurate. So taking into account your own parameters for things such as size, coat care, activity level, etc please come and get to know our dog(s) as individuals to see if their personalities and yours are a forever match.
Thank you!Phone: (334) 567-3377 Fax: (334) 567-8774 E-mail: hselco@bellsouth.net

name: Cody
description:
Adoption fee $100

Meet Cody!!

Cody is a Lab/Shepherd mix.  He is a loving senior of 9 years who spent the majority of his life in a small pen in the back of a yard.  He is gentle, trusting and eager to find a forever home.  He craves the outdoors, but also appreciated cuddling up for a good nap.  He gets along well with other animals, including dogs and cats.

We would like to see Cody be adopted locally here in Alabama considering his age.  He's such a sweet boy.  Please ask to meet Cody!

Paws of Dixie Animal Rescue adopts locally and in the New England area. Our adoption fee includes the spay/neuter, up to date shots, Microchip. 
PDAR.info@gmail.com

**To see all of our pets available for adoption, please copy this link.

https://www.petfinder.com/search/pets-for-adoption/?shelter_id%5B0%5D=AL450&sort%5B0%5D=recently_added


COMPLETED APPLICATIONS TAKE PRECEDENCE OVER INQUIRIES. If you are interested in adopting, the FIRST step is to complete an application.

Please copy and paste the following URL for the adoption application:

https://goo.gl/forms/oPC0SnGUB0aC4Mrr2

Please be advised that our volunteers are busy rescuing, transporting, and caring for our animals. We will respond to your application as soon as possible. Upon review of your application, the rescue in AL will contact you, so you can ask any specific questions that you may have.

NOTE: All Paws of Dixie animals are located in AL foster homes. 

If there is more than one decision maker in the home, all of them should be in agreement.

We DO NOT adopt to anyone under the age of 21.

Thank you for your understanding and consideration.

name: Hurbert
description: This sweet green-eyed boy is waiting on you to take him home so he can play outside, fetch the ball and bring it back to you and take a walk. He is calm on the leash and doesn't pull a bit. He still has good \"puppy like\" energy but also is a snuggler, wanting to be close to you, so would probably also make a good couch cuddler if given the chance. Please come meet Hurbert in person since photos and words can't possibly capture this beautiful and affectionate dog. Observations by volunteer S. Shaffer, 8/29/19

name: Brandy
description: Hey! I'm Brandy and I enjoy playing with toys and even playing with other dog friends! I'm an enthusiastic girl who just wants to show her owner love furever! BE THE MACARONI TO MY CHEESE. Adopt me!

name: 191357 Bowe
description:
19157 Bowe; eight month old male heeler/terrier, about 20 lbs This boy loves to go for rides and sleep curled up next to you in bed. He does prefer the company of female dogs to males and we're told he's good with children! He is a high energy boy so if you want a running/hiking buddy he could work great!

name: 191242 Ronni
description:
191242 Ronni; 4-5 year old female lab. This calm, beautiful girl came to us as a stray and was never claimed. She's sweet, quiet and walks well on a leash. Is she right for you??

name: 191076 Polo
description:
#191076 Polo is an eight month old (as of Aug '19) Husky/Shepherd looking mix, only about 45 lbs. She loves to belly crawl and is a bit shy but sweet and wants a human to trust. Sad that no one ever came looking for her or her brother. Loves water!

description:
