name: Outlaw
description: OH man! You wouldnât believe where Animal Control picked me up!  I was running on the Eastern Boulevard!  Yep, can you imagine? Me in all of that traffic!  It was pretty scary!  Anyway the nice deputy put me in her truck and away we went!  We just knew my family would come looking for me, but they didnât! The shelter has taken great care of me during my stay.  They even got me ready to find a new family.  I have all of my vaccinations, I am heartworm negative, I have a microchip, and I have been neutered.  I am a five-month-old retriever mix.  I am still a puppy. That means I will need lots of exercise, training in good doggie manners, and a ton of love from you! Do you have time for a puppy like me?

name: Charlotte
description: Oh myâ¦..My name is Charlotte and I am one pretty girl!  I was picked up by Animal Control as I wandered in a neighborhood. To tell you the truth, I was glad for Animal Controlâs help in getting me off the street and inside the shelter!  I have waited by allotted time and now I am ready to hit the adoption market!  I am a two-year-old terrier mix and I have all of my vaccinations, I am heartworm negative, I have a microchip, and I have been spayed.  Now you may have noticed in my pictures that my ears have been cut.  I am hoping my new family can over look my ears and just love me for meâ¦..I am an affectionate girl that just wants the love of her family.

name: Kofi
description: Well hey there!  My name is Kofi!  Now tell me have you ever seen such a big handsome boy?  I doubt it!  I am an eight-month-old Labrador retriever mix. I had a home that I loved, but my owner moved to a new place that didnât allow pets. What? Did he forget about big old me?  Well I am moving on and hoping to find a new home soon. I have all of my vaccinations, I am heartworm negative, I have a microchip, and I have been neutered.  I am a big guy with lots of energy! I will need an adopter that can spend lots of time with me and get me a ton of exercise! You know the old saying âA tired dog is a good dog!â Well itâs true in most casesâ¦..

name: Belle
description: Well hello!  I am Belle!  I am a four-month-old terrier mix that is looking for a new home. I had a home that I loved, but my owner moved to a place that didnât allow pets!  Whoa! How does that happen?  Did he forget about me?  Anyway he is moving on to a new place and I guess I am too!  I have all of my vaccinations, I have a microchip, and I have been spayed.  Remember I am a puppy and I will need lots of your time and patience.  Take the time to train me in good manners so I can go everywhere with you!

name: Princess (Reign)
description:
All of our dogs are housed in private homes, we do not have a store or a shelter. We do not show dogs to interested parties until they have an approved adoption application. If you are interested in adopting one of our dogs, please fill out an adoption application on our website www.helpingshepherdsofeverycolor.com You may also find us on facebook: Helping Shepherds of Every Color Rescue.

Reign is a very sweet but somewhat shy girl. She would do best in a calm home. Once she gets comfortable with you she is friendly and silly.

name: Shelby
description: Shelby is a super sweet girl! She sits on command with a treat so will be easily trainable, is playful with lots of energy when she gets outside in the fresh air and sunshine. She will make someone a good walking or running pal, but she is also calm and affectionate for the times you just want to cuddle with her! Shelby is waiting for you to come give her a chance at life and give her a loving home! Please come meet her in person, she will melt your heart like she did mine!Observations made by volunteer, S. Shaffer 8/22/19

name: Kerby
description: Kerby is a white and brown hound mix male dog.  He is 3 years old and weighs 70 pounds.  His adoption fee will include vaccinations, worming, microchipping and neutering.  Kerby is a big happy boy that needs someone who can spend some time with him and train him to be the perfect dog.  Come meet Kerby if you are interested in this big guy.

name: Diamond Girl
description: Meet Diamond Girl...a female white and brown pit bull terrier.  She is about 1 year old, weighs 44 pounds and is heart worm negative.  Her adoption fee will include vaccinations, worming, microchipping and spaying.  Diamond Girl looks to have had a litter of puppies in the not so far past.  She is an awesome dog with a friendly and outgoing personality.  She is great on a leash and very attentive to the people around her. She sits on command and seems very intelligent.  A real sweet heart just looking for love and a family of her own.   Come meet Diamond Girl and see if she might be the perfect fit for you.

name: Roxie
description:
17.8 lbs.,  Est. DOB June 2012.  Lives in a loving foster home.
Vaccinated, spayed, microchipped. Est. DOB June 2012.  Adoption fee $200.00.
Please submit an adoption application, https://twobytworescue.com/adopting/

name: Bubby
description: Bubby is the perfect little snuggle bug, but can be somewhat reserved until he gets to know and bond with his person.  Then he loves to be right against you to accept all your hugs and kisses.  First thing in the morning, Bubby runs to the door because he is so excited to go for a morning walk.  A fenced yard would be a plus as he likes to be active and explore the outdoors, but isn't hyper. His favorite activities include playing fetch with toys that squeak-squeak-squeak, and gnawing bully sticks.  This precious little fella gets along well with other dogs, and doesn't seem to mind cats.  He'll let you know when he needs to go out to take care of business, is crate trained, vaccinated, neutered, microchipped, and ready to steal your heart!  Est. DOB is 6/3/2017.  Adoption fee $200.00.     Please submit an adoption application, https://twobytworescue.com/adopting/

name: Aliena
description:
Whether they look alike or not, puppy litters are always wonderful! Our three A puppies are a mix of Lab and Shepherd. They're typical pups! They love to play, love to love, and love to stick their noses in where they might not belong. Aliena is a girl with a gold and white coat, and lovely amber eyes! She weighs between 16 and 18 pounds. Her sister's coat is black and white with a bit of a wave, and she also weighs between 16 and 18 pounds. Their brother Albert, however, is tricolor and weighs approximately 18 and 20 pounds. Presently 13/14 weeks old, they will all grow to medium size. Great puppies! (posted 8/12/19, ME)
**It is rare that we know with certainty the ages or mixes that make up our wonderful dogs, but we do our best to be as accurate as possible based upon our many years in rescue.
** Adoption: $325 which covers quarantine, shots, worming, food, medical records, spaying/neutering,microchip and an Alabama State Health Certificate. Transport, if needed : $120.00 We consider the transport to be of great importance and, as such, take particular care of the dogs during the trip from Alabama. We make every effort to arrive with healthy and minimally stressed dogs.

name: Slim
description: Meet Slim. He is an 8 year old fella that needs to find his forever home.  He is very laid back and docile.  Loves children and does well with other dogs.  He is house trained.  He is the perfect pup. Just needs to fine him the perfect family.

name: Yellow Boy
description:
Hello! My name is Yellow Boy and I am named after a rifle because when I am let outside to play I go off like a rifle shot. I am the most fun little dog around! I am wanting to be adopted so I can have a human and maybe a dog sibling to run and play with  me!


Breed:  Yellow Lab Mix
Gender:  Male, Neutered
Age:  9 months
Size:  35 pounds

Personality
I love to run and play especially with other dogs!  I love to catch people's attention by hopping up and down in place and wagging my long tail!  I LOVE attention! I am active but once I am brought back inside I will relax and watch what's going on around me. Nothing makes me more excited than my toy dinosaur and a little bit of canned food.  I will do anything for those! I have pretty good manners. I don't jump on people. I just jump and down in place when I am excited like a bucking bronco. Then when I get to run I leap through the air like a deer. I am young and very, very smart and willing to learn new things for snacks and new toys especially if it means we are going for a good run or to play with other dogs if I am good. Can I go home with you?

name: Tig (See Memo)
description: Tig is an awesome pittie, a super docile and calm fella. His gorgeous eyes won me over before I fell in love with his personality. He didn't pull on the leash one bit and did his bathroom business outside where he is supposed to. :) This boy is SUPER affectionate and Super Chill!! He will make a great couch potato to watch some Netflix with you or be perfectly willing to take a leisurely stroll with you! You must meet Tig in person for yourself because to meet and know Tig is to love him! He will give love and affection back to his human(s) immeasurably! ??

name: Alicia
description:
Whether they look alike or not, puppy litters are always wonderful! Our three A puppies are a mix of Lab and Shepherd. They're typical pups! They love to play, love to love, and love to stick their noses in where they might not belong. Aliena is a girl with a gold and white coat, and lovely amber eyes! She weighs between 16 and 18 pounds. Her sister, Alicia's, coat is black and white with a bit of a wave, and she also weighs between 16 and 18 pounds. Their brother Albert, however, is tricolor and weighs approximately 18 to 20 pounds. Presently 13/14 weeks old, they will all grow to medium size. Great puppies! (posted 8/12/19, ME)
**It is rare that we know with certainty the ages or mixes that make up our wonderful dogs, but we do our best to be as accurate as possible based upon our many years in rescue.
** Adoption: $325 which covers quarantine, shots, worming, food, medical records, spaying/neutering,microchip and an Alabama State Health Certificate. Transport, if needed : $120.00 We consider the transport to be of great importance and, as such, take particular care of the dogs during the trip from Alabama. We make every effort to arrive with healthy and minimally stressed dogs.

name: Scooby
description: Scooby is energetic and loves to run and play with other dogs. He also really loves to play in the water so he hopes his new owners will get him a plastic baby pool to play in when outdoors. Scooby is quite heavy but he thinks he should still be able to lay on your lap when you are sitting. He is very sweet. Scooby would much rather spend his time outside than cooped up in the house. He loves to chase the squirrels and pretend he is a hunting dog when outside. Scooby will run right into an outdoor kennel if you have one as he thinks it is his personal outdoor safe place. He really enjoys standing on top of his dog house and pretending he is a junk yard dog. Scooby is heart worm negative, fully vaccinated, neutered, on monthly heart-worm and flea prevention, and ready for his new family.

name: Scarlett
description:
Meet Scarlett! This pretty girl is ready to find her forever home. This playful lady is a pit mix estimated to be 2 years old and is spayed. She gets along with most dogs but doesnât like cats. We are open Tuesday-Saturday 11AM-3PM.
One of the shelter visitors said this...
\"I fell in love with this dog the first time I saw her! I could tell her to sit and she would sit and get her treat. Looked like she would smile at you. If somebody wants a playful, loving dog, she will not disappoint! I wish I could take her but we already have enough rescues! If you can give her a family to love, please adopt this sweet baby!\

name: Leeya
description:
Leeya is a 5 month old mix of Aussie, Border Collie and Lab, and, although she weighs only 28 pounds at the moment, she'll mature to about 50. Leeya is a unique girl. Just look at her medium coat and lovely eyes, and you'll fall in love with her instantly! The most interesting thing about her looks is in the difference between her head which is tricolor and her body which is almost completely white. So different and gorgeous! Leeya loves to play and is wonderful with people as well as other dogs. (posted 8/10/19, ME)
**It is rare that we know with certainty the ages or mixes that make up our wonderful dogs, but we do our best to be as accurate as possible based upon our many years in rescue.
** Adoption: $325 which covers quarantine, shots, worming, food, medical records, spaying/neutering,microchip and an Alabama State Health Certificate. Transport, if needed : $120.00 We consider the transport to be of great importance and, as such, take particular care of the dogs during the trip from Alabama. We make every effort to arrive with healthy and minimally stressed dogs.

name: Garth: loves cuddles! (AL)
description:
Garth is being fostered in Alabama. BDRA will assist with transport.

What we know about Garth:
*housebroken
*blind and hard of hearing
*loves to cuddle
*good with cats

What Garth's foster mom has to say about Garth:
Garth is a sweet little man who doesnât hesitate to let you know when he wants attention, is hungry or needs to go out! He will bark to let you know he wants something. Garth sometimes sleeps through the night, but not always. If he needs to go out he will sit up and move around to let you know. Garth prefers to sleep with you at night instead of in his dog bed. He loves to hang out with you when youâre home.

Garth likes to walk, which is good because he needs to lose another pound. He was a chunky monkey when he came into rescue. Garth would do best as a single dog, but he and my cat sleep next to each other every night.

Garth is also mostly deaf, but not completely. 
Blind Dog Rescue alliance has voted against the use of electric fencing effective immediately.

name: Sparkles Low Fee
description:
This is Sparkles, an 8 year old Jack Russell Terrier mix. Uncomfortable on a leash, she tends to become timid when it's on, but her foster swears that she saw Sparkles smile when her pictures were taken. Sparkles weighs only 15 pounds, so we will adopt her only to families without small children who don't always know their own strength. Sweet, sweet girlshe deserves a nice family who will treat her with the greatest love. (posted 8/10/19, ME)
**It is rare that we know with certainty the ages or mixes that make up our wonderful dogs, but we do our best to be as accurate as possible based upon our many years in rescue.**
Adoption is a lower fee due to her age. It's $225 which covers quarantine, shots, worming, food, medical records, spaying/neutering, microchip and an Alabama State Health Certificate, and Transport.
Weight Scale: Small = less than 25 Medium = 26-60 Large = 61-100 XL = 100+

name: Spencer
description:
Spencer is a mix of Lab, Shepherd, and Hound. He's 5-6 months old and weighs about 24 pounds. He'll mature to about 50 pounds. This is a boy with lots going for him. He's extremely handsome with his short tan coat with brown points and his super cute lovely years and inquisitive eyes. We can't say enough about this wonderful little guy! He's precious! (posted 8/10/19, ME)
**It is rare that we know with certainty the ages or mixes that make up our wonderful dogs, but we do our best to be as accurate as possible based upon our many years in rescue.
** Adoption: $325 which covers quarantine, shots, worming, food, medical records, spaying/neutering,microchip and an Alabama State Health Certificate. Transport, if needed : $120.00 We consider the transport to be of great importance and, as such, take particular care of the dogs during the trip from Alabama. We make every effort to arrive with healthy and minimally stressed dogs.

name: Maggie
description: Meet Maggie! Maggie is a sweet girl looking for her forever family. This lovely lady is estimated to be around 2.5 years old, a pit mix, and she is spayed. She also gets along with most dogs. Will you be the one to give her the loving family she craves? We are open Tuesday-Saturday 11AM-3PM.

name: Rosie
description: Rosie is estimated to be 4 yrs old and weighs 41.2 lbs. She is good with male and female dogs with a proper introduction. Our dog adoption fee is $85 and covers one set of vaccines including rabies, vet exam, spay, fecal, and general dewormer.

name: Snow
description:
Snow is our male Pit Bull mix, age 1 year old. He is cautious because he is deaf, and a fenced yard would be advisable for this dog.    Very sociable and loving.  In fact, he is quite calm and gentle.  

Snow's videos:
https://www.facebook.com/1902156960029671/videos/856731278042987/

https://www.facebook.com/1902156960029671/videos/697008654044917/

Randolph County Animal Shelter, Wedowee, AL 36278  (256) 357-0101, www.RandolphShelter.org

name: Sky
description:
Sky is our female Lab/Husky mix, age 3 years old. She is a cautious dog, and gentle. She will need a home where she can not get loose during storms, as they frighten her. 

Her video: https://www.facebook.com/1902156960029671/videos/339910533628250/

Randolph County Animal Shelter, Wedowee, AL 36278 (256) 357-0101, www.RandolphShelter.org

name: Poppy
description:
Poppy is our female Pit Bull mix, age 2 years old, a brindle colored beauty! She was a bouncy girl who enjoyed the toys. She was a little cautious, and a lot curious, as she just met us. But she found out she had fun with our treats and petting her and we had a ball!! 

Her video link: 
https://www.facebook.com/1902156960029671/videos/911852772482269/

Randolph County Animal Shelter, Wedowee, AL 36278 (256) 357-0101, www.RandolphShelter.org

name: Fannie
description:
Fannie is our female Blue Heeler mix, age 2 years old. She is a little chubby, but oh so sweet and laid back. She just wants to be loved on and lay in the sun. 

Fannie loves the treats and her whole butt shakes when she sees you coming with the treat bag! Sheâs a sweetheart and takes treats so gently!

Her video: https://www.facebook.com/1902156960029671/videos/542926372912698/

Randolph County Animal Shelter, Wedowee, AL 36278 (256) 357-0101, www.RandolphShelter.org

name: Bruno
description:
Bruno is our male St. Bernard/Hound mix, age 2 years.  He is very lively and sociable, and he loves to run.  Curious ! And he gently takes treats. He would love to go car riding with you!

His 2 videos:
https://www.facebook.com/1902156960029671/videos/484795225425029/

https://www.facebook.com/1902156960029671/videos/2193930304165196/

Randolph County Animal Shelter, Wedowee, AL 36278 (256) 357-0101, www.RandolphShelter.org

name: Sadie Page
description: Sadie is a 1-2 year old black lab mix who has stolen our hearts. She is a large love bug who loves to be with people and loves to be outside. However, she is an escape artist and needs to be supervised when in a back yard. She loves to play with other dogs and would be a great addition to any family! Call (205)902-9247 or email jill@wagshomewood.com for more information about adopting sweet Sadie Page!

name: Lourdes
description:
Lourdes absolutely LOVES other dogs.  Despite being a senior girl, she likes to play and play!  Lourdes enjoys exploring outdoors. She also loves snuggling in blankets and towels, and will steal them from the laundry pile. With those wrinkles in her forehead, well, she is just so stinkin cute!  Lourdes foster mom is teaching house training skills. Est. birthdate is July 2007, vaccinated, spayed, microchipped, and ready to be your heartbeat. Adoption fee $100.00 
Please submit an adoption application,   https://twobytworescue.com/adopting/

name: Rojo
description: During my time spent with a volunteer I was found to be: Did I come to the front of the kennel to greet you? Yes 	Was I easy to get out of the kennel? Yes 	Was I outgoing? Yes						Was I afraid to go thru doorways? No 	 Did I bark at you? No 						 Did I pull a lot on the leash?	Somewhat				Was I super interested in other dogs?	Yes		Was I nervous about other people?	Somewhat			Was I nervous about kids? 	N/A				Did I have a lot of energy outside?	Yes			Did I play with toys outside?	No				Was I cuddly?	Somewhat						 Did I go to the bathroom while I was outside?	Yes	Did I have pee/poop in my kennel before I went out?	NoNOTES: Rojo is a little skittish but treats seem to negate that issue. Good energy outside. Seems to be a good dog!

name: Lana
description: Hello, my name is Lana!  I am a one-year-old retriever mix that is looking to find a new place to hang my leash!  I had a home that I loved, but for some unknown reason they brought me here to find a new home.  I have all of my vaccinations, I am heartworm negative, I have a microchip, and I have been spayed.  I am very shy and it may take some time for me to warm up to you.  I am so sweet and cute, I know if you give me the time I will grow to be a loyal and loving companion for you and your family. Will you invest the time it takes for me to relax in my new situation and learn to love and trust you?

name: Ingrid
description: Ingrid here!  Now tell the truthâ¦.donât you think I am one beautiful girl?  Most people do!  I was brought to the shelter by a kind stranger who saw me lost and confused.  She knew I would be safe while I waited for my family to claim me if she took me to the shelter.  Well no one ever came and now I am up for adoption. I am a one-year-old terrier mix and I have all of my vaccinations, I am heartworm negative, I have a microchip, and I have been spayed.  I am a small to medium size girl that is oh so sweet!  I think I could actually be a lap dog! Will you let me try curling up in your lap?

name: 191213 Buster
description:
191213 Buster is a fourteen month old Terrier mix boy, about 22 lbs. Buster is a lot of dog in a smaller package. He is quite active and playful and very assertive with other dogs. He will be best with a larger dog he cannot bully. Just a lot of Terrier attitude but loves people!
This precious dog is one of 74 we took in from a single voluntary surrender situation. These dogs have lived their lives outside in large pens so are NOT housetrained, not crate-trained, not leash trained. Many are super friendly, and we think will be fine with children but to our knowledge they have never been around children. It will be best for any children to meet them at our Shelter to make sure. Some of these dogs are shyer and may be more suited to adult only homes.
These dogs were all fed well enough but were covered with fleas & lived on dirt, so many do have hair loss as a result. A few have some Demodectic Mange which is NOT a contagious condition; we expect those with Demodex to clear up quickly now that they are spayed and neutered, fully vaccinated, flea free and clean. Going to a home full of love will also help immensely as they leave the stress behind of their previous living conditions and also the Shelter.
All those up for adoption have tested negative for heartworms but it is absolutely vital they be kept on monthly heartworm prevention from your Veterinarian to ensure they stay negative. If you are not familiar with heartworm prevention, please first talk to your Veterinarian so you are aware of the cost (minor considering that it saves lives) and are ready to ensure prevention throughout their lifetime. If you have other dogs and they are not on prevention you will first need to get with your Veterinarian to have your dog(s) tested and purchase prevention for it/them. Heartworm prevention is a BIG DEAL to us and while we are happy to educate, please also talk to your Veterinarian about its importance.
We look forward to all of these dogs being adopted into loving and responsible homes where they will get lots of attention, love and care, and never again have to be miserable from fleas and all of the inclement weather they have endured living outside.
Our adoption fees are $100 for dogs. This adoption fee completely covers the mandatory spay or neuter, basic immunizations, de-worming, microchip, heartworm check, rabies vaccination if old enough, free health exam with your participating veterinarian.
To meet all the great pets at our shelter come to 255 Central Plank Road, Wetumpka, AL, 36092, go to our website at www.elmorehumane.org for more information, email us at hselco@bellsouth.net for an Adoption Application or give us a call at 334-567-3377.
We are open for adoptions Mon-Fri 10-5 & Sat 9-4.

name: Steely Dan
description: Steely Dan is a brown and white lab and pit bull mix male dog.  He is about 4 years old, weighs 51 pounds and is heart worm positive.  Talk to your veterinarian or the staff at the Center for information about heart worm treatment.  Steely Dan is a well mannered and easy going fellow.  He is good on a leash and sits on command.  He has 3 strikes against him...he is part pit bull, he is 4 years old and he is heart worm positive.  But I hope there is somebody out there with a heart of gold that will look into his gorgeous eyes and look past all this and will love him.  Are you that person?  This boy deserves his chance at happiness so come meet him today.

name: 191213 Rambo
description:
191213 Rambo is a five year old perhaps Boxer/Lab mix boy. He is a super nice fellow and very handsome indeed. This sweet guy was one of the pups included in our recent very large intake. He's a love, good with other dogs of both sexes and even seems fine with cats, mellow in nature.

This precious dog is one of over 60 we took in from a single voluntary surrender situation. These dogs have lived their lives outside in large pens so are NOT housetrained, not crate-trained, not leash trained. Many are super friendly, and we think will be fine with children but to our knowledge they have never been around children. It will be best for any children to meet them at our Shelter to make sure. Some of these dogs are shyer and may be more suited to adult only homes.
These dogs were all fed well enough but were covered with fleas & lived on dirt, so many do have hair loss as a result. A few have some Demodectic Mange which is NOT a contagious condition; we expect those with Demodex to clear up quickly now that they are spayed and neutered, fully vaccinated, flea free and clean. Going to a home full of love will also help immensely as they leave the stress behind of their previous living conditions and also the Shelter.
All those up for adoption have tested negative for heartworms but it is absolutely vital they be kept on monthly heartworm prevention from your Veterinarian to ensure they stay negative. If you are not familiar with heartworm prevention, please first talk to your Veterinarian so you are aware of the cost (minor considering that it saves lives) and are ready to ensure prevention throughout their lifetime. If you have other dogs and they are not on prevention you will first need to get with your Veterinarian to have your dog(s) tested and purchase prevention for it/them. Heartworm prevention is a BIG DEAL to us and while we are happy to educate, please also talk to your Veterinarian about its importance.
We look forward to all of these dogs being adopted into loving and responsible homes where they will get lots of attention, love and care, and never again have to be miserable from fleas and all of the inclement weather they have endured living outside.
Our adoption fees are $100 for dogs. This adoption fee completely covers the mandatory spay or neuter, basic immunizations, de-worming, microchip, heartworm check, rabies vaccination if old enough, free health exam with your participating veterinarian.
To meet all the great pets at our shelter come to 255 Central Plank Road, Wetumpka, AL, 36092, go to our website at www.elmorehumane.org for more information, email us at hselco@bellsouth.net for an Adoption Application or give us a call at 334-567-3377.
We are open for adoptions Mon-Fri 10-5 & Sat 9-4.

name: 191280 Bennie
description:
191280 Bennie is a six month old male Beagle/Red Tick Hound mix. This little guy was found as a stray and would surely like his very own family. He is brown with pretty ticking and the cutest little bob tail you ever did see. Let's help this little guy find his forever family.

ADOPTION FEES Dogs & Puppies.....$100.00. This Adoption fee includes: mandatory spay/neuter which will be done before you can take your dog or puppy home with you; basic canine immunizations (DHPP-CPV & Bordatella Intranasal); de-wormings; one-year rabies vaccination if old enough; heartworm test if over five months old; microchip from 24-Pet Watch; certificate for free health examination at your participating veterinarian; and a goodie bag chocked full of information, toys, and more.
Yes, there are sometimes exceptions to our normal fee for older dogs or special cases or adoptions of two dogs together. Some of our pets have also been lovingly sponsored by caring people and we will let the approved adopter know about that at the point of adoption. Visit our Website at: http://www.elmorehumane.orgThe staff would also like to remind you that for faster response to inquiries about adoptable animals to have the animals ID#, name & description.This way your questions will be answered in a timely manner.
You can also expedite the adoption process by filling our Adoption Application which you can find at: http://www.elmorehumane.org/HSEC_FORMS/AdoptionApplication.pdf and sending to us either by scanning and emailing to hselco@bellsouth.net or faxing to 334-567-8774.
All pet adoption websites & our shelter management software require that we choose a primary and/or secondary breed for our dogs. While our staff is quite breed knowledgeable, in many cases we are truly making our best guesses as to their breed(s) based on many factors but cannot promise that what we have said is accurate. So taking into account your own parameters for things such as size, coat care, activity level, etc please come and get to know our dog(s) as individuals to see if their personalities and yours are a forever match.
Thank you!Phone: (334) 567-3377 Fax: (334) 567-8774 E-mail: hselco@bellsouth.net

name: 19170 Felicia
description:
191170 Felicia is a one year old Mastiff mix girl. Although she was found as a stray, this pretty girl knows how to 'sit'. She needs a little practice on a leash but she is very sweet. Felicia was good in the cat room and is very loving and likes the treats!

name: Maise was Eevee
description: Observed by volunteer John C Sanford on 9/10/19Did I come to the front of the kennel to greet you? YesWas I easy to get out of the kennel? YesWas I outgoing? YesWas I afraid to go through doorways? NoDid I bark at you? NoDid I pull a lot on the leash? NoWas I super interested in other dogs? YesWas I nervous about other people? NoWas I nervous about kids? N/ADid I have a lot of energy outside? YesDid I play with toys outside? NoWas I cuddly? YesDid I go to the bathroom while I was outside? YesDid I have pee/poop in my kennel? NoAdditional Comments: Maise has puppy energy but didn't pull on the leash very much. She liked to be petted and jumped up a few times with excitement. Handsome dog that should do well in an active family setting.

name: Harper
description:
Loving and affectionate.    She was found under a house with puppies.   Our group has found homes for her puppies and now itâs her turn.   She was heartworm positive and has recently completed her treatments and is now Negative.   Her veterinarian has given her the all clear to be adopted and go to her forever home.   She is a very young girl and has recovered completely from her treatment  and she shows no sign of ever being Positive.   
    She has completed all vetting, up to date on shots, on monthly heartworm preventative, spayed and housetrained.  Please consider making Harper a member of your family.  
          Contact us via email at caawarescue@yahoo.com or visit our website at caawarescue.com and fill out one of our adoption applications.   This is not an obligation to adopt but is our way of making the best match between family and dog.

name: Ginger
description:
Ginger is a little bit on the shy side, but very friendly and loving.  She is in need of a new forever home with people that will love her and take care of her. She appears to be some sort of Chi mix or something along those lines.  She is full sized now and weighs 8 lbs.  She has short fur.  She is a very happy and friendly girl and will make a great pet.

Ginger is residing at Blair Animal Rescue in Cleveland, AL.  

Please call or text Ann Blair at 256-425-6069 (cell) or call 256-425-6069 (landline) if you are interested.  Please be patient as our mailboxes are sometimes full.

name: Ramsey
description:
INTAKE DATE - 8/5/2018
ADOPTION STATUS -  Not Accepting applications at www.weimrescue.com
AGE - 10-12 months old
SEX - Neutered male
SIZE - Smaller than breed standard 41 lbs.
MEDICAL STATUS - Healthy 
HOUSETRAINED - Unknown
CRATE TRAINED - Unknown
GOOD WITH OTHER DOGS - Unknown 
GOOD WITH CATS - Unknown
GOOD WITH CHILDREN - Unknown

Ramsey is a precious pocket weim weighing 41 lbs. He's about 10-12 months old and heartworm negative. Unfortunately, Ramsey is terrified of EVERYTHING. At this time, Ramsey is extremely nervous and fearful; we don't know what happened to him in his previous life, but it's obvious that Ramsey has been through some tremendous trauma. Hopefully he will begin to settle in and we can work on building his trust and confidence.

name: Alexia - Daisy
description: Meet Daisy. She is almost 2 yrs old. She is utd on shots, rabies, hw neg, on monthly prevention for hw/flea/ tick and microchipped. Daisy is sweet and loves attention but she is also very independent. She loves other dogs and running and playing with them. She has the sweetest disposition. She is crate trained and house trained. She loves everyone she meets after having a few minutes of being shy. She would love to have a doggy brother or sister to play with. She is still a puppy and loves to chew things up. She especially loves shoes.!!! If your interested in Daisy, please apply here: www.nhrescue.com.

name: LUX
description:
Lux is a 7 month old hound/terrier mix with a brindle coat. Heâs potty trained, knows how to sit and stay. Heâs been fostered in a home with two cats under a year old and a pup whoâs a year old so we know he gets along great with dogs and cats! He loves, loves, LOVES cuddles and naps but also loves the doggy park and loves to play fetch.

Heâs been neutered and is updated on all his vaccinations. If you are interested in Lux, please go to our website and fill out an application: www.animaladoption.org.  Please email the application to aaas2808@gmail.com.

name: Malcomb (See Memo)
description: This is such a pretty boy. He is active and playful and ready to go on adventures with you. Come meet Malcomb today!Observations of personality and habits of MALCOMB by volunteer Sandy Sims who walked and played with him on July 18, 2019:Did I come to the front of the kennel to greet you? YESWas I easy to get out of the kennel? YESWas I outgoing? YESWas I afraid to go through doorways? NODid I bark at you? NODid I pull a lot on the leash? NOWas I super interested in other dogs? YES, in a friendly wayWas I nervous about other people? NOWas I nervous about kids? Didn't get to observeDid I have a lot of energy outside? YES, he was very playfulDid I play with toys outside? YES, this guy is ready to play and have funWas I cuddly? YES, super sweet Did I go to the bathroom while I was outside? YESDid I have pee/poop in my kennel before I went out? NO

name: Hudson
description:
INTAKE DATE - 7/29/2019
ADOPTION STATUS - Medical hold.  Not Accepting applications 
AGE - 5-6 years old
SEX - Neutered male
SIZE - Smaller than breed standard @ 49 lbs.
MEDICAL STATUS - Heartworm positive/Undergoing treatment for heartworms
HOUSETRAINED - Unknown
CRATE TRAINED - Unknown
GOOD WITH OTHER DOGS - Unknown 
GOOD WITH CATS - Unknown
GOOD WITH CHILDREN - Unknown

Hudson is a very sweet, laid back itty bitty boy. He did let us know that he likes to play fetch! But, unfortunately, this sweet boy is heartworm positive and will have to undergo months of treatment before he is healthy and ready for his forever family.

name: Adeline
description: Meet Adeline, She was pulled from a high kill shelter on 7/26/2019. Poor baby was scared to death. Right after we pulled her, we vetted her. So she is not UTD on all shots, Rabies, Bordetella, HW NEG-. She is on monthly hw prevention, flea/tick prevention and she is scheduled to be spayed on 8/15/2019. She looked to have been a breeding machine in her past life. She looked rough. But she is the sweetest thing. Adeline has such soulful eyes. She is a quiet girl, that is happy being right by your side on the porch or watching tv. She is good with dogs and cats. She loves people. She is all around a great dog!!! If your interested in Adeline, please apply here: www.nhrescue.com

name: ROSCO
description: Rosco is a wonderful lab/pit mix . He weighs about 65 lbs/maybe 2-4 yrs old. Rescuer had him neutered, inoculated, microchipped, & tested for heart worms (neg). He is a sweet dog & just needs a loving family with a yard!

name: Fern
description: Well hello to you!  I am Fern!  Can I just tell you how happy I am to be safe and sound at the shelter?  Well I sure am!  I was picked up by Animal Control on a very busy road in town. I let out a sigh of relief when I hopped up in the back of that truck!  At the shelter I have a big clean dog run, a big bowl of food, and a big comfy bed.  I guess it is time to look for a new home.  I am a two-year-old terrier mix.  I have all of my vaccinations, I am heartworm negative, I have a microchip, and I have been spayed.  Would you like to have this pretty âbutterscotch and whiteâ girl living in your home?

name: Kima
description: Kima here!  I am a three-month-old terrier mix that rode in with Animal Control!  Yea, I didnât mind that ride in the truck at all!  It was lots of fun!  I have enjoyed my time here, but I think I need to find a new home so someone from back kennel can have my cage! I have all of my vaccinations for my age, I have a microchip, and I have been neutered.  I am a young puppy and I have lots to learn about being a good family member. Will you have time to teach me good doggie manners and take me for walks and play with me in the yard? I know thatâs asking a lot, but I know I will be worth it!

name: Avery
description: Hello, my name is Avery.  I am an adorable black and white retriever mix that was recently lost.  Yep, I was picked up by Animal Control!  I was happy to be in the shelter where I was safe with a full belly.  Now if I can just find a home, things will be all right!  I am about three months old and I have all of my vaccinations for my age, I have a microchip, and I have been spayed. If you want to adopt me, please remember I am still a young puppy and I will need lots of your time, patience, and love! Do you have time for me?

name: Harmony
description: Harmony is a black lab mix female young dog.  She is about 5 months old and weighs 25 pounds.  Her adoption fee will include vaccinations, worming, microchipping and spaying.  Harmony is a sweet natured dog that is looking for her chance at happiness with a loving family.  Bring the family to the Center and see if Harmony might be a perfect fit for you.

name: Darla
description: Darla does well with other dogs; however, she does show some resource guarding with toys and food.  She also becomes possessive of her person and children.

name: Fred
description:
All of our dogs are housed in private homes, we do not have a store or a shelter. We do not show dogs to interested parties until they have an approved adoption application. If you are interested in adopting one of our dogs, please fill out an adoption application on our website www.helpingshepherdsofeverycolor.com You may also find us on facebook: Helping Shepherds of Every Color Rescue.

Fred is a little shy at first but he warms up to you pretty quick. He is a little rough around the edges needs a patient adopter who will work with him and not expect perfection on day 1. He is good with other dogs but he may stand up for himself if another dog tries to start an argument through the fence. Fred might also help you redecorate by rearranging your stuff. He doesn't chew it, just moves it somewhere else.

name: George
description:
All of our dogs are housed in private homes, we do not have a store or a shelter. We do not show dogs to interested parties until they have an approved adoption application. If you are interested in adopting one of our dogs, please fill out an adoption application on our website www.helpingshepherdsofeverycolor.com You may also find us on facebook: Helping Shepherds of Every Color Rescue.

George is a sweet boy. He is currently undergoing Heartworm treatment, and he needs some help shedding some pounds. George is a tripod which means he really needs to watch his weight to reduce stress on his joints.

name: Ghost
description:
All of our dogs are housed in private homes, we do not have a store or a shelter. We do not show dogs to interested parties until they have an approved adoption application. If you are interested in adopting one of our dogs, please fill out an adoption application on our website www.helpingshepherdsofeverycolor.com You may also find us on facebook: Helping Shepherds of Every Color Rescue.

My name is Ghost. I'm about 5 years old (old enough to know better, but still very youthful and playful). I weigh about 65 pounds.

I'm a beautiful white German shepherd dog. I play well with others. I'm gentle with small dogs, even annoying puppies. I like big dogs too. I'm a lover, not a fighter. I also have a cat friend.

I'm a really great dog. Some of the things you need to know about me: I'm crate trained, house trained, easy on the leash, and well behaved in public. I
get a little nervous and I'm busy but I settle down and can relax in a short time.
The only trick I know is sit. My foster mom makes me sit before she gives me my bowl of food (she's a meanie).
My favorite thing in the whole world is food. I like toys too, but food is the best!
I'm a little nervous on car rides and going to the vet. I whine in the car, but I don't growl or bite.
If I had a human job it would probably be activities director at a resort. When a new dog comes into rescue I will teach them about all the fun stuff in the yard: kiddie pool, where the toys are, and how to hide in the privet bushes.
I'm in perfect health except for EPI. I don't consider this a problem because its under control with a food additive. EPI stands for Exocrine Pancreatic Insufficiency. EPI is a condition where my pancreas does not produce enough enzymes to digest food. I could starve to death if it wasn't for a food additive. I do just fine with two tablets added to my meal (porcine pancreas tablets). I must have this additive for the rest of my life. It only costs $35 per month. I'm worth it.
I will be your best friend.

description: All of our dogs are housed in private homes, we do not have a store or a shelter. We do not show dogs to interested parties until they have an approved adoption application. If you are interested in adopting one of our dogs, please fill out an adoption application on our website www.helpingshepherdsofeverycolor.com You may also find us on facebook: Helping Shepherds of Every Color Rescue.

name: 191213 Tula
description:
Tula is a 5 1/2 year old female Terrier mix, 12 lbs. She is beyond sweet and loving and sadly also has heartworms. She started her 30-day treatment on 21 August so she will be ready to go to a new home late September.
Please also read below how we got Tula:

This precious dog is one of 74 we took in from a single voluntary surrender situation. Tula is one of the sweetest and happiest dogs. She loves life and smiles all day long. Tula loves to give kisses and doesn't meet a stranger. She is crate trained and loves to go outside and play. Tula finishes her Heartworm Treatment on September 18 and will be available for adoption after that.

All those up for adoption have tested negative for heartworms but it is absolutely vital they be kept on monthly heartworm prevention from your Veterinarian to ensure they stay negative. If you are not familiar with heartworm prevention, please first talk to your Veterinarian so you are aware of the cost (minor considering that it saves lives) and are ready to ensure prevention throughout their lifetime. If you have other dogs and they are not on prevention you will first need to get with your Veterinarian to have your dog(s) tested and purchase prevention for it/them. Heartworm prevention is a BIG DEAL to us and while we are happy to educate, please also talk to your Veterinarian about its importance.

We look forward to all of these dogs being adopted into loving and responsible homes where they will get lots of attention, love and care, and never again have to be miserable from fleas and all of the inclement weather they have endured living outside.

Our adoption fees are $100 for dogs. This adoption fee completely covers the mandatory spay or neuter, basic immunizations, de-worming, microchip, heartworm check, rabies vaccination if old enough, free health exam with your participating veterinarian.

To meet all the great pets at our shelter come to 255 Central Plank Road, Wetumpka, AL, 36092, go to our website at www.elmorehumane.org for more information, email us at hselco@bellsouth.net for an Adoption Application or give us a call at 334-567-3377.

We are open for adoptions Mon-Fri 10-5 & Sat 9-4.

name: Chuck
description:
Chuck is such a good boy! He is a 5 month old mix of Hound and Rhodesian Ridgeback with a coat of tan and white. If you look at the top of his head, you'll see his spiked hairdo which definitely shows how trendy he is! Chuck presently weighs about 25 pounds and will mature to around 55. He's an engaging boy who loves being with other dogs and people. He's great company and will listen to all your stories of the day. He's such a sweet dog, you'll love to have him in your home! (posted 7/28/19, ME)
**It is rare that we know with certainty the ages or mixes that make up our wonderful dogs, but we do our best to be as accurate as possible based upon our many years in rescue.**
Adoption: $325 which covers quarantine, shots, worming, food, medical records, spaying/neutering, microchip and an Alabama State Health Certificate.
Transport, if needed : $120.00 We consider the transport to be of great importance and, as such, take particular care of the dogs during the trip from Alabama. We make every effort to arrive with healthy and minimally stressed dogs.

description:
Angel is an 11 month old mixed breed. She weighs about 45 pounds. Angel is great with dogâs and loves kids. Cats are unknown. She would love a home with a fenced yard to run and explore. 

Angel is spayed, up to date on vaccines, microchipped, and taking preventatives. 

$250 adoption fee

description:
Birdie's foster says, 'If you want an active girl, then Birdie's for you!' A six month old Lab mix, Birdie is delightful to have around. Presently only weighing 35 pounds, she'll mature into a large dog of about 70 pounds! Her short, black coat, accented with pure white is sleek and invites stroking. Birdie loves toys and loves, loves to run. Fine with people and dogs, she has a good temperament and a loving way about her. (posted 7/27/19, ME)

description:
Meet Alawna with the soulful eyes! She's a 6 month old Lab mix, and, weighing in at 33 pounds, she'll mature to about 60. What a delight this girl is! Dressed in a sleek and short black coat, she is a pretty girl with a fine temperament. Perhaps a bit shy until she gets to know you, she's good with people and dogs. Such a good girl! (posted 7/27/19, ME)

name: Steve 31155
description: Steve is an 8-month-old male Border Collie mix who has already been neutered. He is mostly black and has gorgeous white markings. Steve currently weighs 32 pounds and we believe he will be a medium sized adult dog (30-60 pounds). He came to PAHS as a stray and his owner never came looking for him. Since he is a Border Collie mix he is active and playful; so we know he would appreciate a nice fenced yard where he could safely play. Steve is good with other dogs and would be just fine in a home with children. Please come out and meet Steve--he is just a great all around dog! ****Please note that when introducing a new dog into a home with children and other pets adult supervision is strongly recommended until the new dog settles in with the family.****Dogs may be adopted for $120. Cat adoption fees are $50. Our adoption fees cover a microchip, microchip registration, discounted spay/neuter certificate, deworming, vaccinations (as age and law requires), and a courtesy vet exam at participating offices. Unless otherwise indicated under 'special needs' our dogs have screened heart worm negative.

name: 190811 Ladybug
description:
Ladybug is a one year old mix, 14 lbs. She wants to be the only dog in a household and is very loving and very high energy so if you want a smaller dog to bark and kind of bounce off the walls, then Ladybug could be a good fit. Older children will be best since she is so busy. Will work to get newer pics soonest.

ADOPTION FEES Dogs & Puppies.....$100.00. This Adoption fee includes: mandatory spay/neuter which will be done before you can take your dog or puppy home with you; basic canine immunizations (DHPP-CPV & Bordatella Intranasal); de-wormings; one-year rabies vaccination if old enough; heartworm test if over five months old; microchip from 24-Pet Watch; certificate for free health examination at your participating veterinarian; and a goodie bag chocked full of information, toys, and more.
Yes, there are sometimes exceptions to our normal fee for older dogs or special cases or adoptions of two dogs together. Some of our pets have also been lovingly sponsored by caring people and we will let the approved adopter know about that at the point of adoption. Visit our Website at: http://www.elmorehumane.orgThe staff would also like to remind you that for faster response to inquiries about adoptable animals to have the animals ID#, name & description.This way your questions will be answered in a timely manner.
You can also expedite the adoption process by filling our Adoption Application which you can find at: http://www.elmorehumane.org/HSEC_FORMS/AdoptionApplication.pdf and sending to us either by scanning and emailing to hselco@bellsouth.net or faxing to 334-567-8774.
All pet adoption websites & our shelter management software require that we choose a primary and/or secondary breed for our dogs. While our staff is quite breed knowledgeable, in many cases we are truly making our best guesses as to their breed(s) based on many factors but cannot promise that what we have said is accurate. So taking into account your own parameters for things such as size, coat care, activity level, etc please come and get to know our dog(s) as individuals to see if their personalities and yours are a forever match.
Thank you!Phone: (334) 567-3377 Fax: (334) 567-8774 E-mail: hselco@bellsouth.net

name: Yogi
description: OH, hi. My name is Yogi and I am a retriever mix.  My family ran into some financial difficulties and lost our home.  They had to make some hard decisions and it was decided that I should go to the shelter to find a new home. I will miss my family but I know they did the best they could.  Anyway while I have been here I have gotten all of my vaccinations, I was tested for heartworms, I got a microchip, and I was altered. I am a nice boy that is very quiet and calm. I am only worried about one thing. I am about eight years old. Will anyone want to adopt me at my age?  Oh gosh, I sure hope so! I still have lots of love to give out to my new family.

name: Tim
description: Welp!  Howdy!  My name is Tim!  I am a four-month-old retriever mix that is very lucky to be at the shelter.  I was out on my own for a short time and when Animal Control came to pick me up I was very relieved!  We waited my allotted time and now I can officially go up for adoption.  I have all of my vaccinations for my age, I have a microchip, and I have been neutered.  If you want to adopt me, please remember I am still a young pup and I will need training in good doggie manners, lots of exercise, and a ton of love from my new family.

name: Hadley
description: Whoa Baby!  I am so grateful to Animal Control!  They saved my life!  I was zooming around the Troy Highway not too long ago, dodging cars and looking for food!  Well when Animal Control pulled up beside me, I was glad to hop in their truck and ride back in safety to the shelter.  We waited for my family to claim me, but no one ever came and now I am officially up for adoption.  I am a terrier/Jack Russell mix that is about a year old. I have all of my vaccinations, I am heartworm negative, I have a microchip, and I have been spayed.  I am a sweet funny girl that canât wait to have a home and family again!

name: Lexi
description: Lexi is a white and black terrier mix female dog.  She is about 1 year old , weighs 20 pounds and is heart worm negative.  Her adoption fee will include vaccinations, worming, microchipping and spaying.  Lexi is a sweet girl but life has been hard for her.  Lexi needs her guardian angel to look past the physical and look inside at her heart and soul. Lexi has a skin condition that is being treated but will take some time to heal.  If you have it in your heart to help a dog in desperate need, then come meet Lexi and give her the chance she deserves.

name: Sassy
description: Sassy is a sweet and precious tri-colored pit bull and shepherd mix female dog.  She is about 1 year old, weighs 40 pounds and is heart worm negative.  Her adoption fee will include vaccinations, worming, microchipping and spaying.  Sassy is easy going and great on a leash.  This friendly girl needs a family to come meet her and fall in love with her.....so hurry to the Center and ask to see Sassy.

name: Farro
description:
Hi thanks for stopping by to meet me. I had my children young and now I'm an empty nester. I am looking for a human to live with forever, and I don't mind children, cats, or other dogs. I would like to have a fenced-in yard because I don't like leashes. I'm sure with time and patience I will learn not to be afraid of them.   As far as sleeping arrangements, I prefer to sleep on my own bed or a human bed instead of in a crate.  I want a person or family that understands I just need a little time to warm up and adjust, but once I do, I promise to be your grateful and loyal partner. I am kind, gentle and loving, house trained, about 38 pounds., est. birthdate April 2017.  Adoption fee $200.00.
 If you choose me, Farro, to be your partner I will be grateful and loyal forever!
Please submit an adoption application, https://twobytworescue.com/adopting/

name: Gabby
description:
Gabby is less than a year old and weighs 29 pounds. House and crate trained. She has been using a doggie door to go out to potty.  

She loves playing with toys and the other pups in the home. She is perfect for children.  She is such a gentle girl that is learning to love life and everything it has to offer.  

Gabby will need a fenced yard and a 4 legged sibling to play with.  If interested in adopting Gabby please go to our website and complete an application tell them that Gabby sent you....

name: 191213 Jester
description:
Jester is a one-year old male Terrier mix, 11 lbs. He had a lot of hair loss when he came to us but is recovering well. These photos are mid-recovery. He is shy at first but loves attention and would thrive with a family who will help him learn what life inside a home full of attention is all about. Please see below how we got Jester:
This precious dog is one of 74 we took in from a single voluntary surrender situation. These dogs have lived their lives outside in large pens so are NOT housetrained, not crate-trained, not leash trained. Many are super friendly, and we think will be fine with children but to our knowledge they have never been around children. It will be best for any children to meet them at our Shelter to make sure. Some of these dogs are shyer and may be more suited to adult only homes.
These dogs were all fed well enough but were covered with fleas & lived on dirt, so many do have hair loss as a result. A few have some Demodectic Mange which is NOT a contagious condition; we expect those with Demodex to clear up quickly now that they are spayed and neutered, fully vaccinated, flea free and clean. Going to a home full of love will also help immensely as they leave the stress behind of their previous living conditions and also the Shelter.
All those up for adoption have tested negative for heartworms but it is absolutely vital they be kept on monthly heartworm prevention from your Veterinarian to ensure they stay negative. If you are not familiar with heartworm prevention, please first talk to your Veterinarian so you are aware of the cost (minor considering that it saves lives) and are ready to ensure prevention throughout their lifetime. If you have other dogs and they are not on prevention you will first need to get with your Veterinarian to have your dog(s) tested and purchase prevention for it/them. Heartworm prevention is a BIG DEAL to us and while we are happy to educate, please also talk to your Veterinarian about its importance.
We look forward to all of these dogs being adopted into loving and responsible homes where they will get lots of attention, love and care, and never again have to be miserable from fleas and all of the inclement weather they have endured living outside.
Our adoption fees are $100 for dogs. This adoption fee completely covers the mandatory spay or neuter, basic immunizations, de-worming, microchip, heartworm check, rabies vaccination if old enough, free health exam with your participating veterinarian.
To meet all the great pets at our shelter come to 255 Central Plank Road, Wetumpka, AL, 36092, go to our website at www.elmorehumane.org for more information, email us at hselco@bellsouth.net for an Adoption Application or give us a call at 334-567-3377.
We are open for adoptions Mon-Fri 10-5 & Sat 9-4.

name: 191213 Elliott
description:
Elliott is a 3-4 year old male Beagle/Terrier mix, 22 lbs. Good with other dogs, shy at first but then wide open. Please read below to better understand Elliott's background.
This precious dog is one of 74 we took in from a single voluntary surrender situation. These dogs have lived their lives outside in large pens so are NOT housetrained, not crate-trained, not leash trained. Many are super friendly, and we think will be fine with children but to our knowledge they have never been around children. It will be best for any children to meet them at our Shelter to make sure. Some of these dogs are shyer and may be more suited to adult only homes.
These dogs were all fed well enough but were covered with fleas & lived on dirt, so many do have hair loss as a result. A few have some Demodectic Mange which is NOT a contagious condition; we expect those with Demodex to clear up quickly now that they are spayed and neutered, fully vaccinated, flea free and clean. Going to a home full of love will also help immensely as they leave the stress behind of their previous living conditions and also the Shelter.

name: Hank
description: Hidy do!  My name is Hank and I am looking for a new home.  I had a family that I loved. In fact I thought I was in my forever home, but things just didnât work out.  I think they forgot what it was like to have a puppy in the home. I am a six-month-old retriever mix.  I have all of my vaccinations, I am heartworm negative, I have a microchip, and I have been neutered.  If you want to adopt me please remember I am still a puppy and I will take up lots of your time and patience. Do you have time for a puppy like me?

name: Goose
description: The name is Goose!  Now I bet when you hear the name Goose you think really BIG and goofy!  Well I am about seven months old and I do have a little more growing to do and I will say I can be a bit goofy!  I think that just makes me more fun!  I was picked up by Animal Control and I was never claimed by my family!  Sooo Happy Day! I am now hoping to find a new home.  I have all of my vaccinations, I am heartworm negative, I have a microchip, and I have been neutered. Now keep in mind I am still a puppy so if you adopt me are you prepared to spend time with me? Will you work with me and teach me nice doggie manners? I want to grow old with your family and create some lasting memories!

name: Dory
description: Hey, I'm Dory! You don't have to search the ocean to find love, I'm right here! I'm a very sweet, silly girl just looking for her Nemo (my fun-loving sidekick)! Please adopt me, we'll just keep swimming through life together!

name: 190893 Lucias
description:
190893 Lucias; 7 month old male bulldog mix. This boy loves toys more than anything (balls are a particular favorite), but he'll play with anything as long as you'll let him! Just look at those ears! Don't you need this little love in your life and home?
ADOPTION FEES Dogs & Puppies.....$100.00. This Adoption fee includes: mandatory spay/neuter which will be done before you can take your dog or puppy home with you; basic canine immunizations (DHPP-CPV & Bordatella Intranasal); de-wormings; one-year rabies vaccination if old enough; heartworm test if over five months old; microchip from 24-Pet Watch; certificate for free health examination at your participating veterinarian; and a goodie bag chocked full of information, toys, and more.
Yes, there are sometimes exceptions to our normal fee for older dogs or special cases or adoptions of two dogs together. Some of our pets have also been lovingly sponsored by caring people and we will let the approved adopter know about that at the point of adoption. Visit our Website at: http://www.elmorehumane.orgThe staff would also like to remind you that for faster response to inquiries about adoptable animals to have the animals ID#, name & description.This way your questions will be answered in a timely manner.
You can also expedite the adoption process by filling our Adoption Application which you can find at: http://www.elmorehumane.org/HSEC_FORMS/AdoptionApplication.pdf and sending to us either by scanning and emailing to hselco@bellsouth.net or faxing to 334-567-8774.
All pet adoption websites & our shelter management software require that we choose a primary and/or secondary breed for our dogs. While our staff is quite breed knowledgeable, in many cases we are truly making our best guesses as to their breed(s) based on many factors but cannot promise that what we have said is accurate. So taking into account your own parameters for things such as size, coat care, activity level, etc please come and get to know our dog(s) as individuals to see if their personalities and yours are a forever match.
Thank you!Phone: (334) 567-3377 Fax: (334) 567-8774 E-mail: hselco@bellsouth.net

name: 190761 Noodles
description:
190761 Noodles; 1 year old male shepherd mix. He came to us with a badly injured back leg that required extensive surgery. He stayed at a local Vet for a long time healing but is now back with us and he is a wide-open boy! He is energetic and loves to play but he is also extremely loving and will just come lean against you as to get loved on. Female dogs only as a buddy however - no males. And no kitties.

name: 190939 Mama Bear
description:
190939 Mama Bear; female Redbone/Great Pyrenees mix. Mama Bear's owners turned her and her sister, Butterbean (she has been adopted) in to us and we really can't understand why! These gorgeous dogs are as sweet as sweet can be, and very calm natured. As of late September, Mama Bear is eight months old and about 45 lbs so not getting much larger. Loves to snuggle and sit with you and very content to walk by your side as you meander through the yard. Leash shy, so still need a bit of work there. Great with other dogs; very laid back attitude.
