name: Taco Man
description:
Taco is such a handsome boy! Taco is about 2 years old.  Taco is looking for a fenced in backyard and someone who is very active. Heâd make a great companion doing whatever youâre doing. He loves to be petted and play with toys. Please call today to schedule a visit with Taco. 

Paws of Dixie Animal Rescue will adopt this pup locally.

 Our adoption fee includes the spay/neuter, up to date shots, Microchip.  

PDAR.info@gmail.com

**To see all of our pets available for adoption, please copy this link.

https://www.petfinder.com/search/pets-for-adoption/?shelter_id%5B0%5D=AL450&sort%5B0%5D=recently_added


COMPLETED APPLICATIONS TAKE PRECEDENCE OVER INQUIRIES. If you are interested in adopting, the FIRST step is to complete an application.

Please copy and paste the following URL for the adoption application:

https://goo.gl/forms/oPC0SnGUB0aC4Mrr2

Please be advised that our volunteers are busy rescuing, transporting, and caring for our animals. We will respond to your application as soon as possible. Upon review of your application, the rescue in AL will contact you, so you can ask any specific questions that you may have.

NOTE: All Paws of Dixie animals are located in AL foster homes. 

If there is more than one decision maker in the home, all of them should be in agreement.

We DO NOT adopt to anyone under the age of 21.

Thank you for your understanding and consideration.

name: Walker
description:
Walker is our neutered male 5 month old German Shepherd mix. Of course he loves to run and play,  and he is a very lively pup. He loves a good cuddle and a belly rub.  He is very willing to please. 

His slideshow video:
https://www.facebook.com/1902156960029671/videos/609524369538671/

Randolph County Animal Shelter, Wedowee, AL. 36278 www.RandolphShelter.org (256)357-0101

name: Robert
description:
Robert is our two year old male Lab - Border Collie mix.  He seems to have had some training and is very well behaved. He is ready to transition to your home. Will you come and play with him in Bark Park, and see what a lovely companion he will make? 

His video: 
https://www.facebook.com/1902156960029671/videos/311127813099343/

Randolph County Animal Shelter, Wedowee, AL 36278 www.RandolphShelter. org (256)357-0101

name: Candy
description:
Candy is our happy, one year old female Lab mix. She is spayed and sweet as can be. She has four white stockings and a spring in her step. And look at that tall, beautiful tail. She is as beautiful on the inside as the outside.

Her video:
https://www.facebook.com/1902156960029671/videos/364180214298282/

Come meet her in Bark Park, let's make a date!

Randolph County Animal Shelter, Wedowee, AL 36278  www.RandolphShelter.org (256)357-0101

name: Luna
description:
Luna is our 1.25 year old female Lab -Dachshund mix. She is springy and spunky. She has the heart of a big dog in a smaller body. And she is lively and funny and fun to play with. She cut up in Bark Park, and had us encouraging her antics ;-)

Luna's 2 videos:
https://www.facebook.com/1902156960029671/videos/2419668224933497/ 
and
https://www.facebook.com/1902156960029671/videos/804660156595017/ 

Randolph County Animal Shelter, Wedowee, AL. 36278 www.RandolphShelter.org (256)357-0101

name: Mims
description:
Mims is a happy girl with the most delightful personality. She is friendly with dogs, is a true cuddle queen, and would be the perfect running partner.  One of her favorite pastimes is swimming!  She so enjoys going to lake.  Mims is highly treat and food motivated and will \"sit\" in a split second for a tasty morsel.  She isn't found of being crated, but has proven trustworthy when left alone with another dog in her foster home.  Est. birthdate is December 2015,  , mostly house trained  vaccinated, spayed, and microchipped. Adoption fee $200.00.
 Please submit an adoption application, https://twobytworescue.com/adopting/

name: Poppie
description:
Precious Poppie puppy!
Poppy is a yellow Lab mix, about 4 months old (possibly younger) who is very shy at first but warms up quickly. She is very sweet! Poppie is a typical puppy and plays hard and then sleeps hard. 
Poppie will need a variety of things to chew on while she is getting her big girl teeth in. 
She will soon be available for foster-to-adopt until she is old enough to be safely spayed. (For more info on fostering-to-adopt please visit our FaceBook Page and view our âNotesâ section.) Once spayed she will be ready to be adopted. 
Anyone interested in Poppie MUST submit an application via our website at k9resqofal.org.

name: SUNSHINE
description:
Sunshine truly is a ray of Sunshine for your day. Always smiling, always happy. Calm and quiet disposition.  Loves affection and cuddling but not demanding. House trained, and well mannered. Sunshine will make an excellent addition to a lucky forever home. Sunshine is 2 years old.   Spayed, UTD with vaccines and Vetted. Very well mannered in the house or car and on a leash. Friendly with adults, children and other dogs. She has been around cats at adoption event with no reaction to them. We have never seen an aggressive moment from her. She will make an excellent companion dog for a person or family. Please fill out an adoption application today!
PLEASE READ TO THE END. Included in NHR adoption Fee with all dogs and Puppies: UTD with Vaccines, Micro-Chipped, Spay/Neuter included, Treated for internal parasites, and living in a loving Foster Homes learning socialization and house manners, not a stressful Kennel environment. New Hope Rescue is a 501-C3 Not for Profit, All Volunteer Organization. All Proceeds are going to be used to help other rescue dogs and not to pay salaries. Because we are a small rescue we cannot transport out of our immediate area, however if you would like to arrange transportation we may be able to work with you. WE WILL ONLY CONSIDER HOMES THAT WILL MAKE THEIR DOG(S) A PART OF THE FAMILY. To schedule a Meet and Greet please fill out an application HERE: www.nhrescue.com Come and meet NEW HOPE RESCUE and some of our Fosters at PETSMART in Tiger Town Shopping Center (next to Home Depot) Opelika, AL from 10am-2pm CT on the 2nd Saturday of each month!

name: JADEN
description:
Jaden is a Beautiful boy with his blonde coat and green eyes. He is also very sweet and just wants to be someones best buddy.  Jaden is very happy, lots of character, vocal and sweet. He can be a little shy when first introduced, but warms up quickly. He just needs someone who will help his self confidence grow and he will be quite the life of the party!  He was found with seven others living at a bridge in the middle of nowhere starving, hair loss and full of worms. He has been in foster care where he has been vetted, neutered, UTD with vaccines and is now a beautiful guy. He is apx 2 years of age. Because he has had limited interaction with people, he will need someone who will be patient with him as he learns to trust. He has come so far, so fast but still has a ways to go. With the right person/family he will realize his potential and be a loving, protective memeber of the family. PLEASE READ TO THE END. Included in NHR adoption Fee with all dogs and Puppies: UTD with Vaccines, Micro-Chipped, Spay/Neuter included, Treated for internal parasites, and living in a loving Foster Homes learning socialization and house manners, not a stressful Kennel environment. New Hope Rescue is a 501-C3 Not for Profit, All Volunteer Organization. All Proceeds are going to be used to help other rescue dogs and not to pay salaries. Because we are a small rescue we cannot transport out of our immediate area, however if you would like to arrange transportation we may be able to work with you. WE WILL ONLY CONSIDER HOMES THAT WILL MAKE THEIR DOG(S) A PART OF THE FAMILY. To schedule a Meet and Greet please fill out an application HERE: www.nhrescue.com 
Come and meet NEW HOPE RESCUE and some of our Fosters at PETSMART in Tiger Town Shopping Center (next to Home Depot) Opelika, AL from 10am-2pm CT on the 2nd Saturday of each month!

name: STORM
description:
Storm is quite a handsome boy with his beautiful blue coat and his beautiful eyes.   Storm was abandoned at a bridge in the middle of nowhere with seven other dogs. Even with his ribs showing and hair loss it was easy to see with some TLC what a handsome boy he would be! Our Vet estimates Storms age to be 1 year old. He is currently about 40 pounds. Storm is Neutered, UTD with vaccines, and Vetted. We don't believe Storm had much positive human interaction before being brought to into rescue and a Foster Home. Since being in Foster he has shown he'd love to be someones best Buddy. He is a little shy when you meet him, but warms up quickly and  loves attention and pets.  He stays inside the house at night and has never had an accident inside. Because he was without positive  human interaction until recently, He will need someone to be patient with him to build his self confidence and he will bloom into an exceptional companion for the right person or family. 
PLEASE READ TO THE END.  Included in NHR adoption Fee with all dogs and Puppies: UTD with Vaccines, Micro-Chipped, Spay/Neuter included, Treated for internal parasites, and living in a loving Foster Homes learning socialization and house manners, not a stressful Kennel environment. New Hope Rescue is a 501-C3 Not for Profit, All Volunteer Organization. All Proceeds are going to be used to help other rescue dogs and not to pay salaries.  Because we are a small rescue we cannot transport out of our immediate area, however if you would like to arrange transportation we may be able to work with you. WE WILL ONLY CONSIDER HOMES THAT WILL MAKE THEIR DOG(S) A PART OF THE FAMILY. To schedule a Meet and Greet please fill out an application HERE: www.nhrescue.com  
Come and meet NEW HOPE RESCUE and some of our Fosters at PETSMART in Tiger Town Shopping Center (next to Home Depot)  Opelika, AL from 10am-2pm CT on the 2nd Saturday of each month!

name: Kat
description: Hello, my name is Kat and I am a dog!!  What a funny name for a dog!  Anywho, I was found as a stray and taken to a local vetâs office.  They kept me for a while and then sent me to the shelter so more people could see me for adoption.  I am a four-month-old terrier mix. I have all of my vaccinations for my age, I have a microchip, and I have been neutered.  I am a really sweet girl. Everyone at the vet clinic and the shelter have fallen in love with me because I am so sweet and gentle! Why donât you come out for a visit?

name: Frankie
description: Hello Everyone!  My name is Frankie! Now donât let my name fool you!  I am a girl, but I am named Frankie!  I think it is a cute name and it makes me stand out in a crowd!  I had an owner, but she was moving overseas and could not take me with her.  Golly I hope she has fun in her new country but I hope that find a great new home soon!  I have all of my vaccinations, I am heartworm negative, I have a microchip, and I have been spayed.  I am an eleven-month-old terrier mix. Why donât you come out for a visit with me?  I bet you would fall in love with me!!

name: 190966 Pontoon
description:
Pontoon was found at an area lake and brought to us to keep him safe. Sadly no owner ever came looking. He is 2-3 years old, around 55 lbs, laid back personality, good with other dogs, walks well on a leash - one handsome Redbone in search of a loving new home.

ADOPTION FEES Dogs & Puppies.....$100.00. This Adoption fee includes: mandatory spay/neuter which will be done before you can take your dog or puppy home with you; basic canine immunizations (DHPP-CPV & Bordatella Intranasal); de-wormings; one-year rabies vaccination if old enough; heartworm test if over five months old; microchip from 24-Pet Watch; certificate for free health examination at your participating veterinarian; and a goodie bag chocked full of information, toys, and more.
Yes, there are sometimes exceptions to our normal fee for older dogs or special cases or adoptions of two dogs together. Some of our pets have also been lovingly sponsored by caring people and we will let the approved adopter know about that at the point of adoption. Visit our Website at: http://www.elmorehumane.orgThe staff would also like to remind you that for faster response to inquiries about adoptable animals to have the animals ID#, name & description.This way your questions will be answered in a timely manner.
You can also expedite the adoption process by filling our Adoption Application which you can find at: http://www.elmorehumane.org/HSEC_FORMS/AdoptionApplication.pdf and sending to us either by scanning and emailing to hselco@bellsouth.net or faxing to 334-567-8774.
All pet adoption websites & our shelter management software require that we choose a primary and/or secondary breed for our dogs. While our staff is quite breed knowledgeable, in many cases we are truly making our best guesses as to their breed(s) based on many factors but cannot promise that what we have said is accurate. So taking into account your own parameters for things such as size, coat care, activity level, etc please come and get to know our dog(s) as individuals to see if their personalities and yours are a forever match.
Thank you!Phone: (334) 567-3377 Fax: (334) 567-8774 E-mail: hselco@bellsouth.net

name: Soleil B lower fee
description:
Please contact Vickie (dvbrooks57@gmail.com) for more information about this pet.
Meet Soleil ! She is a 7 month old mix of Lab / Shepherd. with a gorgeous tricolor coat that is medium in length. When she has matured, she will weigh in the 55 pound range and so will be at the high end of medium in size. She has a sweet personality, and loves to play. She has some energy , so she would do well with hiking , or a running partner. She is good with other dogs. We suggest training classes for all our young pups. It will make her a great dog, and a happy home life for all ! ME POSTED 7/7/19

It is rare that we know with certainty the ages or mixes that make up our wonderful dogs, but we do our best to be as accurate as possible based upon our many years in rescue.
** Adoption: $225 which covers , transport, complete medical records, spaying/neutering,microchip.
Transport, if needed :

name: Dierksie B
description: Dierksie B is a fun loving young lady! She is a happy dog and is very treat motivated.  Dierksie B needs a home where she can get the exercise that she needs as well as have people who she can love and bond with.

name: Simon
description: Simon is a very laid back puppy. He is the largest in his litter and the first born.  Simon is playful but not overly hyper and is excellent with dogs of all ages, shapes and sizes.  Simon was born at Callie's Place and he is a very special puppy.  We know that you will love him as much as we do!

name: Genesis
description: Genesis is a smart, fun loving girl. She loves water and makes even the most mundane tasks involving the water hose lots of fun.  Genesis is crate trained and is doing exceptionally well with house training. She is eager to please and loves exploring and hanging out.  Everyone who meets her falls in love with her!

name: Andy B great boy 35 lbs
description:
Please contact Vickie (dvbrooks57@gmail.com) for more information about this pet.*
FOSTER MARY ELLENANDYMALEHUSKY HEELER MIXAGE 2 YEAR WEIGHT 35 POUNDSCOLOR WHITE REDCOAT MEDIUMNEUTEREDCHIPPEDMEET ANDY.... HE LOVES BEING WITH PEOPLE AND IS VERY GENTLE AND LOVING .. HE HAS A DOCILE AND QUITE NATURE. HE LOVES TOYS, AND IS VERY GOOD WITH OTHER DOGS.. HE HAS A LITTER MATE BARNEY WHO IS A GREAT BOY TOO. ANDY IS FULLY VETTED AND READY FOR HIS TRUE FORVER HOME. POSTED 7/5/19
*It is rare that we know with certainty the ages or mixes that make up our wonderful dogs, but we do our best to be as accurate as possible based upon our many years in rescue.** Adoption: $325 which covers quarantine, shots, worming, food, medical records, spaying/neutering,microchip and an Alabama State Health Certificate. Transport, if needed : $120.00 We consider the transport to be of great importance and, as such, take particular care of the dogs during the trip from Alabama. We make every effort to arrive with healthy and minimally stressed dogs.

name: Rebel
description:
People often ask if we know their new dog's history, and we usually don't. Rebel is different, though. A lady drove up to our rescue with two dogs and a litter of newborn puppies in her car. She told us that she no longer had a home and could no longer keep the dogs. She asked that we take the dogs, and, of course, we did. Rebel is one of them. A 1 year old, 18-pound mix of Chihuahua and Miniature Pinscher, Rebel's short, black coat glistens in the sunlight and you can't help but stroke his back. Perhaps because of his lack of security prior to coming to us, he needs a bit of time to warm up to you, but when he does, he'll be your best buddy! (posted 7/5/19, ME)
**It is rare that we know with certainty the ages or mixes that make up our wonderful dogs, but we do our best to be as accurate as possible based upon our many years in rescue.**
Adoption: $325 which covers quarantine, shots, worming, food, medical records, spaying/neutering, microchip and an Alabama State Health Certificate.
Transport, if needed : $120.00 We consider the transport to be of great importance and, as such, take particular care of the dogs during the trip from Alabama. We make every effort to arrive with healthy and minimally stressed dogs.

name: Buckaroo
description:
How sweet! Buckaroo is a 6 month old Chihuahua/Dachshund mix (Chiweenie) who presently weighs 22 pounds and will mature to about 35. Buckaroo is a happy boy who loves to have fun with people and other dogs. His shiny, black coat is short and very \"strokable.\" He loves to be petting for as long as you have the energy, but he also loves to quiet down when it's time. This boy has a fine temperament and is just waiting for you to take him home. How 'bout it? (posted 7/5/19, ME)
**It is rare that we know with certainty the ages or mixes that make up our wonderful dogs, but we do our best to be as accurate as possible based upon our many years in rescue.**
Adoption: $325 which covers quarantine, shots, worming, food, medical records, spaying/neutering, microchip and an Alabama State Health Certificate.
Transport, if needed : $120.00 We consider the transport to be of great importance and, as such, take particular care of the dogs during the trip from Alabama. We make every effort to arrive with healthy and minimally stressed dogs.

name: Wig
description:
Meet Wig, a 7-year-old, 50-pound mix of Shar Pei and Lab. She is a lovely girl with a short coat of tan and black and white. She's also a very sweet and gentle girl who can be very shy and, as a result, will do much better in a calm and easy going home. She's good with other dogs and loves kids as well as adults. Wig is a precious girl who is waiting for you. (posted 7/3/19, ME)
**It is rare that we know with certainty the ages or mixes that make up our wonderful dogs, but we do our best to be as accurate as possible based upon our many years in rescue.**
Adoption: $325 which covers quarantine, shots, worming, food, medical records, spaying/neutering, microchip and an Alabama State Health Certificate.
Transport, if needed : $120.00 We consider the transport to be of great importance and, as such, take particular care of the dogs during the trip from Alabama. We make every effort to arrive with healthy and minimally stressed dogs.

name: Diesel 31061
description: Diesel is a 10-month-old male Shepherd/Pointer mix who has already been neutered. He came to PAHS as an owner turn in because his owners could no longer take care of him. Diesel is mostly white but has quite a bit of black markings. He also has some brown markings on his head and face. Diesel is a good looking guy who has enormous and comical ears. Those ears have many different looks and they are most entertaining as you watch them! Diesel also appears to have a big goofy grin most of the time. He currently weighs 38 pounds so he is considered as a medium sized dog. Diesel is a very good natured dog who enjoys any attention you give him. He is leash trained but could work on his manners while on a leash. Diesel is a high energy fellow who would loved to have a nice fenced yard where he could safely play. Due to his extreme playfulness we believe he would do best in a family without small children under the age of six. Diesel would never intentionally hurt a child but in his exuberance for life he might knock a child down. He is good with other dogs. Diesel is such a great dog! With a patient owner who is willing to spend time with him Diesel's has great potential to be a wonderful new family member for some lucky adopter. ****Please note that when introducing a new dog into a home with children and other pets adult supervision is strongly recommended until the new dog settles in with the family.****Dogs may be adopted for $120. Cat adoption fees are $50. Our adoption fees cover a microchip, microchip registration, discounted spay/neuter certificate, deworming, vaccinations (as age and law requires), and a courtesy vet exam at participating offices. Unless otherwise indicated under 'special needs' our dogs have screened heart worm negative.

name: Tovi
description: Tovi was pulled from Russell County on her last day there. She was set to be euthanized. We pulled her and put her in a foster home. She was a littler nervous at first, but warmed up slowly. She gave her foster mom and dad kisses the entire ride home from the shelter. She was grateful.. Tovi is 2.5 years old. She is mixed breed. Not sure what breed she is. We took her to the vet and she is HW POSITIVE. So we are preparing her for the fast kill HW treatment. She is on antibiotics now to prep her body for the treatment. She is currently on Nexgard and Heartgard. She is UTD on all shots, microchipped, rabies. Since we have had her in foster, we have learned that she is not good with cats. She LOVES other dogs, but chases cats. We are looking for a home that is cat free. She will need to be in a home that can keep her calm during her treatments in Sept. Tovi is available for adoption as well. All treatments are being paid for by NHR. Her current foster mom said she's so good in the house. She is so chill and sat in the kitchen while she cooked and was a go with the flo kinda girl. She can play tough and rough with the other dogs in the yard. If your interested in Tovi, please apply here: www.nhrescue.com.

name: Junior
description:
Meet Junior. 
Junior is 2-3 years old. Weighs 11 lbs. He is fully vetted. He is current on all shots, rabies, hw negative and taking monthly prevention. Junior needs a home that is fairly quiet. He loves to sun bathe and hang out with other doggie friends. He is dog and cat friendly. He would do best in a home with NO small kids. He can be a bit to nippy around little kids. He can handle older kids. He is a little reserved at first, but once he gets used to you, he will become your buddy. He loves to be picked up and held like a baby on his back. He would do better in a home with other dogs. He enjoys playing and having a snuggle buddy. He just wants his own human to love him like he deserves. 
If your interested in Junior, please apply here: www.nhrescue.com.

name: McKenzie
description: Hi my name is McKenzie, my foster parents say they did not know a dog could be so good. I love to be rubbed behind my ears and love to follow you outside so I can roll in the grass. My favorite place to be is my dog bed, I tend to sleep  a lot. The only time I have been known to make the dreaded barking noise is when I am impatiently waiting for my food. By the way, meal time is my favorite time of day! I seem to only hear really deep voices so when coming to pet me make sure I see you or I will take off running because I am scared. If I know you are coming, I love to snuggle!!

name: Dale B Lower fee LOVES water
description:
Please contact Vickie (dvbrooks57@gmail.com) for more information about this pet.**
This is Dale. He is a 6 month old male GSD mix. This boy LOVES water! He weighs about 40 pounds and will be a large dog when grown. Dale is a loving dog with lots of energy. He loves people and does good with other dogs. He enjoys playing in the water and is learning to walk on a leash. He will make a wonderful running or hiking buddy with some more practice. Dale is a beautiful boy and he's just waiting on the right family.... posted 7/ 19 /19

It is rare that we know with certainty the ages or mixes that make up our wonderful dogs, but we do our best to be as accurate as possible based upon our many years in rescue.** Adoption: $225 which covers TRANSPORT, quarantine, shots, worming, food, medical records, spaying/neutering,microchip and an Alabama State Health Certificate. Transport. We consider the transport to be of great importance and, as such, take particular care of the dogs during the trip from Alabama. We make every effort to arrive with healthy and minimally stressed dogs.

name: Wiley
description:
This beautiful boy is a 2 year old, 40 pound mix of Chocolate Blue Heeler and Shepherd. His name is Wiley, and he's an extremely friendly boy with good manners. He's blowing out his winter coat now and you can see where his hair is filling in on his back where he had his heartworm treatment. The treatment is done, and he's ready to go home with you! Wiley is great with people and other dogs! Just great! (posted 6/26/19, ME)
**It is rare that we know with certainty the ages or mixes that make up our wonderful dogs, but we do our best to be as accurate as possible based upon our many years in rescue.**
Adoption: $325 which covers quarantine, shots, worming, food, medical records, spaying/neutering, microchip and an Alabama State Health Certificate.
Transport, if needed : $120.00 We consider the transport to be of great importance and, as such, take particular care of the dogs during the trip from Alabama. We make every effort to arrive with healthy and minimally stressed dogs.

name: 191591 Neo
description:
Neo is seven-months old and about 45 lbs. He is way too cute with this floppy ears that go every which way. Great natured boy - loves other dogs, good with cats, great with children. High energy boy who would love to romp and play and chase balls with the best of them! The fourth photo is Neo as a younger puppy - was just cute so left it.

ADOPTION FEES Dogs & Puppies.....$100.00. This Adoption fee includes: mandatory spay/neuter which will be done before you can take your dog or puppy home with you; basic canine immunizations (DHPP-CPV & Bordatella Intranasal); de-wormings; one-year rabies vaccination if old enough; heartworm test if over five months old; microchip from 24-Pet Watch; certificate for free health examination at your participating veterinarian; and a goodie bag chocked full of information, toys, and more.
Yes, there are sometimes exceptions to our normal fee for older dogs or special cases or adoptions of two dogs together. Some of our pets have also been lovingly sponsored by caring people and we will let the approved adopter know about that at the point of adoption. Visit our Website at: http://www.elmorehumane.orgThe staff would also like to remind you that for faster response to inquiries about adoptable animals to have the animals ID#, name & description.This way your questions will be answered in a timely manner.
You can also expedite the adoption process by filling our Adoption Application which you can find at: http://www.elmorehumane.org/HSEC_FORMS/AdoptionApplication.pdf and sending to us either by scanning and emailing to hselco@bellsouth.net or faxing to 334-567-8774.
All pet adoption websites & our shelter management software require that we choose a primary and/or secondary breed for our dogs. While our staff is quite breed knowledgeable, in many cases we are truly making our best guesses as to their breed(s) based on many factors but cannot promise that what we have said is accurate. So taking into account your own parameters for things such as size, coat care, activity level, etc please come and get to know our dog(s) as individuals to see if their personalities and yours are a forever match.
Thank you!Phone: (334) 567-3377 Fax: (334) 567-8774 E-mail: hselco@bellsouth.net

name: 190674 Scuba
description:
Scuba is about six-months old (as of late June) and about 30 lbs so not getting much bigger. He and his brother, Flipper (Red), are active boys who love chasing squirrels and why we aren't yet sure how they will be with cats. Great size for most families and they would love some children to play with.

name: 190957 Sully
description:
Sully, and his sister Laken, look like they could be Plott Hound mixes but just our best guess. They are happy go lucky hound pups, almost five-months old at the end of June, good with everyone, should be in the 50 lb range when fully grown.

name: Peyton B
description:
Please contact Vickie (dvbrooks57@gmail.com) for more information about this pet.Mary Ellen is the fosterMeet Peyton, and his brother Baxter they are littermates. They are 5 1/2 months old about 33 lbs. They are sweet loving boys. They both walk good on a leash. They are good with each other, and love playing. Open your heart, and home to these guys. They are fully vetted, and ready for a true FOREVER family. Posted 6/26/19

name: Rogan B
description:
Please contact Vickie (dvbrooks57@gmail.com) for more information about this pet.*
ROGANNEUTERED3-4 YEARSCattle dog MIX50 LBSMEET ROGAN.... HE WAS RESCUED FROM THE SHELTER HEARTWORM POSTIVE, HE RECEIVED HIS HEARTWORM TREATMENT 5-16-19 & 5-17-19. HE IS A GREAT, AND HAPPY BOY. THIS BOY IS SO READY FOR HIS FOREVER HOME. HE IS FULLY VETTED AND READY TO GO. TN POSTED 6/25/19

name: Maggie
description: Maggie here! I am a three- month-old hound mix that is hoping to find a new home soon.  I came in with some of my littermates and a few of them have already found new homes. Oh golly I hope I find my forever home soon!  I have all of my vaccinations for my age, I have a microchip, and I have been spayed.  I am a funny little girl with a sweet personality! Wish me luck that my new family walks in the door soon!

name: Bryan
description: Hey there!  My name is Bryan!  I am a three-year-old Chihuahua mix that was rescued by a kind stranger.  I was in a dangerous situation!  I was hanging around a gas station, dodging cars and begging for food!  My kind stranger saw me and was able to coax me to her with some treats.  She scooped me up and brought me to the shelter so I would be safe while I waited for my family to claim me.  No one ever came and now I am up for adoption.  I have all of my vaccinations, I have a microchip, and I have been neutered.  One little problem did show up on my health check up.  It seems that I am heartworm positive.  Whoever adopts me will need to have me treated.  If you would like to donate to my treatment, well that would be great! If you would like to foster me or adopt me during treatment, then come on in and letâs have a meet and greet!

name: Jake O
description: Jake O is a fun loving curious lad.  He's very treat motivated and does well with his basic training.  He's playful and a great companion.

name: Sampson
description: All dogs adopted through Troy Animal Rescue Project are up to date on vaccinations, spayed/neutered, and heartworm negative. All dogs are given monthly flea/tickpreventative, monthly heartworm preventative, and are dewormed regularly. Adoption fee is $50. Home visit and vet reference required.

name: Ferb
description: Ferb is a good boy who loves to swim. He likes to talk to you from time to time, but that is usually to get you to give him some loving. He can jump some low fences, and he walks well on a leash. He loves to go for rides in the car!

name: Sophie
description: Sophie is a sweet girl who isn't very active..., which has led to an overweight problem. She has also recently been diagnosed with a low thyroid and is now on thyroid medicine morning and evening. If you are someone who can work with her enabling her to loose weight, Sophie needs you!

name: 190805 Dobie
description:
#190805, Dobbie is a 3-4 yr old male, 40 lb Shepherd/Lab mix with a gorgeous sable and tan coloring. This happy guy is as smart as he is cute. He loves to venture out using his little sniffer or hang out beside his human getting some love.

ADOPTION FEES Dogs & Puppies.....$100.00. This Adoption fee includes: mandatory spay/neuter which will be done before you can take your dog or puppy home with you; basic canine immunizations (DHPP-CPV & Bordatella Intranasal); de-wormings; one-year rabies vaccination if old enough; heartworm test if over five months old; microchip from 24-Pet Watch; certificate for free health examination at your participating veterinarian; and a goodie bag chocked full of information, toys, and more.

name: 190538 Zoie
description:
#190538, Zoie is an adorable 2 yr old female possible Heeler/Beagle Mix. This girl sometimes acts like a little bit of a herder but wants to play, listen & watch for leadership and roll over for some belly rubs. She weighs 40 lbs and is great with other dogs.

name: 190554 Sawyer
description:
Sawyer is seven years old and a big boy - 90 lbs. He is the most awesome dog - super loving and chilled, wants nothing more than to be a big lush in your lap. Sadly he was heartworm positive but completed his treatment on 2 July and is now good to go. He loves everyone but lets say older children best as he is just a really big and powerful boy.
ADOPTION FEES Dogs & Puppies.....$100.00. This Price Includes......mandatory spay/neuter which will be done before you can take your dog or puppy home with you; basic canine immunizations (DHPP-CPV); de-worming; rabies vaccination if old enough; heartworm test if over five months old; microchip from 24-Pet Watch; certificate for free health examination at your participating veterinarian; pet health insurance from Shelter Care (for covered illness or injury for 30 days) with your email address; and a goodie bag chocked full of information, toys, and more. Thanks Phone: (334) 567-3377 Fax: (334) 567-8774 E-mail: hselco@bellsouth.net 9/19/19 6:27 PM

name: Archie
description:
INTAKE DATE - 6/14/19
ADOPTION STATUS - Available. Accepting applications at www.weimrescue.com
AGE - 2 years old
SEX - Neutered male
SIZE - Normal breed standard
MEDICAL STATUS - Healthy
HOUSETRAINED - Unknown
CRATE TRAINED - Unknown
GOOD WITH OTHER DOGS - Yes
GOOD WITH CATS - Unknown
GOOD WITH CHILDREN - Unknown

Archie is almost 2 years old, weighs 75lbs, and is a happy, energetic, sweet boy. He seems to get along well with other dogs, loves to play with toys, and is quite affectionate. He will need an active family that will give him the training, structure, and exercise that his previous family did not give him.

name: Pala
description:
Introducing PALA (means \"Guardian\"). This not so little lady is a quirky mix of Great Pyrenees and Hound. She's about 14 weeks and will be big so a fenced in yard and plenty of room to play is preferred. Pala LOVES toys, sticks, tennis balls... She's pretty easy to please. :D Teething is still a thing for her though so chew toys are great too.

Pala loves playing with other pups and is curious about cats but not mean to them. She's working on her leash manners & basic obedience but will need someone patient to keep working with her. She's crate trained and almost completely house trained. 

This adorable 12 week old girl is full of personality and will keep you entertained with her antics as you can tell below. If you're interested in adding her to your pack, please apply at our website. Also if you'd rather have a male puppy, Pala's two brothers will be available for adoption soon too. :D 

sanctuaryanimalrescue.com/adoption-questionnaire-1

name: Samuel
description: Sammy is a sweet old soul. This 9 year old 45 pound buddy has a heart of gold. Heâs easy going and loves everyone. He enjoys walks, but likes just hanging out in the house with you. He requires a fenced yard. Please apply at www.sanctuaryanimalrescue.com if you are interested in letting this sweet fella retire and spend his golden years with you.

name: Remington 2
description:
Remington (Remi) is a big 1 year old boy that loves to play! Tennis balls, tug ropes, squeaky toys, chase... You name it, he'll play it!

Remi is a handsome brindle and would make a great running or hiking buddy. He is excellent at staying right by his person. Ever need motivation to go just another mile? This guy is it! He absolutely loves walks and will need a fenced in yard. Because of his energy & prey drive, cats aren't a good fit but older kids would make excellent partners. Another large dog would be okay too after a proper introduction.

Anyone interested in ADOPTING this big lug should apply here: sanctuaryanimalrescue.com

name: Buster
description:
Afternoon, Buster here! I'm a sweet 9 year old guy that's just looking to belong. My last family left me at the vet's office for months and since then I've been working to be the best me I can be in order to find my new family.

I like people, kids, some other dogs, but not cats... I was outnumbered at the vet's office and it brings back bad memories. But I mean really, I'm way better at cuddling than a cat. I'm working on all my manners and am doing great. I like car rides, long walks, and pettings. Table scraps are my favorite but honestly, I could stand to lose a couple pounds.

Anyone want to adopt me?  Submit a questionnaire from our website at www.sanctuaryanimalrescue.com.

name: Jayla
description: Hi, my name is Jayla.  Isnât that a cute name?  Well I think it is!  I am a five-month-old terrier mix that needs a new home.  I was picked up by Animal Control and brought to the shelter. I waited for my family to claim me, but no one ever came. Now I can look for a new home.  I have all of my vaccinations, I am heartworm negative, I have a microchip, and I have been spayed.  I have some long legs already, so I may be a big girl when I reach my adult size!  That just means I will be a great walking or running partner for you!  I hope to see you soon.

name: Tater B crate , and housebroken trained
description:
Please contact Vickie (dvbrooks57@gmail.com) for more information about this pet.
Tater /30lbs/6mo/lab,hound/male

Meet Tater.... he is a Smart boy. He has a calm temperament. He has lived his life in a home before being surrendered to a kill shelter. He is good with other dogs. Learning to walk on a leash. So handsome, fully vetted, and ready for a TRUE forever home.
ME Posted 6/16/19

name: Rosalind B sweet soul
description:
Please contact Vickie (dvbrooks57@gmail.com) for more information about this pet.**
Meet sweet Rosalind.... she is a sweet soul, a little timid to begin with but warms up quick, and is your best friend. She is good with other dogs. She is about one yr. And 52 lbs. She is ready for a true loving home. She is fully vetted, and ready to go.ME posted 6/ 16 / 19

name: Jade & Jewel
description:
Jade and Jewel are one-year-old mix breeds. They have a lab, Staffordshire terrier, chow, and other in their DNA.  Jewel was adopted briefly in 2018, however she did not do well without her sibling.    These dogs are very sweet, Jewel thinks sheâs a lapdog to, Jade likes to clean the kitchen floor and you should see these two lick each otherâs lips! 

One adoption fee for two nice companion animals.  Fenced yard required because thatâs all they know.  Crate trained. Email for an application were4dogs@gmail.com

name: George
description:
Name: George

Age: 1 year old
Sex: male
Approx. Weight: 70 lbs.
Ears/Tail: natural ears and tail
Hw Status: negative

Available: Now!

A Little About Me: George says sure, you can hug him, and pet him, and squeeze him (but not too tight!), and pat him, and rub him, and caress him. Also, play fetch with him and laugh at his silly antics and funny faces (including his amazing ability to blow spit bubbles!). Just so long as you adopt him and love him forever!

**COURTESY POST THROUGH ROCKIN' P RESCUE** 

Please visit Rockin' P Rescue, Inc. to submit an online adoption application.

name: Lee Roy
description:
Name: Lee Roy

Age: 4 years old
Sex: male
Ears/Tail: natural ears and tail
HW Status: negative

Available: Now!

A Little About Me: I was a stray and didn't have a home. I just wandered around and didn't have a lot of food to eat. A very nice lady took me in and tried to find my people.  After awhile I got to Rockin P and they found out what a great boy I am.

I would love a house where I can retire and spend the rest of my days in a home that will feed me regular and give me pets and love me. That's all I want. I am doing well in my foster home with the large dogs but I do need slow introductions.  I do great in a crate even though I don't love it. I learned how to potty outside with a doggie door the first day and my foster mom said I was a good boy! I walk on a lease but like to pull a bit so I need practice. I would love to have a \"furever\" home!!

Part of my adoption fee has been sponsored so it is only $150.00 to adopt me!

I am located near Jacksonville, AL. YOU MUST BE WILLING TO DRIVE PART IF NOT ALL OF THE WAY TO PICK UP THIS DOG FOR ADOPTION. 

Please visit Rockin' P Rescue, Inc. to submit an online adoption application. 

Adoption contributions are as follows: 
* $300.00 for a dog 6 months and under
* $250.00 for a dog aged 7 months to 1 year 
* $225.00 for a dog over one year

name: Mookie
description:
Mookie is a sweet, sensitive, soul that wants a family that will love on him, and give him the attention he craves. Someone who works from home would be ideal, or even for a good portion of the day due to his separation anxiety.  He would love a doggie companion too. This good boy is vaccinated, neutered, microchipped, est. birthdate 6/2/2018.  Adoption fee $200.00.  
 Please submit an adoption application,
https://twobytworescue.com/adopting/

name: Maximus
description: Hiya! The name is Maximus!  I am a cute six-month-old puppy that is just full of myself!!  In other words I have lots of energy and a big load of âpersonality!â  I came to the shelter as a stray. Yep, Animal Control brought me in. I was never claimed by my family and now I am up for adoption! I have all of my vaccinations, I am heartworm negative, I have a microchip, and I have been neutered. I am what they call a âteenageâ puppy.  That means I am kind of big and goofy.  I will need training in good doggie manners and work on leash walking skills.  I canât wait to learn every thing you can teach me, because I want to be a good boy!

name: Rosie
description:
Rosie survived being starved in a neglectful hoarding situation. After everything she endured, she is a sweetheart that she chooses her person above all things. She just wants to be someone's special girl and return the companionship. 

Sorry her pictures could be better. She is not as tall as your knee and about the size of a rat terrier, only a little thicker. She weighed 18 pounds at her spay.  

Her foster Mom thinks she would do best with fenced yard, no underground fence, and another dog in the home. She'd be easy have on a  crate training schedule.  She does not mind the crate. 

Rosie is approximately 2 years old. She is spayed, microchip, up-to-date on rabies, Bordetella and booster, DHPP, and taking flea, tick, and heartworm prevention. 

$250 adoption fee. For an application, Please email were4dogs@gmail.com

name: Gretchen
description: Meet Gretchen! Gretchen has been at the shelter since January 2016. She has been overlooked for too long. She is polite so she does not stand out when folks are looking for outgoing, instead of polite with doggie manners.  She gets along with most dogs! Gretchen is a sponsored dog so her fee is only $20! Come meet her at the shelter Tuesday-Saturday 11am-3pm.

name: Sam
description: This is Sam. He just woke up when we took this photo.  He smiles when he's awake & with friends.  He's pretty young and is a bulldog mix.  He's a very happy energetic pup!  He loves meeting new friends.  Come meet this young man... Sam is quite the charmer

name: Bootsie
description:
Adoption fee - $100

Bootsie is about 7 years old lab mix, and loves to swim.  These dog are in our rescue partners home for awhile now just waiting for the right home to come along. We've decided to adopt all these rescue dogs locally.

Bootsie has friends at the fosters house who could be adopted along with her for a friend.

Paws of Dixie Animal Rescue adopts in the New England area and locally here in Alabama. Our adoption fee includes the spay/neuter, up to date shots, Microchip, Alabama Health Certificate, and the transport service to get the new family pet to you if located up north

The pets are delivered by a licensed transporter.

PDAR.info@gmail.com

**To see all of our pets available for adoption, please copy this link.

https://www.petfinder.com/search/pets-for-adoption/?shelter_id%5B0%5D=AL450&sort%5B0%5D=recently_added


COMPLETED APPLICATIONS TAKE PRECEDENCE OVER INQUIRIES. If you are interested in adopting, the FIRST step is to complete an application.

Please copy and paste the following URL for the adoption application:

https://goo.gl/forms/oPC0SnGUB0aC4Mrr2

Please be advised that our volunteers are busy rescuing, transporting, and caring for our animals. We will respond to your application as soon as possible. Upon review of your application, the rescue in AL will contact you, so you can ask any specific questions that you may have.

NOTE: All Paws of Dixie animals are located in AL foster homes. They will be transported north after adoption.

If there is more than one decision maker in the home, all of them should be in agreement.

We DO NOT adopt to anyone under the age of 21.

Thank you for your understanding and consideration.

name: Maple
description: Maple is a beautiful girl who is a total sweetheart!  Being young and energetic, she hopes to have a home with a fenced yard to run, play, and share in family fun and activities. She enjoys other dogs, and is great with the children in her foster home. House and crate trained, est. birthdate is August 2017,vaccinated, spayed, microchipped. Adoption fee $200.00. She can't wait to prove her love with a family to call her own!  Please submit an application, https://twobytworescue.com/adopting/

name: Tilly
description: During my time spent with my Weekend Warrior, I was found to be:Good in the Car?:	 Yes - she will sit in the passenger seat and calmly put her head out of the window OR lay down and sleep in your lap : ) 	Good with other Dogs?:	She has done well on leash walks with dogs! When she first meets a dog she gets hyped up and can occasionally nip at their hind quarters. 	After 5 minutes of walking she settles into the new dog as the novelty wears off and stops the nipping, starts to play bow and feel more comfy. Successfully played off leash with my mellow spayed female dog. See a video of them here: https://youtu.be/RbMIC3NpWoI Good with Cats?:	I feel like she would chase them! Walks by them with not a lot of interest when they are still, but when she sees them run she acts like she wants to go after them. I would recommend intro-ing on leash to cats. 	 Good with Kids?:	She is good with more calm kids like her favorite kid EVER in her pic. Higher energy louder kids scare her. She will let out a low growl and cower. Housebroken?:	Don't know. She peed and pooped in her crate when I had her over night. 	 	Good in crate?:	Yes! Did not cry at all! 	 Good on leash?:	She is OK on leash! She pulls some but not too bad. She will respond super well to training so leash walking should be a breeze after training!		Works for food?:		YES! Super food motivated. Makes her so easy to train! Works for toys?:		YES! She loves tennis balls. Will play fetch! Also loves to play tug. 	Energy Level?: Medium. She needs physical and mental exercise, but will pass out on the couch with you after the exercise. WEEKEND WARRIOR MOM: Meredith Dempsey 09/19/19**In regards to Tilly's last dog-dog evaluation of a 4**During a dog to dog evaluation, Tilly is kept on a leash while facing the helper dog that also comes in on leash. Tilly watched helper dog, Lori, come in, she had body language that indicated high arousal. When Lori turned to exit the room, Tilly went forward to snap at Lori's haunches. While it is one of the most common ways for dogs to meet, dogs meeting nose to nose on leash is not the natural way dogs would greet each other. In an effort to further figure out Tilly's dog sociability Olivia (behavior assessor) and Meredith (staff member) took Tilly on a parallel leash walk with another helper dog, an intact male named Herbert. Parallel leash walks allow dogs to greet each other in a more natural/friendly way. Dogs do not approach each other head on but instead from the side. Upon seeing Herbert, Tilly showed interest, eyes and ears directed forward with tail up but did not vocalize or lunge. Her gaze on Herbert was easily redirected using food - which is a great! Tilly walked by Herbert, calmly observing him in bursts of high energy without any vocalizing, lunging or snapping - again easily redirected by food. After 5 minutes of walking/calm observation, Tilly's body language calmed as the novelty of Herbert waned. When offered Herbet's backside to sniff, Tilly did so gently. She sniffed calmly for 3-5 seconds and did not try to lunge, snap, bite, vocalize or domineer Herbert in any way. When Herbert would go around to interact with Tilly, Tilly would step back and become weary again, nervous about Herbert's focus on her. We resumed parallel leash walking and Tilly's stress level waned again. 5 more minutes pass and Tilly allows Herbert to smell her backside. Upon feeling uncomfortable with the interaction, Tilly sits down removing her backside from Herbert's investigation. No vocalization, lunging, or snapping was given to Herbert to indicate feelings of unease. Tilly and Herbert resume walking together on leash amicably. I feel that Tilly will need structured intros to new dogs because she is a frustrated greeter. A dog that gets over aroused at the sight of novel dogs. She needs time for the novelty to wane and the trust in the other dog to build so that she can settle into the relationship/interaction. Tilly would do best in a home with a calmer/neutral dog that would not escalate a situation and/or make Tilly feel uncomfortable by a lot of unfocused high energy. Adoptable TILLY has a lot enthusiasm for life! She will greet you with exhuberence but has practiced lots of impulse control skills during our WoofPack dog training class. Her junior volunteer trainer, Parker Verant 8.5 years old, has taught TILLY how to: watch, sit, touch, roll over, play dead and even lay down on a mat on her own with no cues!!During my time spent with a volunteer I was found to be: Did I come to the front of the kennel to greet you? Yes 	Was I easy to get out of the kennel? Yes 	Was I outgoing? Yes						Was I afraid to go thru doorways? No 	 Did I bark at you? No 						 Did I pull a lot on the leash?	No				Was I super interested in other dogs?	Somewhat		Was I nervous about other people?	No			Was I nervous about kids? 	No			Did I have a lot of energy outside?	Yes			Did I play with toys outside?	Yes				Was I cuddly?	Somewhat						 Did I go to the bathroom while I was outside?	Yes	Did I have pee/poop in my kennel before I went out?	NoComments: Very sweet....High energy...Very fast learner.....

name: Kallie
description: Oh, hi. I am Kallie.  I had a home that I loved, but the other dog at the house, kept attacking me.  I really donât understand why it was happening.  Anyway for my safety my family brought me to the shelter to find a new home.  I am a Catahoula mix and I have all of my vaccinations, I am heartworm negative, I have a microchip, and I have been spayed.  I am only worried about one thing. I am about nine years oldâ¦.will anyone want to adopt me at my age? Oh golly I sure hope so, because I can still give lots of doggie kisses and lay beside you at night when you are reading, watching television, or sleeping.  See I can still do lots of âfunâ things! FYI...I am in a foster home right now, so if you want to see me please call the shelter so my foster mom can bring me in! She says all I want to do is find a soft place to sleep!  I am not a bother at all!!  Also, everyone says that my fur is so soft it's like petting a chinchilla! Wouldn't you like to snuggle up to me and my soft coat??

name: KAYTEE
description:
Kaytee is a lovable senior dog. She is estimated to be around 8/9 years 
old but like most MinPins, she is still active and a great watch dog. Of 
course, her favorite past time is lying on the couch right up next to 
her owner. She gets along with other dogs but is happiest being the 
\"only lap dog.\" Kaytee is spayed and on heartworm prevention and ins 
18/20lbs. She is housetrained to a doggy door and to 
peepads/newspapers.?? She would make a great companion for a retired 
person(s). Home visit, vet reference, adoption fee, and fenced yard is 
required. Prefer home to be in Birmingham metro area only. For more information, please email chalkitup@bellsouth.net.

name: SAMMY
description:
Sammy is a sweet, lovable Chihuahua. He likes to snuggle on the couch 
and in cold weather, he loves to warm his bum in front of a space 
heater! He is estimated at 4 years old and weighs 13 lbs. He is good with 
other dogs but does bark at the cats in the front yard of my home! He 
would do good with a playful companion. Like most Chi's, he would 
probably do best with older children. He is neutered and on Heartworm 
prevention. He is house trained to a doggy door. Home visit, vet 
reference, adoption fee, and fenced yard is required. Prefer home in Birmingham metro area only. For more information, please email chalkitup@bellsouth.net.

name: Winston (AL)
description:
Hi Schnauzer Lovers:

Meet Winston (thatâs me) !!  I am being fostered near Birmingham, AL.  If you read the rest of my bio and you have the right home for me (must be Schnauzer experienced, and no children living there or visiting), then please fill out an application and ask for Winston in Alabama.


I am that little bundle of love, mischief, and energy level out the roof, looking back at you. Yes, I am adorable, after all I am a Schnauzer! I am one year old, weigh 20 pounds and I am tireless. My foster parents say I cannot be worn down (which is probably true). I am a very smart, sweet and loving companion to anyone who takes the time and patience to get to know and love me. You will have to earn my trust, but when you do, you will be rewarded in every sense of the word.

WinstonD3I am house trained, play fetch tirelessly, and I become a couch potato after dark, and will sleep no where except in the bed snuggled up next to you (and I do mean touching). I do not need an invitation, it is automatic with me. I need a fenced in yard as I love to run, and trust me, you cannot begin to keep up. I love other Schnauzers, and I will let them be the dominate force if that is their thing, but if not, I will take over. I really must have a home that has another dog friendly dog. I will do a lot better at bonding if I have a brother or sister to play with. In fact I need a companion to help use up some of this energy. 

I also need a home with no children as I play too rough, and prospective parents definitely need to be Schnauzer experienced. If you think you have what it takes to love me and be my forever adopted parents, then give me a try, you wonât be disappointed, I promise!

WinstonD4By the way, I might as well confessâ¦I HATE GROOMING !! ..... (bathing tolerated), and...NO CRATES  for me please!!

name: REMI
description: Remi is a beagle hound mix. She is a sister to Ruger who is also available for adoption.  Her owner moved away and Remi needs a home. Remi is up to date on vaccines, neutered and on heartworm preventative. If you are interested in Remi and or Ruger go to our website: www.animaladoption.org and fill out an application. Email the application to aaas2808@gmail.com.

name: RUGER
description: Ruger is a beagle hound mix. He is a brother to Remi who is also available for adoption.  His owner moved away and Ruger needs a home. Ruger is up to date on vaccines, neutered and on heartworm preventative. If you are interested in Ruger and or Remi go to our website: www.animaladoption.org and fill out an application. Email the application to aaas2808@gmail.com.

name: Bailey "courtesy"
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.

All of our adoptable animals are in the care of volunteer foster parents. The foster families provide a safe place for the animal until placement. If you are interested in meeting a particular dog, please email us info@alabamaspca.org.

Not sure you're ready to adopt? Fostering an animal may be a great way to find out if you're ready! Ask about our Foster-to-Adopt Program

Can't Adopt or Foster? Maybe you'd like to provide sponsorship for an animal. Sponsors are needed to help with vet care expenses as well as food, flea/tick/heartworm prevention, etc. Monetary donations may be sent via http://paypal.com to donations@alspca.org. You may also mail your donation to Alabama SPCA, P.O. Box 78, Northport, AL 35476

For more information, please contact us at info@alabamaspca.org

***COURTESY LISTING***
Bailey is currently 22 lbs & aprpox. 5 months old. She is a hound mix sweetie! She is a very mild mannered puppy. She is a great car rider. She just lays in the front seat & looks at you with those big eyes or naps. She is current on vaccinations. She will be spayed, when she's old enough. I would love for her to go to a home with another dog to play with. She loves to play with other dogs!

'COURTESY LISTING' animals are posted to assist an individual in placing an adoptable animal in a permanent home. ALSPCA does not foster, sponsor, or evaluate these animals. Therefore, ALSPCA makes no representations and expressly disclaims any and all liability as to the temperament and/or health of these animals. Please contact the individual as these are private adoptions processed through current owners, shelters, and fosters.

For more information, please contact:

Our Adoption Fee is $125, unless otherwise noted, and goes towards the vet expenses for the animals in our care. Included in the adoption contribution is spay/neuter surgery, age appropriate vaccines, and microchip.

For more information, please contact us via email

info@alabamaspca.org

name: Hooch
description: Meet Hooch! This sweetheart is waiting for his forever family to come and adopt him! Hooch is a bully mix, neutered, and is estimated to be 2 years old. Come meet this beautiful boy Tuesday-Saturday 11AM-3PM.

name: Candy B
description:
Please contact Vickie (dvbrooks57@gmail.com) for more information about this pet.She's as sweet as Candy! Just the name for this girl! A Lab mix with beautiful eyes and a shiny coat of black with a white accent, she's 10 months old and weighs 47 pounds. Candy is very good with other dogs and people, too. Unfortunately, though, she struggles with being alone and so suffers from separation anxiety. She will need an adopter who is patient and perhaps a trainer/behaviorist to offer some tips.LOWER FEE!!DS 3/ 19/19 update 5/28/19 update 8/18/19
*It is rare that we know with certainty the ages or mixes that make up our wonderful dogs, but we do our best to be as accurate as possible based upon our many years in rescue.**

Transport $120, if needed : We consider the transport to be of great importance and, as such, take particular care of the dogs during the trip . We make every effort to arrive with healthy and minimally stressed dogs.

name: Wanda B lower fee
description:
Please contact Vickie (dvbrooks57@gmail.com) for more information about this pet.*
WANDA
SPAYED

11 MONTHS OLD

AROUND 50 LBS

CAME INTO THE SHELTER PREGNANT

HEARTWORM NEG

MEET WANDA.... HER FOSTER MOM SAY SHE IS A SWEET GIRL. SHE LOVES ATTENTION, AND BEING WITH PEOPLE. SHE IS GOOD WITH OTHER DOGS. SHE WILL BE A GREAT ADDITION TO ANY FAMILY.
TN 3/ 11/ 19

Transport, if needed : We consider the transport to be of great importance and, as such, take particular care of the dogs during the trip from Alabama. name: Spirit
description:
Spirit was found in the middle of a bridge and thought to be dead.  She was collapsed and not moving.  However, when picked up she was found to be alive and taken to a Vet.  She was simply malnourished and too weak to move.  
   She is estimated to be just under a year old this May 2019.   She is housetrained to use a doggy door in her current foster home.  She is in a home with multiple other dogs and is good with all of them, loves to run and play like a healthy, happy puppy should.  She has completed all her vaccinations, is wormed, on monthly heartworm preventative and is spayed.  
 We asks all of our potential families to fill out one of our adoption applications found on our website at Caawarescue.com.  All fields must have something in them for it to send, even if you put an X or NA.  If you have any questions our email address is Caawarescue@yahoo.com.   Our adoption fee of $125 helps to cover our vet bills
   Please consider giving this sweet girl the loving forever home she deserves.

name: Bailey R
description:
Bailey's foster accidently took him in because, although he was the neighbor's dog, Bailey decided he preferred him over his original owners. He kept getting away from them and coming to the foster's house. The neighbors said he could stay. And the foster would happily keep him; he's a good dog. However, this one-year-old German Shepherd mix goes after cats and doesn't really like the foster's other dog. Never having been aggressive towards people, he likes people in general as he has had successful visits to the vet and other places. We don't know for sure about children. He is an intelligent fella who needs some training; his foster feels that he hasn't been trained prior to living with him. He needs to be reminded not to jump on people when he happily greets them; he forgets that he weighs 50 pounds. Bailey might do best in a home with not other pets, and a fenced backyard would be great! (POSTED 5/26/19, R)
**It is rare that we know with certainty the ages or mixes that make up our wonderful dogs, but we do our best to be as accurate as possible based upon our many years in rescue.**
Adoption: $325 which covers quarantine, shots, worming, food, medical records, spaying/neutering, microchip and an Alabama State Health Certificate.
Transport, if needed : $120.00 We consider the transport to be of great importance and, as such, take particular care of the dogs during the trip from Alabama. We make every effort to arrive with healthy and minimally stressed dogs.

name: Holly
description:
Holly is a very lucky dog to be here! After her original owners dumped her miles from home, Holly found her way back. When they realized that they couldnât dump her, they were planning on shooting her until a neighbor rescued her. 
Holly is a very energetic dog that loves to play. She LOVES children but can play a little rough. She needs to be adopted to a home with a fenced yard where she will get lots of  attention and exercise. She can jump a fence, so she canât be left outside without supervision. If she gets out, she is a runner.  Holly has been around other dogs, but she is a little dog aggressive. She doesnât need to be in a home with cats either. We recommend her being an only dog in a household.

name: TWISTER
description:
TWISTER, named because she keeps the play going with her brothers and sisters, but loves nothing more than to cuddle in your lap and take a nap. Twister also enjoys splashing in the kiddie Pool with her Brothers and Sisters. Twister has taken her foster parents hearts by storm. She is living inside, sleeping in the bedroom and has become quite the well mannered Little Lady. Twister is House trained, knows to sit and take a treat gently, stay at the door and not run out until invited, and to come when called. She will need strong, gentle leadership and lots of DAILY physical and mental exercise. 
She is expected to grow to LESS THAN 60 pounds. She is current with all of her puppy vaccines and de-wormer and has an excellent start with nutrition, socialization and training.
 Twisterâs pack came to New Hope Rescue because a Lady who professes her love for her 5 grown Pit Bulls made some bad choices and did not get her dogs spay/neutered. (We are working with her to get all of her dogs spay/neutered) We became aware of the situation when these pups were about 3 weeks old. In order to keep the puppies with the Mother, we made regular trips to her home to bring dog food, de-wormer, vaccines and flea and tick treatment. During all of our visits, the Parent dogs never showed any aggression and were always happy to see us and get pets. When the Pups were six weeks old it was agreed by all that the puppies would be in a better place if they came to Grannyâs home to be Fostered. They have been in Home Foster Care since. They have been learning socialization skills from the other dogs here of varying ages (10 months through 14 years old) and various sizes (4 pounds to 85 pounds) They have not been exposed to cats, but with proper introduction, supervision and training, will be a good fit. They love people and children. As puppies they must be supervised with younger children for the protection and training of the puppy and child. New Hope Rescue and Granny have given these pups an excellent nutritional start as well. They are currently on Victor Puppy Food and DYNE vitamin, mineral and calorie supplement. (Victor and Dyne can be ordered at Chewy.com and other places. We are not associated with the Victor Dog Food Co or DYNE co but we highly recommend them both) They also get Grannyâs Chicken and rice cooked for them, and homemade healthy treats. They are exceptionally loving, calm, smart puppies and at 10 weeks of age are already potty pad trained, (They also have a good start at outside to potty) know to sit for a treat and to take it gently, and know to stay at a open door if told to do so while you go through. They are learning âHouse mannersâ as well. Please remember, they are PUPPIES and will need your time, and loving, patient, training and LOTS of chew toys. Lol! They are so full of love and affection to give to their people and only expect the same in return. They are all that is good about the American Bull Terrier breed and when placed with the right person or family, will always be Ambassadors for their breed. 
 PLEASE READ TO THE END. Included in NHR adoption Fee with all dogs and Puppies: UTD with Vaccines, Micro-Chipped, Spay/Neuter included, Treated for internal parasites, and living in a loving Foster Homes learning socialization and house manners, not a stressful Kennel environment. New Hope Rescue is a 501-C3 Not for Profit, All Volunteer Organization. All Proceeds are going to be used to help other rescue dogs and not to pay salaries. Because we are a small rescue we cannot transport out of our immediate area, however if you would like to arrange transportation we may be able to work with you. WE WILL ONLY CONSIDER HOMES THAT WILL MAKE THEIR DOG(S) A PART OF THE FAMILY. To schedule a Meet and Greet please fill out an application HERE: www.nhrescue.com Come and meet NEW HOPE RESCUE and some of our Fosters at PETSMART in Tiger Town Shopping Center (next to Home Depot) Opelika, AL from 10am-2pm CT on the 2nd Saturday of each month!

name: LEE
description:
LEE is a very good boy!  Very mellow and sweet. He is also very smart and learns quickly. He loves nothing more than to please you or to be in your lap cuddling. His other favorite thing is playing or splashing with his Brothers and Sisters in the Kiddie pool.  Lee is a medium energy puppy with so much love to give. He is expected to grow to approximately 60 pounds. Lee has very short hair and grooming requirements are minimal. He is current with all of his puppy vaccines and de-wormer and has an excellent start with nutrition, socialization and training.
 LEEâs pack came to New Hope Rescue because a Lady who professes her love for her 5 grown Pit Bulls made some bad choices and did not get her dogs spay/neutered. (We are working with her to get all of her dogs spay/neutered) We became aware of the situation when these pups were about 3 weeks old. In order to keep the puppies with the Mother, we made regular trips to her home to bring dog food, de-wormer, vaccines and flea and tick treatment. During all of our visits, the Parent dogs never showed any aggression and were always happy to see us and get pets. When the Pups were six weeks old it was agreed by all that the puppies would be in a better place if they came to Grannyâs home to be Fostered. They have been in Home Foster Care since. They have been learning socialization skills from the other dogs here of varying ages (10 months through 14 years old) and various sizes (4 pounds to 85 pounds) They have been exposed to cats and had no reaction to them.  They love people and children.  New Hope Rescue and Granny have given these pups an excellent nutritional start as well. They are currently on Victor Puppy Food and DYNE vitamin, mineral and calorie supplement. (Victor and Dyne can be ordered at Chewy.com and other places. We are not associated with the Victor Dog Food Co or DYNE Co but we highly recommend them both) They also get Grannyâs Chicken and rice cooked for them, and homemade healthy treats. They are exceptionally loving, calm, smart puppies. They know to go out to potty or will use a potty pad.  They know to sit for a treat and to take it gently, and know to stay at a open door if told to do so while you go through. They are also learning âHouse mannersâ. They are so full of love and affection to give to their people and they only expect the same in return. They are all that is good about the American Bull Terrier breed and when placed with the right person or family, will always be Ambassadors for their breed. 
 PLEASE READ TO THE END. Included in NHR adoption Fee with all dogs and Puppies: UTD with Vaccines, Micro-Chipped, Spay/Neuter included, Treated for internal parasites, and living in a loving Foster Homes learning socialization and house manners, not a stressful Kennel environment. Because we are a small rescue we cannot transport out of our immediate area, however if you would like to arrange transportation we may be able to work with you.
