name: Shelby
description: All dogs adopted through Troy Animal Rescue Project are up to date on vaccinations, spayed/neutered, and heartworm negative. Adoption fee is $50. Home visit and vet reference required.

name: Chief
description: Chief is a hunter, and once on a scent he lets you know with his classic Coondog Howl. However, he is also happy staying with his family in the house and curling up in a chair. We estimate him to have been born in 2012, but it's possible he is a little older. Chief will need a large back yard to hunt in safely.

name: Clancy
description: Clancy is afraid of loud noises and busy roads. Cars speeding by scare him and he would not do well being walked on a leash in a busy neighborhood with lots of cars always going by. He has also succeeded in \"escaping\" from collars and harnesses when adoptees attempted to walk him. Therefore, a fenced in yard would be required for the adoption to be approved and the adoptee would need to understand that it will take a little longer than usual for Clancy to adapt to his new home. Clancy is very sweet and would be a great companion and pet to the person who would be willing to invest their time and love to Clancy. His new home would need to allow Clancy to be an inside dog, and to only be put in the fenced in yard when he needs to go outside to do his business. He knows how to use a doggie door, and if you do not have a doggie door, he will scratch the door when he needs to go out, or wants to come in. Please contact us if you are interested in adopting Clancy.

name: Arlee
description: Arlee has a lot of energy and loves to play. Arlee's DNA revealed he is a mix of Carolina Dog and German Shepherd (Level 2), Southern Black Mouth Cur (Level 4), and Labrador Retriever & Whippet (Level 5). Arlee will do best in a home with another dog to play with and needs a fenced in yard to keep him safe while playing.

name: Levi
description:
Hello, 
I was found standing in the middle of road in Alabater by this sweet lady that luckily stopped and picked me up & took me to see if I was microchipped to find my owner but I didn't have one so therefore she is trying to find me anither great home.  This group no nothing about me except that I'm house trained, allergic to cats and a very loving pup.  I will be neutered & up to date on vaccinations before adopted, if you are interested please email us at kbailey772@gmail.com

name: Dixie
description:
Dixie is a very sweet senior gal.  She is in need of a new forever home with people that will love her and take care of her.  She is small dog at about 14lbs and she's appears to be something like a chi/terrier mix with short hair. She is a very happy and friendly girl and will make a great pet.

Dixie is residing at Blair Animal Rescue in Cleveland, AL.

Please call or text Ann Blair at 256-425-6069 (cell) or call 256-425-6069 (landline) if you are interested.  Please be patient as our mailboxes are sometimes full.

name: Dumpling
description:

name: Frankie
description:
Frankie is a lightweight at about 40 lbs but he is too tall to call a medium dog.  He is high energy so small children may not be a good fit for him.  He plays hard and fast and a small child could easily be knocked over in play.  He is very playful but will stop for some affection any day.  He will be about 2 years old this coming October 2018.  
  He is housetrained, fully vaccinated, neutered and heartworm negative.  He is also microchipped.  
   Frankie is in need of someone who can give him the affection and approval he seeks.  He is eager to please and needs someone to love.  
  Our adoption fee for all dogs and puppies is only $125...this covers all his shots, his neuter, he is heartworm checked and is negative and he is microchipped.  
    Frankie was taken from the local county animal shelter prior to being euthanized.  He has some serious scars on his face that extend to the back of his head.  
   If you have any questions about Frankie  email us at CAAWARescue@yahoo.com or visit our website CAAWARescue.com.

name: Homer
description:
Homer is a beautiful 4 year old Walker Hound.  True to his breed, a sweet boy full of love and adventure. Gets along well with other dogs.  All this boy needs is a forever family all his own.  For more information on Homer, please contact us at: adopt@rescuek911.com

Adoption Donation: $100.00
Adoption Application: www.rescuek911.com

name: Brown Sugar
description:
Brown Sugar is a beautiful golden Pocket Pittie.  Approx 3-4 years of age., 40lbs.  Has been spayed and current on her shots. Brown  Gets along well with other dogs. Very well socialized, full of love and kisses which would turn any bad day into a good one.  A fun loving girl with a funny streak, full of personality.   For more information on Brown Sugar, please contact us at: adopt@rescuek911.com. Don't let this great girl pass you by.

Adoption Donation: $100.00
Adoption Application: www.rescuek911.com

name: Bob
description:
Bob is a beautiful brindle 18 month old brindle pup.  He and his sister Jewel came to us after being found in the middle of a road abandoned.  Very well socialized, loves to play, very active and sweet and a puppy at heart..  Bob would require an experienced dog owner, and probably a home without other dogs.  Bob is fearful of dogs and people he does not know. A patient and local owner would be ideal as to come and get to know Bob. He has been neutered and current on his shots.  Approx 45lbs Please let us know if we can answer anymore questions on Bob at: adopt@rescuek911.com

Adoption Donation: $100.00
Adoption Application: www.rescuek911.com

Medication cost is approximately $30/ month.

description:
Ruffles came to TARP via Troy Pound in Troy, AL. She was severely emaciated, with large sores on her body from neglect. It took several months but now Ruffles is ready for adoption. Ruffles would do better in a single dog home or with one other large dog. She is very energetic so we recommend a home that does not have small children. She would love a home with someone who runs or spends a lot of time outdoors.

name: Henry
description: Henry(153) is a brindle, neutered, 3 yr old male American bulldog mix.  He has been at the shelter since 10/11/2015.  He is great with humans, but needs help becoming friends with other dogs. No cats or other dogs in household recommended.  Henry is an energetic guy.  You'll get lots of exercise playing lots with this buddy.

name: Snap
description: Ginger and Snap came to the shelter together.  Either one will warm your heart and keep you company for a long, long time.  They both get along with the other animals and are friendly to the new faces at the shelter.  Each one is ready for a new home.   Both are loving and so friendly.  They were resting at the time of these photos.  Lets bring them out of the shelter and consider adding one to your family.

name: Ginger
description: Ginger and Snap came to the shelter together.  Either one will warm your heart and keep you company for a long, long time. name: Thyme
description: Thyme was born late 2016.  She is VERY SWEET.  She is energetic with a GREAT disposition.  Thyme is very, very loving. Thyme is going to be a big girl.  She had to have surgery on her eye and is all better.  She sees great and doesn't know anything is different.  Thyme can smother her new family with love and dedication, she is sooooo ready.

name: 2 Shuz
description:
7/26/17 This is a courtesy post. If you are interested in rescuing or adopting this dog, please contact Rand by email theellardplace@aol.com

2 Shuz is about 7 mos old, good with other dogs and OK with cats. She is up to date on shots, housebroken, crate trained and walks good on a leash. Very smart and learns quick. She is also on heart worm prevention.
2 Shuz is super friendly and just wants to play with everybody. She does settle down and would probably be fine with an older person or small kids.

You'll fall in love with his wiggle butt!

description:
I was adopted out to a family 1 1/2 years ago along with my sister and now they have called and stated they don't want us anymore, so I am up for adoption again.
Please, if you are interested in me and my sister email Kim at kbailey772@gmail.com.

WE ARE FIXED, UP TO DATE ON VACCINATIONS AND ON HEARTWORM PREVENTATIVE.

WE NEED TO BE ADOPTED TOGETHER...

SERIOUS INQUIRIES ONLY....

name: Yoda
description: Yoda is a sweet, loyal and loving girl. Her short little legs are oh so adorable! Yoda will \"talk\" or howl lightly when she gets excited about going for a walk or getting food. She likes being your co-pilot on car rides. Oh how she enjoys tummy rubs and gives small, sweet kisses in return. If Yoda feels she needs attention, she'll nudge you with her nose for petting and head scratches. She would love to sleep in the bed if you'll let her, but is also very good at sleeping in her own bed when told. Yoda can get nervous during thunderstorms, but cuddling and being near will calm her. She wants you to know that she's fine with cats, but not a fan of dogs and should be your only doggie companion. Yoda hasn't been with children. Est. birthdate May 2014, vaccinated, spayed, and micro chipped. If you believe she's the match for you, Please submit an adoption application, https://twobytworescue.com/adopting/       Her adoption fee is $200.00

name: Max
description: This Is Max.  He came to the shelter on 9/1/2015 and he and 3 of his litter mates are still here!  Max is very shy!  He needs lots of time and attention to help socialize him, but he is very sweet.  He gets along well with his kennel mates and others here at the shelter.  He weighs 28lbs, has been neutered and is up to date on all shots.  Please someone take him home!

name: Buttercup
description:
Buttercup arrived at the shelter on 9/1/2015.  She was 5mths old.  She has grown up here and is now almost 2.  

Buttercup has been at the shelter since late 2015.  She was a pup and has grown at the shelter.  Buttercup is shy and really needs someone who can take a lot of time with her.   She is very sweet and gets along well with her kennel mates.  

She is medium size and weighs 33lbs. She is up to date on all shots, has been spayed and is ready to go!

name: JackyBlackie
description:
Blackie is a little Black Lab.  He arrived at the shelter on 9/1/2015.   
He was a baby when he arrived.   Jackie is shy, but easily persuaded.  He likes time and attention.  He is medium size and weighs 32 lbs.  He is up to date on shots and has been neutered.
Come and see Blackie, he'd love to have company with the hope of a forever home.

name: Dixie
description: Dixie is very active and is a very good escape artist. She will squeeze through, climb up, jump over or whatever it takes to be out of her pen and to be with her human. But the love she gives you is worth all her effort! She has medium energy, and is very submissive. She will lay down and roll over on her back for both people and other dogs. Her DNA revealed Lab/Retriever consisting of Cheasapeake Bay Retriever and Nova Scotia Duck Tolling Retriever on her moms side, and Beagle, Chow Chow and Maremma Sheepdog on her dads side. Pictures of her parents are available.

name: Geena
description: Geena is a sweet girl with lots of love to give. She loves to swim and hunt, but also loves to sit with you in your chair! She will do all she can do to stay with her master, and loves to ride in the car and go with you when you leave. She also has a tendency to bark for a while, but will stop if you ask her to be quiet. Geena needs a fenced in yard to safely play and hunt in.

name: LuLu
description:
LuLu is a beautiful mix.  Approx 7 years old, spayed and current on her vaccines.  Housetrained. Would do best in a home where she is the only dog or with another with supervision.

Lulu is sweet and gentle.  She was a little timid when she came in, but she loves unconditional and wants the same in return.  So loving and very protective of her owner. Follows commands well.  

For more information on LuLu, please contact us at: adopt@rescuek911.com

Adoption Application: www.rescuek911.com
Adoption Donation: $100.00

name: Joey
description:
Joey is a precious Whippet and Roadrunner mix I think...lol.  Can run like the wind and can jump like a kangaroo, hence the name. Would make a great running partner.  Approx 6 months old and 20lbs of joy.  Could use some puppy training classes for obedience. Would need daily exercise.  Very loving and social.  For more information on Joey please contact us at: adopt@rescuek911.com

Adoption Application: www.rescuek911.com
Adoption Donation: $100.00

name: Baxter
description:
What does Baxter do best? LOVE you that's what! All he really wants is to be your big lap baby. He is a laid back, easy going kind of guy that likes snuggles and hugs more than anything. Taking you for long walks, chew bones, and toys are at the top of his list too. Baxter promises to be your best friend, loving all people. He is good with dogs, but should have proper introduction especially with little ones. But cats- nope, definitely not a fan of cats. Baxter would be fine with older children. He is a smart boy that learns quickly, and is house and crate trained. 
Est. birthdate is Dec. 2009, vaccinated, neutered, microchipped, and ready to share his heart all day every day ! His adoption fee is $200.00
If you are in love with this wonderful hunk of sweetness and would like to adopt him as a family member, Please submit an adoption application, https://twobytworescue.com/adopting/

name: Sassy
description:
Sassy is a friendly young dog Bird Dog/Australian Shepherd mix that gets along with everyone.  She is in need of a new forever home with people that will love her and take care of her. She is about full grown and is medium sized.  She is a very happy and friendly girl and will make a great pet.  She loves the water.

Sassy is residing at Blair Animal Rescue in Cleveland, AL.  Due to the recent passing of Roy Blair, we are in need of reducing our headcount. 

Please call or text Ann Blair at 256-425-6069 (cell) or call 256-425-6069 (landline) if you are interested.  Please be patient as our mailboxes are sometimes full.

name: Precious
description: Primary Color: Chocolate Age: 3yrs 9mths 1wks

name: Roxie
description: Primary Color: White Secondary Color: Black Age: 3yrs 8mths 3wks

name: Patches
description: Patches is a sweetheart but tends to stay to himself. Yet he loves to sit with you while you watch tv and loves to be loved. He will be so happy when he gets to go home with his forever family! His DNA revealed Lab/Retriever consisting of Cheasapeake Bay Retriever and Nova Scotia Duck Tolling Retriever on his moms side, and Beagle, Chow Chow and Maremma Sheepdog on his dads side. Pictures of his parents are available.

name: Guiness
description:
Guinness equals true companionship, unconditional love, devotion, and plenty of it! His eyes sparkle, his whole butt wiggles, and his huge grin from ear to ear proves the affection for his people! He would enjoy a fenced yard to run, play, and exercise. Guinness should have proper introduction when meeting other dogs, as he likes most but not all. It's just that he gets excited and can have a hard time curbing his enthusiasm.  This handsome fella  lives in a loving foster home where he's house and crate trained. If you think Guinness could be the buddy you're looking for, Please submit an adoption application, https://twobytworescue.com/adopting/
 He's neutered, vaccinated, and micro chipped, est. birthdate October 2013. Adoption fee $200.00

name: Lylith
description:
Lylith is an adorable senior Poodle mix. She's very cuddly and loving. She is great with kids, dogs, and even cats!   She's house trained and loves car rides. 
Her adoption fee is $100.00.  She's vaccinated, spayed, and micro chipped.
Please submit an adoption application, https://twobytworescue.com/adopting/

name: Emma
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.

  All of our adoptable animals are in the care of volunteer foster parents. The foster families provide a safe place for the animal until placement. If you are interested in meeting a particular dog, please email us info@alabamaspca.org.

You may also mail your donation to Alabama SPCA, P.O. Box 78, Northport, AL 35476

 Little Miss Emma always has a smile on her face. This sweet little love is sister to Duke and all around a total gem. Emma loves to play with her siblings, chase everyone around the yard and receive belly rubs. She loves attention from her foster mom and can't contain her excitement when she comes back home. Emma is up to date on vaccinations and spayed



   Our Adoption Fee is $125, unless otherwise noted, and goes towards the vet expenses for the animals in our care. Included in the adoption contribution is spay/neuter surgery, age appropriate vaccines, and microchip.

name: Krusty
description:
Krusty is one of our seniors.  Approx 8 years old but still runs and plays with all the younger dogs.  45lbs, current on vaccines. heartworm negative. Please let us know if we can answer anymore questions on this great dog, Krusty @adopt@rescuek911.com

Adoption Donation: $100.00

name: Lady Violet- great with children
description: Lady Violet is an adorable lady who loves her people, including children.  Playtime and cuddling are her absolute favorites! Her cute under bite and beautiful smile are sure to make your heart happy.  She is crate and house trained and knows how to use a doggie door. She enjoys chasing tennis balls, and would make a good running/walking partner. Being a smart girl, and treat motivated, Lady Violet knows commands to sit, shake, stay, and lay down.  This pretty girl is watchful and will alert you when company has arrived.  She prefers to be the only dog living in the home, and isn't a fan of cats.  Her adoption fee is $200.00.  She is spayed, vaccinated, and micro chipped, estimated DOB is July 2012.  Please submit an adoption application, https://twobytworescue.com/adopting/

description:

Meet the lovely little Shyla! This super sweet girl is all about people. We are unsure on her lineage but best guess we think there is some petite terrier and a few other smaller breeds. Shyla enjoys playing with other dogs, children and cuddling . She is a little shy at first but once she warms up her sweet disposition and loving nature really shine through. One of the totally adorable things that Shyla does is pat your arm with her paw when she needs a little attention. Although she has only been around a few cats she did bark at them but did not chase them. Shyla is great on a leash but would do best with a fenced in yard where she can run and play. Shyla is crate trained, up to date on vaccinations and spayed. If you are interested in Shyla please visit www.alabamaspca.org

name: Astra
description: Astra is a little shy and will take a little longer to adjust to her new forever home. She stops and lays down when frightened by loud noises or other dogs running up to her. She also loves to lay in your lap and be loved!

name: Jasmine
description:
Jasmine is a beautiful and precious Staffie.  She is loving and gets along well with other dogs.  All the volunteers call her 'wiggle butt' as she greets you with her whole being. She had a hard life before coming into rescue.  She was not taken care of and had many litters.  She is now spayed and heartworm negative Approx 4-5 years old, 60lbs  For more information on this great dog, Jasmine, please contact us at: adopt@rescuek911.com

Adoption Application: www.rescuek911.com
Adoption Donation: $100.00

name: Zuki
description:
Hey,

I'm Ruki and I was saved by this rescue from being put to sleep at a High Kill Shelter, no one wanted to give me a chance.  My foster Mom says I am a great dog, she thinks I might have been trained as a therapy dog before or at least well trained because I love her little girl.  I'm approximately 4 or so years old (really not sure) but either way I'm a good dog.  Please if you are interested in email for an application.  My picture doesn't do me justice.

name: Aspen
description: Aspen is adorable and fun!  She loves to play with tennis balls, and is a great cuddler! Aspen does not like to share her space with other dogs, so she should  be adopted by a family where she will be the only pet.  Aspen is an absolute doll, and we know that if you take the time to meet herâ¦ youâll fall in love. Her adoption fee is $200.00.  Her estimated birthdate is Aug 2014.  She is vaccinated, spayed and microchipped.  Adoption fee is $200.00.   Please submit an adoption application, https://twobytworescue.com/adopting/

name: Missy
description:
Hello,

My name is Missy, I'm the mama of the 5 babies that were found in the dumpster, I'm about 7 years old, house trained and up to date on vaccinations, spayed.  I need a great home where I can live out a life of luxury.  She needs to be an only dog.  Please if you are interested in me email Kim at kbailey772@gmail.com and put in an application for adoption.

name: Jack Flash
description:
Jack Flash is a nervous and shy dog, but loves to run in big open spaces and stay near humans.
He will make a great companion once he feels comfortable around his new family and home.

name: Eve
description:
She is dark, she is mysterious, she is beautiful, her name is Eve,  4-5 year old year old Blue Pittie.   She is spayed and current on her shots.  She gets along well with most dogs, but have to get to know them first.  She loves to play and is a little tease with her toys. She is also very very shy. It will take several visits with Evef or her to get to know you, probably someone with lots of time, patience and pittie experience would be best for her. thank you. Secure fenced in yard required.  
For more information on Eve, please contact us at adopt@rescuek911.com

Adoption Donation: $100.00
Adoption Application: www.rescuek911.com

name: Lizzy
description:
Lizzy is a beautiful black lab mix.  Approx 3-4 years old, 50lbs, spayed and current on her shots.  Heartworm negative. True to her breed, she is very social, playful, gets along with other dogs, and loves to retrieve a ball. For more information on this great dog, please contact us at: adopt@rescuek911.com

Adoption Application: www.rescuek911.com
Adoption Donation: $100.00

name: Boone
description:
Boone, is a happy hound.  Approx 2 years old, 55lbs.  Does get along well with other dogs. True to his breed he loves the outdoors. Boone would do well with a patient family who loves hounds and familiar with the breed. He is a little skiddish around people he does not know at first, but will warm up in time. Would do well with another family dog already established in family.  For more information on Boone, please contact us at adopt@rescuek911.com


Adoption Application: www.rescuek911.com
Adoption Donation - $100.00

name: Nicky
description:
Nicky is very happy for his friend Rocco because he just got adopted.  Nicky also misses Rocco a lot.  The best cure for his blues would be to find a forever home of his own.

Nicky is residing at Blair Animal Rescue in Cleveland, AL.  Due to the recent passing of Roy Blair, we are in need of reducing our headcount.  Please contact us if you are interested.

name: Teddy
description:
Teddy is a beautiful mix.  A little over one year old and approx 55lbs.  Neutered and current on vaccines.  Teddy does not do well with other male dogs. Would do fine with a female friend but not another male dog. For more information on Teddy please contact us: adopt@rescuek911.com

Adoption Donation: $100.00
Adoption Application: www.rescuek911.com

name: Blondie
description:
Blondie is a beautiful Yellow Lab/Pittie mix.  Very loving and social.  Found abandoned in Dadeville.  Needs a forever loving home.  Loves cats. Approx 50lbs, spayed, utd on vaccines and heartworm negative.  For more information on Blondie, please contact us at: adopt@rescuek911.com

Adoption Application: www.rescuek911.com
Adoption Donation - $100.00 -

name: Polly *NEEDS FOSTER HOME*
description:
MEET POLLY!  *THIS GIRL NEEDS OUT OF BOARDING*

Polly is approximately 4 years old, female, weighing approx 45-50lbs. We believe her to be a mutt, so we DNA tested her and it came back American Staffordshire Terrier Mix/Chow Chow mix, so a mutt. She is up-to-date on all vaccinations, spayed, heartworm tested negative so she is on monthly heartworm/flea/tick prevention and microchipped. 

She is an active girl and very SMART! She knows âsitâ, âshakeâ and is working on âwaitâ, âoffâ, âdownâ, and âsettleâ as well as not pulling on leash. Her skills may need some fine tuning since she has not been in a foster home environment in months and is currently boarding.  Polly learns obedience and tricks quickly with positive training & treats. She bonds and respects people quickly...she LOVES her person/people! She aims to please. 

She can be dog selective and does best with male dogs her size and larger, or she will be great as an only dog. We do believe she would do well with children, most likely 10 years or older since she gets excited at times and jumps up. Polly does not need to be in a home with small dogs or cats.  

Sheâs a happy girl but wasnât not given the attention and love she deserves the first chapter of her life! She rides well in the car and is always down to ride shotgun but she does well harnessed or crated in a car as well. She is cratetrained and housetrained. Polly would really like a fenced in backyard of her own she can run and play in, but live as an inside dog and family member. She would also be your girl for adventures and hikes!

Apply to foster-to-adopt or adopt at http://www.pldpr.org 

Adoption Contribution covers: Spay/Neuter, microchip, vet exam, vaccinations, heartworm test, deworm, and all other medical needs prior to adoption. Adoption contribution ranges from $195-300 each. All adoptables are on heartworm prevention (starting at 4 months of age/upon intake) & on flea/tick prevention monthly. PLDP Rescue does NOT have a facility therefore the adoptables are in foster homes (few exceptions) and can only be met prior to the application process at meet & greet events (check our event calendar). Home visits are done AFTER an application and vet reference has been approved. 
Add ALL PLDPR emails to your address book or check your spam folder as we will email applicants questions or to set up the home visit.
Vet references can only be done when vets are open; if you apply on a weekend it will be the following week before a vet reference can be completed.

ARE OUR DOGS HOUSETRAINED? Most are housebroken, crate trained and/or p-p pad trained or working on all mentioned, BUT NOT at YOUR HOUSE - ALL dogs will have/need to be re-trained at their new home. This is not just for rescue dogs, ANY dog going to a new home will have to be re-trained! New food, water, environment, schedule can cause accidents until the dog has time to adjust to all the new things.

Remember by adopting a rescue pet, you are making room for our rescue to save another life.....

name: Vienna *NEEDS FOSTER HOME*
description:
MEET VIENNA!  *THIS GIRL NEEDS OUT OF BOARDING*

Vienna is a beautiful, female American Staffordshire Terrier/Bulldog mix (we have DNA tested her) who is approximately 5 years old. She weighs a healthy 50-55lbs with a gorgeous athletic build.  She is spayed, microchipped, up-to-date on vaccinations, and currently on monthly heartworm/flea/tick prevention. Vienna is crate-trained and house-trained. 

Vienna has a stunning black coat and a gorgeous face to go with it, plus brains! This girl is VERY smart and picks up training quickly! Vienna has a love for things.... balls, frisbees, kongs and more. She would much rather be rewarded with something like that then a treat, but she trains great with positive training methods and treats. She can play frisbee quite well so having a fenced in backyard would be perfect for playing frisbee.  If the right home comes along that does not have a fenced in yard,  then we will discuss adequate leash walking and release of energy for her. 

She would do best in a home as the only dog, or possibly a male dog her size or larger. She is a pure diva and wants all the attention to herself and frankly she deserves it. She gives so much unconditional love to her person/people, it's very flattering to say the least. Vienna is the best side kick to take with you wherever, she loves calmly riding shotgun in the car. She will never let you down and always be by your side.  

Vienna will do best in a home where she can be the center of attention, so maybe the only dog or one other dog (preferably a neutered male). . She is a pure diva and wants all the attention to herself and frankly she deserves it. She gives so much unconditional love to her person/people, it's very flattering to say the least. Vienna is the best side kick to take with you wherever, she loves calmly riding shotgun in the car. She will never let you down and always be by your side.  

She is a wonderful companion who will always greet you with a wagging tail every day. 

She is ready for her next chapter, so please fostering or adopting Vienna!

description: We have dogs and cats of all ages and sizes that could benefit from the home environment provided by foster families. name: Toby
description:
Toby is such a beautiful dog and has the prettiest eyes! Approx 8 months old, this golden/hound mix though only medium size -  thinks he's a big dog!  Current on his vaccines, and neutered.  Loves to play and wants to be with you and play with his toys. Toby seems to be a alpha male and might do best as an only dog. Please let us know if we can answer anymore questions on Toby.
Thank you for choosing Rescue.

$100.00 Adoption Donation

name: Foster Homes Needed
description:
If you love schnauzers, or animals in general, and want to make a difference in their lives, won't you consider fostering for Schnauzer Love Rescue. 

SLR covers a large territory; MS, AL, GA, FL, SC & TN.  There is a need in all the states.  Schnauzers are being euthanized in shelters every day because we do not have enough foster homes to save them all.  Please consider opening your heart & home to these animals in need.

A Vet reference, phone interview, home visit, and 2 personal references are needed to be considered for approval to foster. Vet expenses are covered by the rescue with each Vet visit preapproved by the President of SLR. 

SLR tends to take the old, the forgotten, the unloved and the broken dogs. It is our mission to help these sweet souls become as whole, healthy and happy as possible and to find loving forever homes for them. It will break your heart but as the dog heals & grows in your care you will beam with pride. Nothing you do will be as rewarding as this. 

If you feel you are able to provide a temporary home for a rescued schnauzer, fill out a foster application at www.schnauzerloverescue.org/FosterApplication.htm .Â  .  It will start your journey of a life time of love and sacrifice, yet it will pave your path to heaven as well. If approved you will be joining the SLR family of volunteers.  We are a family in so many ways. Bound by our love of dogs and wish to help those damaged by life, discarded & sometimes in need due to unforeseen circumstances but always victims.

For more information about our organization please visit our website at www.SchnauzerLoveRescue.org .Â 

We thank you & the schnauzers thank you!

name: Scarlet

Scarlet, a beautiful redhead! Approx 6-7 years old.  Spayed and current on her vaccines.  Scarlet was shy at first when she came into rescue but has since warmed up and is doing well.  Gets along well with other dogs. A happy dog and very active.  Loves the outdoors.  For more information on Scarlet, please contact us at: adopt@rescuek911.com

Thank you for choosing Rescue!

name: Trayce
description:
Hello,

My name is Trayce and I was rescued after being put out at a package store along with my siblings at 3 weeks old. I have been in a foster home or a vet clinic for most of my life and don't know what it is to have a family of my own. I am 6 years old and I need a large fenced yard ( no invisible fences ) to play in. If interested, please email us.

name: GOLDIE
description:
MEET GOLDIE! 

Goldie is an adorable, 7 yr old, chihuahua/pug mix. She weighs 14lbs. This girl actually came to us in rescue in 2010 at 6 weeks old. Sadly, after living with her adopted family all these years, she was returned back to us at no fault of her own. We always take our dogs back so we welcomed this girl with open arms. She has been a joy since being back with us. 

Goldie has always lived with other dogs and has done fine, but did become overwhelmed in her previous home because she did not get the attention she deserved and was among way too many dogs. Now that she is in a foster home with 2 other dogs, she is doing great. She also loves kids and shares her foster home with a few. She can be a a little territorial in her crate when she is eating but we have seen no other issues at all. She enjoys her laid back dog friends and loves her people....and belly rubs!! 

She is up-to-date on vaccinations, spayed, microchipped and on monthly heartworm/flea/tick prevention. Goldie prefers to not have to stay in the crate, especially at night by herself so she does well being out at night or even baby gated in a kitchen during the day. She walks very well on a leash and does great with her Freedom No Pull Harness for walks. She is house trained although it does take her about 24-48 hrs to transition into a new, but is smooth sailing after that. 

Goldie has seen a canine chiropractor for her right front leg/elbow just to make sure everything is okay, she sort of has a limp when she trots. Doc said that it is most likely a genetic deformity and there is not much that can be done. She is on joint supplements and doing very well. We also checked her hips and spine and that all checked out great. She is not special needs at all, we just like to disclose all we know about our girl. :) 

This girl deserves a great home that will love her unconditionally! 

If you are interested, please go to our website www.pldpr.org or email us at PeaceLoveDogPawsRescue@gmail.com
_______________________________
Adoption Contribution covers: Spay/Neuter, microchip, vet exam, vaccinations, heartworm test, deworm, and all other medical needs prior to adoption. All adoptables are on heartworm prevention (starting at 4 months of age/upon intake); on flea/tick prevention monthly. PLDP Rescue does NOT have a facility therefore the adoptables are in foster homes (few exceptions) and can only be met prior to the application process at meet & greet events (check our event calendar). Home visits are done AFTER an application and vet reference has been approved.

Add ALL PLDPR emails to your address book or check your spam folder as we will email applicants questions or to set up the home visit.
Vet references can only be done when vets are open; if you apply on a weekend it will be the following week before a vet reference can be completed.

ARE OUR DOGS HOUSETRAINED? Most are housebroken, crate trained and/or p-p pad trained or working on all mentioned, BUT NOT at YOUR HOUSE - ALL dogs will have/need to be re-trained at their new home. This is not just for rescue dogs, ANY dog going to a new home will have to be re-trained! New food, water, environment, schedule can cause accidents until the dog has time to adjust to all the new things.

Remember by adopting a rescue pet, you are making room for our rescue to save another life....

I have not been around alot of other dogs but I think I might like to be an only child where I would get ALL of the attention. name: Cindy
description:
Cindy is a very friendly adult dog that gets along with everyone.  She is in need of a new forever home with people that will love her and take care of her. CIndy is medium sized dog and is full grown at about 40lbs.  She is a very happy and friendly girl and will make a great pet. She has been here for a while, but she is such a great dog with such good qualities.  She is an adult and would be perfect for a family that doesn't want to go through the training and work that comes with adopting a puppy.  Cindy already walks great on leash, sleeps in a crate, and all the other things that come with being a mature dog.

Cindy is residing at Blair Animal Rescue in Cleveland, AL.  Due to the recent passing of Roy Blair, we are in need of reducing our headcount. 

Please call or text Ann Blair at 256-425-6069 (cell) or call 256-425-6069 (landline) if you are interested.  Please be patient as our mailboxes are sometimes full.

name: Bella
description: Bella is a 3 year old spayed female Lab mix.  She came from a family situation and is an excellent companion dog.  She loves to be around people and kids.

name: Link
description:
Hey there,

My name is Link and I was rescued by a gentleman that saw me running down the middle of a country road all alone not knowing where I belong.  I am very thankful that this man picked me up before I got run over by a car.  I am very sweet, loving and pretty laid back.  I love to play with all the pups here.  I am up to date on all my shots, neutered, microchipped and on heartworm preventative.   I have to have a fenced yard ( no invisible fence ) to play in.  If you are interested in me, please email us.

Hugs and kisses......

name: Shelby
description:
Hey,

My name is Shelby and I am approximately 8 years old and I am up to date on shots, spayed and microchipped.  I was found on the side of the road scared and alone.  A nice gentleman picked me up and took me to the vet because he saw that I wouldn't eat anything and was lethargic and had mange.  I am now a lot better and not bald anymore.  I am very timid of people but if you are a PATIENT person I do come around after a while.  If you are interested, please email us.

name: Ryley
description: My name is Ryley a Shepherd mix pup approximately 10 years old and I am very shy, timid and terrified of people.  I was lost and couldn't find my way back home so I came across a couple of back yards that had pups in them so I stayed on one side & they on the other.  One day the owner of the pups in the fence finally decided I could come in and play with his pups.  I kind of got along with them except one and he started hurting me so I have been taken to a foster home where I can be safe until I can find a permanent home.  The lady next door had all my shots done and got me neutered and started me on heartworm prevention.  The only thing I ask is that you be very PATIENT with me because I AM NOT very trusting of people.  The people at the vet seem to think that I had been hurt in some way when I was a puppy that makes me very scared of people.  I just need alot of love where I can trust again.   If you are interested in me please email us.

name: Nemo
description:
This little man has the most unusual coloring, beige merle. He is very affectionate and a good snuggler. He is quiet and polite. Heartworm negative. However: Nemo has arthritis in his spine, despite his young age, and will need to stay on meds and joint supplement for the rest of his life. He is moving pretty normally now but his prognosis is that he will have to have blood tests every 6 months to be sure kidney and liver arent affected by the meds. He is also at increased risk for disc rupture and resulting paralysis so cant be allowed to become overweight or jump down from high areas onto hard surfaces. He is being offered for adoption with this full disclosure. He has been completely vetted; vacinated, microchipped, and on heartworm preventative. 

If you have questions, email case manager, Diana, at drangelo@ualr.edu

Adoption fee is $150 and for that tiny amount, you get the tiny man AND all the vetting!

To make the best possible match for you and the pet, please click below to complete the Adoption Application. 

Once your application has been processed, we'll be in contact. 

We cannot schedule a meet and greet without a completed application. 

If you are viewing this page through PetFinder, Adopt-a-Pet, etc., please go to http://ootwrescue.org/adoption.html to fill out an application or review our Adoption Process.

name: Daisy Mae Duke
description:
Dorothy is your typical black lab puppy, slick and shiny, lively and playful! This pretty little girl came to us after her owner moved away and left her and four siblings and their mom to fend for themselves in a very rural part of Arkansas. Fortunately, neighbors spotted the problem and moved in to help. Once safe, OOTW was contacted and the gears were put into motion.

Dorothy is a loving little girl who has spent her entire life outside. What we usually find when that happens, is they come completely house trained! :) They have never gone in the house, so they are not going to start now! We expect this girl to be about the same size as her mom, around 40 pounds when full grown. Each of the puppies look completely different that its siblings. One looks like a beagle, one looks like a harlequin great dane and another looks like a yellow lab and then you have Dorothy who looks just like her mom! So while we know she has lab in there, we just aren't sure what other breeds might be mixed in! 

This girl will grow to be a great family pet and should be just about the right size for any situation. Don't delay, apply today! Adoption fee is $150. She has had all puppy shots and been wormed. She will be spayed around mid October, receive her microchip and her rabies shot at that time as well. All of this vetting is covered in your adoption fee.

To make the best possible match for you and the pet, please click below to complete the Adoption Application. 

Once your application has been processed, we'll be in contact. 

We cannot schedule a meet and greet without a completed application. 

If you are viewing this page through PetFinder, Adopt-a-Pet, etc., please go to http://ootwrescue.org/adoption.html to fill out an application or review our Adoption Process.

name: Saylor
description: I'm Saylor and I was abandoned at the shelter outside when I was very, very sick. I didn't like it when my family drove away, leaving me behind and all alone. In fact, as sick as I was, I tried to chase the car, to catch up with them, but I just couldn't catch them. I was later found and was taken to the vet where they saved my life and for that, I am very thankful. The nice people at the AWL promise to find me a new home and family that will love me and make me a loved member of their family. I am just a young girl, only 5 months old, so I will need someone that is committed to training me so I can be the best girl and impress everyone with my nice manners. I will need an active family to give me lots of exercise and take me on family adventures. Despite my rough start in life, I am so smart, as German Shepherds usually are, friendly, and sweet. I'm sure after you meet me, you will agree.You can apply on line at www.hsvawl.org by completing the Adoption Application on the home page.

name: Alissa
description: Pure sweetness! That's me, Alissa! I got lost from my family and we never could find each other so now I need a new one. I am a little bit shy at first but I warm up quickly. I am a small girl, at just under 15 pounds, and will melt your heart when you meet me. I am a perfect small size to snuggle with at home and go places with you. While no one is sure of my breeding, I am probably a rat terrier mix. Whatever I am, everyone that meets me loves me and thinks that I am just adorable! I am about 4 years old and have a lovely, calm demeanor. I would be a perfect addition to just about any home.You can apply on line at www.hsvawl.org by completing the Adoption Application on the home page.

name: Layla
description: Even though Layla has had a rough go of it this year she is still a wonderful girl. She loves people. She may be missing a leg, but she takes it in stride and is doing remarkably well.

name: Lucky/Hope
description:
Lucky and Hope, a male/female bonded pair of 2 year old Wheaton Terrier mixes were rescued from a kill shelter July 2017.  Their owner, an elderly lady, depended on her son to care for them and herself.  Sadly, her son passed away, and now she has made the difficult decision to re-home them as a bonded pair. They are accustomed to spending most of the day with their human. 

Lucky and Hope are crate and doggy door trained, fully vetted, heart worm negative and on preventative , spayed/neutered, and looking for that person with a special place in their heart for their love.  They require a fenced yard and doggy door, as they enjoy spending time outdoors. 
Adoption fee for the pair is $200.

description:

Max is available for adoption with his sister Maggie (also with OOTW) Max has a delightful personality and is ready for a forever home. name: Joker
description: He is great with female dogs. Should be guarded when around alpha males. Loves people and attention.

name: Jenny
description: Sweet, good disposition, bright, smart. She is eager to learn and would do well in obedience training.

name: Heidi
description: Heidi is a sweet girl. None aggressive. Loves to be loved on.

name: Fargo
description: Fargo is very loving. Better with females. Good at giving kisses. He will be better in a home. We have seen traits come out due to being in a shelter. He just needs home he will be loved in.

name: Bobo
description: Athletic, loves to play

name: Croc
description: Croc had been abandoned by his former humans. He does well with humans. Just needs some love.

name: Meghan
description: Meghan was rescued by a kind lady who saw she was emaciated, and covered with ticks and fleas. But vetting, good food and a home changed that. Her foster family says she's  smart, funny, and a good girl-house and crate trained. She can sit, lay down and shake hands. She's doing great with her agility training. LOVES TOYS AND TREATS AND BLANKETS!  She needs daily exercise  to run and play in a big yard to keep her happy.  She likes some dogs but can play too rough . She likes cats, but chases them.   A home where she's the only dog would be great. Meghan needs to be adopted by a family that has experience owning pit bulls. My  application is available at www.lastchancear.org

name: Sunshine
description: Sunshine  is just as sweet as she looks. Her human was sent to a nursing home, and Sunshine needs your help.  She is very well behaved, a lovely sort of lady. Sunshine is easy to care for, loves to take daily walks and enjoys regular playtime in a yard. She would fit best into a home where someone is home frequently and she can lounge around inside most of the day. If you're looking for that special dog to keep you company Sunshine could be your girl.

name: Buddy PIP
description: Buddy PIP loves people and is good with other dogs and kids; can't you just see him running in your yard and ready to play? He is a Paws in Prison graduate and received his Canine Good Citizen Certification, meaning he is house trained, leash trained and knows all basic commands. His inmate trainers kept a daily journal of Buddy's progress in training and that journal stays with Buddy for future owners. www.lastchancear.org for application and information.

name: Marley
description: Marley loves people and is very motivated to be with her human. She loves kids and has just graduated from Paws in Prison, where she received  Canine Good Citizen Certification, meaning she is house trained, leash trained and knows all basic commands. Her inmate trainers kept a daily journal of Marley's progress in training and that journal stays with Marley for future owners. www.lastchancear.org for application and information.

name: Celeste
description: Celeste, WOW! Beautiful, inside and out,; she is loyal, devoted, friendly, and obedience trained. She is fully vetted and ready for adoption . Celeste graduated from Paws in Prison, where she received her Canine Good Citizen Certification, meaning she is house trained, leash trained and knows all basic commands. Her inmate trainers kept a daily journal of Celeste's progress in training and that journal stays with Celeste for future owners. www.lastchancear.org for application and information.

name: Lucy Barkley
description: Lucy Barkley  is sweet and friendly and sheâs always thinking! She is fully vetted and current on all vaccinations, including rabies, bordatella, and DHLLP-C. She is also current on all worming and heartworm prevention. Lucy Barkely is heartworm negative and has had a ProHeart 6. She loves people and is very motivated to be with her handler or human. She has just graduated from Paws in Prison and has received her Canine Good Citizen Certification, meaning she is house trained, leash trained and knows all basic commands. Her inmate trainers kept a daily journal of her progress in training and that journal stays with Lucy Barkley for future owners. www.lastchancear.org for application and information.

name: Wendy
description: Meet Wendy, a precious, sweet bull/pit bull terrier mix, around 6 months old. She would love to be your new best friend! Wendy is spayed and house-trained. She is very sweet and is good with all dogs and kids! If you are interested in finding out more about Wendy, please send an email to Susan at adoptions@lastchancear.org and applications are available at www.lastchancear.org

name: Magnum
description: Sarge is a Paws in Prison graduate and has received his canine good citizen certification. He weighs 88 pounds and is a neutered 2 year old male. He is house trained and has excellent manners. Sarge is being fostered in Little Rock. He is current on all vetting including neuter/vaccinations, Bordatella and rabies/Heartworm & Flea prevention. www.lastchancear.org

name: Manning
description: Meet Manning! He is a 95 pound, 2-year-old neutered male lab/golden retriever. He loves to play fetch and get a nice back scratch. He is Heartworm negative and up to date on shots. Manning is protective and patient with his four year old human who crawls all over him! He is also trustworthy in that he can be left out of his crate and doesnât have accidents or chew on stuff thatâs not his. He loves watching TV and hanging out on the sofa. He will alert you when there is someone at the door. For more information about Manning, www.lastchancear.org. or Susan at 5013364486

name: Sasha
description: Sasha loves humans, kids too, and enjoys playtime with other dogs.  She is very laid back and eager to please. Beautiful, easy to care for and love, she is also a great lapdog.  (You heard that correctly, she sees size as no boundary.)

name: Haven
description: Little Haven's family was evicted from the home, and she became \"homeless\" too. Thankfully her owner turned her over to our rescue. Haven is adorable, very sweet with a heart of gold. She loves to cuddle with humans, enjoys playing with other dogs, and has become a spirited playmate with the foster cat. In fact, Haven and kitty enjoy hiding under the bed together!

name: Max
description: What a cute boy! Just look at that little sweet face! Max was dumped in the neighborhood of one of our fosters, tied up to a light pole NOT in his front yard. Who could do this to a boy as cute as Max - right? Max is a lap dog, enjoys cozying up with his human on the sofa. He will do well in with an adopter home most of the time as he's a perfect companion dog. Max is about 5 or 6 years old, weighs a little less than 20 pounds, enjoys his bed and LOVES the girl dogs! He doesn't bother cats, chickens or the family iguana either. Just a very laid back pooch who is eager to get along with.

name: Maxi
description:
Sweet Maxi tied to a tree, and her puppies, were found in deplorable conditions. Taking care of her pups was what she did, but she was emaciated and heart worm positive-a sad soul. Thanks to her fosters,  Maxi is now ready to find her match for the perfect home. Spayed, up to date on all vaccinations, potty trained and kennel trained, too. 
Her three-month foster mom says this: âMaxi is such a good girl, a really great dog, and loyal companion! Sheâs is great walking on a leash, calm and gentle, and just wants to be scratched on the head and loved. Maxi is great to go into her kennel, and I have yet to hear her bark.â Good with other dogs and kids too, the foster mom has âyoung visitorsâ who enjoy taking Maxi for walks. Sheâs very happy and playful with a sweet disposition and loves to be with her person. The family describes her as âvery chill.â

name: Timmy
description:
â¢ Timmy is SO easy to care for and love. He is very settled, very chill and calm, and a real cuddle bug too. Bonds more with people than other dogs. He is definitely not an âin your face dogâ but once bonded, Timmy loves his people. 
â¢ A bit shy with other dogs, Timmy can be submissive with alpha dogs, never one to be aggressive. Instead, heâs usually at the back of the pack. 
â¢ Timmy would be just fine living only with humans, but he does enjoys life with other dogs like him â calm and chill. 
â¢ Timmy can jump fences â so a high fence is required. Leaving him alone in the backyard is NOT recommended 
â¢ He enjoys sleeping with his human, but is also comfortable sleeping on the floor next to his human. 
â¢ Timmy would really enjoy a home with a stay-at-home person as heâs very social. He would do fine with well behaved kids

name: Murphy
description:
Murphy is the Alpha Dog, the leader, the independent pup who can keep himself occupied and comes around from time to time for a loving pat on the head. He loves his people and routinely get up on the bed each morning for his morning loves pats. He is an extremely friendly boy, but his foster says he doesnât demand or depend on lots of cuddles. 
â¢ Murphy LOVES other dogs, is driven by other dogs, finds his energy from them and will do well with another canine playmate in his new home. 
â¢ Meets people very well but will bark when someone comes to the home â making his âwatch dog barksâ an added bonus.

name: Isla Bear
description:
Ok I'm just going to tell you right up front that I am not suitable with small children....I know it's hard to believe considering how cute I am and how much I dearly love people....but honestly little people make me nervous. My name is Isla Bear and I was surrendered by my owner. I am a spayed female Terrier mix, 8 yrs young and weigh 15 lbs. All I want to be is close and the closer the better...I am extremely affectionate once I know my person. I am crate trained, good girl on a leash, housebroken and submissive. Oh and I grin...it's true....it's so adorable...it's kind of a special thing I can do....it's been a hard couple of days since I arrived....missing my family of 8 yrs and wondering why I'm here...stop in, see if we are a match and all my worries will go away! I'm available now!  Adopting a dog from the Conway Animal Welfare Unit is a fairly easy process. The first step to adopting an animal is submitting an application. The application allows us to individually consider applicants and helps us to properly match our pets with new owners. We want to make sure that our pets are going to homes that are ready to provide for these pets long-term. Adoptions are $50 and this includes vaccinations, heartworm test, spay/neuter and microchip. As with any shelter animal, health is not guaranteed but we do our best to screen out those animals that are showing obvious signs of illness or disclose that information prior to adoption. All dogs are heartworm tested upon adoption. 

If you are interested in adopting a dog and you reside OUTSIDE the city limits of Conway and the dog is less than 12 wks old, the cost is $75 which includes a spay/neuter and micropchip. The spay and neuter can only be performed at Vilonia Vet Clinic or Companion Animal Spay/Neuter Clinic. If the animal is less that 12 wks and you live inside the city limits the adoption fee is $25 dollars and you receive a voucher for $120 to use at select clinics for spay/neuter. The other option is that you provide us with proof of a pre-paid spay or neuter at YOUR vet of choice.

name: Charlie
description:
Beautiful eyes, this guy! Charlie was thrown from a vehicle on a very busy highway. When he was found, his pads were burned from running down the highway & he had suffered an injury to his leg, because he had a little bit of a limp. He is completely better now and is ready to find a loving home. He is up to date on all his shots & will soon be neutered & microchipped. He is approximately 4 months old (9/15/2019) and weighs 23 lbs. He will only be about 45 to 50 lbs full grown. Perfect size! He loves playing with other dogs & loves kids! He is also fine with cats!

For more information about Charlie, please contact Susan Neal at daiseymaggie@yahoo.com.

To make the best possible match for you and the pet, please click below to complete the Adoption Application. 

Once your application has been processed, we'll be in contact. 

We cannot schedule a meet and greet without a completed application. 

If you are viewing this page through PetFinder, Adopt-a-Pet, etc., please go to http://ootwrescue.org/adoption.html to fill out an application or review our Adoption Process.

name: Starr
description: Fir more information about Starr contact Rita Grigsby at 8702175878.

name: SADIE
description:
SADIE â READY FOR HER FOREVER HOME AND FAMILY
This sweet little puppy is a miracle! She was found by people who had been in a car accident and  they heard her crying in a ravine! She had obviously been abandoned and was so pitiful! She is now a happy little Lab mix puppy girl staying in a foster home while she awaits her forever home and family. Sadie was born in July, 2019 and is such a good girl! She is very smart, already knows how to âsitâ and is wonderful with other cats, dogs and kids! She is as sweet as can be!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: SPROCKET
description:
SPROCKET IS READY FOR HIS FOREVER HOME AND FAMILY
Isn't he a gorgeous boy!!! Sprocket was rescued by a Good Samaritan who found him running down a busy road. This sweet puppy boy, born in January, 2019, is a Blue Heeler with lots of spots, dots and speckles in all shapes, colors and sizes - blue, grey, black and tan on white! Gorgeous! He has been staying in a foster home and is house and crate trained, great with other dogs and loves people! He is a cuddly guy who likes to sleep with his people and play all day! He will make a great family fur baby!!!

name: CURLY
description:
CURLY NEEDS A NEEDS A FOREVER HOME & FAMILY
Curly is an adorable and very lovable senior Poodle who was rescued when he was younger from an abusive breeder and has been happily living with his family. His family can no longer care for him and he needs a home where he can enjoy his 'sunset years' being loved! His vision is very limited and but that does not stop him from playing in the sun, enjoying car rides, swimming (while being monitored) and getting around very well in the house. His favorite thing???? He wants to be around his people all the time and cuddle! Curly would be a wonderful fur baby for a senior ! He is a sweet heart, weighing just 8 lbs - and he also has his very own chair he loves to sit in!

name: JESSIE
description:
JESSIE
Isn't he a gorgeous boy??? Jessie is a Lab and Mt Cur mix with beautiful brindle markings on his head and his body. He's just a puppy, born in March, 2019, who is full of playfulness and fun! He is good with other dogs and loves everyone he meets at his foster home. He'll make a wonderful family fur baby.

name: FRANK
description:
FRANK
Isn't he a gorgeous boy??? Frank is a Lab and Mt Cur mix with beautiful brindle markings on his head and his body. He's just a puppy, born in March, 2019, who is full of playfulness and fun! name: Blitz - 1909341 / 2019
description:
Blitz
He will grow up in a Blitz! The cutie patootie is a few months old. He is assumed to be another pup dumped within town. He's a bit timid at first and currently responds better to women (we're working on that!). Blitz will come current on shots and fixed. Your job will be to teach him everything he needs to know from potting outside to sleeping on your bed. If you don't have the time to dedicate yourself to a growing pup, no need to apply. Date of Intake: 9/13/19
Blitz is located at Maumelle Animal Services, 425 Cogdell Drive, Maumelle Arkansas. Open M-F 10-5, Sat. 12-4:30. Email us at Dogs@maumellefoa.org for more information. Online adoption applications available at www.Maumellefoa.org. Our adoption fee is $80. Included in the fee is shots, sterilization, microchip, dogs are given a dewormer at time of intake, placed on monthly flea/tick preventative, if heartworm negative then they are placed on heartworm preventative, if heartworm positive then they are treated once an adoption finalized.
We are always at the NLR PetSmart with our available pets on every Saturday of the month. 10:30 - 3:15 ish.
Find Maumelle Friends of the Animals on Facebook!

name: Goliath - 1909337 / 2019
description:
Goliath
Goliath is an extremely well behaved fella. He is about 5 years old and he was owner surrendered. Goliath like car rides and he's easy on the leash. He is dog friendly and enjoys people. He loves to walk around and he also enjoys playtime in the water. He's a catch! Date of Intake: 9/7/19
Goliath is located at Maumelle Animal Services, 425 Cogdell Drive, Maumelle Arkansas. Open M-F 10-5, Sat. 12-4:30. Email us at Dogs@maumellefoa.org for more information. name: Thomas
description: Hi there! My name is Judge Thomas Jefferson Ashley  Junior...but my friends call me Thomas.  I got that long handle on account of I adopted this nice little old lady who lived at the estates named after a famous man by the same name here in Arkansas. She could not keep me so she called Marley's World and Paw came out to meet me. I was nowhere to be seen but the lady said watch...and fired up her riding lawn mower. Within seconds I was trotting along side her. I let Paw know that this was my lady with my manliest bark but when he got out the cookies I decided he was OK too. If you ask him he will share the picture of me minutes later riding home in the back seat with a grin on my face. In fact that is the expression I usually wear. I love life and find almost everything kind of humorous. Paw never did figure out how most of my coat got singed off but when it grew back I shined like ebony. I have a lot of friends here and two of them are golden retrievers. Paw says that except for my color I am exactly the same. I am neutered, had all my shots, been tested for heartworm and found clear and placed on preventative. Paw taught me basic obedience and leash skills. If you watch my video you will see that I have real good manners. I even jump in the tub for a bath when asked. If you want a loyal, loving smart dog that will sit by your side, go for walks with you and let you know if strangers come around then I am your guy! You can follow the antics here on Facebook at Marley's World 2016 For more information call Paw at 870-373-6669 or email us at marleysworld@tutanota.com. To learn more about Marley's World and to fill out an application to adopt me go to marleysworld.net.

name: Venus
description: Venus is a young sweet hound mix. She's small size and has a pretty brown coat with black highlights. She loves to cuddle and give kisses. Venus is friendly around all people and is very good with other dogs. She is completely vetted including spay, microchip, and all vaccines.

name: Lucky
description:
Lucky is a 3 year old Staffordshire Terrier mix, weighing 50 pounds. He is healthy and heartworm negative. He leashes and walks well. He knows \"sit.\" He's energetic, lively, and playful. He is dominant and doesn't get along with all other dogs. If you have a dog you will need to bring it with you to test. Lucky would do best to go to a home with a fenced in yard or to a large SAFE property where he can get the exercise he needs.
...................................If you would like further information or would like to request an adoption application, please e-mail us directly at hss@cablelynx.com. The e-mail link Petfinder offers seldom works. Our shelter phone number is 501-268-3535.

name: Bubba
description: My name is Bubba and I recently lost my home and family because the landlord won't allow pets. I am a friendly boy and love to go for walks. I once had heartworms but now I am heartworm free. I am crate trained and mostly housetrained as long as I am taken out on a regular basis. I am a little feisty with other dogs so a proper introduction is recommended. I have a couple of medical issues that will require me to be on medication from now on but both conditions are well managed with my medications. I worry that this will make it hard for me to find a new family but if someone will give me a chance, I promise to be a good boy and I know they will love with my sweet personality. I am also a real lap dog and miss having a lap to be in. Bubba weighs about 17 pounds, is 4 years old and possibly a chihuahua/corgi mix.You can apply on line at www.hsvawl.org by completing the Adoption Application on the home page.

name: Rockie
description:
Rockie is a 2 year old Mixed Breed dog, weighing 53 pounds. He is healthy and heartworm negative. He knows \"sit\" and would benefit from further training. He gets along well with most other dogs and loves to run and play. He's a happy and friendly boy. He likes balls and will play âfetchâ. Rockie would do best to go to a home with a fenced in yard or to a large SAFE property where he can get the exercise he needs.

name: LILLIE
description:
LILLIE
Sweet Lillie is a Beagle mix girl who is about 6-7 yrs young. She is currently living in a foster home where she is maybe getting a little spoiled! She is doggie-door trained and loves it when her foster parents talk to her! Lillie gets   very excited when they come home from work and she can't wait to greet them. She will find quiet places to rest when she chooses or she will play with the other dogs or she will seek her people out for 'talking and loving!' This girl knows her own mind! She is a wonderful girl who just loves to be loved!

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Hope is HW positive and is looking for a foster to adopt home willing to use our clinic or potentially a preapproved clinic near you. Apply at GreenerdaysAR.rescuegroups.org to receive more information

name: Tucker - 1902035 / 2019
description:
Tucker
9/12/19: He's back! Tucker has been returned due to a move! We don't get why this guy is having such bad luck! He is a great dog. Very friendly and sweet. Amazingly soft if you're looking for a snuggler! Where is his forever family??? And if it is you, and happened to have to move, first Find A Place That Accepts DOGS!!!!!
2/2/19: Thornton (our former Tucker) is now back with us due to a move. He has grown into a gorgeous boy and is very sweet. He is now about 15-16 months old. He is be updated on his shots and microchipped.
11/7/17: This little fella was found and not claimed. He is currently a chunky 10 pounds and is being dewormed now. Tucker is believed to be a lab mix, very soft and solid black. He is around 6-8 weeks old and she is expected to grow to be around 45 pounds. Date of Intake: 11/7/17, 2/2/19
Thornton is currently located at Maumelle Animal Services, 425 Cogdell Drive, Maumelle Arkansas. Open M-F 10-5, Sat. 12-4:30. Email us at Dogs@maumellefoa.org for more information. Online adoption applications available at www.Maumellefoa.org
We are always at the NLR PetSmart with our available pets on every Saturday of the month. 10:30 - 3:15 ish.
Find Maumelle Friends of the Animals on Facebook!

name: BRILL
description: Isnât she a cutie? Brill is a Chihuahua and Jack Russell mix, just 2 Â½ years old and weighing 25 lbs. She is as cute as she can be, house trained, micro chipped, great with kids and loves to play frisbee!!! She will make a great family fur baby!

name: Steven
description: Steven is a sweet guy. He came in with lots of hair loss on his backend. He is working on growing it back in....We would love for you to come visit our animals. We are open Wednesday-Saturday, noon-4pm.

name: Aristotle
description: Approximately 1 year old male pit bull mix. Very sweet and submissive boy. Please consider this sweet boy for your family!

name: Sissy
description:
Sissy is a 10-11 month old Mixed Breed dog, weighing 12 pounds. She is healthy, heartworm negative, and has been spayed. She leashes and walks well. She gets along well with most other dogs and loves to play. She's really sweet and affectionate. She's lively and energetic. She's learning not to jump. She's active and would make a great hiking and adventure buddy.
...................................If you would like further information or would like to request an adoption application, please e-mail us directly at hss@cablelynx.com. The e-mail link Petfinder offers seldom works. Our shelter phone number is 501-268-3535.

name: GEORGE
description:
GEORGE - NEEDS A FOREVER HOME
Mr. Handsome! This is George, a Bassett and Beagle mix boy who was searching for a kind heart and some loving help when he came to the finder's home. George is is a very sweet boy who will make a wonderful family pet. He is about 1 year old and weighs 35 lbs. He's a good ole boy with an easygoing and sweet personality.

name: CORBIN
description: Isn't he a cutie?? Corbin is an adorable Dachshund mix little boy, weighing 27 lbs and born in February, 2019. He is currently living in a foster home and having a wonderful time playing with kids, other dogs and cats. He sleeps in the house every night but is so excited to go out in the morning to play with other foster dogs and kids! I guess you could call him a 'Play Boy!' He absolutely loves and craves attention - just wants to be with his people. He is crate and house trained. He will make a wonderful family fur baby!

name: Nala
description:
Nala is a 1-2 year old Shepherd mix, weighing 45 pounds. She is healthy, heartworm negative, and has been spayed. She knows \"sit.\" She's gets along well with most other dogs. She's super lively and energetic. She loves to play with tennis balls. She's sweet and friendly. Nala will need to go to a home with a fenced in yard or to a large SAFE property where she can get the exercise she needs. She would not be suitable for an apartment or smaller, unfenced property.
...................................If you would like further information or would like to request an adoption application, please e-mail us directly at hss@cablelynx.com. The e-mail link Petfinder offers seldom works. Our shelter phone number is 501-268-3535.

name: WILLIE
description:
WILLIE NEEDS A FOREVER HOME AND FAMILY
Isn't he the absolutely cutest puppy boy?! Willie showed up at someone's home - just starving and so frightened....and so hopeful of finding kindness. He is now staying in a loving foster home where he is having lots of good food, clean water and treats...and he has a soft cushy bed in the house! Doggie heaven! Willie is a Fox Hound puppy, weighing just 15 lbs., born in May, 2019. He is great with kids and other dogs! He has the longest legs and the sweetest little personality.

name: ROCKET
description:
ROCKET - READY FOR HIS FOREVER HOME AND FAMILY
This is one absolutely gorgeous, handsome boy! Rocket is an Anatolian Shepherd and Great Pyrenees mix puppy boy, born in May, 2019. Rocket and his brother, Jackson, were found abandoned far out in the country. Jackson had been hit by a car and they were starving. Now in foster homes, the boys are thriving and both are available together or separately for adoption! Rocket is great with people and other dogs. Due to his size, children 8 yrs and older are suggested. A great addition to your family!

name: LAYLA & LUCY
description:
LAYLA &  LUCY - READY FOR THEIR FOREVER HOMES
These sweet Beagle mix puppies were born in May, 2019 and are just adorable! So very sweet and playful - just waiting to be loved by their very own people! Layla weighs 30 lbs, Lucy weighs 37 lbs and they may be adopted together or separately. They love being around kids, other  dogs and cats! SO sweet and loving - the perfect family fur babies!

name: Elvis
description:
You ain't nuthin but a \"Hound Dog\" oh wait...I'm a Lab...what was I thinking...my name is Elvis and I am a neutered male about 3-4 yrs old and I weigh 84 lbs. So these people....not long after you get here...they poke you with a needle then a few days later they do it again...geez what do I look like a pin cushion...anyway back to my story...they left me \"All Shook Up\" heartworms they call it...dang the luck. I need a \"Good Luck Charm\" quick...preferably in the form of a hooman that can care for my medical needs. I mean what a package, I'm smart, calmer than most Labs, love people, other dogs and duhhhhhhh....handsome. No need in any of you walking around with \"Suspicious Minds\" wondering if I'm your \"Teddy Bear.\" I can assure you I am one hunk of \"Burning Love!\" Get on down here to the \"Jailhouse Rock\" er uh I mean shelter and see what I'm all about...I'm available now!  Adopting a dog from the Conway Animal Welfare Unit is a fairly easy process. The first step to adopting an animal is submitting an application. The application allows us to individually consider applicants and helps us to properly match our pets with new owners. We want to make sure that our pets are going to homes that are ready to provide for these pets long-term. Adoptions are $50 and this includes vaccinations, heartworm test, spay/neuter and microchip. As with any shelter animal, health is not guaranteed but we do our best to screen out those animals that are showing obvious signs of illness or disclose that information prior to adoption. All dogs are heartworm tested upon adoption. 

If you are interested in adopting a dog and you reside OUTSIDE the city limits of Conway and the dog is less than 12 wks old, the cost is $75 which includes a spay/neuter and micropchip. The spay and neuter can only be performed at Vilonia Vet Clinic or Companion Animal Spay/Neuter Clinic. If the animal is less that 12 wks and you live inside the city limits the adoption fee is $25 dollars and you receive a voucher for $120 to use at select clinics for spay/neuter. The other option is that you provide us with proof of a pre-paid spay or neuter at YOUR vet of choice.

name: MURPHY
description:
MURPHY- READY FOR HIS FOREVER HOME AND FAMILY
Just look at his beautiful coat - a reddish brown color - a bit of the Irish??? Sweet Murphy was rescued from a kill shelter as his 'time was up' and he seems to know and appreciate it every day! This handsome young Lab mix, is about 1-2 yrs old and is such a happy boy. Murphy is wonderful with other dogs and seems to love everyone he meets as if they were old friends! He loves to run and play with other dogs, and his foster mom says he is very sweet and loving! He'll make a wonderful family fur baby!

name: MILLIE
description:
MILLIE - READY FOR HER FOREVER HOME AND FAMILY
Isn't she a pretty girl?? And such a happy girl too! Sweet Millie was rescued from a kill shelter as her 'time was up' and she seems to know and appreciate it every day! She is still a puppy girl, less than a year old, and a Lab mix. She is staying in a foster home and her Mom says she is 'very very sweet and loving.' She loves to run and play with other dogs. She will make a wonderful family fur baby as she is great with everyone she meets - with a 'smile on her sweet face!'

name: Raza
description:
Ok just let me say I love to be on the go! Finding someone as active as me is my goal! Hiking, swimming, camping, rock climbing....ok you may have to carry me on that one....I love it all...especially if I have my favorite hooman to share it with! My name is Raza and I am a 1 yr old spayed female Lab mix and I weigh 35 lbs. I will likely not get any bigger so that makes me the perfect size to explore with but small enough to travel. I have been here several days waiting on my owner but they haven't come for me....and lucky for you that makes me available now! name: Murphy
description:
So there I was enjoying myself in the park having the time of my life, running, playing, rolling in things I shouldn't and then............well I guess you can figure out the rest.  I'm Murphy and fun loving neutered guy about 4 mths old and I weigh 15 lbs. They are calling me a Terrier mix...but I think that's just a default when they don't know what to call you. I'm a playful guy, very active but have my moments I love to be close and cuddle. I have been here a couple of days now and my owner hasn't come. I will be available 9/13/19.
